title: Amazing central hotel.
text: We loved the people that worked there, who were so friendly and helpful, and the rooms were big  by NYC standards. Great food and very clean and quiet for sleeping which is hard to find in this bust city. Great value too!

title: A Midtown Manhattan Gem
text: We had a wonderful visit at the Omni Berkshire for an extended weekend visit to Manhattan. The midtown location is great- walking distance to many of the big attractions (Broadway, Times Square, Central Park) along with easy subway access for those who wish to explore the city. The room and hotel facilities are well appointed and comfortable and the staff are friendly, helpful and professional. Our Loyalty Ambassador Jennifer was helpful before and during our stay, John and William at the door offered a warm smile and lots of local knowledge and assistance. We had a slight issue with our AC and Charles and Robert promptly corrected the issue -  before we actually knew there was an issue! I can see why the hotel has so many return guests- if we find our selves in New York again we will definitely return to the Omni Berkshire!

title: Hotel does not give invoices to Booking clients !
text: No-frills room without any kettle, coffee-machine or minibar. Limited and expensive breakfast options. The building is clean and the beds and linings are very comfortable. This hotel sounds like a good option in midtown. However I have had a bad experience with the billing : my room was booked and paid for through the Booking website, and the hotel refused to send me a proper bill after my stay, despite the fact that Booking will not provide any, and specifically states that it is up to the hotelier to provide a legal invoice. I am returning to NY for one week in a few days, and it won't be at the Omni Berkshire Place. Where the competition is high, service is of the essence...

title: EXCELLENT
text: My stay at OMNI NYC was excellent from the front door, bell, food service, and desk staff. TheSuit we had was fabulous with all the bells and whistles and allowed me and my family stay to be extra special. The room was clean, there were treats, a stereo, lots of stuffed animals and toys for the children to play withand we had a fridge to store our food and drinks. Kudos to all of the staff at OMNI NYC.

title: Excellent experience at the Omni!
text: We spent one night at the Omni Berkshire so I could run the NYC Half Marathon. Everyone we encountered was amazingly warm & helpful. At check in, we requested a coffee pot as I needed to be up very early for the bus to the start line. The coffee set up arrived at our door moments after we checked in. The room was small but cozy and clean. We had dinner at the Berk Grille, and it was very good! We also opted for late check,out, which gave me time to shower and change after the race. Truly a perfect weekend! (Ps I finished the race in 2:28!)

title: Old and tired
text: Omni Berkshire Place is in a great location and the staff are friendly. There is a decent bar at the front of the hotel but the food in the bar is very average. Price of room is a little pricy even for New York. There is no water or coffee available in the bedrooms which is poor. Bedrooms are tired and dreary.

title: HORRIFIC OMNI BERKSHIRE STAY
text:
An unfathomable, cascading series of progressively more serious calamities performed by an array of mis-managed hotel departments:  housekeeping, room service, the front desk staff and unbelievably, up through the highest levels of Hotel Management.

Is anyone actually “Managing” this hotel? Apparently not.

We made numerous attempts to calmly discuss our quite serious concerns regarding some atrocious events and personal space encroachments, many of which could only occur with the full knowledge and contractural agreement of upper management.

We were told the General Manager was busy with appointments and apparently unable to make time to speak with us at another time, nor did he make any effort whatsoever to reach out and  “hear” our concerns at any point during our disastrous stay. Details forthcoming after some much needed rest.

title: Rude Bar and Waiting Suff
text:
Went to the bar when staying at the hotel. The waiter walked off half way through our order. When we asked at the bar if we could order drinks we were told we had to go via the absent waiter.
When we finally managed to ask to order a cocktail he threw the menu down on the table.
We went elsewhere at this point. 
We did mention this at checkout and were told something would be done . The hotel took the full amount from the card and didn't apologise.

title: Mother-Daughter Weekend in New York
text: We absolutely loved our stay.  To get the subway experience we took the subway direct from LaGuardia and were within 2 blocks of the hotel.  We arrived early but was offered an upgrade and early check-in.  The Concierge made a great late breakfast suggestion, Toasties on the next block. The room was very clean and had everything you need, toiletries, towels, robe, hair dryer, iron/board.  The doorman (Booby) was so friendly and even arranged a car service back to the airport at departure time.  I will look for Omni in all the cities we travel to after the service we received in New York!

title: Exceeded all my expectations
text:
My stay at Omni was superb. The service was excellent. The room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and equipped with all the amenities one could need for a luxurious stay. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the attention to cleanliness was evident in every corner of the room. The location was excellent, making it easy to explore the city and access various attractions and dining options. Additionally, the surrounding area felt safe and vibrant, adding to the overall appeal of the location. 
The staff provided attentive service throughout my stay Ask for a coffee machine and they will deliver to you. Highly recommended for a comfortable and enjoyable experience.

title: The best
text: This was a special trip to NYC for me and family/friends. The Omni made it even more special. The quality of customer service is simply the best I have seen in years! The hotel is beautiful and the location is terrific. The attention to details made this event one that we will remember for years. Thank you Jennifer Torres for your assistance and tremendous effort to create such a unique weekend in NYC. We will be back!

title: Love this Omni hotel
text:
Lovely stay in great location 
Great staff all around
Nice room
Near St Patrick’s Cathedral and great shopping, safe area with many amenities nearby
Good beds and quick room service
Beautiful roomy marble bathroom 
Only retraction was long wait for elevators

title: New york stay
text:
Perfect location minutes walk from times square. 
Clean hotel, friendly accommodating staff. Comfy, warm bed spacious rooms. 
One member brought me tea and coffee facilities saw I had my 2 children with me and then brought back some milk and cookies for them.
Wonderful service.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Stay was wonderful from the moment we arrived and William, Doorman and Michael, Bellman were very welcoming and professional. Check-in was quick and efficient. The suites were spotless and very clean. Room service food was prepared well and delivered timely. Wake-up call was given on time.

title: Great Experience
text: From the moment we checked in to the time of our check out, We had a great experience. Cleanliness, staff interactions, bar area, morning beverage service were all exceptional. We have had multiple stays in NY recently and we have found the hotel we will be using going forward.

title: Great Location
text: The Omni is a great hotel in a great location.  The rooms are a good size, especially the bathrooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Great location to walk to Central Park and the stores along 5th Avenue.

title: Good choice in central Manhattan
text:
We found this to be a great location, fairly close to everything we were looking for plus the subway.
As there were three of us we booked a huge room with large terrace. An extra bed was brought in for our 3rd party so we still had use of the couch which was great. The terrace was a great bonus, lovely sitting out at night with the city happening all around.
The bar was fun, staff were good.

title: If you’re looking for a great midtown hotel - its the Omni Berkshire! Perfect location, friendly staff, and clean rooms!
text: Rooms were very clean and spacious.  Excellent location with a subway stop steps from the entrance.  Staff was wonderful and upgraded us upon arrival.  We were a group of 4 ladies on a girls trip - we will stay here when we return to midtown Manhattan.  Highly recommended!

title: Great Hotel for Mid Town fun!
text: Great location. Lots to do within walking distance. Close to Grand Central and Broadway. Staff very friendly. Quiet and spacious rooms for mid town. We would definitely stay here again.  Definitely check out Hama Japanese restaurant close by.  Highly recommend.

title: Check your sheets
text: I really wanted to love this hotel. The location can’t be beat, we booked this hotel because of the close proximity to radio city music hall. We came for a family trip to see the rockettes, the first time for all of us. We went to the 8pm show and then walked around to see the light show at Saks after the show. When we returned to the room, we were all very tired. After getting ready for bed, we turned down our bedding and the sheets had clearly not been changed from the previous guests because there was hair and fuzz all over our sheets. I then turned down the bedding of our children’s bed and again there was fuzz, a sticker from a piece of fruit and hair. I have never had this experience before at a hotel. We called down to speak to a manager and they had offered to change our room but with it being almost midnight we declined, the Manager sent someone up to change our bedding. I believe his name was Joseph, he was very apologetic and friendly. We helped him make the beds because of the time of night and our kids were exhausted. The next morning I spoke with another manager who really didn’t apologize but just said she could assure me they don’t get many complaints and offered me an upgrade with my next stay. I explained that I am sure If this is done with my room I am sure It isn’t the first time. Please check your sheets when checking in. She did ultimately give us a credit for breakfast and waived the resort fee for our troubles. It’s just very troubling to have this experience in a hotel. I will always check my bedding at future hotel stays, but will not stay here again.

title: Fantastic Hotel in Unbeatable Location
text:
This is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location. It is just perfect if you are hoping to experience the magic of NYC during the Christmas holiday season. The rooms are bigger than many others in the city and they have valet and self parking available.  The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious, and there was plenty of room for our family of 3 for our weekend trip. 
While the room does have a safe and mini fridge, there isn’t a coffee maker by default. If you call the front desk and request one, they will deliver a Keurig with pods and some mugs. I suspect most travelers are more likely to want to caffeinate at one of the many nearby coffee shops, but it’s nice to have available in room if you’re a crazy early riser and aren’t ready to venture out yet. We didn’t eat in the restaurant but did take advantage of in room dining one evening after exhausting ourselves running around all day.
The Omni Berkshire is about 2 blocks to Rockefeller Center, so it is ideal for the family trip over to ice skate or visit all the shops and see the spectacular tree. Holiday photo ops on every corner and then some. Everyone on staff is so friendly and helpful and if you’re lucky you may have a chance to dance with Lenny the Doorman. 
We’ve stayed many places in NYC, and we’ll definitely be back.

title: Back again
text:
We had a great experience! When we checked in, we were given drink passes for the bar as part of our rewards . Everyone was helpful and friendly. Our loyalty ambassador, Jennifer , checked in on us. We also stayed in May and had a great experience. 
My family and I have stayed here for over twenty years. We love to return and see many familiar faces. 
We are returning this weekend and bringing our children .  We made sure to book in advance and can’t wait to return . Highly recommended.

title: Disappointed in the services offered
text:
The hotel is in a great location 
The room size is good for a Manhattan hotel 
The hotel bar / restaurant doesn’t open until 5pm, which is a bit inconvenient if you want a coffee or snack early afternoon 
No water set up in the room, you have to call room service and sparkling water is chargeable - inconvenient!

title: Comfy, friendly but refinement needed
text:
Friendly, helpful staff.
Very clean room with comfy, if soft, bed.
It’s not quite as grand as the official pics, but it’s comfortable enough.
The only issue which was annoying is that you don’t get a refrigerator and tea/coffee making facilities, although you can request these. However, for a four star hotel I don’t expect to have to request these items, they should be standard.

Would I go back. Yes.

title: Very good and clean rooms, just terrible staff!
text:
It was a great stay, the room was clean and perfect for the city! 
The only big negative point is the staff. I haven’t met one “nice” person (a part from the door man’s who were juste great). Otherwise, at the restaurant it was like a hidden camera, so un respectful… at the reception it was the same … I would still come back because the rooms were very good, but it’s a shame to have bad staff …

title: Omni is ALL IN!
text:
The Omni Berkshire team is ALL IN! I could rave about the grandeur of the hotel, the beautiful rooms and the perfect location, however, the highlight of this stay was the staff! 
I am visiting from the Omni in Nashville, and meeting these individuals reminded me why the Omni family is so special! Special shout-out to Lenny and Bobby the doormen, Nilton, Maria, and Ume from Front Desk, Andrew from Berk’s bar, Jennifer Torres and a very generous woman (glasses, great energy) from Berk’s bar whose name I unfortunately did not catch. Lenny and Bobby were always so welcoming and primed the warmness of the staff from the day I checked in to the day I went back home. Lenny has the most amazing personality and someone I personally think represents the liveliness of Omni (If there was a way to send him to every Omni location to boost morale or be a special guest for POE events that would be one of the best decisions Omni would ever make.) 
Upon arrival, I was greeted by Lenny, checked in by Maria, and surprised with an amenity by Jennifer (it was a beautiful surprise considering that I only briefly mentioned celebrating my birthday in New York.) That was the kindest welcome anyone could even hope for. The hotel itself is a jewel set amongst treasures being in a beautiful location but also it was convenient to get around through the city from this location. Rooms are spacious and cozy. 
At checkout, I received a very warm farewell from Andrew at Berk’s Bar who is a great example of luxury hospitality; although I was grabbing a quick breakfast, his service was very intentional and kind. At checkout I had the pleasure of interacting with folks who obviously enjoy what they do, Nilton and Ume. When someone says we hope to see you soon, it doesn’t always come off as genuine, but when I was bid farewell by Nilton, Ume, Bobby and Andrew, I was already planning my next trip to come back. 

Omni Berkshire has a great eye for talent!

title: Nice hotel for NYC
text: This was our first time staying at an Omni. The rooms are a nice size for the city and the bathroom was clean. The soaps are Nest which were nice. Beds are comfortable with plush pillows and bedding. We opted for a city view which was not as nice as I would have expected for a city view as you had to look down to see an intersection. We were only on the 5th floor and the hotel is not very tall. One elevator went down when we were there and there are no stairs for guest use as the concierge explains it’s for safety. I did check the map in our room to ensure there was a plan with stairs in case of emergency to exit. They have a menu for dining on the tv which was not updated. They only have dinner room service and the kids menu is small which was surprising to me as they promote this hotel for American girl visits. We got warm cookies and chocolate milk as a gift the first evening which was nice but not on Saturday. There is supposed to be a we code with the menu in your room for ordering, our room didn’t have one. I would recommend more than 2 pillows per bed and more than 3 towels in the bathroom. ( we were a party of 4). The concierge was friendly and always helped with the door and calling a taxi. The location of this hotel was great for American girl, 5th ave and Rockefeller center. Overall I would rate this hotel as average. It was decent for NYC but not sure I would go out of my way to stay there again.

title: Terrible place and staff
text: This is actually, truly a horrible hotel.  Yes they Are full, but not an excuse.  The room has tears and cuts in the furniture and the closet has to be held closed with a trash can. Closet doesn't have a light. Nothing is thought out. The staff is horrible.  Asking for an umbrella allowed me to talk to the entire team as everyone wanted to pass the buck.  The restaurant doesn't have room service in the morning or day, which is when you want it. And if you go to the restaurant for breakfast, prepare to be disappointed with the staff. Food was fine, but the guy next to me asked 5 different people for jam - and everyone heard and ignored. Not a nice place. I have no idea what the other reviewers were smoking when they gave it good ratings

title: Fabulous hotel and location
text: I can’t remember the last time I stayed in a hotel and had such a fabulous experience. All of the staff were outstanding-doorman, security, housekeeping, restaurant staff, main desk, concierge. Everyone was so helpful, polite, kind. The room was great and clean and the beverage delivery at the door each morning as a Select Guest member (free to join) was amazing. This hotel is awesome and I will stay there again,

title: The Omni is a Universal Classic
text:
There are numerous hotel options in my beloved New York City. Some are really lavish, while others are cozy and charming. It turns out that I stayed at the Omni more than three times throughout the first half of the year. It should go without saying why I returned to the same hotel, but my receipts show it. 

The Omni has set itself apart from a number of hotels I have visited over the years, from its classic modern stylings to its iconic TikTok doorman. Luxe hotels are the new "it" thing, with never-before-seen amenities and experiences, but nothing beats a classic. You know you're in the presence of something exceptional the instant you step through the revolving doors and enter the elegant and gorgeous foyer submerged in white marble lined with gold trims and wood accents. 

The staff is always friendly and attentive. They are always willing to "figure things out" and are helpful and accommodating. 

I've been in "smaller" rooms as well as the grand suite. It's the same every time... I feel at home. And, no, I don't have a "home/house" as the amazing photographs of the Omni show. Each room's stylings were modest in nature and without pretentiousness. It wasn't attempting to be something it wasn't. 

My most recent stay was my favorite. It was a gift for my birthday. We Leos have huge personalities and much bigger demands. So my wife booked us into the large suite. My wife, by the way, is a Leo too. Needless to say, it was fantastic. We had several friends and family around for a night on the town which started in our room. There were no problems. It seemed as though we had the entire hotel to ourselves. Great memory.

To be seen for who you are and your character speaks volumes in this day and age. The Omni team knew me... supported me as a returning guest, and provided me with the sense of security that you provide to all visitors. 

The Omni on Madison Avenue is a New York City institution, conveniently located near sights such as St. Patrick's Cathedral, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, Central Park, and Park Avenue. Book it right now. Thank me later!

title: Great location, good service in Mid-Town Manhattan!
text: The location was perfect. Could walk to all major attractions in mid-town Manhattan. The service was excellent and the room was very comfortable. No turn down service and you had to request waters in the room. Dining is very expensive and very average fare, limited selection for breakfast. Otherwise it was a very nice stay. Would definitely return.

title: Centrally located
text:
I have stayed at this hotel previously in the past but this was my first time there since before the pandemic.  I really enjoy the midtown east location of this hotel. Located on 52nd St between Madison and 5th Ave, it is an easy and quick walk to the E,M subway stop and also the 4,5, 6 train stop as well. Also located within reasonable walking distance of Grand Central Terminal, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and MoMa as well other visitor attractions.

I had room 1702 this time. Everything was clean and in good working order. I utilized the free morning beverage delivery for Omni Select Guest members each morning and it was delivered promptly within the time frame I requested.

The hotel had enough desk staff and bell staff so that I never experienced any long waits. I had to store my bag upon both arrival and departure and there was always someone there to help.

I definitely plan to return to this hotel again in the future, due to the location, pleasant staff members and well kept appearance of the hotel.

title: Great Location
text: My GF and I just spent three nights at the Omni and overall it was pretty good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little dated but in general is kept in good repair. Perhaps its greatest benefit is its location. Time Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Centre, etc. are all within a 10 – 15 minute walk. On the negative side, the room didn’t have a refrigerator, we had to ask for slippers, there are few places to let wet towels dry, no complimentary water, and the bathroom really needs a fan. Given the cost of our stay, I think these items should be standard.

title: Always Reliably Wonderful!
text: This is the best staffed and nicest hotel in NYC!  Always reliably wonderful...from check-in to departure, it's always a pleasure to stay at the Omni Berkshire.  Professional staff, clean rooms, fabulous location. This will always be our home when we visit Manhattan!

title: Omni NYC
text: Beautiful and clean . All staff excellent. They went out of their way to make sure I had everything to make my stay enjoyable. Within walking distances to lots of iconic sites. Would definitely stay again.

title: Omni Berkshire is fantastic hotel
text:
The Omni Berkshire is truly my favorite hotel in the country. It has it all, great people, very nice rooms, and perfect location 

It’s a wonderful property. I was crestfallen when it closed during COVID and announced it would be sold. So, so happy when it reopened. There is no place as lovely with spectacular people!

title: Bartender incredibly rude
text: Love the hotel, the location, the doormen, front desk staff... but what is happening with the bar/restaurant staff? I ordered a glass of port and there was a congealed lump of something disgusting in the bottom of the glass. Instead of apologizing and swiftly taking it from me, the bartender said "Stop playing with it". Shockingly rude. Perhaps it was because two seconds prior to that, another customer complained that his beer was flat. The bartender simply replied "I changed the keg 5 minutes ago". Wow. After the bartender told me to stop "playing with the lump in my glass" he said "Can I get anything else for you?" and glared at me. I said no and immediately spoke with "Brett" at the front desk to complain. Brett was absolutely fantastic and said "what can we do for you to make up for this?" I said I don't want anything other than to be heard. The hotel is FANTASTIC in every way, but I was honestly shocked at the rudeness and defensiveness of the waiter. Again, Brett was great and I simply said please look into this. That's all I want.

title: Midtown Manhattan Favorite
text: From the doorman to front desk & housekeeping, the staff was very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, I can't say the same about the restaurant and bar staff. This was my second stay, at this property, and each time they were unfriendly, short, and rude. However, the property has a great location. It is mostly away from the noise and traffic. Yet, the property is still within walking distance to all the main attractions, restaurants, shops and subway. Easy to get transportation to and from LGA. Highly recommend this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

title: Best experience at the Omni Berkshire NYC
text: Best experience at the Omni Berkshire NYC! Incredible staff, impeccably clean hotel rooms, great attention to detail! Love the staff at this hotel!!! Isis ( loyalty Ambassador) and Mary ( Concierge) thank you for all the attention to detail and making our stay so special! This is why we only stay at the Omni Berkshire when we come to NYC! Last but not least a BIG shoutout to the bell staff at this hotel! You are all so hardworking and always have a welcoming smile!!!

title: Good to see it reopen
text: Great to see this place reopen, though neighborhood has been affected by the pandemic. Many stores and coffee places around closed. Service very good and rooms impeccable. It is a great location in mid-town so I will probably return.

title: Great Hotel! Central Location!
text: Great Hotel! Central Location! Good customer service! We stayed at the Omni for 3 nights while visiting NYC. The check in was quick; the room was clean; the location was central to everything. This hotel is located close to Central Park; 5th Ave shopping; St. Patrick’s Cathedral; and Rockefeller Centre. The bed in the room was very bad but we were moved to another room with newer bed. Apparently they were in the middle of changing all beds in the hotel. We were given 4 free drinks at the bar for this inconvenience.

title: Awesome Hotel and Staff!
text:
We returned home last night after one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had in NYC. I understand some of the extras like the wine and cheese and coffee and croissants in the lobby this weekend are thanks to the GM and might have been a special occasion being Easter weekend, but non the less it made us feel special! It was a lovely touch and it pushed this property to the very top of our list. We live 1.5 hours from the city and visit very often and tend to stay at different hotels, to try them out. We were very pleased with the level of service (thank you Maria at the Front Desk for all your help and patience!), from the front desk to the bellmen, and helping by attending to my request made prior to my stay asking for a tea kettle for my room as I tend to like to have it available as a heavy tea drinker.

One of the nicest things is the 17th floor terrace open to all, from there you can see St. Pats.

Also, the upgraded room we selected (Premier Skyline King - 12th floor and above) after booking with a AAA rate, was fantastic! Love the space, the temperature of the room, bed, pillows, bathroom and especially the location, it was so quite despite being on 52nd street! 

Love Love Love this property! The location smack dap in the middle of midtown, across and a bit down the street from Cartier (as an example of how close to the bustle it is) and around the corner basically from St. Patrick's Cathedral.

Well done! You and your crew should be proud.

We are now proud members of your rewards club and hope to return often (Which I recommend to acquire two drink vouchers at the restaurant per stay). And it will be on my recommended list for my friends.

title: Perfect location and experience!
text: Perfect location, clean as a whistle, and fantastic customer service. No detail overlooked, even down to the freshly baked chocolate chip cookies! This was our first time in the city in several years and the staff made sure it was a wonderful experience.

title: Excellent birthday weekend
text: Being true fans of the Omni chain, and having a free night, we decided to use that night to celebrate my birthday in NYC.  The Bershire Place offered to upgrade for a small fee to a suite - I mean, it was amazing.  A suite with a balcony in NYC - why did I have to be born in January??!!  ;-)  They went above and beyond to acknowledge by birthday - truly.  I was touched and overwhelmed.  The weather was lovely, the room perfect, the staff friendly - perfect weekend.  Thank you to all!

title: Great to see this hotel reopen
text: Hotel was very good, my first visit since pre-covid, everyone super friendly and helpful. The room impeccable. I only give the stay a 4 because the neighborhood has really changed since covid. Gone is the little deli across the street where you could get a quick coffee, also many empty store fronts on Madison Avenue. I would definitely stay there again.

title: The best place to stay in Manhattan
text:
I stayed here through 7th-14th February and I had the best time of my life. 
This was my 7th visit to New York and I felt this time I needed a good hotel away from the mayhem but close enough to walk so I booked the fabulous omni Berkshire place. 
I wasn’t expecting the grandeur of the lobby when I walked in, it was fabulous. I knew this was my place. 
It’s 1 minute walk either street for most metro lines, you’ll walk to Times Square in under 10 minutes. 
The staff are amazing, not your run of the mill staff in most hotels in New York. Usually you just get checked in, charged extortionate resort fees and never speak again. Not here. All the staff were so friendly I even had a chat with Seth about football. I thought my knowledge was good, his was way better. 
The minute you get out of the elevator you’re greeted by Mary or Kevin who want to do everything to help you. 
I mentioned to Kevin one day I was thinking of walking the Brooklyn bridge and he gave me exact directions of where to get the best pictures and the quickest way to get there. What a professional. 
One night we came down in the lift and thinking of maybe doing a show. We met Mary at the desk and our show and dinner were booked in seconds. She was a queen. 
Could not recommend this hotel highly enough, we were treated so well from check in to check out, I need to mention Willy the doorman here because he got us a cab at such a busy time and brought our bags to the cab for us.  
My 8th,9th and 10th time visiting the greatest city in the world I’ll be staying here.

title: Location is great! A pleasant, comfortable stay.
text: We had a good five night stay at the Omni Berkshire during a family holiday to New York. We stayed in a family room (two doubles) on the 5th floor and found the room comfortable and quiet. We were pleased there was a bath tub as we were travelling with a toddler. We were slightly disappointed with the room amenities (for example, no coffee machine or bottled water and turn down only on our first evening) given the cost of staying in the hotel. The location was great - easy walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and subway stations. Overall, we had a good stay but felt the room amenities could be improved for a 4* hotel.

title: Pleasant stay near theater district
text:
I stayed here for one night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I encountered staff checking in, attempting to check in early, leaving my key card in the room and assistance with using the business center. Every time they were friendly. The room was clean and quiet. Toiletries were plentiful and the bed was comfortable. 

My only complaint I had was I booked thru Orbitz and paid upfront, later I saw I was charged $32 after checking out and told it was a destination tax fee that all NY hotels have. I think that should have been included in the upfront cost so there was no surprise. 

The hotel did seem to have mostly senior citizens patrons, not that it bothered me but it’s a quiet hotel.

title: Great Location
text: We loved our stay at the Omni. The location is central to all things one might want to see during the Christmas holiday break, including the Christmas windows, Rockefeller Center, the light show at Saks, etc. We liked the offering of wine and cheese in the late afternoon after walking all day in the cold! The food at the restaurant was pretty good. The decorations were beautiful in the lobby. The staff was very kind, especially the doormen and bellmen. We would definitely visit again.

title: Perfect for a Family trip to the city
text:
Amazing Holiday in the City!

The Omni was perfect for our family of 4 (2 kids/2 adults) for a quick pre-Christmas trip to the city.  The location was great - walk to Rockefeller, Lego, Nintendo, American Girl, Broadway, Bryant Park, Central Park.  Easy walk to the subway and we didn’t have any issues getting a taxi or Uber when needed.  

We stayed in the Madison suite, one king bed, sofa bed and a rollaway, and there was still a ton of room for the kids to hang out and relax after a busy day in the city. There was a mini fridge and two person dining table, too.   The room was quiet with great views.   The bathroom was large with a big soaking tub, which was nice for end of day sore feet.  

I was impressed with the responsiveness of the staff.  We needed a rollaway and extra towels and they arrived quickly.  I feel like so many hotels haven’t figured this out post Covid, so it was nice to not have to hunt someone down.  Kevin and Mary in the concierge were very helpful in booking our car service to and from the airport.  

The only downside we found was no in-room dining, just coffee in the morning.  We will be back for sure!

title: Omni Berkshire Staff
text:
We decided to visit NYC and stay at the Omni Berkshire. One expects great service at a luxury hotel and they did not disappoint.

The nice surprise was the staff.  Not only friendly and attentive but over the top in how we were treated . Thank you Nor in the restaurant and Lenny out front.  We will be back mostly because of your hospitality!

Chuck and Karen Evans

title: Great stay!
text: Great location between 5th and Madison.  Close to Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall.  Close enough to Timed Square without feeling too busy. Safe area.    Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Easy parking with valet. Bell staff was wonderful!

title: I would highly recommend not staying at this hotel on your next trip to NYC
text: I came on a business trip and need access to my room before the 3 p.m. check-in. The Omni Berkshire charged me a $45.00 upgrade fee for a premium room that was over the street. The room was so loud from street noise barely slept. The room definitely was not an upgrade. I was very disappointed with my stay. I would highly recommend not staying at this hotel on your next trip to NYC.

title: Warm and wonderful employees...very special
text: What makes this hotel so very special are the wonderful employees who truly care about it and the clients.  I want to specifically send a shout out to Nancy Evangelista and Frans Mudoro.   I usually arrive late, and they always greet me with a big smile and friendly conversation and tremendous warmth.  After a long journey, they make me feel so welcome.  Nancy and Frans care about the hotel, their fellow employees, and their guests.  They are terrific and a huge reason why i stay and will continue to stay and recommend the hotel to others.  Thank you, Nancy and Frans!  Rob W.

title: Great location, lovely hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for a fall weekend in NYC. The rooms were a decent size for NYC, nicely decorated and clean. Good bath products too. The hotel is walking distance to so many places- easy walk up to Central Park, over to Broadway shows and Lincoln Center. There is not a large lobby to hang out in, but Berk’s Restaurant and Bar was great. And we hung out on the outdoor patio on the 17th floor.

title: Nice location .., but.
text: Best location in NYC, but the beds are just like sleeping on a board and the pillows were like saltine crackers. Could not get a good nights sleep. Nice staff  however. Will stay somewhere next time with more comfy beds.

title: Horrible accommodations, service and insanely expensive
text: Horrible accommodations, horrible service and incredibly expensive! We paid $605 a night - for a room that was across from the elevator and on the 7th floor. I booked months in advance and asked for a high floor away from elevators and ice machine. Our towels literally had holes in them and our shower curtain was moldy?! In addition they tell you that Wi-Fi is free and then charge you an extra $30 a night for a ‘destination fee’ that they don’t disclose and it just shows up on your bill. When I called to ask what it was they said it was for Wi-Fi and the concierge that we never used?! Horrible hotel!

title: Terrible breakfast service and extremely rude !
text: At breakfast, I was refused to move to a table of my choice and the wait staff was extremely rude asking how long I intended to sit there.  It seemed border line racial profiling since I’m Asian and was staying there at the hotel for a week on business. I have not come across such service anywhere and not what you would typically expect at such a place. Very disappointing!

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text: I wanted to take a moment to sincerely thank everyone at the hotel for the lovely reception they gave to me and my family last week.  It was an extraordinary stay at a beautiful hotel and I am very appreciative of all of the hospitality you gave us.  From the excellent rooms to the wonderful amenities, the Omni Berkshire is an excellent choice in Manhattan.  Rooms are large and modern, the location is perfect for almost anything you’d want to do or see in NY and overall, the hotel is a great value. A big shout out to Isis, for making everything great.

title: Mediocre visit
text:
Hotel is in a good, midtown location. Our room was ok but nothing over the top. Didn't have any meals in the hotel so can't comment. Staff were not overly friendly, although gentleman across from elevator on right side of entrance was very friendly and pleasant. Front desk staff and porters not so much. We went to bar for drinks and really didn't get any engagement from he bartender...we're definitely up for a bit of chit chat but didn't get the vibe here.
We stayed at this hotel years ago and wanted to go back. 
Not sure I'd go again....found something lacking. Spent a lot for two nights but didn't feel like it was special. Hotel was clean and found no faults but feel staff should be a little more outgoing.

title: This Place Has It All.
text: This hotel has what I have come to expect from the Omni brand as a platinum member. Crisp and clean property with great service.  The location is safe and in proximity to many of the iconic New York sites.  Lenny at the door was the door to the City.  He assured that all was well and made us feel safe.

title: You’ll be better off going to a motel
text: When I checked in my room smelled horrid & has stains on the towels & robe so I requested to be moved & I was moved to the 17th floor just for one of the sensors in the hotel room to fall off while I was sleeping stains on the floor & robe when I complained about it at the front desk they did nothing about it I also had issues with our check out & the lady at the front desk was no help however she did agree to hold my luggage so when I come back the next morning sat in the lobby & ate my breakfast before my Uber arrived  then got my luggage & left but not before a older lady with glasses at the front desk stared & gave me very unwelcoming looks & hey I get it New York is different but this lady also went to the back multiple times to talk about me & literally did it at the front desk while I was leaving keep in mind at no point in time did I even speak to her I was just minding my business eating & waiting for my scheduled Uber so with that being said if you want to pay 600 plus for mediocre service a nasty room & unwelcoming staff then this is the place for you otherwise literally ANYWHERE ELSE will be better this was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at.

title: The best hotel in New York city
text: This is the best place to stay in NY city. The location is perfect and the staff very welcoming.  The room we had to celebrate our anniversary was over the top. The amenity was also delicious and very much appreciated.  Thanks to all for making our stay so special.

title: Stayed 4 nights in July
text: My wife and I were here to see some Broadway shows.  We picked this hotel because it was walking distance to the theatres we were visiting (the Niel Simon and Wintergarden) and there are some good restaurants on the way and near the theatres.  The Berkshire is a hotel with a lot of history which you can Google.  It has been updated as much as you can update an almost 100 year old hotel.  The place was very clean, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and rooms and lobby were nicely furnished.  The only knock was the bathroom which was pretty small.

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
text: This is a first rate hotel, in a perfect location. Wonderful friendly service and very helpful. The staff went out of their way to please me ,and I love the fresh water with fruit in it by the elevators. The rooms were spacious, and the bathroom had every amenity, one would want. However, the valet parking was very slow ,and expensive.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: The Omni is close to everything.  It would be nice to have room service, but there are lots of options around.  Nice staff.  Berk's Bar casual food better than expected.  The hotel very solid value for money.  The courtyard facing rooms are very quiet by NY standards.

title: Stay here! Wonderful!!!
text: Fabulous stay at the Omni Berkshire! Traveled with our teenage daughter and her friend and were upgraded to a beautiful  spacious suite, so much room so the girls had their own area ( because who wants to room with your parents?) thank you to the amazing front desk staff for that!!  We adored Lenny the doorman he was so entertaining and fun! Beds were very comfortable and the location was perfect proximity to 5th Ave, Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Such a great stay! Thank you so much! Keep doing everything you are doing!

title: Perfection
text:
Nicest hotel I've been in in quite awhile. Daily made service (shame on you other properties that don't do it) at least they tidied up and made our beds, provided fresh towels. Clean and observant staff from the doormen to the Concierge and Front desk.
Convenient to coffee shops and good restaurants, easy to get a cab from mid-town. On Fifth Avenue so shop till you drop! I can't venture enough compliments about this property as it is a welcome, quiet, retreat.

title: Great Location
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place in May 2022 for a long weekend. The hotel is in a great location easy to walk to nearby major attractions. 
The room was standard, but nicely furnished and the bathroom was spacious. We typically receive upgrades with our status, but that was not available then. 
Although we were located across from the elevator the hotel interior was quiet. However, major street construction from late evening to the morning was underway every night and at times disrupted sleep. The hotel bar and restaurant for breakfast are very nice with friendly staff. The bellmen were very accommodating. It was a bit odd that the concierge did not know about the newer Moynihan Train Hall--another staff member behind the desk had to explain it to her as she only knew of Penn Station. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay, and we would recommend this Omni to family and friends.

title: It's like Coming Home
text: We have been coming here for 15 years.  We cant' imagine the toll Covid took on the staff and team here.  We were thrilled to see this Fine Hotel return ( post Covid ) - So booked a return trip.  Not sure if there is a new property Mgr.  But let me say - it was the Best overall stay at this Hotel ever.  It's always been great & why we are so loyal and return.  But this trip - we were truly acknowledge and recognized for our years of returning and loyalty & it was awesome.  Service, Staff , Room and everything was perfection.  So glad that Mary is back on Concierge providing the same - Fabulous service - She always has.  She is definitely a NYC Diamond !  Lenny entertaini9ng and caring for you at door.  Michael & Crew at the front desk providing seamless & thoughtful  check-in - Andrew & Team in the Bar ( many years) caring for your every need.  Location is always perfection .  This place is where you want to be !  Thank you and be back soon.  Love you all like family.  Mark, Gary & Cherry

title: A wonderful NYC hotel-home away from home👍
text:
SO happy the Omni is back! A wonderful hotel with a perfect midtown location. Lenny the doorman is amazing and will make everyone feel so welcome. Be sure to sign up for select guest prior to booking—it’s free. Free coffee each morning.
Highly recommend!

title: Great visit!
text: I had the most wonderful stay at the Omni Berkshire.  The staff is incredible, the rooms were spacious and luxurious and the amenities were amazing.  This hotel recent underwent a nice lobby refresh and it looks terrific.  Omni was going to unaffiliate itself with this hotel after covid but due to NY labor issues decided to keep it.  I hope Omni keeps this property forever.  It is a truly wonderful property--one of the best in NYC.

title: few nights stay in Feb
text:
Fist time back in this hotel since the pandemic , my husband was on a business trip . We had a great room, sadly no room service available .

Staff super Mary the Concierge is lovely and always helps us . 

Love the location

title: Still great!
text: We.had a great time at the Omni.  Although the hotel can use a little lift in some of the rooms, the location is superb and the courtesy and kindness of each employee is, as always, warm and welcome.  Congratulations and thank you for opening again!

title: Magical stay at the Omni Berkshire
text:
We took a last minute trip to New York to see a show at Rockefeller Center and ended up staying at the Omni just based on proximity.

What a wonderful surprise! The hotel had just reopened a few weeks prior. The room looked fantastic! It was quite large by New York standards. It was so comfortable!

The staff could not have been more helpful, professional and hospitable. The very nice concierge even advised on a rapidly approaching storm when we were running out to grab a quick lunch. She wanted to make sure we did not get caught out in bad weather. The entire staff was so kind and eager to help.

It was an easy walk to Rockefeller Center and to Central Park. 

We had a magical stay in New York and the Omni Berkshire was a very large part of the magic.

We had a

title: Great location, good service when you can get it
text:
I'm torn how to review the Omni.  Like many hotels globally they are probably challenged to get staff and thus certain things are below standards.  

The hotel is a half block from my firm's HQ so absolutely convenient location for that and many things in mid-town: Rock center, Radio City, etc.  First the good: the staff in the hotel with whom I interacted (not sure if the attached bar/restaurant is actually managed by the hotel or not so excluding) are top-notch including the doormen/bellmen and the front desk.  They use the guest's name, they acknowledge status, they engage in polite chat but are also efficient.   

The housekeeping staff are clearly stretched thin but are polite and efficient.  When I returned from the office at 6 pm my first day my room hadn't been serviced but a maid knocked on the door as I was leaving for dinner at 6:15.  Cleaning was limited: my sheets didn't appear to be changed at all during my five-night stay, carpet wasn't vacuumed, but things were tidied.  At least it's something.  

Fitness room is actually pretty decent but equipment is jumbled.  Most noticeable was that staff clearly didn't even check the room for days at a time - several used towels were strewn in the same spots for several days before finally being picked up.  equipment was never arranged - dumbbells were never put back on the rack, bosu balls were all over.  Again, staff clearly didn't pay attention.

I was in a basic king-bed room facing the interior so I assume the entry-level room.  It had clearly been refreshed - looked like fresh paint, carpet and TV.  furniture isn't new but was in good condition.  Bathroom was small but nicely arranged - looks like it was redecorated about 15 years ago.  HVAC is a joke - like most NYC hotels in the winter you can't actually make the room cooler, it's always going to be warm; the numbers on the thermostat are just there to entertain you.  Oh, and pet peeve: NO COFFEE MAKER (or refrigerator) IN THE ROOM!!!  And in a hotel with no room service and no free coffee in the lobby, this is a no-go for me.  

The attached bar/restaurant was a real let down.  I wanted to have dinner solo one evening but they wouldn't seat me in the dining area and pointed me to the bar.  The bar was packed most evenings and I never saw anyone checking vaccination status (required by NYC law and, uh, logic).  Since there's no coffee maker in the room (see above) I hoped I could just walk in the morning and grab a paper cup to go - nah.  This is another huge turnoff for me.

Overall, convenient location, good staff, OK room and gym, but lack of room amenities and lack of dining option means I'll avoid the Omni on future visits.

title: Never again.
text:
I checked in this evening for a business trip, and specifically asked for a room on a high floor (this hotel has over 16 floors).  The man at the desk named Brent said those floors were closed due to the hotel recently reopening.  I said congratulations but I’ll take the highest floor available.  He put me on the 6th floor.
I try to go up the elevator and my key would not allow me to advance, as I’m about to step out of the elevator, an gentleman gets on and he is going to floor 17.  I thought that was weird because Brent just told me the tops floors were closed, but I let it go

I go to dinner with my colleague after a long days work, and when we return, she tells me she is on floor 17, and she did not ask for that floor they just gave it to her.  I went back to the desk to inform them of this and another gentleman said there is nothing available, and it’s “tricky”. They tried to convince me my room was an upgrade, but if I ask for something specific why offer me an upgrade without obliging my request?
 My colleague and I checked in on the same day, booked the same room for the same 2 nights.  I get frustrated and embarrassed at this point and I just yield and say Nevermind. I go to the elevator and my key does not work to advance me to my floor again,  Instead of fixing my key, they call security to escort me up.  He follows me to my room and stands in the doorway and looks in, I did not feel safer, I felt followed.

I haven’t been here that long but I know for sure I will never be back.  I don’t like how I am being treated and as someone who has travelled for work many times, this is far below the experience I would expect from a Hotel of this caliber.  I am tempted to check out and go somewhere else because I just don’t feel valued as a guest.

title: Fabulous hotel!
text: We travel to NYC every Thanksgiving. This is the first time we have stayed at an Omni hotel. The hotel is in a wonderful location. Between 5th and Madison. Across the street from Cartier and all the luxury shops. We were able to walk everywhere. Including Central Park and Time Square. The room was nice and quiet. I gave the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 because the beds were 2 double beds instead of 2 queens. Also- there is no coffee pot in the room. I am an early riser. They have coffee available in the restaurant at 630am. There should be a coffee pot in each room. The Doormen at the hotel were very nice and helpful. Lenny the doorman gave us a recommendation for breakfast the next street over, Toasties. This was an excellent recommendation. Thank you Lenny! It cost around $40 for French toast, omelette, bacon, coffee for the 3 of us, instead of over a hundred at the hotel restaurant. The hotel was not full occupancy, we could tell because we never had to wait for the elevator. We will definitely be back. Such a fun area and great hotel.

title: Mr
text:
I’m standing in the lobby at 1 pm. The guy  who checked me in called adam won’t let go to my room until 3 pm unless I pay a $75 dollar fee. Obviously the rooms are ready otherwise I couldn’t get in with a $75 fee but they would rather charge me that on top of the $500 I had to pay for one night. The guy has attitude and stared me down when I questioned this. 
Sometimes you wonder why they let people without any sense of service stand at the front desk of a hotel. Such poor form.

title: Sadly, it has closed 'permanently'
text: On June 11, 2020, I received my Omni Select Guest email which informed me that the Omni Berkshire is permanently closing.  Having stayed at this wonderful hotel since the 1990's, I am very sad for the wonderful management and staff at the Berkshire.  My wife and I have fond memories of Lenny, the terrific doorman.  His personality is first class and we will miss talking with him.  For those old enough to remember, the Berkshire was the hotel were "guests of Saturday Night Live stayed" during SNL early years from 1975 through the seventies.  We had the great fortune to meet and talk with Diane Carrol in the elevator, meet and talk with Snoop Dog when he arrived at the entrance.  I still enjoy looking at the photo of my wife with Snoop in the lobby.  This hotel will survive and hopefully be re-born under different ownership.  The location is perfect for visitors to the city.  Central Park is close by, the MOMA is close by, 5th avenue is close by, travel uptown or downtown is easy.  We will miss staying at our "favorite hotel in NYC".

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
This hotel is by far one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in! We stayed here for 11 nights and we are so pleased we did! It's close to all major tourist attraction sites, and luxury shopping is literally a few steps away from the hotel! Transport links are nearby including subway stations that gets you around the city in no time! 
Our room was spacious, clean and modern, and can I just say they have the best house keeping staff! Very friendly & professional!! Door staff and reception were also very friendly & helpful! 
As it was our first time in Newyork we wanted to stay somewhere comfortable & luxurious without paying an arm & a leg for it and Omni does both of those things! After a long day & night exploring the city, we couldn't wait to get into our comfortable beds! 

They also do not charge any additional taxes that som hotels do once you check in! 

So thankyou Omni for helping make our trip a memorable one! We will certainly be back again!

title: Wonderful Stay in NYC
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place for my Mom's 70th birthday and it was a wonderful experience.  The location is the best you can get in NYC (just off 5th Ave and a short walk to so many shops, restaurants, Central Park etc.)  The staff are so helpful - in particular the concierge service is exceptional! Our room was on the 32nd floor with a street view - highly recommended to add to the NYC experience! The restaurant in the hotel is lovely and the staff are very attentive but if it's too expensive, there are lots of lovely spots to eat nearby.  We had breakfast in Le Pain Quotidien which is only a 2 min walk from the hotel and casual dinners in places like Bill's Bar & Burger at the Rockefeller Center (only a 3 min walk) - however for a more upmarket dinner we would recommend Tao Uptown which does amazing cocktails and food and is only an 8 min walk from the hotel. We didn't get to use the fitness facilities during this trip but it's great to have that option in the hotel. We will definitely stay at the Omni Berkshire Place the next time we're in NYC!!

title: Excellent hotel in great location
text:
We stayed here as part of my 40th birthday celebrations and really glad we did.
The staff are very helpful.
The rooms have everything you need.
The location is a massive plus too.
I would definitely recommend staying here and would have no problem in returning here.
We had a great time.

title: Awesome.
text: I've traveled to the Omni Berkshire Place a number of times over the years, but this was my first visit in quite a while. The experience was fantastic: they've re-done the fitness center since I last went and they have almost everything I need; the housekeeping was fantastic. Prices fluctuate at this hotel, but if you have the option of booking here, it's an awesome value.

title: pretty good
text:
Spacious rooms great location to many sites.
But no in room coffee and the toileteries are not very good no shower caps and great doormen and excellent water in the lobby,the concierge service is very good and the elevators are very rapid. The room service is excellent and very early so if you are a late riser I suggest that you put the DO NOT DISTURB SIGN on the door

title: Decent but expensive
text: It is hard to choose the right hotel in NYC that you will feel comfortable in without missing anything that you can have gotten in a different hotel for the same or lower price. This is why my review is very honest as I am hoping to help other people deciding if this hotel is good enough for their needs. Why? Bc this hotel might be OK for an American citizen coming for a 1-2 days business but not OK for turists or a couple. Well I was quite disappointment rather than satisfied. This hotel provided a bed, roof over my head, shower, toiletaries INCLUDING quetips/swab and towels. What I was very disappointed in was that the room had NO complimentary water nor tea nor coffee like the rest of the worlds hotels has. Even 2 star hotel have such needs so this is why I will give this hotel 3 stars. I called the receptionist and I asked for tea and they brought to my room 1 teabag, 1 lemon slice, a spoon of honey and a bill charged 7 USD for this tea. I had no option but to pay and was hoping it would be a magical tea but it wasn’t. It was not possible to open any window so I would leave the AC on around 75 F/24 C. Every night my throat would get so dry and I was missing drinking water hence why I ordered the tea. Very annoying that I had to deal with that for the 5 days I was staying! Breakfast was really expensive too so it would pay better off to get ubereat or find some other place. I had 1 XL bathrobe for 2 people staying in my room. When I asked for a size small I was told they had only one size so I guess it is made for an average american size. Hotel is great walking distance to most things but I found out it would be better to stay in East Village as most nice events were happening there. Cleaning lady was very pleasant! I did not see why they had hired 2 men to stand by the entrance 24/7 but wouldn’t open the 2 heavy doors you had to pass to enter/leave even for a lady like me. In general the staff was great and very friendly!

title: Business hotel
text: Everything was excellent. I had a small challenge with my items left in the room- however I would return. They have a great bar. So for a great location in midtown Manhattan stay here . Highly recommend as it's close to major tourist holiday areaa..

title: Everything you could ask for!
text:
I recently stayed for two nights at the Omni. Our stay was excellent, and here’s why:

1. Upon arriving, we were greeted by a smiling doorman and excellent front desk service from Humi (sorry if I’m misspelling). Throughout our stay, the staff was exceptional, always warm and helpful.

2. The room was spacious at a bargain price, one of the best values you’ll find in NYC. There was one tiny issue—the bathroom door would not latch—but we reported it and it was fixed immediately.

3. The location is excellent. Walkable to many attractions, but far enough from Times Square for a little (relative) quiet.

I will stay here again, no question.

title: Excellent return visit!
text:
I’m
A repeat guest because this location just can’t be beat for visitors. So close to both Rockefeller and the park. I’m glad there’s Isadoras across the street for inexpensive meals and snacks, but also if you are an Omni select guest member they will deliver complimentary coffee in the morning. 
This trip included my teen daughter who was celebrating a birthday and the hotel went above and beyond (thank you Krystle!) to leave her special treats and make it a great trip for her. 
The beds were clean and comfortable and the Nest bath products were nice. 
We were also grateful for the smooth express checkout and the clean, friendly airport transfer. The doormen were kind and helped with cabs and directions. Will definitely return!!

title: IT'S TAX SEASON AGAIN.
text: The rooms are great, The staff is top notch.They exceeded my every expectations. I have a profile with the hotel, and they do their best to exceed it. I am a repeat client and they understand my specific needs to keep my clients happy..

title: Omni holiday trip
text:
On arrival the doormen were there to greet us but the hotel front has scaffolding so not too impressive (as does 50% of New York it seems)
As you enter the lobby it is much smaller than imagined, only sitting space for about 12.
The receptionist asked our name and then said he needed to check room was available, which seemed odd as it was 6pm. He came back after a few minutes and said all good.... door keys were printed and we are told we had room 301. Looking back we got no information about the hotel, what was on our doorstep or anything useful. This may be because the concierge is round the corner but they just smile and have print outs on the desk. 
We were also not informed of what the resort fee goes towards, in fact the full 5 nights at $34 a night was taken from our card on check in!
One bonus is that we linked our Omni rewards card and got given 1card per night that allow 2 morning drinks per room. We got coffee each day and there was enough in the 2 pots for all 4 of us in the room (2a and 2 teenagers). 
The room was nice and quiet away from street noise (except sirens) but with no city view, which we knew. The beds were fairly small but the bathroom was a decent size. Teenage boys sharing a bed was a challenge but just enough room to put a pillow down the centre of the bed.
There seemed to be a cold draught from the window but the room itself was warm enough, air con heated the room fairly quickly. We didn’t hear any other guests from above or side (2nd floor was conference facilities so no noise from there at night). 
Location was good, away from the madness of Times Sq and near to Rockefeller’s and 10 minute walk to Central Park, however nearest subway to get to financial district was either 59th street or Grand Central (unless we missed something). We went to the Vessel and Chinatown and both were a long walk away, save your legs and get a subway.
Check out was 12pm and no issues storing the bag until pickup. 
All in all they just didn’t make us feel special..... not enough to complain about but we expected more, given what we have experienced at other hotels around the world.

title: Not good for coffee and tea lovers
text: Myself and my partner stayed here for four nights and although the hotel room was very spacious and had all the essential amenities the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room did disappoint me as I am a caffeine fiend and need a cup of coffee first thing in the morning to get me going. Luckily there was a cafe right opposite the hotel so we were able to grab one there but it would of been so much nicer having one in the room even a kettle on its own would of sufficed as we could of grabbed some coffee and milk ourselves. The room was lovely but we were right next to the ice machine so we had a bit of traffic now and again but nothing major; the hotel itself was very elegant looking and was in a good location but one gentleman at the desk was very unhelpful and abrupt with my partner so that wasn't a pleasant experience as he put us off returning in the future.

title: Great hotel but very rude management on front desk.
text: Nice hotel. Clean rooms but no coffee or kettle facilities in room which is a huge downfall. Huge downside for us was we paid several hundred to stay for 4 nights.we asked the night manager on the front desk for an extra hour or 2 late check out and he was extremely rude, help was non existent and he wanted to charge us $135 which is ridiculous. I’ve never know such a rude individual working on a front desk. We are coming back to New York In may for 10 nights. For this reason alone we will be spending our money else where which is a real shame because we really liked the hotel. Seem happy enough taking the money from guests but with no help back. Currently in room 1205.

title: City Getaway
text: Hotel is in a great location for shopping ,theater,and dining.  Well maintained and the rooms are well appointed and nice sized.  Staff is very helpful. Transportation and access to subway and buses is also a positive.

title: Amazing Stay & Amazing Person
text: Krystle Neives is the reason why my wife and I keep coming back to OMNI Berkshire Place. The room was amazing and Krystle made our stay even more memorable. This is the only place I look to stay when we come into Manhattan and Krystle is the reason why. Thank you so much for your thoughtfulness.

title: Thought it would be better
text: Room was spacious but it was the Madison Suite so it should be. You pay a lot of money for nothing special.  Housekeeping was great and so were all the doormen but that is where it ends.  Rooms are outdated and again for the price should be much nicer.

title: The Good, the Bad and the Average
text:
Let’s start with the good in this hotel. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards and the bed is an absolute winner. As extensive travellers we sleep in lots of beds but this was outstanding. Great rooms are definitely a great start. The concierge desk was well staffed and super helpful. Thank you Mary in particular. The doormen always had a friendly few words too. It’s a shame these guys couldn’t pass on their customer service skills to the frosty front desk. We received a cold to lukewarm reception from Patricia whose personality and charm matched the subzero temperatures outside. Yours was the first impression, my dear and it was poor. She muttered something about additional fees but not what these were...I’m still trying to work these out. We are Omni benefit holders (which the hotel should have known as I did advise of this pre-arrival) but there was no mention made of what these benefits might be. I compare to almost any other hotel which will say “ah, I see you are xxx, let me tell you what this means for you during your stay”.
With no Nespresso machine (I get that, it’s a 4 star so not a must), we laughed out loud at the surcharges had we wanted to order a cup of coffee with room service...I wished I’d taken a photo but if my memory serves me correctly ...cup of coffee 7 USD (fine) but for anything over 5 USD (there is absolutely nothing listed), an 18% service charge plus a 5 USD “in room dining experience fee” (LOL) is charged. This is hilarious at best and downright outrageous at worst. Again we travel all over the world and we are anything but cheapskates but I’ve yet to have seen anything quite so in your face obnoxious. What a shame.
So upon reflection the good was good, the bad was appalling and actually there was little average in between. I may have to revise the title of this review 😊

title: Our home away from home in NYC
text: I started staying at the Omni Berkshire for convenience when my corporate headquarters moved to within a couple of blocks, but our experience with the hotel has made it our go-to hotel choice whenever we visit New York City, for work or pleasure.  The staff is top-notch--always helpful, knowledgeable and accomodating.  The location is ideal--a quick walk to anywhere in midtown (Central Park, Times Square/Theater District, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, etc.) with lots of good restaurants nearby.  We love being close enough to everything that we can easily walk but also just far enough away from crowded tourist areas.  Not only have we never had a bad experience, we've always had great experiences here and the Omni Berkshire is highlight in our trips--everything about the hotel feels like a frictionless experience and we always look forward to our trips to the city in part because the hotel aspect is so pleasant and enjoyable.

title: Not a Good NYC Hotel Choice
text:
With so many hotel choices in NYC, the Omni Berkshire is not a good place to stay.  The hotel is rundown.  We stayed there with our 13 year old twins.  At bedtime, we pulled back the sheets on one bed and there was hair all over it.  We called to have the sheets changed and it took over an hour for someone to come.  There is black mold in the bathroom over the doorway.   We ordered a cappucino in the morning via room service and it took over an hour for it to come.  Our first day there, we ordered lunch room service.  We paid $200.00 for our room-service meal (eggs, bacon, avocado toast and a club sandwich) it was way overpriced and just basically not that good.  

Early morning, housekeeping bangs on all the doors to get the rooms clean so don't think about sleeping in!  

We chose this hotel because we loved our experience at the Omni in Los Angeles.  That is a wonderful hotel.  The Omni Berkshire in NYC is nowhere on the same standard.  So, be careful if your decision to choose this hotel is based on a good experience from another Omni.    

We would never stay here again and would not recommend it.

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel was clean and location was great. Walking distance from Time Square, shopping and a short drive away to ktown. 
My friend was taking a shower and shower head fell off. I hope this doesn't happen to any other guests. Even though we were up on 18th floor view was not as great as I thought.

title: Very nice, well located hotel
text: We had an excellent stay (3 nights). For us, the location was perfect. We walked from Grand Central Station, walked to the theater (Hamilton), walked to son's apartment (30th st), walked to cousin's apartment (60 th st) and on Monday, our only rainy day, walked to nearby MoMA. Room was very nice and QUIET! We faced an interior space, not attractive, no view, but kept the shade down and really enjoyed the silence. Service was great, helpful and polite when we needed it, but we needed little. Unfortunately we were too busy to even check out the exercise room. We got a great deal on the room rate. Would definitely go back.

title: Always our go to in the city !
text: Clean and great location.  We ve stayed here for over 12 years.  Love the staff here.  Kevin & Mary in Concierge are like family !  john out front was awesome.  As always thank you for taking such great care of guest.

title: Great place in ideal location.
text: We stayed here 2nd to 9th Feb and really enjoyed the service, room and location of the hotel. Rooms were thoroughly cleaned daily, were warm and comfortable - the double bed was huge, comfortable and bedding was lovely. All staff were helpful and couldn't do enough for you. Location was great for us, close to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: De las mejores ubicaciones en NY
text: Además de la ubicación, el proceso de check-in en linea lo hace muy sencillo. Localizado a tan solo unos pasos de la Quinta Avenida, la Catedral de San Patricio, acceso al metro de Nueva York y las mejores tiendas de la ciudad. Precio calidad muy bueno

title: NY NY Holidays Trip
text:
Excellent Experience!
Location, one of the best, in a couple of steps you are in the Fifth Avenue, best corner Cartier and ... everywhere you looked Christmas decoration, Hotel, Stores, every corner of NY,NY...

title: Great New York stay
text:
We were in town visiting for a show at Radio City Hall. When we got to the hotel the doormen couldn't have been more friendly and welcoming.  The check in process was quick and easy.  The room was spotlessly clean and quite spacious.  The bed was very comfortable.  We were leaving on Superbowl Sunday and as we waited for a friend in the lobby, my husband had a great conversation with one of the doormen about the 2 teams and again all of them couldn't have been nicer.
Thank you for making our stay a great one.  We will be back and would recommend this hotel in future to people.
Tara Mulroy and Fran O' Brien

title: What a wonderful hotel
text: Stayed here for three nights from 16-19 Jan . From the moment we arrived everything was seamless. The front desk check in a pleasure . Kevin and mary at the concierge desk so helpful . We had adjoining rooms . Perfect for our family of 5 . They had no problem in setting up spare camp bed for the youngest . The location is perfect . I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough .  I will be back to NYC and can’t wait to stay at the Berkshire again . Well done to all the management for such a fine and well run Hotel . Niall healy and family Tralee Ireland

title: Couldnt fault a thing - great location!
text:
Lovely classic feel about the hotel , very clean - the staff extremely helpful and friendly .
I think the location has to be one of the best around .
Our room was comfortable and spacious , we did not have any view ( overlooked other buildings) but it was a the back so very peaceful at night . I would definitely stay here again.

title: New york ia
text: Fab hotel with excellent location and very knowledgeable and helpful staff. Rooms spacious and aminieties excellent. Would recommend this hotel. Lovely deli over the road from hotel. Would defo stay again.

title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location
text: Stayed just one night for a short weekend with a friend. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. Our room was large by NY standards and lovely. What was particularly interesting was how quiet it was. Everything we planned was close by - tea at The Plaza, MOMA, and a play right down the street. A perfect location for a trip to NY.

title: Good time with with the family
text: The location is ideal to Rockefeller Center, shopping, and Central Park all within walkin distance.  The staff is extrmely friendly and helpful. Julien at the concierge desk assited us in the best place to go with a 6yr and a 2yr including a great kid's freindly restaurant.  Tony and Larry at the front made us feel welcome from the moment we parked to the moment we check-out.  Both Micheal at the bell desk we extremly helpful.  Micheal at the front desk made us feel welcome and like family.  Abhi at housekkeping took care of our needs immediately. The overall experience was superb and I recommend the hotel for a great weekend getaway.

title: Well-Located and Friendly
text:
The Omni Berkshire Place is in mid-town Manhattan only a block or two from Rockefeller Center and maybe a block over from St. Patrick's Cathedral. It's an easy walk for business and sites such as MOMA (about 2 blocks away). Central Park is about a half-mile away. I walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, but it's about 1.5 miles along 5th Avenue. I enjoyed the walk, but you could easily take an cab/Uber/Lyft.

My room was modern and clean. It was smaller than hotels I've had elsewhere, but that's pretty much true of any hotel in New York. There were ample plugs at the desk for my phone, computer, etc. They have Internet included in the rate if you become an Omni rewards member (which doesn't cost anything). You can upgrade speeds for a fee, but I found the standard speed fine for reading emails.

The staff was pleasant both at check in and when I spoke later on a logistics issue.

We had a fire alarm go off, apparently for technical reasons, at 3 a.m. I would view that as an aberration.

There is no coffee maker in the room. You might be able to get coffee at the restaurant downstairs. I'm not sure of how common this is of other New York hotels, but I would have liked a cup to start my day in my room.

This is a nice, well-located hotel and would make a good choice if you are in New York for business or pleasure.

title: Winter in the City
text: Great location, excellent cocktails at the bar, wonderful and efficient staff, and large spacious rooms.  My favorite place to stay in the city.  Near Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping, and fabulous restaurants.

title: The Omni Berkshire is a great hotel that cares about its guests
text:
I recently stayed at The Omni Berkshire and wanted to say that I really enjoyed my stay. Everyone from the bellman, front desk, concierge had a great attitude. The success and failure of a business is the quality of the people that are hired. I stay here 20 nights a year and it’s great to see the same people working at the Omni Berkshire. 
All the best, Ken H

title: Another wonderful stay at the Omni!
text: We stay only at the Omni Berkshire in NYC.   The service is great, the rooms are beautiful.   We had the Author suite this past weekend for four nights, wow...amazing room! Concierge was able to get us a car service (luxury SUV) back to the airport the same price a cab would have been - how can you argue with that!   Bob's is great for late night drinks and appetizers too!

title: The only hotel I’d stay in while visiting NYC!
text: The Omni Berkshire is centrally located to all subway lines, Central Park, shopping and theaters. The location is especially safe for late night arrivals from the airport or the theaters. Always sparkling clean and the entire staff is incredibly friendly and genuine, nothing fake. I’ve even left valuables in the safe before (en route to the airport) and the security staff helped calm me down and FedEx the items back to me. I will be forever grateful!

title: Christmas in NYC!
text: Family visited NYC for Christmas, staying from Christmas Eve. Omni Berkshire is well situated & close to both Times Sq & ideal for Fifth Avenue. Desk Staff were fantastically helpful, Mary, Seth & Adam all available to provide advice and information. Door staff attentive and helpful arranging transportation & directions. We used “Bobs Kitchen” the adjacent hotel restaurant on one occasion. It was convenient but a little expensive for a limited menu. Rooms in Omni Berkshire were lovely. The room service was first class. A terrific convenient & well priced hotel.

title: Lovely location
text:
A group of 10 of us stayed here for a long weekend & we loved it!
