It’s a beautiful hotel in a great location for seeing all of the touristy things! 
It was an easy walk to Times Square, Grand Central & lots of other places and there is a subway station just around the corner to get to anywhere else you need to get to.
The rooms are pretty spacious for New York & were spotlessly clean & the staff were friendly. I’d definitely recommend anyone to stay here.
There is an adjoining steakhouse, but we didn’t eat there as there are plenty of other options around.
We were all very happy with our stay.

title: Please refund our deposit
text:
Enjoyed a fabulous stay in a great location!

The hotel charged over £3,000 to our credit card as a deposit for two rooms. There were no extras on the account to settle and were told we would be refunded. After three weeks, the money had not been returned despite emailing. We have now had part of the money returned. I’ve continued to ask for the remainder to be paid, but had no response again. The only way I can think to get them to respond properly and finally pay the remainder of the money they took from us will be by posting this message. Not great. Be careful.

title: Poor hotel 4 star not
text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights inJanuary , hotel location excellent but the food in the chop house was terrible, you get served a giant inedible carrot with all main meals , never in my life have I been served carrot in this way, please change it ,it is awful. Breakfast was ok but having to butter your toast and eat breakfast with a giant steak knife is impossible.some staff great but others inpatient and unfriendly,no coffee or tea making facilities in the room,which upset me as I like a early  morning cuppa without the cost of room service, which is why presumably they do it. Would not stay here again.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great location for shopping and entertainment. Very professional staff in every department. A favorite NYC hotel with easy walk to Times Square for theater and World class shopping just a half block away. Also easy access to Laguardia.

title: Central location
text: I did a one night stay at the Omni Berkshire in December, it was a good location for both business and holiday site seeing.  I was underwhelmed by the rooms, low ceilings and bad lighting left a bad impression.  Front desk staff was super friendly and helpful when I was checking in very late in the evening, so I really enjoyed the service level.

title: Deludente ...
Amazing stay at the Berkshire Place!
text:
My stay at the Omni Berkshire Place was incredible!  The room was clean and spacious, the staff was very helpful and they even left me a nice welcome gift (Champagne and Fruit) when i arrived as it was my birthday weekend. 

It was during the holidays so it was nice to see Santa Claus sitting in the lobby when I was heading out and i got to take a picture with him.  

The entire experience was very pleasant!

title: Perfect
text:
Lenny took excellent care of us and made sure our transportation was safe, shopping successful and we were headed in the right direction.  A lovely hotel.  Go to Gregory’s for coffee, breakfast etc....we also enjoyed Isadora’s for a quick inexpensive breakfast/lunch. Both restaurants are near the hotel.  
The hotel is nice I do wish they had a bar separate from Bob’s Chop House—-we weren’t impressed with their bar or service.

title: Confort, ubicación, atención y comodidad,
text:
Hotel excelentemente situado entre la Av. Madison y la 5ª Avenida, en la calle 52, prácticamente en el centro de Manhattan. A tan solo 15 minutos paseando de Time Square, a cinco minutos de St. Patrick y del Top Of The Rock. Para mi el sitio casi perfecto para alojarte en Nueva York.
Desayunar en el hotel es muy caro, por lo que justo en frente esta Isadora, un lugar donde poder desayunar a un precio razonable, teniendo en cuenta que Nueva York es una ciudad cara.

title: Over-priced and so unfriendly place and staff
text: The hotel does not desserve a 4* label. There is no lobby. The last renovation certainly took place a long time ago. The breakfast takes place in the hotel steak house restaurant, which is a totally dark place where you just don't want to stay for breakfast. The staff is unpleasant and not at all friendly. They talk rudely. They don't take into consideration your expectations and/or simple needs. There is not enough lifts, so you have to wait for ages to go up or down. There is nothing about this hotel that is to be positively mentioned except its location.

title: Love the location!
text: The place is hidden yet it's in the middle of everything.  I was here for work, and it is 7 blocks away.  Traffic might get congested because it's in the middle of everything, but there's an Amazon Go couple blocks away.  5th Ave on the other side.  Gift buying, food hunting, all are conveniently located.  The bell staff are super nice and the check-in staff tried to accommodate which both are much appreciated and welcome for out of town folks.

title: Great Stay! Will definitely go back
text: We came upon this hotel on a last minute stay.  Walked in and the lobby was great, instantly I felt good about the Omni.  The rooms were clean, nice large size, large bathrooms, which are so important.  Every detail was included.  It was a rainy NY and not only was there umbrella in the room but in the lobby for our use.  The adjoining restaurant, was friendly, and offered good food and drinks.The location was ideal and close to all.  The Omni Berkshire is our new favorite hotel!!!

title: Location and service
text:
I travel to NYC fairly frequently on business and always try to stay at the Omni Berkshire because it is close to my company's NYC office and I like the place!  Rooms are good sized.  Bathroom is clean, not too big, but very serviceable.  Room is well set up. Room service menu is very good - I recommend the salmon!

My most recent trip there (December 2019) I noticed a a few things that the Omni doesn't have but other comparable hotels in the area offer:  1. there were no robes in the room (the towels are not that big!), 2. there was no shower cap, and 3. there were no snacks or minibar.  Also, while all website say free WiFi, the in-room info stated there would be a charge.  These things won't keep me from staying at the Omni in the future (didn't there used to be robes???), it would be nice if they were offered. 

All in all, a very good experience always and I will be back!

title: Highly recommend
text: The Omni Berkshire was a perfect location for the holiday season.  Within walking distance to 30 Rock, Radio City. The rooms are a nice size....not small at all; beds are UBER comfortable. Easy check-in.   Never had to wait extensively for the elevator. Friendly staff.  Loved everything about it. Just a really great stay and I will definitely stay here again and again.

title: Great location for a busy New York holiday
text: We stayed here for New Year’s Eve 2019/2020. The hotel and staff were brilliant. The room was clean and modern, and larger than we expected for New York which made our stay very comfortable. The majority of the time we could not hear much noise from outside but there were times when we could for example the bins being collected, traffic jams (car horns), but overall this wasn’t a big issue. The concierge were extremely helpful on a number of occasions. The adjoining restaurant Bobs has a bar which is quite pricey but this was expected in central New York. Location is great, close to the main attractions and also a metro station which was easy to use. The only downside was the city tax we were required to pay (around $35 per night) so it is worth being aware of this before booking as it can increase the overall cost by quite a large amount if you are staying for a few nights. Although, we had researched this and understand it is standard across city centre hotels. Overall a good base for a busy few days in New York City.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
L’emplacement de cet hôtel est idéal
En revanche, on ne comprend pas très bien à quoi servent les concierges en face des ascenseurs
Ils ne réservent pas de spectables, pas de restaurants, pas de taxis...
Manque une bouilloire pour faire un thé au retour de longues marches new yorkaises et un bouteille d’eau à l’arrivée

title: Great location for all things great in NYC!
text: Located perfectly for shopping, sightseeing and restaurants! Make sure you sign up to the free members scheme to receive a free beverage for up to two guests each morning (hot or cold). In room dining seemed pricey but there's a decent  cafe serving breakfast  lunch and dinner if needed just opposite

title: Christmas in New York
text:
We stayed xmas eve till the 28th, clean room decent size, location for us was perfect. Christmas decor was lovely, wish they would run this through more of the hotel, even something simple in the rooms. I did take my own to ensure we had xmas feel within the room. 
No fridge in the room which would be a good idea not sure if we could have had one or not. No water or tea coffee in room, this is something standard in uk hotels. Again if there was a facility nobody advised and I couldn't see anything to suggest on the room info, room service only. The staff on the front door are very helpful, probably more so than front desk and concierge, (sorry just my opinion) 

This wouldn't stop me from staying here again as mentioned a clean hotel in good location did help. 
Think the hotel missed a few tricks with it being xmas and as New york is one of the best places to go for Christmas I think the hotel could offer more.
A note from the hotel to the youngest about wishing them a good Christmas, a merry Christmas drink offer to toast christmas. A christmas card, just ideas throwing them out there...

title: Happy New Year
text: This was our third visit to New York and the Omni is by far the best hotel we have stayed in while visiting this fabulous City. The room was far larger than what we have experienced in the past and the location was fantastic for getting out and about. The staff are very accommodating and pleasant, we arrive around 4pm and because our rooms were not ready they provided our party of 7 with a free drink of our choice in Bob’s bar.  The beds were quite comfortable with nice fluffy pillows, good-sized bathroom and a street view above the reception area although this did not affect our sleep quality. Should we return to NY in the future I would have no hesitation of staying here again.

title: CHRISTMAS в Нью Йорке
text: Как и два года назад отель превосходен. Все сотрудники отличные работники, готовы помочь всегда. Комната чистая и тёплая. Консьерж Ленни , как всегда, помог с машиной и был очень любезен. Всем рекомендую отель. И мы только туда всегда !!! Расположение лучше быть не может.

title: Excellent decision
text: We just returned from a week in NYC domiciled at the Omni Berkshire. We had a suite which allowed us to spread out and relax. Every part of our experience was positive. We were most happy with the location and proximity to Rockefeller Center and two subway entrances nearby. We also enjoyed several restaurants within walking distance (Valbella, Toscana 49, and Lavo). Isadora’s across the street for snacks. 24-hour CVS just a couple of blocks away. The keys to this property are the doormen John, John B, and Anthony. They’re all great guys who get you headed in the right direction & via the most efficient means to your destination. Room service was also very good. Next time we’re in NYC, we’ll be at the Omni Berkshire. Why change great?

title: Excellent location and clean room
text: My wife and I visited Manhattan (NYC) in early December to see friends. The hotel’s location is excellent for visiting museums, sightseeing and various restaurants. It is also close to subway stations and bus stops which is wonderful considering the heavy traffic in Manhattan at Christmas time. The hotel room was a bit small, but very clean. We loved it.

title: Excellent position for sightseeing
text:
Visited between 23-27 dec with my wife and another couple of friends . easy check in and room was on 9th floor with inside views of offices but this made it very quiet as rooms with road were a lot noisy compared as road traffic could be heard. 
The hotel is in excellent position for walking to attractions like Rockefeller centre Central Park Times Square and shopping on 5th avenue and Maddison avenue 
Rooms are spacious and clean and tidy and all staff made for a lovely holiday and are credit to the hotel 
Totally recommend this hotel

title: Great spot, quiet room!
text:
Situated on 52nd and Madison the hotel is in a perfect spot for many key attractions
The room was well appointed a good size and more importantly no traffic noise, which is amazing for new york.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The bar is welcoming and situated next to the restaurant.
Would recommend as a great base.

title: Superb In EVERY way!
text:
From the minute we arrived, until the moment we departed, the Omni Berkshire was a WONDERFUL experience! We arrived in a snow squall, and was quickly greeted by a smiling, and very welcoming bellman! The friendly front desk staff efficiently checked us in. Our room was beyond comfortable, including an amazing bed, relaxing shower, and all the amenities one could wish! Oh... and let's not overlook the wonderful room service! The food was delicious, the service staff was prompt and courteous. The Omni Berkshire is uniquely located within walking distance of many of the Christmas sights, as well as the Museum of Modern Art, Fifth Ave, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, and Trump Tower, just to mention a few. Bob's Steak & Chop House, located within the hotel, is excellent, as are many great restaurants close by! 

We would highly recommend the Omni Berkshire for your stay in New York City!

title: Two days in NYC
text:
We loved the Omni Berkshire, the staff is wonderful, our room exceeded our expectations as we were upgraded to a lovely suite.
The hot chocolate was the best as was the gentleman who delivered it.  It was the perfect place to stay to see the Christmas Show!

title: Best NYC experience, from a Former New Yorker now living in New Orleans
text: I have stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place recently, Sept. 2019.  My experience then was outstanding.  I was in for my sons wedding and invited several good friends to stay at the Omni with me.  Staff was exceptional and a special shout out and an additional thank you to the Front Door Doormen, the housekeeping staff and the Bar Tender at Bob's.  They all added to a wonderful time in NYC.  This is from someone born in NYC, lived here until well into my 40's, now living for the past 30 years in New Orleans.  Could not have had a better stay anywhere!  Thank you Omni.   Arnold M. Goldberg

title: Avoid at all costs
text: I’m black status with Omni and was shocked by the service here. The front desk agent Maria was so sneaky and tried to look up our personal information after we questioned her actions in terms of lying and saying that valet parking was operated in relation to Omni and was entirely third party. The manager Andrea , was amazing in handling how saddening Maria treated us . Never go to this property- we love the ritz across the street or even the Langham.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Our stay was excellent. We had a beautiful room.  The staff is so attentive and friendly.  We stayed with 2 children and the hotel is family friendly.  The location is perfect - easy walking to most popular spots - radio city, rockefellar, times square.

title: Excellent Service!
text: This was the first time my friends and I had stayed at this hotel. It was amazing!  The personalized service, attention to detail, midtown location, and willingness to accommodate us in ways we didn’t even think of made our trip to NYC that much more memorable! Thank you, Omni staff.  I can tell you I will see you again because this is now my favorite hotel in NYC!

title: Nice hotel but there is better value even in New York
text: We stayed here in October for 2 nights and were content with the hotel and the location.  They convinced us to upgrade to a different room which was literally no bigger and the only difference was a view into offices instead of a roof so we went back to the front desk and the front desk lady was rude that we wanted to switch to our originally booked room. I believe I paid about 300 per night which I felt a was tad high given the size of the room. But it was a pretty good hotel otherwise and definitely did the job.

title: Great hotel for New York City
text: This property is our absolute favorite in New York for both business and pleasure.  Our room was nice, clean, and the staff was very attentive. Also a great location as well. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: My mother and I had a fabulous stay here. We have visited this property every year for the past 15 years. The staff always is friendly and accommodating. This year my mother took ill and we had to cut short our stay. The hotel worked with us to ensure we left happy. The property is perfectly located with easy access to the subway. We will continue to visit this hotel every year because the staff does a superb job in ensuring a quality stay.

title: Beautiful hotel with great staff
text: Traveled in from LI for an overnight stay to see West Side Story...separate review . My husband passed this hotel everyday for 25 years as he worked up the block . Always on our list to try ...finally made it! Just lovely hotel, lobby, and very comfortable room. Surprisingly quiet room (926) considering how many rooms in the floor and we were near the elevator . These older blogs have nice thick walls! Nice shower , roomy bathroom, comfy bed, great location for going to the Broadway theatre . Had dinner at Bob’s in the hotel ....convenient in the pouring rain and just fabulous ! Also separate review. You will enjoy this hotel...go...enjoy!

title: Nita good beginning but turned out good
text: I booked the hotel directly and still didn’t get the room I had requested. We were moved after the first night. We stay here for the location, which is perfect. Concierge was worthless. The mgr was very accommodating with all our problems. But, location location location. Club sandwiches in restaurant were horrible and expensive.

title: Beautiful Hotel in a Fantastic Location!
text: I traveled to NYC with some friends for a girls weekend in the city and to see the holiday sights. We selected the Omni Berkshire Place primarily for its location, as well as the wonderful price we were so lucky to snag it for on expedia. We booked the spacious Berkshire Suite but I believe we may have been upgraded to the Madison suite without knowing (room 612)! The hotel was clean, spacious, in a wonderful location and the staff was excellent. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and hope to return very soon!

title: Very nice hotel in a great location
text:
We selected the Omni Berkshire Place primarily for its location, as we were visiting for a few days to see the holiday sights and wanted to be near Rockefeller Center, Radio City, 5th Ave, etc.  It is perfect for that, and quite a bit less expensive than the nearby Lotte Palace which we also considered.  It doesn't have the grand lobby and the rooms were not particularly luxurious, but they were clean, comfortable and well-appointed, and the service was excellent.  

We were on the 4th floor overlooking 52nd Street, and did not have any problem with noise. I saw one comment about waiting for elevators - we did not find them to be slow, and also note that there are two banks of elevators on either side of the lobby, maybe 50 feet apart, so it should not be an issue.  The rooms are nicely done, although showing their age a bit.  Bed was very comfortable.  There was only one bathrobe in the room, so I requested another, not knowing my husband had also asked - we ended up with four robes!  Also couldn't figure out how to reset the time on the clock, so they ended up replacing it with a newer one, which was nice as it had USB outlets on it as well.  They do have electrical outlets at each bedside, which I always appreciate.  There is no coffee maker in the room, but if you sign up for their free loyalty program they will deliver your choice of beverage each morning.  There's also an umbrella in the room, which came in handy one day.

Bob's is a good restaurant, we had breakfast there a couple of times, as well as a nice steak dinner and, another night, a light meal in the bar.  Of course there are many other options within walking distance, including the excellent Fig and Olive right across the street.

title: Location a Positive but Amenities Were Lacking
text:
The Omni’s location was perfect for our trip, but the hotel left us wanting more. Check in was easy and we were directed to the elevator to get to our upgraded room. We learned that the hotel only used one of the two elevators for guests while the other was for service personnel.  This caused us to wait for long periods of time to get to the room or to the lobby.

Our clean room had a small bathroom with a single sink and a tub.  The hair dryer worked for a while at full strength then cut to less power.  The bathroom door needed to be propped open because it continued to close.

The king sized bed was comfortable.  There was a safe but no turn down service, bottled water, or a coffee maker. Our room was close to the elevator so we could hear voices at night along with the sirens and traffic outside the window.  

The Santa in the lobby was perfect. His clothing was beautiful and the children loved him. When we went outside to get a cab, we were told to walk to the corner to find one because the street was closed off. 

For the price, we expected a bit more.

title: really impressed with the Omni
text:
we visited the Omni after reading the good feedback and would agree . location is excellent , especially for shopping . staff are friendly , rooms very clean and comfortable 
and free wifi worked well . i would stay again without a problem

title: December in NYC
text: Very nice hotel with friendly staff! A bit pricey for the room, but it’s December. The staff made great city recommendations and they were always smiling and friendly. They made you feel valued as a hotel guest,

title: Best Holiday Location and Accommodations!
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire over Thanksgiving and can not say enough great things.  The hotel was spotless and beautifully decorated for the holiday season.  Every employee was personable and helpful.  Without the asking, our room was upgraded to a gorgeous corner suite - a great treat especially since we were staying on Thanksgiving Day/Night.  The location is right off of 5th Ave with Rockefeller Center/Saks Fifth Ave window display just a short walk around the corner.

title: Wonderful stay at this amazing hotel..
text:
This was our second stay at the Omni Berkshire New York and we have now found our perfect place to stay in NY...
We have stayed at many other hotels in NY, but the staff make this place extra special and the hotel itself is also very beautiful with great amenities and spacious rooms, not to mention its fantastic location.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone who want to visit NY....You will love it...

title: Consistent Quality
text:
As a solo traveler that visit NYC every month via train, the Omni Berkshire meets my needs perfectly. Close to Fifth Avenue with none of the tourist mayhem and noise, the Omni staff provides a warm welcome and a consistent in-room experience. I once lost my new glasses outside the hotel due to a rainstorm and the doormen had them! I somehow wasn't even shocked that they would keep them safe in big bad New York.

I find the rooms to be cozy, the bathrooms to be generous and appreciate the amenities, I always choose a city view and have always faced 52nd street. Very close to all bus lines and MTA.

Did I mention that room service is attached to Bob's steak house? Never a bad meal. There are other wonderful eateries, Starbucks and drug stores nearby to keep you comfortable during your stay.

The highlight of my recent Thanksgiving trip was Santa sitting in a chair at reception. The reception area isn't that fabulous, but the whole place is welcoming and cheery because that is the tone from the staff and thus all the guests. I laugh at the price of other properties in this swanky neighborhood knowing that I am getting a great deal. I have already booked my January stay.

title: Have Not Been There Since the '70s
text: My husband stayed in this hotel due to a ton of travel in the 1970's.  I remember visiting then,with Il Minestrello Restaurant across the street, which has since closed.  Anyway, the hotel for us was extremely quiet  At first I was not crazy about the room, but was too tired to change my room...it turned out for the best!  Had a great night's sleep.  The lobby has been updated, but the rooms are a bit tired.  Oh well.  Cons:  Tired rooms/no coffee in lobby in the am/$30 per night destination charge??/  PROS:  location, location, location.....loved the location/Subway is nearby/Concierge wonderful/fun bar with a glass of wine gratis!

title: Happy Thanksgiving !!!
text: Having visited & fallen in love with New York a few years ago we returned, this time staying at the Omni. The hotel itself is typically American, clean with staff who couldn’t do enough for you. The location is perfect for shopping (close to 5th Ave) and near to both the Rockefeller Center & Central Park. Many of the other attractions are within walking distance or a short cab / bus ride. Would definitely return to the Omni if back in the big Apple!

title: Weekend in nyc
text: Nice hotel in great location. Rooms a bit small but rooms enough. Beds were quite comfortable. Nice bathroom. Window in room had no view, other than an “industrial” court, but if you upgrade you can see street view. Door staff were always friendly. A bit pricey but considering it is NYC and in a great location, one would expect that.

title: Great Location Horrible Beds
text:
Hotel is in a good location for visiting NYC.
Staff are friendly and helpful.
Rooms are very small. 
Two small double beds. Beds need to be replaced and are  terrible. Stayed for 5 nights. I had a horrible nights sleep each and every night and was sore every morning. Beds are junk. 
Rooms are dusty. Grate that runs along light fixture in the bathroom is layered with dust bunnies and hair. 
Noisy hotel. Garbage trucks every morning and cars honking at them every morning at 5 am.
No Omni Memberships benefits.
Good location but not a comfortable hotel.
(You may want to look at the Lotte which is a larger hotel down the street)

title: First time in NYC
text: We have just arrived home from an amazing holiday in Nyc. The hotel was lovely n clean and a fab location. The staff were fantastic, so happy, polite and helpful. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and be staying there the next time we visit NYC. the steak house (bobs steak & chop house) which is the restaurant attached to the hotel. Was amazing, the service and food was out of this world. Would highly recommend if you are staying in the hotel.

title: My Favorite Place To Stay In NYC
text: This hotel is in one of the most convient locations in NYC. Easy walking distance to so many things to do.  Great food options close by.  Not to mention the staff is always friendly and accommodating.  So many different types of rooms to help you make any stay comfortable.  Completely Five Stars!!!!

title: Large Clean rooms, friendly staff
text:
I stayed at the Omni Berkshire place for two nights.

PROS: My room was large and spotless. The linens were new and without stains. Comfy king size bed. The hotel is close to Rockerfeller Center and you can stowe your luggage before and after check-in. The front desk staff and bellhop were very friendly.

CONS: No bathrobes or minibar. The hallway was noisy and the walls were somewhat thin. I could hear my neighbor coughing

title: NYC stay at OMNI
text:
Loved our stay with Omni Berkshire!!
Great location, staff over the top helpful with everything!! Rooms were quiet , clean and comfortable!! Restaurant food was very good and convenient!
I’ll definitely book Omni on our next NYC visit!!!

title: Omni Berkshire The Best
text: We always enjoy our stay at the Omni Berkshire.  We find the location so near to 5th Avenue is extremely convenient.  The lobby and overall facility is very well maintained and prestigious.  The staff is very friendly and responsible.  Our room was pristine and included all expected amenities.  The Omni Berkshire is a pleasure.

title: Fantastic base to explore Manhattan
text: We stayed for a wonderful weekend in this hotel and I would rate it highly in every way. My only comment would be to avoid using Bob's Steak and chop house next door for breakfasts. We made the mistake of doing so and got the most overpriced and underwhelming breakfast I have ever had in all my 59 years. Isadora's diner across the street is a far better breakfast option.

title: Weekend at Omni Berkshire
text:
For the past few years, we’ve come to the Omni Berkshire in mid November to celebrate my wife’s birthday and catch a few plays. It is becoming a yearly ritual. As a Platinum Omni member I am usually treated very well. This year, however, we found our room a bit smaller than usual, and we had to expressly request amenities that previously were offered without our asking such as bathrobes, water and fresh fruit & cheese. 

Altogether it was a good stay but when your expectations are high, anything less seems slightly disappointing.

title: Omni Berkshire
text: This is our second stay with Omni in Manhattan. We stayed in 3 nights in August and then one night over Veterans Day. Both stays were very wonderful and since we have had such great experience with the staff and quality we plan to always stay at Omni, not only in NYC but anytime we travel. The staff is so friendly and welcoming with sincere smiles. It must be a great place to work. We will be back. They honor veterans and offer a discount. Thanks for a great stay Omni Berkshire, we hope to be back soon! We love the location of the hotel. It is quiet and very clean.

title: Fabulous room and friendly welcome
text: Given that most New York hotel rooms are tiny,  this was one a great size and very comfortable.    The staff were friendly and helpful.  Bob's bar adjoining had a good busy atmosphere.   Would definately stay again.

title: The best of New York
text: I have stayed at dozens of NYC hotels. This is a beautiful hotel at a perfect location for cultural events and shopping too. Very quiet, very spacious and elegant rooms. The staff clearly wants to make certain you have a perfect stay.  I would expect to pay far more than I did.

title: A hotel that goes the extra mile!!!
text:
My experience at the Omni Berkshire Place is always exceptional! I really can't say enough positive things about it. 

The entire staff, from the doorman,front desk, concierge,housekeeping, and room service are 100% curtious,friendly,professional and completely customer service oriented. It feels as if everyone has been through some sort of advanced hospitality training, yet it feels genuine. 

The hotel is sophisticated in a timeless way. It is bright, clean, pleasant and elegant. The rooms are spacious and comfortable...a great place to relax. 

The location is fantastic...tons of shopping on 5th Ave and Madison Ave.,great restaurants in a variey of price rangesMOMA a couple blocks away, subway one street over, a safe, clean and civilized central location. 

The Select Guest Loyalty Program is by far the best and most generous I have ever come across in both my personal and business travel experience. I would encourage everyone staying at the hotel to make sure they sign up.

It is definitely a great value, but more importantly, it is a great experience. There are so many hotels to choose from in NYC. Maybe some are trendier or whatever, but to me the Omni Berkshire is the only place to stay in NYC. 

Natalie Testa

title: Consistantly Outstanding
text:
The Omni Berkshire consistently meets my high expectation for a business hotel.  Value per dollar is good.  Unless sold out, this is the place I stay for my NYC business trips.

It is also in a superb location for both mid-town business or for a fun visit to NYC.

title: Needs a Facelift
text: The Omni Berkshire Place honestly for me doesn’t fit into the Omni brand. My suite is very spacious but everything looks/feels dated. My coffee table is all stained & banged up...it’s definitely seen better days. The shower tab in the bathtub didn’t work so getting ready for work this morning was a hassle. Would love the room (size wise) if it just felt like the last time it was decorated or shown any love was the late 90s.

title: Omni Berkshire Place NYC
text: Convenient mid-town location, but also noisy and congested location.  Would consider this to be a business hotel not appropriate for leisure travel or families with children. Enrolled in the Omni Hotel Select Guest program while at the hotel, although I would prefer staying at a Hilton, Marriott, or Hyatt property.  No mini-refrigerator in the large closet space; ice machine on the floor was inoperative.  Hotel decor is rather drab and unexciting. Staff were friendly and courteous.

title: Daughter’s
text: The Omni surely did not disappoint for my daughter’s birthday trip. The room was such a great size and clean. The staff was very friendly upon arrival. The location could not be any better. Especially since we walked to Broadway shows every night. Cannot wait to stay here again!

title: Best place in midtown  NYC
text:
This is my second stay at the Omni Berkshire and it is the only place I will stay in NYC!!! The hotel is lovely, great location, rooms are very comfortable and the people are amazing. They truly make you feel special!
You can walk to Rockefeller Center, Central Park and Times Square all within minutes!!!
Can’t wait to return!

title: Margaret
text: We were in NYC for a wedding with a bunch of our friends. We had so much fun at the Omni. Everyone was so friendly and helpful - from the bellman to the concierge to room service! Thank you for a wonderful trip!

title: Very comfortable hotel in great location
text: I stayed at the Omni Berkshire when I was In New York for a business trip.  It was a large room, clean, comfortable bed and great location.  I will definitely go back next time I have to stay in New York.  Staff was friendly and made the visit enjoyable.

title: Fine hotel, misleading pricing.
text:
Room was clean, comfortable. About the same as other midtown hotels in this price range. Street is not too noisy, which is good.
Was charged a $34.42 "destination fee", but was not informed of the fee on check-in. The charge just appeared on the credit card.
Other hotels in the area are doing similar things (they do tell you about it on check-in though) although at this Omni you apparently cannot use the "fee" to buy a drink, as you can at other midtown hotels. I called to confirm this -- they said the fee was to cover "wifi and other things". So, add that fee onto the daily costs as you consider this hotel.

title: Great experience
text: We booked directly through the hotel, and the associate was wonderful. She helped us get the best rate available (which was better than any of the booking websites). Our room was very clean, and just right for our purposes. The staff were accommodating and polite, and we were given a lovely surprise for our wedding anniversary. The location was very convenient. We would absolutely return to this hotel.

title: Weekend visit
text: The room was very clean, and the service was impeccable. The room had everything I needed except for a refrigerator which just needed to be requested. It came in minutes. I had breakfast at Bob’s (in the hotel) and room service for lunch. Everything was delicious and room service arrived very quickly.

title: Nice but small flaws
text: Good concierge services, quick and frindly check-in, clean, cozy room and good location. But then the flaws: shower in a bathtub not for this room price and charging mobile devices not via usb directly.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nothing excessively fancy,but attractive,mostly well-kept.  Convenient location several garages on walking distance at about$80/day.
Sometimes I get looks when I go places that I look like I can't afford or don't belong. I got no funny looks here.
The staff was professional and responsive.
The room was perfectly clean.
The desk was a bit beat up-but was the only thing that was. No fridge or to go cups.  Ice machine on each floor (major plus).

Con-the resort fee. I'm so incredibly annoyed by this underhanded tactic. I hasn't realized there was a fee. I've no idea how this qualifies as a resort. Charge the price you charge, and don't slip these charges past me. It's insulting.
For that reason alone,I won't return. Minus one star.

title: Many attributes but tired
text: We had stayed at this location many years ago and unfortunately I don't think anything has been done since last visit.  The location is central to any activity you have planned.  For us this is a big plus.  The employees are all very helpful and try to take care of any needs you have.  The reasons for the average rating is that when we arrived our room was very cold and the Heat/AC was only blowing cold air & could not be fixed.  We were moved to another room but the issue was still present.  We finally just turned the unit off.  The rooms need major renovation.  The bathrooms are also dated and in need of renovation.  If redone this hotel would certainly rate higher.

title: Always great accommodations at Omni Berkshire.
text: I have been traveling to New York for business for ten years, four to five times a year and always stay at the Omni Berkshire. The accommodations are excellent, the staff is great and being centrally located in midtown Manhattan makes it very convenient. As a runner, the hotel is only a few blocks away from Central Park and there is no better way to start the day than a run around the reservoir. Robert in the bar and Lenny the doorman are legends!

title: Family trip
text: el hotel esta perfectamente situado. El personal que trabaja es muy amable. Specially Michael Santos who make my check in he was awesome. The manager Francesca Pirrone she was excelent. Definitivamente recomiendo el hotel.

title: Wonderful stay at the Omni Berkshire
text: We had a wonderful stay. Staff smiles and greets you...everyone was pleasant and helpful. Doormen were great. The Location can't be beat for any Times Square/ Broadway/ Midtown needs. Mattresses in our room were probably ready to be replaced (a little bouncy) but overall just a lovely stay. Rooms very clean and when we told them we were there to celebrate our daughters 16th birthday, they left some treats in the room to make it extra special. Thanks! We will for sure stay again. Omni Berkshire is great!

title: Perfect Hotel for visiting Manhattan
text: So well placed right next to Fifth Avenue and near the Rockefeller Centre. Lovely rooms with plenty of space. Efficient and friendly staff. Good room service. Hard to best. Would definitely recommend.

title: Family Gathering
text: Long term employees brought back great memories having stayed here many times in the 90s. Howl is still in good shape. NYC has completely ruined traffic in front of the hotel. Still a great location. Good Value

title: four day visit
text: really enjoyed our stay staff really helpful especially the information desk the ladies were brilliant thank you with helping with the maps and the transport stopped me stressing thank you would recommend you to anyone

title: Omni Berkshire, NYC, midtown
text:
Excellent hotel in a perfect location to enjoy NYC.

Homelike warm ambience with all the modern convenience.

Only one restaurant in the hotel was quite upscale and very expensive.  Would like
to see a cafe with easy foods in the hotel.

title: Best New York City Stay
text: This hotel gets everything right from the welcoming doorman to the front desk clerk that checks you in to the Loyalty Ambassador that always takes great care of guests. Bob's Steakhouse is amazing downstairs and you can walk wherever you need to go. Stay here!

title: Cumplen a la perfección
text:
Muy buen hotel, habitaciones adecuadas y ubicación perfecta. Muy recomendable.
Check in y Check out muy rápidos, y la limpieza y temperatura de la habitación excelentes.
La concierge absolutamente centrada en el cliente.

title: Feel at home in Omni Berkshire NY
text: The warm welcoming of the doorman and the reception stuff gives you the feeling you arrived to you home in New York. Rooms are nice and cleaan Bads are comfortable . Any arrangements needed are taken care by the friendly concierge stuff... tthe Bar is traditional and very nice

title: Convenient location
text: 52nd St seems continually congested making car access to the hotel difficult.  Hotel facilities are good though maintenance is lagging(ice machine on our floor was not functioning for our three dsys there). As is true if most places in Manhattan,  breakfast is exhorbitant ($15 for coffee in the room). Cup of self serve coffee is $5

title: Great service, location and clean
text: Room is great, service was great. We had room service and they provided free cheese board with the bottle of prosecco as we were celebrating. Tea and coffee delivered on time every morning we asked for it. Bar is good too at the hotel

title: Fall vacation with kids.
text: This was our best NY trip. Omni staff very professional and friendly. Location is a plus and cleanness of the property in general was crispy. We traveled with 2 kids and the staff informed us about events and things to do in the city with kids, amazing, we enjoyed every minute.

title: Top notch
text: Omni Berkshire is a very comfortable hotel with an excellent and attentive staff.  Within walking distance to many of New York's best restaurants, shopping, theater and Central Park, it is an obvious choice.

title: Terrific Hotel
text: From start to finish, my stay at the Omni Berkshire Place was fantastic.  The entire staff was amazing - from the Loyalty Ambassadors all the way through to the Front Desk and to Housekeeping.  Every single member of the hotel staff made sure that my stay was the best possible.  The hotel is beautiful, a wonderful mix of modern and classic, a quaint feel of old and new.  The location is ideal, right in the thick of great shopping, restaurants, and a few blocks from the Theater District, yet still quiet enough to get a good night's sleep.  If you are looking for the best cocktails in New York City (and the best burgers) stop by Bob's Steakhouse, right in the lobby of the hotel.  Delicious!  I have no doubt that any season or new traveler will have a great experience here at The Omni Berkshire Place.  Highly Recommended.

title: Special weekend
text:
We stayed here for our nephew’s wedding and had the most wonderful extended weekend.   The staff was so accommodating and welcoming,   We will definitely stay here again when we visit NYC.  It also is a great location for sightseeing,
We really enjoyed our time at the Omni.

title: Not a four star
text:
I stayed there for one night only and I’m glad it was only one night. The hotel room was small, and it definitely needs renovation as everything in the room is so aged. The room is not clean either. I saw a thin layer of dust on the two glasses inside the cupboard with fingerprints all over them. The bathrobe hanging behind the bathroom door is yellowish, which I did not even want to touch it. The toiletries are minimal and I really doubt the tiny bottles are enough for even one person (I brought my own toiletries) The floor lamp could not be turned on and needed to call guest service to come fix it. Lastly, when I checked out, I need to move three suitcases plus many misc stuff out of the elevator. The concierge staff sitting right in front of the elevator did not even move an inch to help me hold the lift door or give me a helping hand. Neither did the bell boy or doorman at the main entrance. I was quite disappointed at the customer service experience. 

Every little thing adds up to the conclusion that it is overrated and not worth four stars at all.

title: Great location but not what we expect from an Omni hotel
text: Stayed in NYC for a couple nights before heading to the Finger Lakes.  Great location and very nice room (luxurious bathroom) but one of the worst beds we've experienced in a long time.  The second night we asked for extra pillows which helped but we would not stay here again simply for the uncomfortable bed.  Otherwise, nice front desk service and great location.

title: I would Rate This Property - Just OK
text: For a 'hi-end' property it left us thinking..why no coffee in the rooms or lobby..no room to unpack (except) for the end tables..small for a unscale room ??  The location was great but I think next time I'll try another hotel (Sofitel) for my $$.

title: Very Good Hotel
text:
Visited this hotel in October for 5 nights for  my wife's 50th birthday and we were welcomed in our room with a bottle of bubbly and a fruit bouquet. We were on the 18th floor and to the quiet side at the rear which we loved. No noise from any traffic at all. Room was extremely well presented, spacious with good size bath and bathroom.King size bed was very comfy and we slept really well. Location is ideal just off 5th Avenue.  If you sign up to Hotel you are entitled to complimentary hot/cold drinks delivered  to your room in morning as there is no kettle or fridge in room. Used cafe opposite for breakfast as really good and fair priced. Found the attached Joes Steakhouse fairly expensive and poor service especially the miserable bar staff.  
Hotel have a concierge for requests/questions but we used the door men & bell boys as we found them very knowledgeable and friendly. They got us a private transfer not yellow taxi  to JFK for $70. We really Recommend this Hotel and would use it again definitely.

title: Great hotel, great staff and great location...
text: We have just returned from New York City to England after staying at the Omni Berkshire Place for 4 nights.  This was my fourth trip to New York and this was definitely the best hotel I have stayed at so far.  Every single member of staff we spoke to was very helpful, courteous and professional.  Check-in was very smooth and our premier room was lovely.  The hotel is spotlessly clean and was a fantastic base for our trip.  It is ideally placed for midtown Manhattan and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.  I was so impressed, I will definitely check out availability at Omni hotels first for our future trips abroad. Thank you.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: First time staying in an Omni hotel and definitely not the last. Omni exceeded our expectations by far. The staff was fantastic and genuinely cared to make our stay the best. The room was spacious and very clean. Loved how the bathroom walls were all mirrors  and had a huge countertop. The water pressure was great too which that’s always a plus in any hotel. Elevators were fast and the lobby always had water which was a nice touch especially after walking all day in NYC. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY.

title: Pretty Nice But...
text: We stayed here for over a holiday weekend.  Common areas were nice.  It has a restaurant, "Bob's Steak House" adjacent to it, which I shall write a separate review on. Our King Deluxe Room was decent but nothing special given the regular price most guests will pay.  The furniture is okay, although the TV only has two movie channels but you can Chromecast to it from your cell phone. The bathroom was small but had a stone tile floor and shower, with just enough space for your supplies. The bed was reasonably comfortable but have again, nothing special. The service was good, most of the staff was friendly, and the entire hotel was very clean.  The best thing about this hotel was the location, at 52nd off Madison, which was a long walk away (or short Lyft/Uber) from Times Square, Radio Center, Ed Sulivan Theater, and NBC Studios, but the immediate surroundings were a step up from these notably busier streets.  We had one notable problem while there, with the heat in our room. The first night it was fine, second night it blew only cold air.  Staff responded within an hour and attempted to fix it. Then it started only blowing continuous hot air regardless of the thermostat setting. We finally cut it off entirely and did not call for a second repair. If you can get it at a discount, the location makes this a passable choice. However, I would not recommend paying full price to stay here!

title: Lovely stay
text: Really nice hotel in a great location. Room was small, very similar to those you'd find in Europe, but clean and comfortable.  The attached bar/restaurant was nice to have and we found ourselves having a drink there a few times during our stay.  Would definitely recommend!

title: Lovely room, but poor service and hidden fee
text:
We stayed for only one night and were happy with our room, but very disappointed with the service. 

Overall, the staff were very perfunctory - speaking only the bare minimum and not at all friendly or polite (except for two housekeepers, who greeted us warmly). For example, a bellhop said only "One bag?" when I asked to check my bag; he gave no basic hello, goodbye, or thanks. I'm not a snob and don't expect special treatment - but in a luxury hotel in NYC, I was surprised not to find common courtesy. 

When we checked in, our room was not ready, which is not a problem in itself because it was two hours before the 3:00 check-in time. The gentleman at the desk took our phone number and promised to call when the room was available. When 6:00 came, we asked at the desk and found that the room had been ready for an unspecified amount of time. The gentleman apologized briefly for the wait, but not for the lack of phone call. 

Our room was very nice, with a very comfortable bed and furniture and a spacious marble bathroom. Everything was immaculately clean. 

We prepaid for our room in full and were not informed of any other charges, either at check-in or check-out. However, after we left, we were charged an unspecified fee of $34.43, which is unacceptable and even deceptive. I emailed Omni customer service asking for a refund and received no response within the promised 48 hours. This has left a very bad taste in my mouth, and I would not return to this hotel.

title: Fantastic place to stay!
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire on a friend’s recommendation, and were excited how wonderful it was. Excellent staff in all area’s, comfortable beds, and pillows, luxurious bathroom, and a quiet room save for a few honks from the streets. Right in the middle of the action. We will return again!

title: Great location, bad service.
text:
The location is fantastic and the actual hotel is designed very nicely, the rooms are nice and modern and clean etc. The problem we had that took the shine away is the staff. No warm welcome on arrival, we got to the desk to check in, we were very early, we were told as it is early we can not check in unless we upgrade and were told that this is obviously a higher price and his tone was as if we could not afford this price to which he never even told us the price. He also took the deposit on my credit card and asked if that amount was ok to put on our card , again as if I couldn’t afford the deposit. We had emailed previously to ask if we could check in early but this guy didn’t care about that. When we did check in later that day we were just given a card and pointed to an elevator, no offer to help with the bags or a beverage like the couple in front of us had been offered. We also walked out of the elevator behind another couple who were greeted by a member of staff with a simple morning and as he came to us we were just ignored. It certainly felt like because we were younger we were ignored and not really welcome here. 

However on a positive note the lady on room service was extremely friendly she spoke to us every time we had seen her and couldn’t help us enough, she provided a fantastic service.

title: A Complete Pleasure
text:
Our stay at the Omni Berkshire was a complete pleasure. Check-in was a snap, though it was a Wednesday afternoon in fall and probably not their busiest time. My daughter was given a welcome gift at check-in (a bag with cards, games) that she was pleased to receive. We had a King Room and it was surprisingly spacious for a NYC hotel. The room was clean, well-lit and pleasant. We both slept well on the very comfortable bed and the shower had really great water pressure. The hotel also delivered cookies and milk before bed. The room felt like a luxury after other stays I've had in NYC. I did sign up for the Select Guest Program at no cost so I could have free wifi. It was our first stay as a Select Guest, so some of the amenities may have been tied to that program membership.
In the morning, leaving our luggage with the bellhops for the day was very easy. 
Every employee we interacted with was professional, warm and helpful. 
The location is superb. You aren't on a main thoroughfare, but you are steps away from many attractions and the bus and subway (E,M). It's a fairly short walk to/from Grand Central. Rockefeller Center, Radio City and all the Fifth Avenue shops are nearby and you can walk to/from Broadway shows along Times Square. We visited the Met and the American Museum of Natural History easily, choosing to walk one way to the AMNH through Central Park.

title: Excellent room - comfortable
text:
Efficient checkin and check out 
Very well appointed room. Comfortable bed. Great shower and bathroom. No complaints. Large room by New York standards. Onsite restaurant I did not use as reviews were mixed and it’s expensive. But there are so many great places to eat 24/7 in the city.

title: CONSTRUCTION NOISE - STAY AWAY
text: The location is great, there is no denying this.  The room is huge for NY standard.  However they definitely need to do major updating; sound proofing their windows & doors.  I could hear my neighbors slam their doors all night long.  On top of that, the bed was stiff and the pillow was flat.  I think it is time they update their beds.  And worse of all, I was on the 15th floor.  From 7AM on, I heard so much street noise, from cars honking... but the worse of it all, the construction nearby the hotel.  I could hear drilling and hammering from 7 AM until the time I checked out.  I was so stressed from the noise that I had to make a complaint to Expedia.  This is not acceptable.  I even have proof as I recorded the street noise with the windows closed from the 15th floor.  I was facing Madison Ave and below me, there was no construction.  Again, I am a New Yorker, I have stayed in many hotels to relax, I was so stressed after leaving this hotel, I took myself to a spa.  If you need to hear the video, I am please to sent it your way.  Paying $300 a night for this rubbish is not worth it.  I stayed in the heart of Time Square and I never heard noise pollution like I had in this hotel.  Use your money wisely and go somewhere else.  CitizenM is good or spend a little more Park Terrace.  Please, these old school hotels need to refurbish.  I will never stay at an Omni again.

title: Wish I knew about the coffee pot option!!
text:
Upon checking out, I was asked how my stay was. I replied “Fine, but you really need to provide in-room coffee”! Then he said it was available upon request. It would have been nice to know prior to checkout!!! A little note in the room perhaps? Some added value for the ridiculous $30/day fee added on to rack rate! Grrrr!!

Aside from that, we had a lovely stay. Hotel is well situated in midtown, great for walking around Manhattan. Clean and pretty basic.

title: Very Efficient
text:
I have stayed at Omni Berkshire several times over the last two years as the location, both for business and leisure is excellent - but this time the overall experience was different - exceptionally better. The best way to summarise is ‘Very Efficient’. 
The welcome was friendly and the check-in took less than a minute. 
I think the rooms have been refurbished - my room (Deluxe) was spacious, warm and luxuriously done. The bathroom was big, clean and with good amenities.
The requests for room service and housekeeping were dealt with quickly, efficiently and politely.
My request for late check-out by an hour was agreed upon in less than a second and with a smile. The check-out process was fast and efficient and took about a minute.
Recommend the hotel strongly especially for a business trip.

title: great room - excellent location
text: arrived early and was able to check in right away.  lovely room, with a plush king bed. If you want to stay right in the middle of nyc, this hotel is wonderful and provides an excellent location.  Great value as well.  Would highly recommend staying here!

title: Fabulous Hotel
text:
Loved this hotel, friendly, helpful staff, clean luxury rooms and great position for sightseeing and shopping.  Lots of good restaurants in and around this hotel. 
Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

title: Delightful!
text: My husband and I have visited New York City many times and found our favorite hotel. No doubt. We were treated more as family than tourists. Each member of their staff was pleasant and caring. The housekeeper even checked to make sure that the spacious, beautiful room met our standards. We will return!

title: Classic NYC hotel with art deco feel in GREAT location!
text: Superb value in the heart of NYC.  This was our third visit in the past couple of years to the Omni Berkshire.  Classic NYC hotel just steps from Fifth Ave & Madison Ave.  Walk to shopping, park, theatre, restaurants, etc.  Large comfy rooms that are well appointed.  Very welcoming with excellent service.  Nice marble bathrooms.  Do check out the patio area and work out space upstairs (17th floor?).  Excellent views.  At the time of our stay there was construction across the street during the nights and weekends - do ask about this at check in and inquire@ a quiet room interior, although it may be smaller.

title: Omni Berskshire Place, great stay!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay @ The Omni Berskshire Place @East 52nd street between Madison & 5th Avenue, NYC. Upon arrival, we were greeted as if we were old friends.  Our room was immaculate, spacious & upgraded.  All my requests were honored, and our stay was perfectly suited for my week of shopping, theatre, and dining with my three adult daughters! We'll be back!

title: Last minute weekend trip to NYC
text: Had a great room at the Omni Berkshire in New York City on 10/5/19 room 803. Room was very clean and very quiet. I had about 6 pillows to choose from on my bed. Great flat screen TV with big closet that had an ironing board and iron as well as room safe! The bathroom was spotless with great shampoo, conditioner and moisturizer from the manufacturer: Nest. It also came with a great make-up mirror that lit up and a blow dryer as well. It was off of E52nd street and very close to Zara  on 5th Avenue and (a gigantic) Uniqlow for shopping on 5th Avenue. I would definitely stay there again. It was a little hard to find because Google maps had me walking in circles. The hotel is tucked away and you have to really look for the name on the hotel. It also has a great gym if you would like to take advantage of good equipment as well. Will book again! Just a side note: the restaurant on the premises is very expensive. There are plenty of very reasonable restaurants that fit every budget near by.

title: Elegance
text: This hotel is in the middle of mid-town and a block from Rockefeller Center and three blocks from the Museum of Modern Art.  The decor is understated, but lovely.   It has excellent staff.  Yumi, at the front desk will welcome you.  The concierge is very knowledgable.  The bar has big drinks and juicy mini-burgers.

title: Prima hotel op top locatie
text: 52 nd street tussen 4 th and 5th is natuurlijk helemaal goed. Het hotel doet een beetje chique aan en is enigszins ouderwets. Douchegordijnen vind ik minder voor dit soort hotels, maar het is er heel schoon. Op de 17e is er een gym en een buitenterras. Lekker om even bij te komen. Helaas is er geen drankje te verkrijgen. Ook is er geen mini bar in de kamer.

title: Excellent location! Helpful Staff!
text:
The hotel is in great location between Madison Ave and 5th Avenue. Near all the Cafe’s, Bars, Shops  and Restaurants  and a very short walk to Broadway and Times Square.

I stayed at the Omni hotel for 11 days in the middle of August. A few days before my arrival I received an email from Angelique  the Hotel Loyalty Ambassador asking if there was anything I needed to help enhance my stay. I thought that was a nice touch!

The Hotel staff in general were polite and helpful and very responsive to issues when raised and quick in getting them sorted out.

The room was clean and very spacious and had all the usual hotel facilities. The bed was very comfortable. As a Select Guest I got to choose a free beverage that was delivered every morning. 

My only complaint would be about the Wi-fi which was quite intermittent and was constantly cutting out.

Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at the Omni and would definitely stay there again!

title: Great place to stay
text: My husband and I stayed here six nights in early September. We had flown all night and were exhausted when we got there. They were nice enough to give us early check in. The location is fantastic and close to everything yet quiet and comfortable. The staff was outstanding. They were helpful and friendly. The adjoining restaurant was excellent too. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel & great staff!
text:
My best friend and I came here for 3 nights last weekend for a long weekend. 
Door staff were lovely, check-in was super speedy and our room was large and clean. Great location close to 5th Avenue and Rockerfeller Centre - would definitely stay here again next time I’m over from London! Oh - and our Espresso Martini’s at the bar were delicious!

title: Exactly what we needed
text: I stayed at this hotel on a 2 night business trip recently.  My associate and I picked it because it was very close to the office we were visiting but it also had a reasonable price compared to some of the “higher end” places.  This hotel is clean - convenient - and has excellent customer service.  Everyone working at this Omni cares about providing you a good stay - from the front desk person to the hotel operator to the room maids.  It was an excellent spot for our business trip.

title: My home away from home
text:
The Omni Berkshire is what you’d expect from an excellent hotel in New York: Nice ambiance, well maintained, efficient and clean. 
How do you rate that? With what or who are you going to compare? 
But the Omni is a lot more if if you have a problem, it transforms itself into something unique. It’s no longer about automated responses or narrowly defined responsibilities. You meet real people that care about you working efficiently and emphatically to solve your problem. And that is five stars, no matter who you compare it with.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is in a great location. There is construction going on and scaffolding out front but it did not hinder our arrival or departure. All the staff were helpful and friendly. We had a room on the 12th floor with a view up 5th Avenue, not too much street noise, room was spacious and very comfortable. Bathroom is a good size and the shower had fabulous water pressure. Did not eat in the dining room but did have drinks and an app in the bar, both were excellent, nice atmosphere a little loud once it filled up but that's to be expected.

title: Thanksgiving in NY
text: Amazing hotel and even better location. Stayed here for 4 nights for Thanksgiving upon check in I wasn't happy with my room and so asked to be moved. This was done very quickly and my new room was very clean and a decent size for standard NY rooms. I have been to NY a number of times and I have to say the location of this hotel was amazing located just off 5th ave and a great location if you want to go and visit the Macy's thanksgiving parade. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Lovely staff and good service.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: Stunning 4 star hotel, big beautiful spotless rooms with a big comfy bed and huge tv, good bath and shower. In excellent location near rockefeller centre and walking distance to times square and central park. Staff are so friendly and helpful! Front entrance staff  and maids in particular are all so friendly and hardworking!! Lots of beautiful restaurants close by and subway is a short walk away would recommend the subway for travelling to JFK quick and cheap. Will stay here again next time in New York.

title: Parker says "Fabulous hotel; perfect location; great staff."
text: This hotel has it all.  Perfect location for all Midtown sights including the Theater District.  Lots of great and sights within walking distance, including Roc Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square....and subway station relatively close too, which brings all of NYC to you.  Staff is remarkable....rooms are spacious and clean, with beautiful marble bathrooms.  Try to score a street view.  Watch the bookings because the rates fluctuate wildly, so check this place out when you're under the $200 range for maximum enjoyment.  If you have to stay in Midtown....and you do have to stay in Midtown....this is the place to be.

title: Bien Mantenido
text: Hotel antiguo, bien mantenido, con habitaciones grandes, baño normal, alfombrado, ascensores pequeños. Los porteros muy simpáticos y a amables. Los del front desk falta mejorar la atención al cliente.

title: Super emplacement et au calme
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé à 2 pas de la 5ème avenue, 10 min de centrale park, 10 min de Time square... 10 min de tout... et du métro...
 Nous étions côté cour, donc très calme.
Belle chambre mais sans frigo dommage.
Le personnel est très agréable.

title: Love this place
text: This place is wonderful and perfect for what we needed.  The location was right downtown and close to everything. They even had a welcome plate of food to welcome us in. The rooftop terrace was perfect for relaxing after a long day. The rooms were clean and a bit small but had great storage. The beat part was the complimentary drinks in the morning. The concierge people were all very helpful. I was gladly stay here anytime.

title: Beautiful
text: Great location. Beautiful room with comfortable bed. Small as expected. The rooftop is a great spot to rest after a busy day. Easy access to nice area if the city. Food was expensive but service was top notch.

title: 60th Birthday Trip with Family
text:
The staff at the Omni Berkshire was so friendly! Lenny, the employee at the entrance, met us everyday with a smile on his face. He told us all the great places to go eat while in the city. Being from Texas, we are way out of our element in Manhattan. But Lenny made us feel comfortable, and never led us astray. Thank you Lenny, and thank you staff at Omni! We truly enjoyed our stay!
PS - give Lenny a pay raise, he deserves it!!! With love, the 6 crazies from Texas!

title: Omni Fun in NYC
text: Stayed at the Omni and was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The location was awesome. Close to St. Patricks Cathedral, Radio City and also Central park, near lots of shopping. ! Bobs Steakhouse was great for dinner and cocktails. We'll be back again!

title: Recomendable
text:
Hotel con muy buena ubicación. Habitaciones grandes, así como el baño.
Muy limpio. Buen servicio en todos los aspectos.Cama amnplia y comoda.relación precio-calidad aceptable, teniendo en cuenta que estas en pleno centro de New York.
Típico hotel americano, a lo grande. como solo lo usamos, para dormir, no puedo opinar de el resto de servicios.

title: Choose Another Hotel
text: Suite was not as pictured--dark and only view was of building.  Arrived at 4 pm and suite was not available until after 8:00 p.m.  Gave us a room to use until then to get ready for play and dinner (unpack and re-pack) and $100 food and beverage credit--nice gesture, but didn't make up for not being told about amenities we had to pay $30 per day, hair in three different places in bathtub, yellow spots on the shower curtain, several blood stains on sheets, housekeeping knocking and waking us up two of the four mornings even though Privacy Please sign was on door, and when I asked for a two hour late check out the desk clerk gave one hour and Alex, the manager on duty, said he wouldn't give any because they were sold out.  Strange...websites showed the Suite was still available to reserve.  Never will we go back.

title: Très bien placé mais vieillot. Services moyens. Confort de literie et calme. Pas digne de 4 étoiles.
text:
Hôtel plutôt vieillot mais très bien situé, à proximité des magasins de luxe, près du métro, calme malgré la vue sur rue. Literie très confortable. 
Petit déjeuner très cher, à la carte, pas très raffiné, et pas de buffet. Prenez vos repas à l’extérieur. 
Service moyen : plusieurs demandes nécessaires pour obtenir des chaussons, absence de réfrigérateur alors qu’il faisait 28 degrés dehors : on nous annonce que la plupart des réfrigérateur sont cassés. On a dû jeter les aliments et boissons achetées. Une compensation de 15$ nous a été offerte car nous avons réclamé. 
Absence de cafetière ou de bouilloire dans la chambre y compris pour se faire chauffer un peu d’eau, ce qui existe dans la plupart des hôtels trois étoiles (le Berkshire est 4 étoiles). 

Hôtel à recommander néanmoins, en raison de sa situation géographique, le calme et le confort de la literie, mais pas pour les prestations. Prix correct si en promo.

title: Another fantastic Omni hotel stay
text: I’m a regular at Omni hotels having stayed at several over the past years. Berkshire Place seemed perfect for our four night city break hence the booking. Checkin was again very pleasant and efficient. There was a slight discrepancy with our booking reservation but staff indicated they would get our room changed at first light the following day. And indeed they did this. The gentleman who sorted us was Tsering if I recall correctly. He moved us efficiently to another room and kept us abreast of the slight delay in the change the next day. Expertly done as expected. The room was quite spacious for my little kiddo and me. Two double beds. The beds were really comfortable and ensured a great rest every night. The bathroom was a fair size too - often in NYC they are tiny. And two closets were perfect for us. Plenty of ironing stiff and spare towels and pillow cases. My only gripe with Omni is there are no coffee making facilities - yet as a designated Omni guests one gets complimentary coffee or orange juice in the morning anyway so that makes up for it. The concierge was on hand for excellent advice on more than one occasion - and always with a big genuine smile too. A welcome change in the hotel world these days. It’s unfortunately check out day today - but we are already planning when we will return. I’d highly recommend the Omni Berkshire for its great facilities and guest service - and the fact it’s right where things are happening in Manhattan. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable.

title: Great Location
text: Spent 3 nights at the Omni Berkshire between 8/23 - 8/26. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and plenty of shopping and restaurants. Room was very clean and spacious which I hear is a bonus for NYC. Staff was extremely helpful and pleasant to deal with. I would definitly stay here again and would highly recommend.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Excellent service, comfortable rooms, great location but I feel like I got jabbed with an upgrade of 40 which was not needed. Otherwise, everything was excellent! Staff is super friendly and helpful. I highly recommend!

title: ottima posizione
text:
l'albergo è in ottima posizione, centralissimo nel cuore di manhattan... certo, le camere non hanno di default, macchina del caffè e frigobar che vanno richiesti (senza sovraprezzo), il bagno con vasca e tenda... ormai decisamente out... 
però, vacanza in famiglia, ristornate sotto l'albergo eccezionale!!!

title: Excellent
text: Wonderful hotel, located close to everything, staff is so friendly and the rooms (we had a King with a great view) were clean and very spacious.   Reasonable rates - steakhouse was also great, pricey but very good.   Would stay again for sure !

title: Perfect spot in Manhattan
text: I have stayed here twice and can’t wait to come back.  We love the Berkshire!   The rooms are large and well appointed.  The staff is fantastic.  The location is great!  In a sea of so many undesirable NYC hotels, the Berkshire is stands out as one of the best!

title: Fabulous trip to the Big Apple!
text:
Really glad we chose the Omni Berkshire, no complaints about our stay at all.  Location perfect for us, in a quieter area of NY, good to escape the hustle and bustle of areas such as Times Square.

Warm welcome on arrival, with swift check in.  Our room was on the 7th floor, there are 3 lifts available.   Our room was a lot bigger than expected and was very clean with a king size bed (we had booked a double), with free safe.  The bathroom was a good size, if a little old fashioned with marble tops and lots of mirrors, but was very clean, toiletries were provided and the towels were changed daily, very good shower.
Nice touch was the courtesy umbrella in the wardrobe, which we made use of one day on our trip.

No view as we were surrounded by other buildings, but no problem with light and we weren’t in the room much during the day.

We didn’t eat in the hotel as it was expensive (as was the rest of New York), however, there is a deli café opposite (Isadora’s) which was perfect.  They served a very good cup of breakfast tea and a vast selection of food, hot selection (eggs, bacon, pancakes), plus bagels, muffins, fruit, yoghurt.  We also ate dinner there on our first night, which was very good.

Checkout was at 12.00 and we were able to leave our cases in the hotel during the day until our return to the airport.

We would definitely stay at the Omni again if we return to New York.

title: Wonderful!
text: We stayed for 3 nights in July and couldn’t have been happier. The location is great, the staff were all wonderful and the rooms were spacious, clean and nicely decorated. When we arrived our room wasn’t ready even though it was 8pm but as we had to wait a while we were given vouchers to spend on food and drink in the hotel for the inconvenience and we were very happy with this. The front desk and door staff were wonderful and there is a great little cafe directly opposite for coffee, snacks or morning breakfast.

title: Reliable charmer with great location
text:
I am a long time repeat customer here, just recently spent a enjoyable stay here.

The location is stellar. Close walking distance to everything midtown has to offer without being in the thick of the city crowds.

Vibe is that of a 500 room, 21 story pre war somewhat  upscale co-op.
Rooms are comfortable and large by city standards with very comfortable beds. No in room coffee makers or room technology of 5 star hotels.

 But, the hotel is showing signs of age and would benefit from a refresh. However, it will give the traveler solid comfort.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: What a wonderful place to celebrate my birthday!!!  Excellent location and accommodations, fantastic service, and Bob’s Steak and Chop was perfect for our family dinner!!! The food was top-notch!!!  We will be back!!!

title: Hidden treasure
text: The Bellman and  doorman went above and beyond to help in anyway with directions, car service or recommendations on where to eat. We had so much fun talking with them or just saying hello, welcome back.

title: Awesome
text:
Thank you Ms Angelique for taking good care of us especially the  cake, treats and wine sent for our daughter's birthday celebration. 
The complimentary microwave and refrigerator were also sent to our room after a mix up. 
Adam checked us in but forgot the children welcome bags but picked it up the following morning.
Love the marble bathroom and the shower pressure. Room clean. The table had minor cuts/damage and needs fixing up.

title: Close to Rockefeller Center
text: This is a very convenient location in the City - very close to Rockefeller Center and many business locations.  Typically very professional service, good restaurant and comfortable rooms.  Clean, quiet and hospitable.

title: Wonderful hotel with exceptional service
text: We have recently returned from our visit to New York.  Choosing to stay at the Omni Berkshire was the easiest, and best decision.  Staff are wonderful, kind and welcoming.  The hotel itself is a great location, well appointed and provides the oasis you need after days out in the city.  We were always greeting warmly upon arrival, which is a very nice aspect after long days being a tourist in the busy city.

title: Great stay in heart of the city!
text:
We stayed at the Omni for a week! 
All the staff were friendly and assisted with any and all needs! 
The airline lost our luggage and the Omni provided essential items to assist with this challenge! 

The hotel was wonderful, the staff very helpful and friendly, the location awesome! 

We will definitely stay at the Omni again! 
Thanks for a wonderful experience!

title: Rock star diggs at a cover band price.
text: We have had nothing but truly excellent experiences at Omni hotels from Texas (2) to Louisiana (2) to Florida to Montreal to New York. Every one has been on a level with higher priced brands (4 Seasons, Waldorf), and the personalities we've encountered with the Omni staff are actually better. Outstanding service, stellar locations and gorgeous properties. The Berkshire Place Hotel is no exception.

title: Best service in the city
text:
Another great stay at the Omni Berkshire Place!
Friendly, professional service with excellent accommodations in a great location. Time and time again , Omni Berkshire Place provides outstanding hospitality.

title: Perfect location, great service, relaxed atmosphere
text: The location is perfect - a 2 minute walk from Rockerfeller Plaza and 1 min to the nearest subway. The lovely guy at check-in upgraded us to a premium room which was spacious, spotless and well equipped. The whole place had a wonderful, relaxed atmosphere - staff were there if you needed something but otherwise just leave you to it which is fab. It all seemed very well organised, calm and felt like home from home. Would definitely stay again.

title: Comfortable
text: Speedy check-in and check-out, spacious, nice amenities, quiet and personalized service. It is a nice way to travel for business. It was helpful to hear about the Omni Select Guest program for frequent stays.

title: Never again
