text: Was over an hour delay checking in, offered me a better room for the wait, room they gave us was basically a closet with 2 tiny beds. Staff was amazing, only part of hotel I truly enjoyed. The chances of me returning is none. I understand it is NYC but way overpriced for a closet with 2 of the worst beds I've ever been in

title: Enjoyable stay
text:
Had a 3 night stay in an Berkshire suite. I thought the suite was a good size for Manhattan standards.
The staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge team.
Bed was really comfortable, had an inward facing room which was lovely and quiet, and the room was nicely furnished.
Would stay again next time I am in Manhattan.
Didn’t try any food in the hotel but the deli opposite was great for any immediate refreshments.

title: Perfection
text: I, very often, stay at the Omni Berkshire Place.   The staff knows me well.  The staff are not a bunch of kids, doing a job, but a mature staff who know hospitality.  The location is perfect, with both rooms and bath immaculate.  I look forward to their warm welcome, with my next stay.

title: Great location
text: Stayed 4 nights in July with family (2 adults + 3 children) on vacation. Hotel is in a great location being just off 5th Avenue and a block walk from the subway. Rooms were a little small but expected this in NYC and one was on the inside of the hotel with no view which meant it was very dull without day light but we didnt stay in the room much as out sightseeing. Comfy beds and nice bar/restuarant downstairs.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Siamo stati 4 notti in questo hotel. Senza dubbio ha un’ottima posizione,ad angolo con la 5th avenue e quindi vicinissimo ai negozi piu lussuosi delle grandi marche. Vicinissimk anche il Rockefeller center. 
Ben servito anche da metro e bus vari,anche i big bus e i tour. La camera carina,tutto sommato pulita e silenziosa. Personale hotel molto gentile. Lo consiglio tranquillamente.

title: Prime location and friendly staff
text:
stayed here for a couple of days. was my first time staying here. hotel was in a prime location near everything. highly recommended paying little extra to get the suite. 
all the staff were helpful and friendly from the door man and the porters to reception to the concierge. 
special thanks to Krystal loyalty manager. 
Omni is part of the Global hotel alliance. being a black member got some welcome amenities. 
highly suggest you enroll and continue staying with the group. 
definitely a returning customer. 
very satisfied as the rooms and hotel is in great condition and very spacious for NY standards. 
also suggest trying the steak house.

title: Great location, clean and comfortable, nothing spectacular but certainly nothing negative!
text:
Walking distance to Rockefeller, Times SQ and obviously 5th Ave.
Nice lobby area, the cold water pitcher by the elevators is a very nice and smart touch!
Allows guests to fill up on their water bottles as they head on out! I've stayed in premium hotels that did not bother to even have this so simple yet utilitarian feature and cost the hotel almost nothing.
The common bathroom in the lobby is also very nice and clean. 
Room is normal size by manhattan standards and the bed, pillows etc were nice and comfy. The staff were fairly professional and courteous.

title: Great location
text: Very pleasant stay at this uber convenient location. Spacious room, plentiful towels, efficient bathroom, comfortable beds, nice individual lit closets, speedy maintenance and housekeeping. Bathroom is full of mirrors. Items available on request include things like robes and makeup mirror although we were surprised robes weren’t in the room already. Odd no clock in room or vent in bathroom. Nice gym with two peloton bikes. Rooms quiet. Connected restaurant fine for breakfast. Overall very nice hotel and would return.

title: Sehr schönes Hotel mit perfekter Lage
text:
Sehr sauberes Hotel. Unser Zimmer war recht klein, hat uns aber vollkommen ausgereicht. Das Bad war verhältnismäßig groß und wurde auch täglich gründlich gereinigt. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. 

Nebenan ist ein Restaurant "Bob's Steakhouse". Der Nachtisch (Brownie with Ice Cream) kann ich nur empfehlen. Eine riesige Portion, die man sich am besten zu zweit teilt! :-)

title: Great location poor views of scaffolding and silly prices
text:
We booked this premium hotel right in the heart of 5th avenue with short walks to all the main shopping and Central park. On the same trip we stayed at two more budget hotels. Therefore we were surprised that the Omni didn’t provide any water or tea or coffee in room, and disappointed that our executive king room on the third floor was overlooking their building scaffolding.  So we had a room you couldn’t look out of and no water in room on arrival. The budget hotels we stayed at welcomed us with iced bottled water at reception and free tea coffee and at one free hot cookies.  Nothing is free at the Omni.  
For a premium price thus hotel didn’t live up to expectation. The bed was very comfortable and the housekeeping excellent, so those were big positives.  

But compared to the other two hotels there was no USB sockets in room, no water, no fridge, no tea or coffee, the shower leaked and the bathroom door was sticking.  The price of food and drinks and breakfast was also extremely high but that isn’t so unusual in this area. However, no matter where in the world you come from $14 for french fries plus a required $5 a person for room service delivery plus around 20% tip surely makes this hotel win the dearest fries award.  Hence my title of lovely hotel bad views and silly prices. Oh and no apology for locating us above scaffolding which makes me think they are a bit arrogant.

title: Summer trip to NYC
text: The service provided by this hotel is top notch. We are select guest members of Omni and have stayed at many Omni hotels. The service provided by Omni Berkshire Place blew all the other Omni locations away. The location is excellent and the rooms are immaculate and comfortable. My daughter slept on the queen sofa bed and said it was quite comfortable.

title: The concierges & location are the best.  The noise inside is not so great.
text:
I didn't get a chance to write anything about my stay here, but then I was in another hotel where the concierge managed to give me drastically wrong directions, hung up on me a few times after holding for 10 min, and started using google maps to answer a restaurant question (as if I hadn't tried that).  I am a fairly independent traveler, but some trips go much better when you have help from a concierge (what I just described was London for $650/night).   Given how much is going on in NYC, the concierges here are very valuable and there are several of them & they're 10 feet across from the elevator.  Everything I asked them was answered in seconds and answered correctly...unlike the London situation. 

The only downside to this hotel is for noise-sensitive people. I thought the interior courtyard-facing rooms were going to be quiet, but you still get a lot of the siren noises of NYC and the ambulance honking...maybe some car honking, even though the street is beyond another building altogether.  (You're just facing office windows).  Internally, there are some strange things going on with noise that other reviews mentioned.  The AC unit can be loud.  If you don't care, then ignore this - the rest of the hotel is good & the bed is comfortable.  They even squeezed a fairly decent gym in here.

The location matters because cabs take longer than walking in many cases.  The subway is also a much better option, and the concierge can tell you what subway to take most of the time (they stops are close to the hotel).  Almost everything I wanted to do could be reached by the subway or on foot.  The only thing about this area is that the restaurants can be overpriced for what you get because it is a very expensive location where the food isn't great.  So I had some disappointing meals on my trip because I was often eating nearby, particularly near the theaters.  When I ate elsewhere, it was much better.

title: A last second booking worked out GREAT!
text:
We needed a place to stay quickly as some other plans changed and we were able to get into the Omni Berkshire Place. We are Omni members but made the reservation thru AMEX. We arrived way early (11:00 am) because of plan changes and were delighted to be able to check in and go to our room. We cleaned up, rested a bit.

The room at the Omni was excellently appointed and immaculately clean. The A/C worked wonderfully and cooled us off very quickly (we were there the first week of July and, to quote the Lovein' Spoonful it was a "Hot time, Summer in the City". Being located centrally it was a simple task to grab a cab and take off on the town first down to Little Italy and then on to the Hudson Yards.

From the Hudson we walked back to the hotel stopping along the way when the heat became too much. But, there is just so much to see and experience in Manhattan that walking is the best way to take it all in. In that the Omni is located in a good spot, you can visit Saks, St Patrick's, the Monkey Bar or the outdoor bar at the Lott Palace within 5 minutes by foot. And have excellent service at the Omni to boot.

title: Love the Omni!
text: We are loyalty members with Omni and they upgraded our room which was amazingly beautiful and fit our family of four nicely with plenty of space and a separate living room with a pullout sofa. Everyone was very accommodating and service was extra fast. We drove to NYC and valet parked the car. The staff especially out front of the hotel was super kind to offer recommendations, directions, and welcome us back each time. I'm completely sold on the Omni experience. We've stayed at the Homestead, Bedford Springs, The Grove Park Inn and now the Berkshire in NYC. I will definitely go back! Thank you, Omni. You made our quick 48 trip to NYC easy and enjoyable.

title: You will NOT be disappointed!
text: The Omni Berkshire is a great place to stay while in NYC. The location is great. Great value. Unbelievable hospitality. Great rooms. Spacious, clean rooms. Their Select Guest program and benefits are better than any other hotel group I have ever experienced.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Worst "welcome" ever. Good hotel but bad receptionist.
text:
When we arrived there were bell boys and luggage carts but nobody offered to help us with the suitcases. The receptionist (a tall bald white man) answer to our "Good morning, we have a reservation" without even looking at our face with a simple "Spell your name". I said it and he kept "Spell it!". I felt so uncomfortable after such a long trip and the excitement of finally arrive to NYC! 
We are regular educated people so I guess his behavior was because he had a bad day but I think this is inexcusable. We have travelled around the world and also to NYC in other occasions and never felt so unwelcome.
We wanted to ask for some tips about places and so but we declined to do it due to the dreadful treatment in reception.  
The hotel is nice, clean and very well situated. The rest of staff are more or less friendly (not smiley but proper). My rating would be better if it wasn't for that awful experience.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The hotel is excellent. The location is close to everything yet not in the middle of everything. The staff was friendly and polite and offered many suggestions. The rooms were a nice size for New York. I was pleasantly pleased.

title: The best place I could recommend in NYC!
text:
Service- door always opened for us, check in a breeze, the concierge was a bit hit and miss making it clear that they charged more for nearly everything they helped with.  

Location- 15min walk to Times Square with heaps of close shopping and restaurants.

Rooms-
Spacious (rear ft in NYC), beds to die for, pillows of absolute comfort, rooms quiet as a mouse and AC that works!

Most definitely will stay again!

title: Wonderful experience staying at The Omni Berkshire
text: There are so many options to choose from when you come to NY. I would recommend staying at The Omni Berkshire because of their wonderful staff. Their beds are unbelievably comfortable and the people that work there care that you have a great stay.

title: Always a great experience... Great Locations
text:
Came this past weekend for my wife's birthday. Adam at the front desk could not have been more kind or professional.  We got a nice room and my wife a piece of cake to celebrate her birthday, what a nice touch. 

Rooms were very clean and well appointed and the location is top not.  Had breakfast in the hotel which was a home run and the bar in Bob's is a perfect way to end your day. 

A+++++

title: Couldn’t be Better!!
text:
My wife and my first visit to NYC, to celebrate her birthday on Independence Day. Stayed for a week at the beginning of July.

This hotel couldn’t be better located, just off fifth avenue on E 52nd St. almost in the middle of where you need to be for everything. Fantastic.

Check in efficient and friendly and gave us all that we required/requested. Great staff.

Our king room was good. Pretty basic, but plenty of room and a good shower. We were located at the rear of the property where it was quietest. We loved it.

Air con great as were the ironing board, iron, hairdryer, internet, safe and numerous other facilities inside. No view other than an office block, but we were there to see them anyway so we weren’t bothered.

Concierge helped with any queries we had and gave good recommendations for things too.

Bed great and we slept very well. 

Turn right out of the door and witching 200yds you are on fifth avenue. Empire State Building and lots of other things such as Central Park, Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Broadway are within a few hundred yards. Turn left out of the door and you go onto Madison Avenue. A great breakfast/lunch place is directly opposite the Omni and they did fab food and it was cheap.

Couldn’t fault anything at the Omni. Great location, great staff, great bar....I just found Bobs steakhouse a bit pricey so we didn’t eat there. 

Couldn’t recommend enough!! It’s fab!!

title: I want to be a part of it!
text: This was our first family trip to NYC and it couldn't have been more perfect.  The Omni Berkshire was a huge part of that equation!  We called the hotel in advance to let them know that we have an autistic teenage son and to request a room as "high up as possible" on his behalf.  We also let them know it was a combined birthday / anniversary trip.  We were surprised on arrival to not only receive a gorgeous 10th floor (corner) "city view" with wrap-around windows - but the hotel also upgraded us from the Berkshire suite to the Madison suite.  Such a nice surprise!  There was room for everyone to spread out and be extremely comfortable.  (Not always such an easy feat with two teens over 6' tall!)  We requested an additional roll-away bed before check-in as well, and were pleased to find an actual twin-size bed (as opposed to a glorified cot).  Our boys fought over the queen-size pull-out couch and the roll-away as expected, only this time they were fighting FOR the roll-away.  We were a bit shocked to discover the suite did not have a mini-fridge, but after a quick call to the front desk, one was swiftly delivered to the room.  That saved the four-night stay!  Housekeeping was friendly and extremely helpful.  Every room service meal / snack was delicious.  And the concierge tipped us off (and made reservations to) a lovely little Italian restaurant about 5 blocks up the street when we asked for "anything but Olive Garden Italian".  Everyone was so polite and accommodating, no matter the request.  I don't know what they put in the air there, but we all slept until almost 10 am every day - and we all remarked what good sleep it was.  All four of us would stay there again in a heartbeat!

title: AMAZING
text: I was extremely impressed with the hotel. The staff was helpful, kind, attentive. My kids felt very comfortable. Our suite was amazing! Big bright windows, plenty of storage, comfy chairs & couches. Will absolutely stay again!

title: Many negative issues...
text:
Organization of congress we attended, booked this hotel for us for 3 nights..
Clerk at check-in was confused and did not know whether our room was prepaid for alll or a portion of the 3 nights, since there was an issue with 2 separate bookings apparently. Were not informed breakfast was not included, nor where breakfast was served nor the hotel's WIFI information. My husband fell out of the bed,  hurt his head on sharp edge of bedside table. Went to reception to ask for First Aid kit and was told that security would come and take care of the issue. They did come within 5 minutes and did an amazing job in dressing the wound. 
At check-out we were told that we were responsible for payment of room, despite the fact the the room was prepaid. When checking in at new hotel by evening we discovered that my husband had left 3 shirts in the closet. Phoned hotel, spoke to security/lost/found and were told there was no report of these shirts being found, but they would follow up with us next day after checking with housekeeping. Never heard back. How is this possible? Somebody must have noticed them hanging in an empty closet. Now home we discover that in addition to a 2-nights charge for our parked car we were charged for 2 additional nights even though we only stayed 3 nights.
Not a great experience given the fact that the price per room is not insignificant.

title: Two Average Nights
text: I was there on a business trip with my husband, so we were not too concerned on price.  For whatever reason, it was one of the pricier rooms we have had in NYC, so I had high expectations.    They upgraded our room to a suite on a high floor.   It was clean and comfortable, no complaints there.  Basically the bedroom side was a small NY room and the suite part had a couch and a desk, with a door that closed in between.  Neutral colors and safe choices. The staff was nice. The elevator was not slow (we've had that issue in many other NY hotels).  I used the gym downstairs, which had towels and water and was generally in good condition.  The cleaning crew made it through early in the morning, which was nice that it was clean when I stopped in before lunch.  So as you can see, no real complaints here, but there just wasn't anything outstanding or above average.  The lobby was not at all inviting, but the hotel location was super convenient in MidTown. From the pictures, I mistakenly thought there was a rooftop bar, but there is a rooftop patio, with a view of the church and a few chairs and they let you order room service to that location, but it's not really a destination.   I'd stay here again if someone else was paying for it or there was some super deal on price.  For the same price or less, I've preferred other hotels with interesting people-watching lobbies or some modern decorating scheme, or some over the top service touches.

title: Mixed feelings
text: The hotel is lovely and in a fab location for exploring NYC. I do agree with others that there is a slight smell in reception and also our room did not smell fresh. We booked the hotel through BA in a package deal. On arrival we were asked for our credit card. It was not explained that they would put a holding charge of $75 on there. I had to query this when we noticed it after a couple of days. We were told that this would be released within 48 hours of checking out. This has still not been released, so i am very unhappy about this. I do think that this should have been explained to us on check in and not just taken. I had emailed the hotel before arrival to let them know that we were celebrating our daughter's birthdays of 18 & 21 this year. They would not offer us a free upgrade, we would have to pay nor could we join the select membership because of the booking being done with BA. They did however still provide us with free wifi and 2 free drinks every morning, which was a lovely touch. They also sent some prosecco and cake up to our room for our daughter's. So i have mixed feelings about this hotel. The room was clean and was cleaned every day, but there was a strange smell in there. The beds were comfy and we were on the 9th floor so it was quiet. The staff were lovely and friendly too, so i can't fault any of them to be honest. Would i stay there again? No i don't think so.

title: Fabulous stay
text: Just checked out from first stay at Omni Berkshire Place and just had to comment what a wonderful hotel made even better by all of the staff we encountered from arriving through checking in and all the staff during our stay have been wonderful and so helpful but also so friendly. Hotel is in a great location and the decor is great with very good room sizes especially for New York. Would definitely stay here again

title: So much better than my prior hotel several blocks away.
text:
Excellent. Great location. Great staff. Very good rooms (I could have paid $40 for a better room), excellent concierge, excellent front doormen, NY Times and WSJ in the morning, cold, citrus water near elevator appreciated after all the walking... Word to the wise, I am having to use my cell-phone for my internet as I, for whatever reason, did not book "direct" using my Omni account. But a coffee maker in the room or in the lobby would have been appreciated. I will be crossing the street tomorrow morning, again, to get our coffees.

Highly likely I will stay here again on my next trip and I will book "direct".

title: Perfect Location for a NYC experience
text: My husband was in the City for two meetings and I tagged along.   His business was on Wall Street, but since I walk everywhere we stayed at Omni because of it's location and also because we're Omni members.   Their membership perks make travel much, much nicer!    Adam and Jessica were extremely helpful and very friendly!     I could walk to Lexington/Park Ave. for shopping and easily walk to MOMA. The bar in Bob's Steak was comfortable and inviting for cocktails.       The whole hotel experience made the trip one worth repeating.  Very soon.

title: Berkshire hotel
text:
This hotel is a gem well situated near Central Park 
Bloomingdales etc... 
service is implacable from the door men who greets you to room services 
Rooms are spacious and sleep easily 4 people French doors separates the master bedroom from a small living room with hide beds 
Each of us had our own space 
It is quiet well maintained 
I highly recommend this hotel 
It’s the little attention that got us smiling everyday a little knock on the door ( bell actually) for some cookies and drinks in mid afternoon or ice and xtra towels at night morning greeting with juices of our choice brought to the room 
They know how to take care in a special way if their customers

title: Basic
text:
Pros- friendly staff. Location. Big room 
Cons- feels dated, very basic for the price. Not enough towels. No mini-bar or fridge. 
It certainly didn’t feel like a 4star hotel priced at over $400... would rather have paid a bit more and stayed at the Whitby, again.

title: A special night for Ashley
text: A special night out for Ashley graduation, dinner at Rosie's and the play Wicked. Checking in at the Omni Berkshire Place was a breeze and a short distance to both places for dinner and the Broadway play Wicked.

title: Great stay
text: Having stayed at many hotels in mid-town Manhattan the Omni is certainly one of the nicest stays for its class of hotel. Clean room with well appointed bathroom, friendly staff and service. The hotel is central to the business district and only a few blocks walk to Central Park and Times Square. I also enjoyed the continental breakfast delivered each morning which was a simple yet great start to the day.

title: Spacious, sparkling clean and conveniently located.
text: I would definitely stay here again.  It was in a great location for our purposes.  Everything was neat and clean. Staff were all friendly and helpful.  The shower was fabulous, hot and strong pressure.  The bed was very comfortable, too!

title: Great hotel
text: From the moment we arrived, this was the hotel to be in. Speedy and polite on reception, clean room, friendly staff. Carlos, on the front door is a credit to the management-nothing was too much trouble to him, and always a smile. Such a convenient place to stay-close to everything.

title: perfect example of fantastic customer service (care)
text: Maurizio Chiovaro (General Manager) and Tim (our server) made sure they do their research real time and get some vegetarian food for me which i greatly appreciate and something i will never forget. Usually when vegetarians like me ask for veg options at restaurants across the globe, its not given too much importance and people do not go out of the way to help and ensure they serve each customer equally, but what Maurizio and Tim did is what everyone in the service industry should do. Thank you guys.

title: Hotel Raccomandato Vivamente
text:
Siamo stati a NY per la prima volta e, dopo aver consultato Trip Advisor per individuare tra le centinaia di hotel presenti a NY quale prenotare, ci siamo orientati nella scelta sull'Omni Berkshire Place.
Scelta più che azzeccata. A partire dall'ubicazione: è in "pieno centro", ovvero a ridosso della 5a e conseguentemente nelle immediate vicinanze sia dei negozi più prestigiosi (ma anche di marche inferiori), che  di ristoranti, mezzi di trasporto (la metropolitana è a poche centinaia di metri).
L'hotel : è particolarmente curato. In reception personale sempre disponibile , ancorchè personalmente non possiamo vantanrci di parlare un fluent english. Peraltro i ringraziamenti più graditi vanno al Sig. Dario (assistant front Office manager ) che si è fatto "portavoce" nei confronti della Direzione dell'hotel per due problematiche :
1. Mal funzionamento dell'aria condizionata (problematica risolta dalla mattina alla sera con tanto di scuse da parte dell'hotel per l'accaduto - con vassoio di pasticcini -);
2. Discordanza tra fattura finale e mail di prenotazione (ovvero fattura ben più alta rispetto all'importo prenotato), risolta prontamente grazie al suo intervento.
A parte questi aspetti, NON abbiamo segnalazioni negative. 
E' un hotel che Vi raccomandiamo vivamente.

title: Great staff
text: We stayed at the Omni for our holiday visit to New York in June, we had a great time and this hotel was a big part of it, all the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was quiet and very comfortable, the hotel was clean and close to lots of attractions, Central Park, Times Square, The Rockefeller Center and the subway. We eat on the go so never tried Bob’s steak house, opting to grab a drink and sandwich / takeaway from Isadoras Café across the road.

title: Terrific stay, would stay at Omni again
text:
We arrived in NYC on Friday June 14th and luckily our two rooms were ready and they allowed us an early check-in so that was good.  There was a small issue with one of the two rooms so I spoke with the manager at the front desk and she couldn't have handled it any better so I was pleased, (thank you Jessica) :)
Our rooms were nice, clean, comfortable and also spacious by NY standards.  
Lenny the Bellman was wonderful, always smiling, fun and full of great suggestions for dining, coffee, etc.  
We dined at Bob's Steakhouse in the Omni and had a terrific meal and a very fun waiter (thank you Kevin from Heaven lol ).  There was a blonde lady at the concierge desk who was friendly and helpful, however, I found a couple of gentleman at the concierge desk that seemed pre-occupied and not really interested in helping when asked questions about the Hop-On Hop-Off tour buses.  We actually had better concierge service from Lenny :)
All in all a really good experience at the Omni, perfect location, walking distance to Times Square and Central Park; we would definitley stay there again.
Last but not least, Lenny arranged our transportation back to La Guardia with Ruben and we were so happy with his service we took his business card and would also use Ruben's services again.

title: Phenomenal stay
text: We couldn’t have dreamt of a better hotel to stay at for our trip to NYC over Easter Weekend. We had a gorgeous room with a balcony that offered a breathtaking view of the City. The hotel is ideally located, at a short minute walk from the 5th ave and the Nike store, it is close to some of the city’s best restaurants and the service is fantastic at the hotel. Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful stay at the Omni Berkshire Place
text: Omni Berkshire Place is a hotel that is ideally located in Manhattan and offers professional bellman, front desk and concierge services along with most quiet rooms and comfortable beds. Coffee is offered free to each quest and brought to your room at your pre-requested time.

title: Great place!
text:
Great staff, great rooms, great service and great food. The reception is always professional and timely. The room was great with all the amenities. Food and drink at Bobs Steak is always hearty and fantastic.

 at Bobs is always outstanding.

title: Simply the Best
text: From start to finish our experience was great! The hotel staff is attentive and friendly. The food at Bob's steakhouse was fantastic and our location was great! Close to everything and easy access to shops, shows, great food and Central Park. I highly recommend the Omni for anyone staying in Manhattan. Five Stars!!

title: Well appointed rooms; centrally located; good room service---a solid choice at the $475/night price point.
text: I've stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place numerous times and it is consistently good.  The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are quite comfortable (similar to a Westin Heavenly Bed).  The room service is much better than typical hotel fare and surprisingly flavorful.  I have stayed at other hotels in the same area and most fall short of this level of quality.

title: Fun getaway!
text:
The Omni Berkshire is a tremendous hotel with a couple of problems, one of which could be easily solved. The hotel is gorgeous and is a 4 diamond property, I'll say that to begin. 
They problems are the street noise and the beds. The noise from the street stays constant until way after midnight. I mean big trucks and 60db Rap Music and construction. I slept very little our first night. We were moved to a higher floor and away from the main street, which helped. However, the second problem wad the quality of the beds. The matress felt like a cheap 2 star hotel,  very springy.
We stayed another night on this trip and went to another hotel. The difference in the bed was phenomenal. I slept great. 
The staff at the Omni was second to none. From the bellmen to the cleaning crew ti the front desk. Adam, at the front desk, was especially delightful. Helpful in every way, and as professional as you can get.

title: Good hotel
text: This is the typical reliable, clean and comfortable NYC hotel. Nothing spectacular or particularly interesting but it is worth your money. The place has a top location, comfortable beds, clean and well functioning bathroom. The rooms are spacious. Highly recommended if you want good without overpaying.

title: Unbelievably noisy room
text: Do not stay there if they put you in any of the rooms on the lower floors! I was very unhappy and they are totally aware of the problem. Unless you can sleep thru traffic, sirens, garbage trucks etc - go elsewhere

title: Excellent, as usual
text:
This hotel is very consistent. The staff, from top to bottom, should be praised for their kindness and helpfulness. 
The food and service at BOB's is tops and my only complaint would be that the portions were very large. That seems to be a NYC Steakhouse tradition. If you would like a quiet hotel that is restful;  would like to have some stress reduced; eat well and head back into the world in the morning with an improved mood then you should try the Omni Berkshire Place. I return as often as I can.

title: Exceptional service (except concierge)
text:
Adam greeted me when I arrived at the front desk.  He also checked me out five days later.  He was exceptionally friendly and service oriented.
We enjoyed the hotel very much!  It was a bit over a mile to the theatre district (our main focus for the five day outing). 
Cabs aren’t always easily hailed. 
Michael always went to great lengths to get us a cab and take care of us.  He really watched out for us (two ladies that are a bit older). 
Due to our situation we also received two free beverages each day.  We loved having our morning orange juice delivered. 
The beds were very comfortable. 
The bellmen opened doors and were very gracious upon each arrival and departure.  Very welcoming!
We asked the concierge for information twice.  We didn’t feel he cared that much about aiding us and was not helpful.  He could have easily engaged us and been of services.  We relied more on the internet.  
We loved staying here!
Thank you again, Michael the bellman and Adam, the desk clerk.  You make a difference!!

title: A bit disappointed
text: We are loyal Omni guests, but this stay was sub-par.  Our reservations were not correct.  Thankfully, they were able to accommodate us, but in a much smaller room than we had booked.  The 17th floor terrace from which you can see St Patrick's Cathedral was closed.  We were very disappointed as we were looking forward to sitting out there and seeing the city.  The view from our room on the 11th floor was not quite as good.  We had Wi-Fi issues that were unable to be fixed our entire stay and slow-draining shower.  They were able to fix the shower, and service was fast when we called.  The staff was friendly and helpful overall, especially the doorman.  The location is right in the heart of just about anything you could want: shopping, Central Park, food, etc.  I'd give them another shot, because we are typically very impressed with Omni hotels, but this time was not their best showing.

title: Time for some updating....
text: You can't beat the location- especially if you're going to the theater, shopping, etc.  We've stayed here quite a few times, but this is probably our last visit.  The hotel needs to be refreshed.  The lobby is tired.  There's a mildly unpleasant odor in the hallways.  Smells like they are trying to cover up a stink.  No coffee maker in room.  One bar of soap in bathroom, no shower cap.  You can hear every little street noise.   Bathrobes if you ask.   Mattresses and pillows need to be replaced.  La Guardia is under construction.  Give yourself at least 2 hours to get to the airport.

title: Good location. Bathroom nice, bed comfy enough, doormen pleasant, concierge meh
text: My title says it all really. We stayed at this hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary on a room only basis. The concierge desk isn’t manned until 7am (not much use for jet lagged Europeans waking up at 4am) and mostly wasn’t well staffed the rest of the time. The reason I am bothering to write this review however is that I have just learned that my aunt phoned and emailed the hotel to try and arrange a surprise bottle of champagne for us but they never called back or replied to the emails she sent. Disappointing service in this day and age.

title: Omni Berkshire Place NYC
text: Love this hotel!  The location is convenient to walk to just about anything in the city, and the subway is just around the corner to reach the outlying places.  It's about a 10 minute walk from Grand Central.  The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice. Highly recommend!

title: Simple elegance
text: The Omni Berkshire offers old New York in a practical, elegant form. Bob’s serves wonderful food. The hotel staff are very guest oriented. The housekeeping staff are efficient and do it right the first time.

title: Somewhere to sleep in an excellent location......
text:
This is a business hotel with no frills. Rooms are large by New York standards but no refrigerator, no bottled water or coffee making facilities.  You get a bed and a bathroom.

You are just another customer when you stay here. Arrived after a fraught journey to be checked in by a somewhat rude and arrogant desk person. I asked two questions neither of which were answered as the person concerned had their own agenda and they were not going to deviate. 

The location is good.If you’re staying on business, stay here, if you’re on pleasure go elsewhere.  Don't eat in the expensive and overrated hotel restaurant. Breakfast in the excellent diner opposite and in the evening wander down to 2nd where there are some excellent Italian restaurants.

We encountered the latest wheeze to extract more money from clients with their charging a nightly $25 Berkshire Amenity Fee in addition to the room charge - what amenities I ask?

title: Family Reunion
text: Omni Berkshire Place was in an excellent location, close to Central Park, The Plaza. The check in front desk staff were excellent. The afternoon bartender was great and we all had an interesting conversation with him.

title: Terrific experience
text: We had several special requests, such as no feather pillows or down comforters, and although the room wasn’t quite ready at check-in, they sent someone right up to take care of it. The housekeeper was friendly and efficient and said that we should stay in the room while she worked if we wanted to. The room was like a womb, so quiet and peaceful. When visiting in NYC, I actually like to hear a little of the buzz of the city at night, but all we heard was silence. Not complaining at all!!! Staff was helpful and pleasant and we loved the neighborhood. Room was well-appointed, clean and comfortable.

title: Magical Stay at the Omni. Fantastic Location, Outstanding Service, Great Rooms!
text: We spent the weekend at the Omni and had an amazing stay. The location is central to everything. The hotel staff was superb! The Doormen were kind and helpful. The bellman kindly helped us store our bags after check out.  I was in touch with Kevin, the Concierge before our trip and he provided excellent restaurant recommendations. He also had numerous suggestions for things my children would like to see and do in the city. Room Service was fast and delicious. We stayed in a beautiful suite that was VERY spacious and comfortable. Cindy with guest services went above and beyond to make sure my son had a special birthday. The staff at the Omni truly made this a trip we will never forget. We can't wait to come back to NYC and stay at the Berkshire again! .

title: Decent
text: Eh..........................this place was just okay. VERY OLD hotel, does not seem like it was updated in the last 20 years. Lobby is beautiful, rooms not so much. This may have been a 4-star hotel 10 years ago, definitely a 3-star today.

title: Nice hotel that lacks the personal touch
text:
This is a business hotel with no frills. Rooms are very large by New York standards and well appointed but it misses out on the personal touches that are all important on a holiday.  Housekeeping wasn’t perfect, we had to ask for towels and the bed was poorly made and there is a lack of information about the hotel in the room.

You are just another customer when you stay here. Arrived on my birthday to celebrate my wife’s 40th. Not a solitary acknowledgement or Happy Birthday greeting. 

The location is good, just off 5th behind St Patrick’s. The lobby is basic in comparison to similar priced hotels.

Hotels are a place to sleep but it’s that little extra that separates the nice places from the great places.  If you’re staying on business, stay here, if you’re on pleasure go elsewhere. 

I wouldn’t return given the many hotels in New York. It’s nice but nothing special.

title: Tired & dated hotel
text:
We stayed here as a family for 4 days in NY.  The hotel was always clean and tidy and the staff on the doors were polite and helpful.  

We were on the 19th floor.  The room was adequate for our needs which was a place to sleep, but it was very tired and dated.  The bathroom shower was horrific due to it running unbelievably slow so bath was the only option.  

Bizarrely the hallways were sub zero conditions and we would literally freeze going from the lift to the room.  

Location was great in the Broadway and Times Square was a short walk away. 

We didn’t eat anything in the hotel as the prices were madness, but that said that’s New York in general! 

Would I stay again here, unlikely unless they have a mass overhaul and bring the hotel into the 21st century.

title: Muy Bueno
text:
Muy buena ubicación, buena habitación considerando que esta en NYC, es cómoda y a un costo razonable.
La cafetería NO es muy buena, el personal no es amable en cambio todo el personal del counter es sumamente amable.

title: Faded glory
text: Very good service, with exceptionally (for New York) friendly and helpful staff.  This was first time a this hotel in more than a decade, and time has not been kind to the hotel.  In the detail (eg frames of pictures in elevators) are old and worn.  It’s too bad because location is great and rooms are spacious and well laid out.

title: Excellent hotel, location & weekend price
text: Great value. I think we were very lucky to get a weekend price of US$225 a night. Very good price for the location and hotel quality. On top of that, we were give a huge room. Excellent hospitality and friendly staff.

title: Grande
text:
Hola.

Once días en Nueva York y todos en este hotel.

Al estilo de los hoteles estadounidenses de medio alto nivel. Muy grande y limpio, pero algo antiguo.

Servicios suficientes y con una ubicación excepcional. 

Personal muy amable y profesional.

Próxima vez en NYC será una opción a tener muy en cuenta.

title: 10th floor-Overlooking Madison Ave
text: The Room was excellent and spacious. High ceilings, master bedroom and master bath was excellent! Soaking tub, nice shower with perfect water pressure and enough room to get around without feeling claustrophobic.  The living area was very nice as it provided more than enough room to walk around while providing nice views of madison avenue.  Probably a perfect room during the Macy's day parad. Overall a great experience!

title: Big rate for an OK room
text: At $700/night I expected something more from this otherwise well reviewed hotel  People were great.  But the room was a classic over-priced New York City hotel room.  Nice location and service good.  The $23 triple latte/espresso was over the top for breakfast as well.

title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 5 STARS start to finish
text:
Absolutely outstanding stay. I attended a group event, held in house, and stayed two nights at the Omni. 
Hotel staff was exceptional. Doormen were polite and courteous; going above and beyond! Housekeeping was efficient and friendly. Room service was so fast. 
And we ran into an incident with a guest who accidentally made a huge ruckus in the hall. The staff's prompt response to the issue and resolution of it deserves 5 Stars. 
Thank you Kelly at the front desk and Jess for your lovely handwritten note. Beautiful touch. Thank you Francesca for your attention to our stay!
And the incredible tall doorman that helped us all the way to our car!!! (I wish i caught your name)
Xo
Look forward to staying with you again!

title: Great Place, very convenient, Great location.
text: Theater District, St. Patrick's, Restaurants.  Great service, clean rooms. Visited New York City for a wedding visited 2 or 3 local restaurants/bar all walking distance. Got to use the umbrella provided in the room. Thank you for a wonderful time.

title: Great stay
text: I stayed at this hotel for a four days business trip. The hotel is very well located and everything worked very well. People were nice and diligent. The service was very good and the room was of a nice size and clean. Great stay!!

title: Great weekend at Omni for wedding
text:
Booked two nights for a friend’s weekend wedding and reception... 
Everything was closeby, St Patrick’s Cathedral wedding and Empellon for reception and back to Bob’s Chop House after party! Great location for all of it!

title: Solo Trip & first time in USA
text:
Spent 7 nights here on a solo trip and my first ever visit to NYC. Hotel is in a great location, easy to get around everywhere and the Subway station is nearby. There’s a cafe across the road to get a bite to eat on the go or stock up on drinks and snacks.

Room was comfortable, clean (apart from if you pull the bed away from the wall (searching for my charger)... but it didn’t bother me.

The staff were friendly and helpful and I felt very comfortable in this huge, unfamiliar city!

title: Magical Wedding Weekend
text:
The staff at the Omni are Wonderful! Everything we needed was delivered in minutes! Bell & door service was spot on!
The Omni provided Steamers, beauty chairs & .... The Madison suite and the Apartment are Awesome!

title: Fine for a night
text: There's nothing particularly special about this hotel, but it was fine for the night I spend there.  Everything was clean and well maintained.  The view from my relatively small "deluxe" room was almost Dickensian, but the bed was quite comfortable.

title: Great Mid-Town Location, Nice Rooms, Near Subway
text:
The room was large enough and had a comfortable bed. The room on the 11th floor was quiet. Everything was clean. Lobby is elegant and efficient. There is high water pressure in the shower. No visible mold in shower. At least one plug to provide electrical to bcharge cell phones l.

Negatives included no coffee service in the room and no microwave or refrigerator. There was also an unexpected charge daily on our room for “amenities.”

title: nice staff
text:
the hotel is at a decent address in manhattan no spec view
typically the Sheraton -80's standard in the rooms no minibar no floor drain in the bathroom so there will be flooding when you shower!  
probably the slowest internet in usa 
everyone in the staff is very nice spec director Francesca,
  Everything is expensive to eat/drink  in this area  about 3 times Swedish prices

title: Satisfied
text: No complaints, very pleasant hotel. Location quite quiet but once we got our bearings found lots to do.Staff helpful in directing including to nearby subway station. Several cafes nearby including one across from the hotel entrance.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Location is great, staff are great, rooms too.
Pricing comparable.
Nice feature is you can have fresh coffee delivered to your suite 
at your preferred time!
There used to be awesome green apples available at reception but 
no more as too many freeloaders took them!
This is my annual trip to New York preferred.

title: Beautiful rooms, great service, amazing location!
text: Love this property. Yes some rooms face the inside but they are well-appointed, comfortable size, impeccably clean and highly functional. Nice bathrooms, well-lit, comfortable beds. Book an outside facing room for extra light at a small surcharge!

title: Last minute Jewel in the city
text: After being stranded at the airport for over 5 hours and the plane was delayed another 7 we decided to rebook for Monday and go back to Manhattan.  My partner was calling hotels while I dealt with the airline to his dissatisfaction.  I called the hotel directly and the loyalty ambassador was able to get me in. Not only did I only get a room, but was upgraded to a suite and greeted with snacks and drinks after my long day.  I order room service which was amazing and slept on an awesome king size bed overlooking the city.  Truly recommend this property for any of your stays in the city.  Is perfectly located and the staff will make you feel like Royalty.  Thanks Omni Berkshire!

title: Great location and good atmosphere.
text:
A lovely boutique hotel in NYC. Great location and good atmosphere.

The deluxe double bed rooms aren’t big, however they a good size for New York City, and comfortable. The furnishings weren’t too dated or worn. The beds and pillows however were not particularly comfortable, which was disappointing.

There was no view, however looking towards the nextdoor buildings meant it was quieter. Away from the street noise.

Not as clean as I would like.

Staff generally polite and not unfriendly.

The meeting room we had was good. Spacious enough and the meals were well-catered.

I would stay here again.

The restaurant (Bob’s Steakhouse) and room service left a lot to be desired. Behind the times. They had gluten free bread available, but not gluten breakfast options like pancakes, granola, or quinoa bowls etc. Likewise, the room service dinner and dessert menus were very limited and uninventive generally and specifically for gluten free options. I had the creme brulee, which definitely cannot be called a brulee. It was the equal "creme brulee" I have ever had in my life. Hard and gelatinous. The staff in Bob’s restaurant were impatient and unfriendly. The restaurant could be so much more than it is, as the traditional setting itself is pleasant.

title: Wedding room block
text: We hosted our wedding room block here for our out of town guests.  Ashley Bright and her colleagues were fantastic!  They held my wife’s wedding dress, delivered welcome bags timely, and accommodated guests’ requests.  My sister-in-law, who was staying five nights, needed a small refrigerator for her babies and the hotel delivered one within minutes.  Their rates are extremely reasonable and they do everything with a smile. All our friends and family raved about the Omni!

title: Most enjoyable!
text: Omni is the best. Had a wonderful time here. Everything was absolutely perfect.  Cindy Fong our Loyalty Ambassador made sure our stay was perfect.  Hotel is beautiful and the best location. Highly recommend and this will be our go to hotel when we return.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Wonderful room, super clean, great location. Definetely recommend to friends. I recommend stay in the premium room with 33sqmt. Perfect for a family with 3, big bathroom. Confortable beds, great shower

title: Very nice...
text: Adjacent to... but not in the tourist areas. Large rooms that are in good shape. No fridge or coffee in room. Some tape on hallway rug but otherwise a great spot. Street is quiet on weekends. There is a deli across the street if you want to cut the breakfast bill.

title: In NY as at home
text: Clean  and  welcoming  environment in an excellent position, close to the bus and underground lines that connect to the main destinations.  Great room service and courtesy from the staff. The cost for breakfast offered is expensive (probably like in all of Manhattan), but Ny offers many other valid opportunities.

title: A Step Above...
text: Couldn't have asked for a better experience!...This was our first time staying at the Omni Berkshire Place location (we've stayed at other Omni locations), my husband and I were in NYC to celebrate our 18th Wedding Anniversary. From the moment I called to make the reservation, to the time we left, our experience at this location did not disappoint. When I called Reservations, the Reservation Specialist kindly reminded me that we qualified for a "free" night which I didn't realize (so I was thankful for that). She helped me book a basic level inside room. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to a very nice and quite comfortable one bedroom suite with a view of St. Patrick's Cathedral, and with big THANKS to Cindy at the hotel, we were treated to a complimentary bottle of Champagne, Chocolate Covered Strawberries, and a Cheese & Fruit Platter that was delivered to our Suite, complete with a personalized HAND WRITTEN note wishing us a Happy Anniversary. We were blown away, it was all such a nice personal touch and something we won't soon forget. Everyone from the gentlemen at the Concierge Desk who assisted us with dinner reservation recommendations, to the Doorman and Bellhop guys who were extremely friendly and helpful with our luggage and made sure we got the discount sticker to self-park our car, to the staff at the Front Desk (and to Kevin (?) who happily extended our check-out time), and the Waiter in the hotel restaurant that served us breakfast, were all just simply on their A-Game and delivered top notch customer service from the moment we arrived right up until the minute we left...Although our stay at the Omni Berkshire NYC location only lasted twenty-four hours, the professional level of quality service the entire staff delivered, left us with a memorable experience that helped make our anniversary weekend more special and one that we will remember for years to come. We definitely look forward to staying at this Omni location again in the future and would highly recommend the Omni Berkshire Place to others looking for a hotel experience that goes above and beyond the hotel guests expectations!...Extending a heart-felt Kudo's & Thank You to All!

title: Great Hotel
text: The Omni is a beautiful hotel well located for theatre and dining. We walked everywhere and enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The complimentary coffee was an added bonus in the morning.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was modern with a city view.

title: Disappointing
text:
After staying with Omni in other US locations we decided on Berkshire Pace for this short trip.

On arrival our room was not available but our telephone number was taken to advise us when it was ready. No call was recd so we headed back at 4pm. On receipt if the key we were not asked if we'd visited before or knew the area, no mention was made of any facilities or the rooftop bar

We were allocated a room on 3rd floor - not great. We booked a premium executive king. The room was large for NY standards with good size bathroom. This is where the good stops....

The hallway had a strange smell, possibly marujana. The room despite the descripition by Omni had no robes, slippers , bottled water or ipod docking station.

The bathroom had complimentary toiletries, these were not restocked when used, nor was the bottled water.

The concierge was located directly in front of the elevators, they never made eye contact or asked if we needed anything.

The curtains did not meet in the room and had to be clipped together each night to keep out the light.

On checking out (yes ut was 3.15am) but we were not even asked if eveything was ok. 

So compared to previous stays at the Shoreham and Parker House this was poor. So we've left NY  disheartened and when we do come back we know not to stay at Berkshire Place.

One note of thanks, the doormen and bell men were always friendly and welcoming.

After going back to reception asking for robes they were delivered but did not smell fresh.

As we are loyalty members we were given vouchers for a morning drink.

title: Good location
text: The hotel is very well situated and I am hoping that our disappointing stay was a glitch. The attention to details expected from a 4 star hotel was lacking and consequently we did not enjoy our stay as much as during past stays.

title: Thoroughly average hotel in a good location
text:
This hotel is average, at best, for the price.  The principal advantage is the great midtown location.  Avoid it if you are seeking a luxury room, or even one that is good for business travelers. 

The room is dated, with average bed linens, poor lighting, and a bathroom tiled in reddish, very dated marble.  No coffee service in the room.  It does have a decent sized desk.

title: SUPERB GUEST EXPERIENCE AT THE OMNI BERKSHIRE AS ALWASY
text: The Omni Berkshire offers a superb quest experience. I have stayed here many times for family visits. All the staff are welcoming, cordial and professional, and the rooms are lovely. We are just two minutes walks to St. Pat's Cathedral, a real plus for Easter Mass. Loveliest experiences ever at the Omni Berkshire.

title: Great value at a fabulous location
text: The Omni Berkshire is a great respite from the bustle of New York at 52nd and Madison at the same time being an easy walk to theatres, shopping and the MOMA.  The rooms are spacious and clean, the staff friendly and professional, and the hotel offers a great value proposition given the location and quality of the property.

title: Consistently Great Hotel
text: I have used this hotel many times over the last few years and it never disappoints.  Hotel has a consistently high standard for rooms and service.  Location is convenient - 5th and 53rd Subway is right around the corner.

title: Excelente
text:
Muy bueno. 
Muy buena ubicación. 
Excelente las habitaciones y el baño.
Muy bueno el conserje. Grandes consejos para conocer NY.
La cama y el colchón muy buenos 
Muy recomendable. 
Calefacción muy buena .
TV flat muy buena

title: Perfect Location
text:
We arrived at our stunning Hotel on Easter Sunday having fought our way past the Easter Bonnet parade in our coach
The rooms are beautiful and well presented with maple veneered wardrobes and panelling
The bathroom is well apportioned with a bath and shower and  and bathrobes are provided
The location is close to Times Square and Central Park and is very quiet at night.

title: The hotel locaton in Midtown is excellent to visit museums and exclusive shopes on the 5th street.
text:
The dinner at the hotel was good but the restaurant was very empty . The service was excellent and I have enjoyed American steak with my visitors tigether . When I booked through Expedia web site it was written  the  breakfast is included  in the room price.
This was one of the important point to me  to choose this hotel, A couple of days before I left for New York an e mail from the Expedia arrived and said I will get $15 to spend for  food a day. 
After all the hotel said there is no breakfast included in the room price so I guessed this  $15 is for breakfast .
Unfortunately a breakfast cost minimum $23  Make sure to find out how much the agent pay for the breakfast. 
The point is if man see

title: Family break
text: Combining family business matter and spring break in the city, it was a perfect spot! Staff very friendly, very accomidating. Expensive few days, but worth the great memories which Omni Hotel provide. Thank you!

title: Terrific hotel in superb location
text:
This is an excellent hotel. Our room was modern, spacious and spotlessly clean. All staff were courteous, welcoming and helpful. We ate in the bar on our first night - the sliders and charcuterie plates were great while there was a good choice of craft, draft and bottled beers alongside cocktails, spirits and wines. We also enjoyed a nightcap there most evenings. 
Just a few steps from Fifth Avenue and within walking distance of most attractions we couldn’t have picked a better spot for our first stay in New York.. It is certainly a hotel which we would recommend and stay at again.

title: Best of the Best !
text:
Best hotel experience aways !  When ever I travel whether business or pleasure I always try to stay at an Omni never a disappointment !  Best customer service and one of my favorite hotel loyalty programs.
Always can't wait to return.

title: Great for a weekend trip
text: We stayed in a suite on a high floor and it was spacious enough for our family.  The location is great for hitting the sites in NYC. The bathroom is nicely appointed and has a big tub if you have kids.  There is no mini-fridge in the room and the room marked 'ice' on our floor was locked with a key.  I didn't spend much effort to solve those problems but would have been nice to chill our drinks as we were there as tourists and did a lot of walking.  The front desk was helpful getting our room set up as needed and the check-in was smooth.  We would come back, especially given the proximity to the american girl doll store.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Omni Berkshire. Check in was quick, our room was on the 14th floor and we were so impressed... So many people always say how NYC hotels have small rooms but ours was the opposite, it was pretty huge, was a king size bed room. Room and bathroom were clean, plenty of storage space, safe an desk. We were high enough that there wasn’t much noise heard from Madison Avenue below either. Hotel kept our bags after we checked out until we needed them for catch our flight. The fitness centre was pretty big with a range of machines, water machine and apples! Only one thing I would say is that tea/coffee making facilities in the room would have been nice, considering the price, or a central place where guests could get one on the mornings... still doesn’t stop me giving the 5 star review though.

title: Abusive Exploitation of a Teen
text: We arrived at the hotel on April 5th. We had reserved two rooms, one of which was for our 14 year old son. Our son is seriously allergic to tobacco to the extent that it can lead to anaphylactic shock like symptoms. The bedding in his non-smoking room had a strong tobacco odor. He called the front desk to request changing his room for health reasons. He was told the hotel had no open rooms other than the Rogers & Hammerstein Suite. They moved him there. My wife & I were out walking while all of this transpired. You can imagine my shock & displeasure when I found out the next morning when we checked out that our 14 year old son's room cost close to $900 for the night. The woman at the front desk who had arranged the room change had never consulted us, the parents, regarding the change & cost. My wife & I would have gladly switched rooms with our son as opposed to paying this exorbitant rate. This was a clear abuse of a young teen by the hotel staff. Despicable.

title: Fantastic Retreat in great location
text: Great location, easily walkable to shopping and many key tourist sites. Comfortable room, big bathroom, double closet, great for sharing with a friend. Love the morning coffee delivery service and comfy bathrobes.  Staff is outstanding.

title: Convenient for all major tourist sites
text: We were given a room slightly to the back of the hotel which cut down on external noise. It was an excellent base for all the major tourist sites. There are probably hotels slightly cheaper but you really get what you pay for. Would definitely stay again

title: Clean, sophistacated looking and great location
text: The staff were courteous.  The room was very clean, no dust, no smudges, no dirt, and it smelled clean.  The bathroom, sheets, upholstery and refrigerator was clean.  I enjoyed my stay and plan to return.

title: Excellent location and hotel!
text: We stayed here this past weekend and are so glad we did!  The location is wonderful.  Each employee we encountered was very professional and helpful.  We were especially appreciative of the concierges and their assistance in making dinner and brunch reservations for us.  We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Great location, large room for family
text: We stayed in a room for 4 people in the February half term. The room overlooked the road (but this was a good thing, lots to see) and was large enough to have the king size bed in addition to 2 X rollaway beds in for the children (11 and 14yrs).  The hotel is opposite a really good deli where you can get a great breakfast (they also serve hot food for lunch and dinner) called Isadoras and is a 5 minute stroll away from the Rockerfeller Centre. We would definitely book this hotel again, due to it's location and cleanliness/comfort of rooms.

title: quiet oh so quiet!
text: 4 nights in a Berkshire Suite (bedroom plus lounge) in April 2019.  First of all the location of the hotel is fantastic - steps to 5th Ave.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  The decor and overall feel of the hotel for me is that of slightly faded but very comfortable; this isn't a 5 star hotel so little things like the shampoos etc in the bathroom are provided but not what I would call high-end.  Some of the paint is a little scuffed.  Its just a little bit tired.  But that was fine with us, because our room and indeed most of the hotel was quiet and peaceful which we weren't expecting based on the location.  We treated ourselves to a suite and having that extra space was a REAL luxury.  The bed was gigantic, and two huge flatscreen TVs one in the bedroom and one in the lounge.  The bathroom was big.  The suite overlooked an internal courtyard well not really a courtyard, an outside space - the only natural light we got bounced in off the other buildings but it was light enough and so so so quiet.  We got breakfast from Isadora's across the street, perfect.  One night we ate at Bob's downstairs, very good.  The hotel was a welcome retreat at the end of each day and we could not fault the comfort and peacefulness.

title: Perfect for families!!
text: If you are looking for spacious, nicely appointed rooms and fantastic service for you and your family, this is the best hotel!  We needed adjoining rooms for our boys and us.  They suggested a suite with a king bed and adjoining room with 2 queens.  It was less money than 2 rooms in one of those boutique hotels downtown and WAY more space!!  If you are looking for the chic, hip boutique hotel, this may not be for you, but if you want pretty rooms with lots of space for you and your kids, it is perfection! And the location could not be better! We had a wonderful stay!

title: Sleep here--don't eat here!
text: We just spent a quick getaway weekend at the Omni Berkshire Place. The location was great and the room was fine.The shower was fabulous! What would have been a positive experience was overshadowed, however, by the obscene cost of food in the restaurant. There is no coffee available in the room or hotel lobby for hotel guests to enjoy, so guests are directed to the attached restaurant (Bob's Steak and Chophouse) where guests are charged for coffee (Each cup costs either $6 --it went on my room bill, so I didn't know the cost until I ate at the restaurant the next day.) The day we were leaving, we went to the restaurant for breakfast, as it was early on a Sunday morning and nothing else was open. That's when we really felt like suckers. There was no breakfast menu displayed, and there is none online. (There is a dinner menu online, but it does not include prices.) Once we sat down and got our menues, we were horrified to see that everything on the menu cost more than $25! Omelets cost $28, and other breakfast prices were comparable. The total bill for two cups of coffee, a mediocre omelet, and an order of yogurt with granola was over $80.They had even added in a tip, with no option to change it. The whole experience left us feeling as if the hotel had taken advantage of its guests. I realize the restaurant is not run by the hotel, but that is the source of room service and morning coffee, so there is clearly a relationship. At the very least, coffee for hotel guests should be available--and free. I won't stay at the Omni again, since we like to stay at hotels where breakfast is available. It's available at the Omni, but we're not willing to be gouged again.

title: Two nights in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 3/21 & 3/22 and we had a great experience overall.    We had booked via the app HotelTonight and then upon check in we had an option to upgrade our room and we decided to do that.    However, it was raining a lot and our room 1822 began to leak from the ceiling overnight and into the morning and the water went into the closet and onto some of our clothing.   The hotel staff members that we interacted with were all very helpful in getting us all moved to another room (1618).   We were really pleased with their service and helpfulness.   Due to the ceiling leak and time lost due to having to deal with that, the hotel made it right by refunding us the upgrade fees as well as their daily "activity fee" (or whatever it was called).    The size of both rooms that we had was very spacious for NYC standards, in my opinion, as well as the bathroom.  I felt that everything was very clean and the bathroom was inviting and not creepy like in some hotels.    It ended up that our credit card got charged for something it shouldn't have, but the hotel continued to help us when I called them to get it resolved.   Thank you to Francesca, Elvira, Claudia, and Jasmine for all your help and making our stay a great one.

title: TRUE LUXURY AT OMNI!!
text: Just spent a weekend at the Omni Berkshire Place and it was a great stay! The lobby is beautiful, with lots of seating. Front desk personnel are very professional and treat guests like family. My room was on the 15th floor (1501) and it was very clean (a pretty good-sized room). Beds were very comfortable, big TV, and nice bathroom. Only negative about the bathroom is that there’s no exhaust fan so after a shower, it can get quite hot and humid. Not a big deal though, just a heads up. Housekeeping did a great job as well. A lot of outlets in the room which was a plus. Bob’s restaurant for breakfast (connected to the hotel) was very good. I absolutely loved the outdoor terrace on the 17th floor overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral... a very nice place to just relax and socialize. The balcony also has heated panels so when it is cold out, it is not as harsh which is great. A very airy fitness center also on the 17th floor. I stay at an Omni property whenever I can. If the destination I travel to has one, I automatically book Omni because I just love the whole atmosphere and vibe of the Omni chain. Overall, it was a great stay and cannot wait to return! Definitely recommend!

title: Great location, comfortable and quiet
text: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel, room, bar area and staff to be excellent. The rooms were comfortable and very quiet. This made for a great nights sleep- a rarity in hotels for me. We stopped at the bar for a light snack and drinks and found the service personable and efficient with tasty and well made drinks. Would definitely stay again and recommend this location!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Omni Berkshire is in midtown Manhattan. Walking distance to Times Square and Broadway shows. Taxi to anywhere.
Excellent hotel. Most comfortable bed. Very quiet room. Fantastic customer service. Bob’s Steak Restaurant and Bar downstairs, great food and service.
This is a four star hotel, in NYC, so expect it to be expensive. For my money spent, it was well worth it. No complaints. I will stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay.
text:
Beautiful place, clean, friendly personnel, great location!! Would definitely stay here again. 20 min walk to the metropolitan museum. Not far from subway. Amazing restaurant across the street, Fresco by Scotto, best cheesecake I’ve ever had! And wonderful tiramisu martini! 
Side note : parking was a little high but this is to be expected in the city. $85 valet, $55 self parking.

title: A Great Business-Related Stay - I Recommend Staying Here.
text: I stayed at this property for a business/work related trip for 5 nights during March 2019. I also used this hotel to conduct business and found their staff very helpful. The spaces were all clean and maintained nicely. The restaurant on site is good! The only issue I ran in to was that my shower's hot water and cold water knobs didn't work correctly. Upon calling the front desk, maintenance was up within 20 minutes and fixed the problem almost immediately. Specifically, I found Kendric at check-in very pleasant and helpful. Additionally, Bruce was a HUGE help in assisting moving boxes and helping us pack up. There was an additional gentleman at the bellhop who's name I cannot remember but he was very helpful in securing our luggage whilst we waited to check in/ check out and also offered to help me many times as I was putting up and taking down business signage throughout the hotel. The location is great and easy to catch a cab with the help of the hotel staff. The room service was prompt and food quality was just as good as I would expect. The staff at the concierge quickly retrieved packages that I had delivered to my attention - something I find is often "difficult" but was handled with such ease at this location.

title: Great hotel
text: Love this hotel! Great location with nice clean rooms.Im a really light sleeper and was given a room across from elevators so I asked to be changed and it was no problem at all. We were able to leave our bags with bellmen since we weren’t leaving until later that day.

title: Pretty nice hotel not quite 5 star yet though
text: certain things were subpar for a 4 star hotel but very beautiful hotel and comfortable beds. the location is perfect and the service good. and if youre not a select guest become one cause it definitely makes the experience much better.

title: Gem in NYC
text: Was treated like a VIP. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and spacious. Great location, close to St Patricks Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Trump Tower, Radio City Music Hall and many more. Restaurant in the hotel but I didn’t eat there. Many restaurants within walking distance. Will stay here whenever I stay in NYC.

title: Ease
text: Everything from check-in to check-out was easy. We arrived well before check-in and were switched to a different room so we could check in earlier.  Only issue was we couldn't get bottled water to take our prescriptions which was odd but we made it work. Overall highly reccomend and would return.

title: Ideal
text: We have just returned from a 5 night stay. We booked through Virgin Holidays so i can't comment on the price.   Couldn't fault the Hotel at all,  the room was very nice and the Staff so friendly.  We didn't eat or drink at the Hotel as we wanted to be out and about, the location is great.

title: Excellent Hotel and location
text: For our first ever trip to NY we stayed here and really enjoyed the hotel and location.  Prices were decent (about $275/night) for the fact it was November and during the xmas tree lighting at Rockefeller Center.  Location was excellent because it was walking distance to everything (Rockefeller, shopping, subway, etc.).  I mean everything is pretty much walking distance but I personally liked the location.  Service was excellent as well and the hotel room itself was perfect for what we needed.  Highly recommend this if you're staying in NY!

title: Stay-cation in the city!
text: The Omni Berkshire was great for a staycation in the city. I was able to get a cheap rate via Priceline. The room was standard size and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom wasn’t overly impressive but did the job. We did not have food or drinks at the hotel. There are plenty of dining options near by. I would recommend for a short stay in the city.

title: Costoso in rapporto alla qualità
text: Hotel storico in buona posizione, non lontano dalla metro. Costoso sopratutto se si considerano gli extra. Colazione improponibile dato il prezzo assurdo. Camere piccole e bagno un pò datato. Si può trovare di meglio

title: St Patrick’s Day Weekend
text: Great central location walking distance to Central Park, Empire State and Chrysler building.  Subway station right at back of hotel , which handy when exploring downtown. Excellent beds and helpful staff - would recommend. Also great bar / restaurant.

title: NYC Omni
text: Very good hotel located in Midtown NYC. Traveled with family for overnight in NYC. Rooms were spotless. Hotel staff was very pleasant, from front desk check in to doorman on departure.  Highly recommended.

title: Great experience
text: Very helpful staff. From the doorman, concierge, front desk to housekeeping- all very kind and helpful. Great location to see sites either walking or short ride by Uber. I walked to Whole Foods and Uber back to have healthy alternatives during stay

title: Great boutique hotel in prime location
text: Lovely hotel with a very convenient location near Fifth Ave, Central Park, good restaurants, museums, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's, etc.  Rooms are a good size and staff are pleasant and helpful.  Great place to stay.

title: 3.5 stars for average hotel with hiccups
text:
Good:
- location 
- front desk, porters/bellmen, guest services were helpful & friendly
- multiple electrical outlets by the desk and bed 
- comfortable bed - not too soft, not too firm 
- good free wifi for email and internet
- good water pressure 

Average: 
- average sized NYC room (it gets a bit tight with the room service cart)
- decor was very hilton-ish (i.e. boring and beige)
- room service arrived on time; order though was not fully correct; food was fine 
- room seemed relatively clean, but glasses in the bathroom were not clean.

Bad:
- The night before, I called to pre-order my breakfast (there was no breakfast door hanger in the room). The woman who answered seemed highly annoyed by my call and confused about the breakfast. Her confusion and lack of knowledge lead to the following morning's issue. I called room service in the AM b/c an order selection was incorrect. The woman who answered (Jean - sp?) immediately and defensively snapped at me. While the order was rectified and the server who delivered the food was friendly, the room service phone rep had a poor attitude. 
 
Random: 
- bar soap, no body wash
- no coffee maker in the room
- no fridge/no mini bar

Advice:
- should have more than 2 regular pillows on the king bed
- put at least 3 bath towels in the bathroom 
- retrain your room service phone staff 

Would I stay here again? Sure. I think the good outweighs the bad, esp as a business traveler
Is it my top choice? No

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great hotel!! The staff are friendly and helpful.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The gym has updated equipment and is clean.  I've stayed at the Omni several times for work and I will continue to so.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Great Service, from the Valet to the Front Desk. Room was real nice and spacious. Everything was clean and in order. No complaints here. Thank you for a super stay! I will stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: NYC every year, always a pleasure
text: We go to NYC every March and we have always stayed at the Omni Berkshire. We've been doing this trip for over 20 yrs and love staying there. The bellmen are the best and most courtious in NYC. The location is perfect and in walking distance to most attractions. Rate for what you get in very fair. Highly recommended!!

title: Weekend With My Daughter
text: Last weekend, I met my college age daughter for a couple of days in the NYC.  We stayed at the Omni Berkshire property and were pleasantly surprised.  Prior to our arrival, I contacted the concierge desk to requested 1) dinner reservations for two separate nights,2) information on a salon for my daughter, and 3) a near-by gym for working out.  Without delay, I received an email with the requested information.  These guys were spot on with their delivery.  Our first dinner was at an old theater within walking distance to the hotel (Thai food) and the second was right across from the theater we requested (Italian).  All throughout our visit, we interacted with the concierge desk and they continued to provide us with information.  Disclaimer-I am an member of the Omni loyalty program and enjoy their properties, but this is one of their gems that went above and beyond what I normally see.  I highly recommend a stay at this property: great location, exceptional staffing, and overall, excellent service.

title: So comfortable
text:
My favourite NY hotel.
