Rooms are comfortable and clean, Omni members get free coffee service and turn down. Restaurant and bar have delicious food, wind and service. Located close to 5th Avenue shopping and anything you need. Best doormen in the city!

title: Larger rooms than most NYC hotels with high ceilings, large windows. Super location.
text: This is a special NYC hotel. Great mid-town location --- between Madison and 5th Avenue. It is a mid-sized hotel, which we like. Larger than normal NYC rooms, also with an ability to get a higher/quieter floor. Guest rooms have high ceilings. Street view rooms have large windows. Professional staff. We have stayed at this property for around 15 years now, so that tells you something! Can even stay on points other places, and did once or twice, but we prefer the Omni Berkshire Place's spacious guest rooms and staff.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Great hotel, lovely room with comfy bed and the staff are amazing - very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect with many "must sees" when visiting New York only a short walk away. Would definitely recommend!

title: Elegant and Friendly
text: This is a stately, well-kept hotel in Manhattan just off Madison Avenue. Here for a conference, I walked back from Mt. Sinai to the hotel. It’s a good jaunt down Fifth Avenue -taking me to the Metropolitan Museum of Art - no time for the museum, but a pleasant stop at the gift shop. I walked in front of the heavily guarded Trump Tower. I had hoped to have time for a city tour - but this was a delightful substitute. Hotel ambience and service was extraordinary.

title: Great location, rooms good size for NYC
text:
Great location, right in the mix of Manhattan and can walk anywhere from the front door. 

We had a room, with no breakfast - but lots of places to eat nearby. Room was a good size for NYC, but overlooked the back of the hotel - which was offices etc, not the greatest view! Room was a little dated, but clean. 

Okay facilities, with nice bar and helpful concierge

title: Best place to stay in New York
text: I travel for business monthly to NYC and have a choice of hotels. I pick the Omni every time. As business traveler , they make you feel at home, and make you feel special. The rooms are large, exceptionally clean and comfortable. The loyalty ambassadors, the door staff , the concierge and the front office staff are the best in the city. There is no other placeo say.

title: Perfect
text: I recently stayed at this hotel with my partner for 5 nights. The hotel looks basic on booking.com and other sites but the rooms are modern with a nice size tv and a nice clean bathroom. The location of the hotel is second to none and I don’t think it can be beaten for this price! You are on the doorstep of fifth avenue where you can shop away or a 10 minute walk from Times Square. The staff were extremely friendly and the door men will do anything to ensure your taxi driver drops you off and picks you up from the correct place! Absolutely lovely stay will definitely be going back.

title: M klapper
text:
I love staying at the Omni Berkshire. The location is fantastic and I love the comfort  of the rooms. I found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. 
I like staying here for work sand for pleasure. Anything I needed, the staff was happy to help. For me, the Omni Berkshire is the perfect hotel to stay at.

title: nice, mostly affordable hotel
text: the omni hotels are a good chain, I find.  nothing overly luxurious, but they have solid, no-nonsense comfort.  and if you join their loyalty program, you can pick up some nice perks with each stay - free wifi, free coffee in the morning, or a free drink in the bar at night, a shoeshine, maybe get your clothes pressed, and so on.  the Berkshire Place was a nice, very centrally located hotel in midtown.  our rate was, with a loyalty discount, just under 200 a night, which for New York ain't bad at all.  the bar was loud and crowded, but the drinks were good.  didn't try the food.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location.  Very good service.  Lobby is attractive and up to date.  Rooms are very nice and also up to date.  Bed is very comfortable. Bathrooms also in great condition and clean. Great for business and pleasure. I highly recommend it.

title: The Heart of the World
text: It is a great hotel in the heart of the world. At Omni, you can find all you need from a businness hotel and be close of the main attractions.  The city pulses and the hotel trumbles. The hotel has a great service, frindly people a a good infraestrucute.

title: Lovely stay.
text: The Omni provided a great little oasis in the midst of bustling midtown. It was the perfect little getaway for our Valentine's staycation. The staff were all incredibly pleasant and helpful, especially the breakfast manager (get the breakfast package if you can!). Be sure to check out the 17th floor roof deck with some classic NYC views. We will be back!

title: great hotel
text:
really nice hotel. From the doorman  onwards everone is so friendly and polite. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable, and you never have to wait long for the lift !
The location is great for all the popular New York sights.

title: Excellent Location
text: Excellent location and Facilities. Large rooms for NYC. Very good service and housekeeping. Bob's is a good amenity very strong drinks at bar. Walkable to many retailers, restaurants, Central Park, Rockefeller Center.

title: Mostly good stay though beware of "resort fee"
text:
I wanted to stay in mid-town to go see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child for my birthday.  Rooms were typically high, but there were some decent deals to be had on the unnamed hotel bargain sites which is where I made my booking for a very reasonable rate.

Upon arrival after an early-morning flight, I was very happy that my room was available for early check-in.  The elevators looked old but moved quite well.  The hallways seemed a bit dated, but also seemed clean.  The room itself was a king bed, next to the ice room, overlooking the AC unit in the middle of the building.  The room consisted of a king bed, desk, nightstand, lamp, chair, TV, and closet with safe along with a standard bathroom.  The desk had a bit of wear but otherwise seemed clean.  The rest of the room also felt clean and I applaud the house-keeping team.  The bathroom was decent sized, though there was a white floor rug that couldn't really fit in the room without getting bunched up under the shutting door.

Being a room on the inside rather than on the street, I didn't really have many noise complaints.  Except for the person occasionally hacking in the next room, noise was not an issue.  On the final night of our stay, there was an occasional overwhelming smell of pot smoke in our hallway and creeping into our room, but it did not linger for long.

Location was pretty good.  There were plenty of good cafes and restaurants in the area as well as a drug store the next block over for snack and drink items.  The theater district was very walkable, though the subway was also convenient.

Upon check-in, I was advised that there would be a $75 hold on my card.  I was not advised that there would be a $25/day resort fee that would be charged, nor was I advised as to what amenities that resort fee opened up for me.  I suppose I used the internet, but I was otherwise disappointed at the "value" granted by these fees.  At least at other hotels in Manhattan with a resort fee I've stayed at, some "store credit" was given for the on-site cafe or restaurant or, at the very least, was told about the charge and was provided a list of things the charge included.  I was not even told about the charge upon check-out ... I was waved out with the staff member noted I had prepaid.  I'm assuming the $57 charge on my credit card includes even more tax on the resort fee since I have yet to see a receipt.

Note: This hotel does allow dogs.  This was not a big issue for me, though there were some delinquent pet owners during my stay that I observed letting their dog poop in the lobby.  Not quite a classy welcome home.  Perhaps part of the resort fee is dog doo removal.

title: Good Location but....
text:
I can't fault the location of this hotel, minutes from Central Park and a short walk to the Rockerfella Centre and Times Square, so that is a massive plus point.
HOWEVER because of it's central location, there is ALOT of traffic noise, throughout the night, so take earplugs!
Also NO tea making facilities in the room, and I know America are not into Tea like us Brits, but when I sent for Room Service for a 'pot' of tea, I got a tray with a tiny cup and saucer and 1 tea bag for the unbelievable cost of $15 plus tip! it's the most expensive cup of tea I've had in my life and I could have bought over 1000 teabags for a similar price, ridiculous!
The hotel itself has nothing going on, no bar or communal area or other facilities where you could make a hot drink or a Coffee. The one restaurant on site is a Steak Bar where you can get a beer and a glass of red wine for a mere $30! We had breakfast in a cafe around the corner, where interestingly we bumped into half of the other hotel guests.
Finally there is a $25 Amenity fee charge 'PER DAY' allegedly to cover the costs of the 'hotel facilities' interesting, as there were none that we found, and we certainly didn't use any. We were told at 'check out' that this was supposed to cover the cost of the WiFi yet when we tried to connect we were warned of a further $14.99 fee, so didn't bother. So being charged an extra $75 Dollars felt very unfair.
I'd love to tell you the staff were great too, but as we hardly interacted with any of them, I cant. Also Hotel sent us to the Airport in an unlicensed cab, think it was one of the Bell Boys 'mates'! 
So all this makes it sound as though we were unhappy, but overall the Hotel was fine, it just lacked soul, and very simple things like the ability to make yourself a cup of tea! it all felt very much as though their priority was to 'take your money', rather than 'look after their guests'

title: A great stay
text: Great location, very professional attention to detail. Made our anniversary stay specialn by surprising us with champagne and chocolate covered stawberries. Complimentary coffee brought to the room in the morning. Had a great dinner at the adjacent Bob's Steak House. Just a perfect place to stay. 5 stars.

title: Excellent choice
text: We stay at the Omni in NYC several times a year. It is a manageable walk to the theater district and close to shops, restaurants, and subways.  The staff is excellent.  The rooms are small, but I would say medium-sized by NYC standards.  Very quiet and clean. I highly recommend it.

title: Take away the poor service & it would be great!
text:
A fantastic central location, 2 mins walk from 5th Ave & close to Times Square, Rockefeller, Grand Central, Madison Square Gdns etc! 

Recently decorated rooms, good size, great storage, comfortable beds & with good housekeeping. 
A quiet hotel for NYC & reasonable nightly rates for the city. 

Front office staff did their job but were unfriendly and very matter of fact! If I managed this hotel I’d be giving them all lessons in customer service because they pretty much all lacked anything beyond the basics of their roles; A shame because it could be superb! 

Tip: Avoid Bob’s for breakfast, it’s good but ridiculously expensive! (c.$100 for 2xegg dishes, 2 tea, 2 OJ) Head to the Rockefeller centre for plenty of breakfast options on the go!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Podría parecer no muy moderno, y en algunas habitaciones hasta medio descuidado, pero nunca me ha decepcionado. Siempre limpio y von buen servicio y se han remodelado ya la mayoría de los cuartos. La ubicación es inmejorable! El restaurante del lobby tiene buena comida y un agradable ambiente.

title: World Class Service - Excellent Location
text:
I have been staying at the Omni Berkshire Hotel for several years and it is always a wonderful experience. Apart from its elegant atmosphere and well appointed rooms, what brings me back to this hotel is it’s excellent and professional staff. Many of the same friendly faces have greeted me for years, and throughout the hotel - from the front desk, the bell stand, the gym, housekeeping and the loyalty ambassador - one is greeted by a friendly professionalism characterized by taking that additional step that is always appreciated by this often weary traveler.

The Omni Berkshire’s excellent location also makes it a great home away from home for both business and pleasure. Being very close to the MoMA, shopping districts, and my favorite restaurant in Manhattan, La Grenouille, which is just a few doors down, I always find some time for pleasure even on the busiest of trips.

To the consummate professionals of this wonderful institution - I thank you once again for all you do!

title: Buena estadia
text:
Llegamos al hotel por la mañana, mandamos un mail para avisar y confirmar nuestra estadía. Así y todo nuestra habitación no estaba lista, entendible porque el check in es más tarde. El señor del desk front fue medio seco. Sabiendo que hablábamos español no nos hablo y él sabía hablar español. Nos dijo que pasemos a la hora, pasamos y no estaba aún lista. En fin se ve que después se olvido de avisarnos y finalmente al acercarnos ya estaba lista. 
Sacamos una habitación premier con dos camas, las camas no son muy grandes. La habitación normal, prolija y cómoda. Nosotros siempre que fuimos a NY nos alojamos en el Waldorf Astoria en las Torres, y este hotel es mucho más chico. Muy prolijo limpio, la limpieza es muy buena. Teníamos dos placares, no había cajones. Una heladerita vacía lo cual es genial para guardar bebidas y yogures para nuestra hija. El baño cómodo, limpio, elegante y con todo lo necesario. La habitación contaba con un escritorio y un sillón para descansar. 
Fuimos para navidad y el hotel estaba todo adornado y incluso había un santa para hacerle el pedido de regalo. En el lobby que no es muy grande pero cómodo hay agua saborizada para servirse. Lindo detalle. El hotel muy bien ubicado. Recomiendo el hotel. No se si volvería estoy esperando la inauguración del WA.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Stayed here in February 2019 for 5 nights, 2 adults, 1 child. 
Can highly recommend this hotel. 
It is CLEAN, 
SPACIOUS (we we're a little apprehensive of hotels in New York, many getting the reputation of being the size of a shoebox - not this one!) Great room, plenty space.
HELPFUL friendly staff and 
GREAT LOCATION.
Thanks for a great stay.

title: Newyork en amoureux
text:
Très bel établissement, chambre spacieuse et service irréprochable.
Il manque une cafetière dans la  chambre.
Très bien situé pour visiter NewYork.
Belle vue sur une partie de la cathédrale St Patrick.

title: Un bel hôtel, emplacement idéal
text:
Super emplacement, proche métro, 5ème Avenue.
Chambre qui donne sur l'arrière de l'hôtel donc au calme :) 
Sympa la terrasse du 17ème étage avec vue sur St Patrick.
Concierge très sympa qui donne des supers adresses ( église Gospel)

title: Super hôtel
text: Nous avons séjournés 6 nuits à l’hotel Omni place. C’est un super hôtel très bien situé. Proche du métro qui vous amène direct de l’aeroport ligne E (32$ la semaine) (Après avoir pris le Air train 5$). L hôtel est proche de central park et de Time square tout ce fait facilement à pied. Hôtel propre et calme (nous étions côté cours) le lit est immense et très confortable. D’apres moi il manque quand même un frigo dans la chambre et des peignoirs de douche. Le personnel de chambre est très discret. Le personnel de l’accueil très accueillant mais ne parle pas français. Conciergerie disponible avec magazine pour touriste et carte de la ville à disposition. A l’entre il y un portier qui peut même vous appeler un taxi. Il y a un restaurant/bar mais nous n’y avons pas été. Pour le petit déjeuner vaut mieux éviter d’aller en face c’est hyper chere.  Si l’occasion se présente je retournerai sans hésiter dans cet hôtel.

title: Not what it used to be
text:
The Omni used to be a great hotel, perfectly located midtown Manhattan, ideal for business trips and shopping alike. Nothing too fancy but all the essentials were there. 

It has now been stripped down. No more minibar, no more shower gel, no more tea or coffee machine in the rooms. A coffee at the bar now costs $15 (double espresso) and there is no vending machine so get your water from the Duane read before heading to your room. 

In addition they charge a $25 “resort fee”, so don’t get fooled by the low internet rate and find another place to stay.

title: Overnight stay
text: Our stay was good but for the price of the room we wish it atleast had a mini fridge and or a microwave. The room was very clean and the front desk staff was very friendly. The are was conveniently located.

title: Disgusting rooms
text: On the service it's a beautiful hotel.  Pull back the sheets and mattress pads and all you have is hair, hair and more hair.  In addition, the actual mattress had a large blood stain which appeared to be overlooked for some time. Absolutely disgusting.  They did agree to comp my 2 day stay but as a relatively prominent hotel you'd think things of this nature world not be an issue. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Beware it's not worth it.

title: Quick staycation
text: Such a great overnight at the Omni Berkshire —-perfectly located in midtown near 5th Avenue, St Pats, Rockefeller Center, et al.... It’s midtown Manhattan, so the rooms aren’t large— but they are super clean, and the staff is super friendly. I would definitely recommend staying here! 😊

title: VERY NICE PEOPLE THERE TO MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A GREAT TIME
text: Just stayed at the OMNI Berkshire Place for 3 nights. I am a frequent visitor of NYC. I always stay a few nights in a hotel and a few nights with my friends who live there. This time we picked the OMNI. Booked a standard room via BA and the deal was pretty good. Emailed the concierge a few days before my arrival to let them know it was my wedding anniversary. I always do so if I am traveling o my anniversary. When we arrived the hotel manager on duty upgraded my room to a very large and very nice suite with living room - sofas - two huge TV's - great bedroom in a very quiet part of the hotel on floor 10. the hotel is a 4.5 star hotel as far as BA is concerned , some say it is a 4 star and some other say it is a 5 star but for me they were amazing. just the type of place where you want to stay when you want a quiet yet cool hotel with great and spacious rooms exceptional members of staff and a very friendly attitude. with regards to the rest, yes,  the hotel was not build yesterday therefore some areas might need a new leak of paint but who cares - what counts for me is the way they make you feel and they made me feel very special and looked after. Thanks again guys.

title: Localização excelente
text: Hotel elegante com quartos amplos , boa cama e o melhor localização excepcional , principalmente na época natalina pq as lojas da 5 av ficam todas ornamentadas. O unico senão é o consierge que deixei uma encomenda pra ser entregue e não foi entregue por não saber onde foi colocado, só dois depois encontrei. Mas super recomendo

title: Great location - everything else is just ok
text:
Given the reviews of the Omni, I thought it would be a more impressive experience. I had also read that it was a good for folks traveling with kids, but there was nothing that was particularly kid friendly. The hotel was fine - it was clean and the room, while small, was typical for New York. 

I had paid a bit more to get a higher room (10th floor or above) but they put us at the bare minimum (10th floor), which was not high enough to avoid the traffic noise bouncing between the buildings. So it was really really loud at night and it kept waking us up. Every motorcycle and truck roared by the window. NYC is loud but I haven’t had as much of an issue at other NYC hotels. 

The ventilation system also rattled a lot in our room. Instead of white noise it was like one of those toy vacuum machines that pops as it goes along. I tried to set the thermostat so that it would put out as little air as possible. 

The service was nondescript - nothing horrible but no one was particularly nice or went above and beyond for anything. 

I had read that the hotel had great “turndown service.” When we didn’t get it, I called and asked for it (mostly out of curiosity) and was told it had to be specifically requested. So I requested it. We still didn’t get turndown service. I gave up. 

The location, though, was fantastic for tourist activities. That is a definite plus!! 

I don’t think I would stay again, if I can find another option hotel in the area. But I wouldn’t actively avoid it either.

title: Mitigé
text:
Bon emplacement, proche de Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller center, 5eme avenue, Cathédrale St Patrick.

Chambre "premier" au 16eme étage très spacieuse et très propre.

Le hall d'entrée n'est en revanche pas très accueillant. Manque vraiment un espace bar / salon pour apporter un peu de chaleur.

Point noir concerne la restauration : petit déjeuner en room service à éviter : très cher pour du jus d'orange non pressé et des viennoiseries sèches.
Restaurant Bob steakhouse à éviter également : salade en sachet, mozzarella qui n'en est pas...

Erreur de facturation sur la note le jour du depart, qui nous a finalement été remboursée après de nombreux mail et appels.

title: Habitación muy cómoda!
text:
Nos hospedamos con mi novio para vísperas de año nuevo. La habitación que nos dieron era muy cómoda, acogedora y bastante espaciosa. El baño también era lo bastante grande y bien equipado. La limpieza muy bien. La vista no era buena, teníamos prácticamente la pared de otro edificio frente a la ventana (estábamos en el 8vo. piso), pero tampoco fue algo que nos condicione. Lo que me sorprendió fue que cobraran un cargo extra de U$15 diarios por el uso de wifi, el cual no utilicé, habiendo wifi gratis en todos lados, incluso saliendo a la calle ya tenías señal. Me parece que es un servicio que a estas alturas, ya debería estar incluido.
Por todo lo demás, quedamos muy satisfechos.

title: Great weekend!
text: I took my daughter for my 40th birthday and we had an amazing trip! Can’t wait to go back! Location was perfect. Service was great. Close to shopping, restaurants and of course the American Girl store.

title: Great experience
text: Only negative and a very small one at that  was no refrigerator or microwave in room craved some popcorn after a awesome day in the city! Room was great the service was outstanding and location is perfect to walk to all major attractions.

title: Perfect hotel in prime location
text:
We stayed at this hotel for a week. Absolutely worth it.
The hotel is on the 52nd street, between Madison Avenue and 5th Avenue, perfect location, yet not in the middle of the busy crowded streets. 
The staff are very friendly.  Concierge are very helpful and recommend few coffee shops and restaurants steps from the hotel which turned out to be really good.   
I strongly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there next time I am in New York

title: 3 visits in Last 4 years
text: My wife and I have been coming to New York for the last few years for our birthdays. Our prefered place to stay is the Omni Berkshire Place. We are always treated like VIPs. The rooms are great and extremely comfortable.

title: Unbelievable stay at the Omni Berkshire
text: I love staying at the Omni Berkshire. My needs are simple. Give me a room that is clean and comfortable and I would be happy but the main reason I like the Omni is because of the wonderful service and excellent staff. You see the same faces every time you stay at the hotel. If management did not take care of their employees there would be more turnover.

title: Awesome hotel
text: Excellent hotel - clean, very comfortable and great location for all the downtown attractions in NYC. Staff were super-friendly and efficient, and very welcoming. Absolutely wonderful stay. Couldn't fault a single thing.

title: Hits the Spot
text: As a business traveler, the Omni Berkshire hits the spot for what I want in a hotel. They are not trying to be too trendy with dog bowls in the lobby, etc. Check-in and check-out easy and professional. Guest room clean and well appointed. Wifi works well and stays connected. Coffee service to your door in the morning, and I even got a newspaper. (Remember when you always got newspapers?) Plus this is a great location for doing business in Midtown Manhattan. Also, this hotel is not overrun with tourists, mostly business people.

title: Great family weekend
text: Excellent service, convenient midtown location. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and well maintained. They handled everything we needed promptly. We would definitely stay here again. Great stay!

title: Another great stay
text: My husband and I had another great stay at Omni Berkshire place in NYC. Our room was great and service was excellent. Just one thing to note. You can grab breakfast at bob’s next door, which you can access inside the hotel. Our breakfast for 2 was $86.00 before tip!! Please do not waste your money. The breakfast was not good and you are also charged an 18% “service” and are expected to then provide gratuity.

title: Business Trip
text: Great for business or leisure travel.  Location is excellent for business in midtown, museums, Central Park work-outs, and shopping if you have time.   Amenities at Bob's are great.   All staff are courteous and professional

title: Upscale, Clean, Quiet, Great location
text: Stayed over the Thanksgiving weekend. This was our 1st trip to NYC and stayed with another couple from CT. I purchased the rooms via PL. As with many hotels on PL, you get what you pay for. So I wasn't expecting too much. But to my surprise, OBP NYC is a very nice hotel. The first impression, the lobby, isn't that opulent nor spacious but it's modern and bright. We arrived early so we were able to quickly check our bags and go out for late lunch. The check in process was quick and the staff was friendly, nice. And when we need cabs, the guys always helped us get them. Our room faced the street so we had a nice view and the room seemed recently updated. It was tastefully done, very clean. Nice big closets to hang our coats and shirts. The bathroom was spacious and bright. We expected a small room but our 2 double bed, premier room was good sized, bigger than I expected given what I've heard about for NYC and older hotel. Please don't associate "older" has a negative. Yes, the hotel has been here for a long time but you wouldn't know it too much from the inside. We didn't eat at the restaurant but we did have afternoon drinks at the bar. When we were there, it was lively and the bartenders were all very friendly and helped me pick a beer. Patrons were very friendly and talkative, just felt very comfortable there which I wasn't expecting given the stereotype I had about NYC. The location is great which is one of the reasons I picked this hotel. There's a Starbucks just a couple blocks away and other places to eat breakfast/lunch within a block or two. There's a pharmacy a block away for basic things you might need. And the subway stop is like a block and half away, do down and there's a Dunkin' Donuts.  I could go on and on, but trust me OBP is a very nice hotel. It's not going to wow you when you step into the building but it is upscale, clean, quiet and in a great location.

title: Absolute Perfection
text:
My wife and I spent the weekend in NYC early in January and stayed at The Omni Berkshire for the first time. Needless to say it wont be the last. From the moment we were greeted by the doorman the experience could not have been better. Fast, friendly, check in process and we were given a beautiful room on the 20th floor. It was huge by New York standards and so very quiet, plus the amenities were great. The entire staff should be commended on their professionalism, friendliness and he;helpfulness.

The Friday night we arrived we were both exhausted and asked the concierge for a neighborhood Italian restaurant close by that he would recommend. He directed us to an amazing locals restaurant about 5 blocks away that was fantastic. A nightcap in Bobs Chop House made for a perfect evening.

If you are going to NYC you can not find a better location nor a better experience. I would highly recommend the Omni Berkshire. We look forward to our return from Texas. Thank you to the entire staff

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel excelente por tudo que oferece
Os quartos com 2 camas espaçosas, banheiro todo em mármore e o serviço espetacular
A localização é fantástica na 52th street ; os funcionários sempre solícitos e simpáticos
Fico aqui sempre que venho a NYC
Café da manhã de excelente qualidade

title: Watch out for additional charges!
text: The hotel is located in a perfect place, close to everything midtown. The hotel itself is starting to look old and the rooms are a bit smaller and not as clean as other hotels nearby in NYC. I was disappointed that they added several charges when we upgraded to a larger room. They explained some charges when we checked in but during check out they had added other things. I would prefer if they had explained everything up front. There is no coffee in the room, which is terribly inconvenient and the shop across from them has coffee but not very good. We were up super early jetlag and found it was terrible not to be able to get a hot drink anywhere that early.

title: Centre of NY
text: Hotel is situated in prime position with Times Square just around the corner and good shopping stores. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and beds are comfy. Would highly recommend staying her.

title: Our favorite New York Hotel
text: We have stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place multiple times over the years.  We love the intimacy of this smaller hotel, its fabulous location within walking distance of culture and dining (as well as shopping), its tastefully decorated rooms, and the well sound proofed rooms.  But most of all we value the gracious and welcoming staff, for whom nothing ever seems too much trouble. This is a special place!

title: Exceeds Expectations
text: We are repeat guests (10+ years) of The Omni Berkshire Property.  The Location is idyllic!  Walking distance to all the attractions that bring us to NY during the Holiday Season:  Rockefeller, Central Park, Theatre District to name a few.Service, Staff, Rooms & Amenities are unsurpassed.Come with dreams, leave with memories.

title: Excellent stay, even better location
text:
The hotel is conveniently located so that lots of the main attractions such as the Rockefeller centre, radio city hall, Central Park and Times Square are all within a 10 minute walk which makes it an excellent base for exploring the centre.
The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. WiFi is available for free in the rooms if you join the Omni loyalty program, which only takes a few minutes so is well worth doing.
Overall we had an excellent stay and will definitely be staying here again if we visit New York again.

title: Great Position, Great Place
text:
We were really please to have stayed at this hotel, the position of it just off 5th Avenue just couldn't be better. You are literally a few minutes walk to the Rockerfeller Centre, all the shops, Trump Tower and only about a 10 minute walk to Central Park. Also, the subway is only a few minutes walk too so everything in New York was so easy to get to.

In addition, I must praise the staff - when we arrived, which was about 5pm after a flight from Manchester, our room wasn't ready. Now it would have been easy to just tell us to wait but instead we were taken into their bar and given free drinks and starters and made to feel very welcome whilst our room was finished. You have no idea how these small things make such a difference because all you actually want to do is get to the room. We really enjoyed ourselves there and with two teenagers with us who were tired and hungry it was perfect.

Also if you join their membership, which we did you get free coffee / tea in the morning which was a great start to the day. Of note, there is a great cafe opposite which is open early and worth nipping over to for breakfast take out / snacks/ cooked meals / drinks etc.

Room service was good and the conscierge helpul.

Overall a lovely hotel with helpful staff all round. Would definately recommend and would definately go back.

A big thank you to them for helping make our holiday as good as it was.

title: Impeccable Experience
text: Stayed here for a business trip. Best service I have received at a hotel yet. The staff members make it a point to get to know you by name, everything is personalized, excellent customer service, excellent food (including room service - have to try the bread pudding!), felt at home. Will do everything in my power to only stay at this property if ever in NY and refer to anyone I know!

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: Just stayed here and enjoyed it.  For the price and the location, was pretty nice.  Great location near Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue, easy walk to subways.  Rooms were a good size for NYC and fit my family (3 children) well.  We appreciated the kids activity bags and cookies that were delivered to our room - also the concierge was a great help in finding restaurants nearby that would work for both adults and children.  Only a couple of negatives - we were on the 5th floor and there was a good bit of noise late into the night.  Also, the lobby is fine, but not very big and not one of the exciting NYC lobbies where it can be fun to spend time.  It would be nice to have coffee and a minifridge in the room.  But for the price and location, and because the staff was very nice, we were satisfied.

title: Very good place
text: Effective, discreet. Very good location to go to Central Park, MoMA, Rockefeller, Guggenheim, for shopping, even a Santa Claus in the lobby, only flaw outdoor brightness may be better to the upper floors

title: Fantastic Location
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire for our first ever trip to New York and I really don’t think we could have stayed in a better location. The room was great and the staff friendly and helpful. Our only niggle and perhaps this is how it’s done in the US; no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

title: Very comfortable room
text: Very comfortable room, well lighted and quiet from traffic noise.  Friendly, Efficient staff Great Location by Rockefeller Center and Moma.  Omni Club gets extras like in room morning coffee and newspaper

title: Good location Bad service  better options available. Resort fees costs 50% more than advertsed rate with fees and taxss
text: Good location for tourist but poor servic and they charge a $25 per day resort fee without telliing you. This IS NOT A RESORT NO GOLF, NO POOL  GYM IS A PATHETIC TINY ROOM. When I asked them what I got for the cbarge the answer was a `free` newspaper the they walked away.

title: Great place for a NYC stay!
text: Great location, great room and great staff! We have stayed before and as a Select Guest, we received coffee at our door - very nice touch! easy access to buses on Madison and Fifth or E train. Have already recommended to others

title: Fantastic option, pleasantly surprised by our stay!
text:
Stayed on 1/1-1/2, a little staycation. Our goal: shop, catch a museum exhibition and have an elevated dining experience. Normally I'm more of a downtown NYC person but in retrospect this midtown location worked out perfectly. Why? Because on 1/1 most shopping is closed but hey not in Midtown! Literally right across from Rockefeller Plaza with all those associated shops, 7 min walk from Saks and right at the part of Madison Ave that begins the shopping options. Most major fine dining restaurants were also open.

Property itself: considering it's an old building I really like how the rooms are decorated. Tasteful, clean and classic. Doesn't feel old, musty or like you've been condemned to live in an old person's house. Even the bathroom is comfortably spacious, with enough counter space to be useful. Nice long desk that was about the width of the room so plenty of space for that too. Thoughtful touch: corkscrew along with the requisite ice bucket, tongs and glasses. Noise level was more from the hallway, can't complain about the noise from the street. Lobby is functional so not a huge lounging space but who cares, it does what it needs to do. Check-in was smooth, although the promised text message on when my room would be ready never arrived.

Overall, fantastic for what it is and the location is easily the best part of it.

title: Best Family Vacation Ever!
text: Our family has gone to NYC many times, but our recent visit was the best ever thanks in large part to our experience at the Omni Berkshire. The location was perfect. Close enough to everything but insulated from the noise at night. Rooms were beautiful and service was among the best we've ever experienced. Staff  at every level responded to any and all requests with with the kind of "my pleasure" attitude that you can only dream of!

title: Central location
text: Great location.  Just over a block from St. Patrick’s cathedral.  Friendly staff.  Clean room, comfy beds, good sized bathroom.  Small lobby, 2 elevators.  1 restaurant/steakhouse on site with limited menu.  But you have a lot of food option if you walk outside!  10 minute walk to grand central.

title: Perfect stay
text: This is my fourth trip to NYC and we normally stay at some very nice hotels on Central Park south,but I liked the look of the omni so had a change. I cannot fault this hotel on anything, all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful,there entire hotel is spotless and the location is just right.Our room was a very good size,with big comfortable bed,the bathroom was also very nice with a great shower. There is a great bar/restaurant joined to the hotel that was great a little pricey but that’s how it is in New York.

title: Mixed review
text: Some members of staff were extremely polite and helpful but others not . The double beds were very small more like a large single. The rooms however were very clean and the food in the restaurant was fab , if a little pricey.

title: Adequate
text:
I stayed here for a week with friends and family 15th-22nd December.

The location is excellent which is primary positive about this hotel. Central Park, Times Square, Empire State and Rockefeller are all close by. Amenities such as a deli, Duane Reade mini market and subway station are all close by.

The hotel is older and to some degree this character is part of the hotels appeal however some aspects are run down. We had to change room as the bathroom mirror was cracked in half on arrival. Dealt with efficiently however I am unsure how this escaped the attention of the cleaners, last thing you need after an early flight with children. Our second room had expanding foam visible where the wardrobe had cracked, when showering the water didn't drain until the shower was turned off.

The rooms were clean and a decent size, with comfy beds,no tea/coffee facilities was an inconvenience.

When I arrived home I found that I had been mistakenly charged $80 for valet parking (I did not have a car) and this has been dealt with quickly.

Overall I was happy with the price I paid for the location, the actual hotel was ok. Being honest I was slightly disappointed given the reviews, I do consider myself to be a person with reasonable expectations.

I have stayed in NYC before at a comparable hotel near Grand Central and found that hotel far better than the omni in terms of decor and facilities.

title: Christmas Visit
text: We stayed here 2 years ago and remember it being much nicer. Of course we chose it for the proximity to the attractions such as NBC, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller center,...etc..but even Red Roof inn gives you a mini fridge and complimentary coffee! The room was sufficient but not spectacular and the pillows we're worn and thin. No vending....it was substandard for the price.

title: Decent stay
text:
Stayed there for 6 nights.

Location is quite good in midst of manhattan with cafes around to get you to get coffee and snacks

Checkin was smooth and i had booked the room from previous day as was checking in  very early in  morning

Room was average with all basic things taken care of except refrigerator or fridge where i could have kept some water juice or coke.

Room service was prompt and i ordered for laundry which was quick and very effcient even though price on higher side

Cleaning was done regularly with no issues

Overall satisfied with stay because of location which was close to my office

title: One of the best hotel experiences ever
text: What an amazing hotel. The staff across the board, from bellmen/doormen to desk staff to concierge to housekeeping to room service... I can't even begin to cite people, everyone we encountered was warm and genuine and ready to help with anything. The rooms are beautiful and so comfy. Same for the bathroom. "The W" or "The Hudson" this is not, so if you want weird modern tiny rooms go somewhere else. But if you want to be taken care of in classic NYC style, this is the place. A great location as well. And yet another shout out for the staff. You will not find a better staff at any hotel. As good, maybe... but never better. Thanks to all of you!

title: 5 star once again!
text:
This was my second visit to this hotel. This year with my husband to celebrate our 30th Wedding anniversary before flying on to Mexico.
I love the location of the hotel it’s absolutely perfect. Our room was lovely and clean and a good size. The hotel is immaculate. The staff were always lovely and friendly, breakfast was pricey but always top notch, so well worth it. 
We were also given a lovely card with wine and cheese and crackers to celebrate our anniversary. It was such a nice touch and very much appreciated. 
We will be back next December to our favourite city and will stay at the Omni Berkshire without hesitation.

title: Comfortable and great location
text:
Not a bad hotel for NYC. A good location just off 5th Avenue and a short walk from Central Park. 

Room are above average for New York, clean and comfortable. Staff throughout are friendly and helpful. 

We stayed just before Thanksgiving and prices were very reasonable.

title: Definition of average
text: There is absolutely nothing more than average about this hotel other than the price of the rooms which are expensive for the quality. Very touristy hotel with bus groups, small lobby, outdated  and worn out furniture, stained bed linens and mediocre to poor service. Upon check in they gave me keys to a room. When I went the key didn’t work. I returned to the lobby and said it didn’t work and that it sounded like there could be someone inside. They checked and said it’s vacant and sent me back and it still didn’t work. They then sent me with security to open the door at which point a woman who had been sleeping opened the door in her bathrobe. It’s fine if you need a place to stay and the bed is very comfortable but other than this there is nothing to recommend this hotel.

title: Heading in the Wrong Direction
text:
We checked into a suite (Room 1519) and found out it was right next to the elevator which you could hear every time it moved. In addition, the couch in the sitting room was absolutely filthy with stains and a grimy sheen to it. When we downgraded our room to get a cleaner room away from the elevator, they were unable to supply an additional chair to comfortably sit in our room. However, there were intermittent cable TV outages which made relaxing a little difficult. Also, they have instituted several policies at this property which I do not believe benefit the customer. 

First, they have removed all mini-bars and refrigerators which means you can't bring any leftovers back to the room or chill a bottle of water or wine. Second, they no longer allow you to review your charges from your room as you go along so that if you see an issue you can't address it immediately. Instead, they send you an e-mail before you check out which means standing in line with the crowd to resolve a questionable item which could have been settled in advance of checkout. The restaurant is ridiculously overpriced even in NY and they automatically add 18% for a gratuity regardless of party size or quality of service. 

Then, after we had checked out, I received a call telling me my bags were still in the room long after we had left the hotel (obviously a function of their poor room assignment process.) This is a hotel which is definitely heading in the wrong direction and is out of touch with the needs of their customers.

I understand it was December and the hotel was very busy but the policy choices and

title: Perfect location, friendly staff, great stay
text: Thanks to the wonderful staff, from the friendly, tireless doorman to front desk eager to help, and concierge staff always ready with useful information. Great stay. Location is superb, near the high end stores on Fifth Avenue, the Park, and great dining.

title: Christmas 2018
text: Love the Staff.Work staff is very personable and professional.Santa is fantastic.Rooms are getting run down.Rugs are worn in places.Getting a car in and out was a mess.Jelly beans are classic.Room quality is declining.

title: Christmas Spirit is Alive at the Omni Berkshire!!
text: My wife and I and another couple just enjoyed another wonderful stay at the Omni Berkshire! Although we love the Ritz and Four Seasons - when in NYC we always stay at the Omni Berkshire Hotel! Starting at the top with the Managing Director David Chase, and Loyalty Ambassador Cindy Fong, everyone that works at this hotel truly goes out of their way to treat their guests like family! Their warm hospitality is what makes staying here during the Christmas season so enjoyable. If you want a hotel where the people that work there truly care about their guests - in the best location in the city - look no further!

title: Good hotel in great location
text:
This is a very traditional hotel - not a modern skyscraper being brick built and about 18 storeys Hugh which is small for New York.

Very welcoming doormen but unfortunately the reception staff I dealt with were very mediocre.

The room was a Berkshire Suite which was well presented and perfectly comfortable- all it lacked was a mini bar.

The heating was bus the air conditioning which was noisy in the bedroom so we relied on the lounge heater to heat the whole room which it did.

On the location everything is fairly close - Rockefeller’s was less than 5 min, Central Park, Broadway and a Time Square were 15 minutes on foot.

9/11 memorial was about 30 min by metro so also easily accessed.

Cabs were difficult to get so you’re better ordering an Uber.

Hotel was happy to store luggage for the day after check out.

All good really...

title: STAY AWAY!!!
text:
Very dissatisfying experience. The staff I had contact with was beyond rude.

I was accused of smoking and will be charged a cleaning fee. I DO NOT SMOKE!!!     

They proceed to say the whole floor smells and have to deploy Ionizers to clean the air. 

I HAVE NEVER EXPERIENCED SUCH A MISTREATMENT OF A CUSTOMER.

I feel sorry for non New Yorkers having to stay here. 

STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

PS. TV's are outdated, Remote wouldn't let me change channels.

title: Best Location in NYC
text:
We did a pre-Thanksgiving vacation to NYC, A wonderful time to go with Christmas 🎄 decorations up in the city and before the weather turns very cold. 
You can’t find a better location in NYC. Just a block over to 5th Avenue and on Madison Ave with lots of trendy shops. 
The hotel is the right size to give a personal touch to its guests. The room and bathroom were a very comfortable size, and the bed and bedding were excellent. 
No question we will be back.

title: Great location
text: Great location for exploring midtown by foot. Easy access to subways to explore Manhattan (and even Brooklyn). 7 city blocks to Central Park, 5 blocks to Time Sq and just off 5th Ave. A typical Omni in terms of quality. Staff very friendly. All positive

title: Winter Vacation
text: Fantastic Hotel and staff. The hotel is in mid-town Manhattan and close to everything. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and quiet. The value is very good for the excellent service received.

title: New York with the family to celebrate a family reunion
text:
We stayed at the Omni because it was a family weekend.  It took 75 minutes to get to the hotel from LGA.   WE CHANGED ROOMS BECAUSE WE NEEDED TWO ROOMS WITH ADJACENT DOORS TO ACCOMMODATE four adults and one baby. I had phoned to request the rooms two times previous to our arrival and even asked when We were checking in, but ended up with two rooms far away from each other.  I spoke to the manager and We ended up in room 1425 and 1427.  We cancelled the crib as we brought our own but they did deliver a crib Any way.  
The manager was an excellent asset and made our room change easy. The staff from the doorman, room service, cleaning staff and front desk were excellent.  
You cannot beat the Omni Select member perks.  We received newspapers, drinks coffee orange juice, and we ordered room service twice and found the service excellent and delicious.  The room is small we were on a deluxe king and the bathroom small too.  There was lots of room for our clothes and toiletries.  Room is in good condition.  There is no view at all just a courtyard of buildings. 
 The check in area is old style cosy and the elevators are not too quick.  The fitness room had water and apples and equipment was good.  There are windows.  No bathrooms.  THAT was surprising.    
Overall we found the Omni gave us good value for our room.  We would definitely return.  
Location was good for shopping walking museums and restaurants. Not ideal for a weekend of Broadway.  About a 45 minute walk to times square. 
We had a great weekend.

title: Christmas in NYC.
text: The hotel is centrally located and within easy walking distance to many sites.  The staff is courteous and helpful all the time.  This is our yearly visit to NYC and the Omni is our choice always for our holiday excursion.

title: Staff is so nice
text: Not the newest hotel but awesome staff and you cannot beat the location for exploring Manhattan.  It’s really close to the Rockefeller center stuff and also a block from the subway to easily get up or down town.  Santa was visiting in the morning and we had a nice chat!

title: Great hidden hotel in Midtown
text: This hotel in Midtown Manhattan has an excellent location adjacent to Rockefeller Center close to time square in right off of Madison Avenue with easy access to Central Park for jogging, this hotel is ideal for any visit to Midtown. The rooms are very nicely furnished with great amenities for Midtown at a very competitive price point. The staff is accommodating and generally very friendly.

title: Omni Berkshire Place A Perfect 10- Location & Service
text: An Amazing stay at the NY Omni Berkshire.  Staff and service was impeccable.  My family and I felt like we were treated like royalty.    The hotel is in the perfect location, a block away from all of the holiday action (Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave lights, and short walk to Time Square & Broadway).  A Special Thanks to Cindy the loyalty ambassador, who went above and beyond to may my 2 boy's first trip into the city a special and memorable one.  I have never been to a hotel chain that has provided this level of server, care and will go out of their way to ensure you have a great experience.   Thank you-

title: Perfect
text:
For a short trip to NYC this hotel is ideal. Great location, excellent staff and good facilities. Plenty of restaurant near by as is 5th avenue MOMA and otrher major attractions.
The perfect end to a two week vacation

title: Room Upgrade was highlight of visit to NYC
text: We were upgraded to the Penthouse Suite without asking and were amazed at how spacious and lovely everything was. Hotel is older, but has been modernized, so the rooms were stylish, well laid-out  and spotless. Very accommodating staff and an excellent restaurant, which you don't always find inside a hotel.  Definitely will be returning.

title: Conventional with high standards
text: I’m at the Omni at least once a year for a board meeting. The quality of both individual room and support for the group gathering is uniformly high. There’s nothing startling about it - and who wants to be startled by their hotel? It fades into the background, but it is a comfortable, friendly, high-quality background.

title: Christmas in NYC
text:
Good stay. Nothing extraordinary.

Location:
My husband and I stayed here due to its close proximity to the Rockefeller center, 5th Ave, subway and in general bigger rooms compared to time square.

Service: To be honest we would give 2 stars if it weren’t for the bell men outside that were so friendly and offered nice small talk. During Check-in we weren’t greeted, asked about our flights, if we had questions about location. It was straight to the point- Name if reservation, confirmation of checkout, we need a card for incidentals, here’s your key. I don’t know if this is typical NYC behavior but we were unimpressed. During check out we were hauling our 2 large luggage’s out the door and again their were 2 men greeting in the lobby in which they didn’t even open the first set of doors the bellmen outside were the only ones to open the second set of doors. So rude. 

Room/Amenities: Our room was always kept tidy and theirs your basic necessities of a 4-star- toiletries, blow dryer, safe, 1 robe for two people?, ironing board, channel assortment, etc. nothing impressive for your standard Felix king room.

For our next NYC stay we will definitely try somewhere else. Although their were no major issues we definitely enjoy a more welcoming environment with friendlier more helpful staff. We have definitely stayed at better 4-star hotels.

title: Excellent 5 day stay
text:
Everything about this place was great, location, food, staff, and accommodation. First time I New York and the hotel seemed to be a max 10 minute walk from most things that we wanted to visit. 
Will be back, thank you!

title: Disappointing stay
text:
My family and I stayed here for three nights this summer and had a disappointing experience. I had held off writing this review at corporate's request while they were looking into my issue, but they never got back to me so here goes.

It's clear that the Omni was once a great property but is now suffering from neglect. The property just feels old, and not in a sort of grand and charming way. The furniture is dated, the carpet is dirty, the wallpaper is scuffed, etc. Moreover, the staff had a miserable attitude when it came to mundane things like delivering toothbrush/toothpaste kits, making sure the crib was in the room (as ordered in advance) and fixing the TV (ours stopped working the last night for some reason, and despite repeated calls to fix it, no one from maintenance ever showed up). Finally, note that the hotel tacks on a $25 per night amenity fee at the very last minute. The fee was instituted just 1.5 months prior to our stay and purportedly covers WiFi, the gym, newspapers and access to the concierge (besides WiFi which is table stakes these days, all of the above was of course available free of charge 1.5 months prior). Most concerning regarding the fee is that it is not disclosed anywhere on the website (i.e. under terms/conditions, reservation FAQs, etc.) and is only sprung on you at checkout with no details provided depending on which channel you book under. I had reached out to the property to mention my dissatisfaction at the bait-and-switch, and when they were unresponsive I gave corporate a call. Apparently unresponsiveness runs in the family.

There are plenty of great hotels in midtown. No need to stay with these guys again.

title: Nice but small
text: Everything was beautiful my only complaint is that I purchased the same style room as someone else for the same price and my room was 1/3 of the size of theirs. Thankfully it was just 2 of us in the room and we didn’t need to stay there for an extended time.

title: Best hotel we have ever stayed at - ANYWHERE!
text:
Prior to arriving, i contacted the Omni Berkshire hotel to notify them that it was my partners 23rd birthday & that her mother had also been diagnosed with terminal cancer. I just wanted to make her birthday was that little bit special with a few requests. I recieved a reply from a wonderful lady called Cindy who assured me that she would take care of my requests. Not only did she do this, she exceeded my expectations and provided us with a level of hospitality i could only have ever dreamed of!! Every single night she sent up different gifts such as cheeseboards, bottle’s of champagne etc. The Wednesday was my partner Rebecca’s birthday and Cindy sent us up a bottle of Rose wine as requested, as well as a huge slice of red velvet cake and various other cake samples. My girlfriend was sobbing with joy, she couldn’t believe how special and welcome we were made to feel at Omni Berkshire. The level of service we recieved from all staff members was top notch, but Cindy stood out for us! 

As for the room - it was immaculate. Bathroom was big, shower was excellent as well as the bathtub. We had bottles of water prior to arrival waiting in the fridge, and the bed was enormous, could have slept 5!! We used the gym once as well and it was extremely clean and hi-tech. The hotel is in a prime location as well and is within walking distance to almost every tourist attraction that we went to, apart from the WTC & 9/11 Memorial. Absolutely ideal! 

We could not recommend the Omni Berkshire highly enough and the next time we’re back in NYC, it’s an absolute certainty we’ll be back to stay here. And once again a thanks to all staff who were brilliant - but also a SPECIAL THANKS once again to Cindy! It’s a trip we will never ever forget thanks to her :)

title: Central e de qualidade
text:
Hotel muito central mas em zona tranquila.
Quarto confortável ( falta mini-bar) Funcionários simpáticos e atenciosos.
Excelente relação qualidade/ preço para hotel desta categoria e localização.
Recomendo!!

title: Great Hotel!
text: Hotel is awesome, hotel restaurant not so much! The staff at the hotel were friendly and very accommodating. Location was perfect for the parade and sight seeing. walking distance to everything we were looking to visit.

title: Great Hotel
text: After hours sightseeing it was great to come back to a lovely quiet room with a bath for soaking tired feet  and beds to die for. Street noise from our room was minimal so we slept really well. I would definitely recommend this hotel for it’s comfort and location and would happily return. Housekeeping was also great.

title: Brian great but couldn’t fix all issues
text:
From overcharging $260 in hotel fees to waiting two hours for Thanksgiving dinner at their Chop House, this hotel was a disappointment. Between my two sisters and I, we paid for 18 nights so we spent a boatload of money and yet, really what did we get?  My room, though I paid the same as my sisters, was noticeably smaller than theirs. Even the door to the room was about 2/3s the size of a regular room. Turns out being on the end next to the stairs your room gets squeezed. When asked about this, I was told I had a deluxe room like my sisters but if I wanted to pay for a bigger room they had them. Point missed by rude front desk women. Just wanted the room I paid for and sisters got.  Even ordering a pay per view movie was met with “contact front desk” which we did and was followed by their confusion. 

There were a few bright spots. Brian and Jessica, Hotel Manager, fixed most issues, housekeeping was excellent and location unparalleled. 

But I’ve been to Nyc at least 12 times. I’ll find another hotel, less money and no overcharges next time.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We had a great time at the Omni. All the staff from the bellhop, valet, front desk and concierge were all so warm, gracious and kind.  They gave us tips on where to eat and best places to visit with maps. Rooms were a bit cramped for a family of 4 getting ready at the same time.

title: Wonderful NYC experience
text: This was by far the BEST NYC hotel experience I have ever had!  Everyone was warm and friendly and extremely accommodating.  The rooms were beautiful and amenities exceptional.  The value was extraordinary!  I will ONLY stay at this hotel when I visit NYC!!!

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Excellent hotel and location.Cindy, Loyalty Ambassador and the hotel manager, Brian were amazing! They both went out of their way to make my daughters birthday extra special. This is one of my favorite hotels to stay in. Thank you both for an amazing stay! Cant wait to come back!

title: Janice dornan
text: Just back from the omni had a great stay 4nights Patrick was fantastic with my wi fi issues had dinner also in hotel which was very good service was slow table booked for 7.30 dinner wasn't served till 8.10 santa on sat was good touch drinks in bar was lovely but not a lot of space tables were all full but just one of those things would go back as near the rockafeller

title: Super convenient
text: Nice room, good service and an extremely convenient location for strolling Fifth Avenue and visiting MOMA, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The walk through Central Park up to the Metropolitan Museum and the Frick Collection was long but easily doable while the nearby subway stop put us within an easy walk of the Whitney.

title: Price Switching
text:
I often stay at Omni hotels and average a week each year in them. I am a member of Omni Select Guest program and periodically attain "Platinum" status. 

When I called to make a reservation at the  Omni Berkshire in New York, I was quoted a price and was told that if I needed to add a third adult, an additional fee for a rollaway would be necessary. I said I would call back when I had a little more time. I did call back about an hour later and was told that though the original room was still available, if I wanted to have a rollaway, I would need to reserve a larger room, even though the original room was some 270 ft.² I explained that the sales associate with whom I had first spoken had told me that the original room would in fact accommodate a rollaway. To no avail, the second associate insisted I needed a larger room at a substantially higher price. Deeply disappointed by the Omni Berkshire's attempt to charge me more that had been agreed, I immediately booked a room in the same area with another major hotel chain where the room is larger and the costs transparent and consistent as well as lower. 

I hope sharing my experience will encourage the Omni Berkshire's management to adopt a fair and transparent pricing policy that is in keeping with the other properties in the otherwise excellent Omni chain.

title: old world elegance, wonderful service, perfect location
text: I am a frequent business traveler and always stay here when I am in the city. There are other trendier places, but the staff here is incredibly accomodating and always greet me with familiarity and warmth and make me feel like I have come home.  The bellmen know me by name, and the front desk staff always welcome me.  As great as the staff is, it is worth doing a special shout out to Bryan McManus.  Bryan  is one of the managers at the hotel and he always goes above and beyond the call of duty to treat me as a valued guest.  His and his staffs' professionalism, courtesy and excellent customer service keeps me coming back.

title: Good, but not perfect
text:
This was our third stay at the Omni Berkshire over the past few years.  First of all it's a great location.  It's also a nice hotel with helpful and friendly staff.  My complaints were minor, but enough to limit the review to four stars: 
1. The TV had no reception the first nght we were there.  I called the front desk and inquired about it and was told that the bad weather affected the reception.  The pay per view was available, but it cost $19.99 to watch a movie.  Management should have offered us the movie for free considering that there was no TV reception.
2. The noise of doors slamming all night long was a problem.  They need to put some sort of felt on the doors so they're not so loud everytime a guest comes and goes from their rooms.
3. There was no mini bar or refrigerator in the room.  Nothing if you're thirsty or want to munch on some over priced pretzels or candy.  
Otherwise, it was a good experience.

title: Staff is amazing
text: Ive been to a lot of hotels in NYC and by far the staff here are the most helpful and kind that I’ve seen. I would definitely stay here again! The room was fantastic and the roof top patio was also awesome. Fantastic location and delicious restaurant next door!! Can’t want for my next trip!!

title: Great location, great staff, great building
text: Think my family has been staying here (and no where else in NYC) for 13 or 14 years. The location is fantastic for tourists and for those who need Mid-Town. The staff is extremely professional. The guest rooms have high ceilings, large windows and are generally larger than the hotel rooms in the city. We are really thrilled with it. The only negative for us would be that the hotel restaurant does not offer as wide a menu as the previous restaurants there; it has gone more steak heavy. There are many other things to eat, but portions are huge and we'd love even broader choices. Quality of the food is very good.

title: Super Hotel
text: An extremely comfortable, and quiet hotel, in the centre of New York.  The staff are all extremely helpful and very pleasant.  The hotel is in an excellent location, so one can easily explore New York. Many of the main sights are within walking distance of the hotel.  It is a lovely hotel to come back to after a day of sightseeing.

title: Omni Berckshire Hotel
text: Centrally located; very good prices. Rooms are clean and functional. Staff is friendly and helpful. I have stayed at this hotel several times and has never been dissapointed.  In my opinion, the best feature is its location, close to Times Square, Central Park and many other interesting places within walking distance.

title: Perfect location for a short visit
text:
I stayed at this hotel on a quick weekend visit to NYC. I have stayed in many hotels around new york city and by far this has been the most ideal. Located right in between Madison and 5th avenue it was very convenient for everything . Shops, restaurants, pharmacy, salons, cafes and more were all walking distance to this hotel. Rockefeller center is also very close and St Patricks cathedral as well, all a few blocks from the hotel. 
The check in and check out processes were smooth, concierge services are efficient. Staff helped make restaurant reservations and bell staff equally efficient and very helpful. Front desk staff were also very helpful. 
The room was a very good size, very spacious, very well lit and comfortable and  clean bed. Housekeeping cleaning ladies  were very efficient. The room had an iron and safe but what was lacking was a mini bar and ref which is quite essential in hotel rooms. Hotel room rates were very reasonable. I will definitely stay here again next time i visit new york. I had a very pleasant and  comfortable stay. There is a very nice seating area at the lobby and a restaurant chop house on the ground floor .

title: Happy customer
text: Great hotel minutes walk from the Rockefeller Centre. Large room and bathroom with really comfortable beds. I slept really well despite being in the heart of it all. Would happily stay here again and recommend to others.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed for three days in November 2018 while in town for my eldest son's best friend's sister's quinceanera.  This hotel is well-appointed and the staff was very good.  Our interior room was superbly silent.  Location is great - a block or two to the subway.  We parked for three days at 136 E. 55th Street Garage instead of maybe $80 here a night for parking and that garage was very professional, about three or so blocks away, and it cost just $117 (!) so that is pretty good savings and this money we saved I spent on an excellent tour of Central Park, which I would also highly recommend.

title: Good location but otherwise nothing of note
text:
Great location on Madison, with a subway round the block.  Easy to get to all the popular places.  

Our king size room was in good condition but the plumbing in the en suite was old and noisy. We were on the 10th floor right in front of the elevators.  The noise from street level and loud people getting off the elevators meant getting a early good night's sleep (before 10 pm) was impossible.  I specifically requested a higher floor and a room away from the elevators in advance but that was obviously ignored.  At check in the receptionist was so cold, unwelcoming and unfriendly that after 15 hours of travelling I did not have the will to combat her rudeness with my usual charm.

The staff at the door, concierge, reception, ignored my daughter and I every time we walked past, every day, twice a day for 5 days!!  Anyone expecting over the top overly friendly American customer service will definitely not find it here, 

I complained via email and to reception that food had gone missing (uneaten, wrapped and fresh, clearly not rubbish).  It was ignored until check out when I gave them one final chance to look into my complaint before I escalated it.  After much shuffling and oh well, ummm and errrr, the duty manager offered generous reimbursement which I received today.  I'm grateful to the hotel for the compensation which was more than the cost of the food that went missing.

title: Anniversary trip
text:
We visited New York to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. 
We arrived to be told Mr Trump and the UN were in town so traffic was horrendous and everything was locked down around our hotel. 
Still, we managed to find it easily with the help from a lovely police officer.
Check in was fast, very pleasant receptionist staff.
Our room was very pleasant, no view ( which was a little disappointing), bed very comfortable.
No tea/coffee making facilities in the room.
There was some remedial works taking place in the ice room next to our room with trailing cables in the corridor but it wasn’t a problem.
The hotel very kindly sent us a bottle of fizz and some chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate our anniversary - very nice touch.
The restaurant that is attached to the hotel  is very smart but I have to say it was very expensive. We had breakfast there one morning and it cost about £65 for basically eggs and bacon, we didn’t go there again.
Overall an enjoyable stay with very pleasant staff.

title: Superb! Except for the bedding.
text: Exceptional staff on every level - from housekeeping to bell staff to front desk - everyone was so wonderful and courteous.  The location is absolutely perfect!  We walked back from our Broadway show and it was so great to be in walking distance from the theatre but not have to stay in Times Square.  The standard king room was very lovely and a nice size, however, I really, really disliked the mattress, the pillows, and the bedding which proved to be very disappointing and not like bedding I have experienced at other Omni hotels.  The mattress was really hard.  The pillows were very saggy, and the "comforter" was so, so thin!   I loved everything about the hotel except for the bed, which was a bummer.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Good location, very elegant hotel, great service. Quiet street, close to St Patrick's cathedral, Rockefeller center and Radio city music hall.  Great doorman that were very helpful.  Rooms were nice and good bathrooms as well.

title: great hotel
text: Our visit began with the upgrading of the room for my birthday. We booked a classic room and got a suite on the 20th floor which was very quiet even though it turned to the busy street.The suite was very spacious with a very comfortable bed and excellent cleaning services.The service of the hotel staff was courteous and efficient. The hotel's restaurant was excellent with high-class food.The hotel's location is excellent: 52nd Street and 5th Avenue, opposite the very trendy restaurant "Fig & Olive" and opposite a great barber shop.At the end of our stay we received a late check-out without any fee.Highly recommended.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: I visit NYC usually once or twice a year and have stayed at numerous hotels throughout Manhattan. I will have to say that the Omni was in an amazing location and the rooms were spacious. I have been at several other hotels that are the same price where the rooms are very cramped. The hotel isn't the cheapest but it's hard to find a good quality hotel for a decent price in NYC depending on the time of the year anyways. We were steps from all the shops as well as Rockefeller square. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent stay& location
text: Excellent stay &locationDefinetely will return and revisitQuality inroomdiningFriendly staffProximity toneverywhereConcierge wuite helfullInteresting choice of restaurantGood pricingSpacious rooms

title: Family visit to New York City
text:
Completed on promise to take daughter ( Hannah 17yo) & son(Connor 14yo) to the States with my Wife Helen ( age withheld ) or Ill be in trouble
We had a wonderful time based at the Omni Berkshire Place. Hotel great (only our double beds were a little small) otherwise faultless.
Staff particularly the concierge service could not have been more helpful and actually seemed delighted to help with any queries. Everyone to doorman through to cleaning staff very polite and helpful
Location fantastic allowing us to walk to so many of the sights so we were able to fill our days nicely and back to our place on 52 Street
Brilliant trip - Brilliant Hotel
Thanks

title: Stay at Omni Hotel, NYC
text: The hotel has the feeling of a boutique, more intimate hotel, rather than the larger mega hotels in NYC.  Our room size was a good size fro NYC, where the rooms are usually tiny.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, from the house staff, to the front desk , as well as Lenny, the doorman. The bathrooms were adequate, but very clean.  The nightly turndown service was an added plus. The location of the hotel was centrally located, within walking distance to MOMA and Rockefeller Center.  Overall, enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

title: Great location and service
text: Great location. We walked about 10 miles during our 1.5 day stay in NYC. Close to so many shops and restaurants. We had a city view room on the 4th floor and the city noise did my bother us. King size bed was super comfortable. Room was small but clean and we slept well. Omni provides complimentary beverages in the morning delivered to your room. Doorman was super helpful and hailed cabs for us when we decided to use them.

title: Darkest hotel room I've ever stayed in
text: The hotel's location is perfect, and it is very clean (the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean.) The gym is well-equipped, and has water and fruit for guests. Now, the room was the darkest room I've ever stayed in... I travel to New York almost 10 times a year, and have stayed in many different hotels, and I was appalled at how poorly-lit the room was. So much so that I didn't feel like going back to the room during the daytime. It was truly depressing. Also, some of the furniture in the room had visible signs of wear (like the desk). Other than that, the hotel is very good by NY standards (considering the location, cleaning, facilities, and courteous staff).

title: Excellent location
text: The hotel is very comfortable and with an excellent location. The service is good and the amenities also ok. It’s not cheap but for the place is at a regular range. It’s in walking distance from the theaters and 1 block from the MoMA.

title: Disappointed with Decor
text: I had high expectations for the Omni Berskshire based on my stay at the Omni King Edward in Toronto. I would  stay here again. The lobby is beautiful but that’s where the fabulosity stops! The rooms are dark and small. However the rooms are clean!  The front desk staff were very efficient and professional. The Omni has an ideal location for midtown shopping and museums. Also the on-site restaurant had good food and ambiance!

title: Not Impressive
text: Upon arrival it didnt look like the pictures. Its a hard was to spend $400/500 bucks a night! It could ise a good refresh.  The hallway on our floor was dusty and needed vacuuming.  The bed slept well.  The TV was old and blurry.

title: Great Location for Theater and Shopping - Pricey
text: Loved the location for a quick NYC visit.  Convienent for Theater and shopping.   The staff were great across the board.  Recommendations were good.  It would be so nice if they could include some bottled water, especially for guests checking in as they do in Europe!  Especially at these prices!  Thankfully there is a deli across the street.   The room was nice and the bed was comfortable.  The bath is older, but functionable.  My biggest issue was no outlet in or near the bath or the mirror, which was in the entry....Very difficult to style your hair.  I had to try to style it blindly and then go check it out....Not sure I would stay again just for this reason.  No views.

title: Nice rooms - but that's all
text: This hotel has a very cramped lobby and only one bar called 'Bob's Chop House' (so you're not sure the first night if it is a bar or just a restaurant.  The rooms are excellent, but the limited space for guests downstairs in the lobby is a problem.  Also, the 'Chop House' seemed to have very patronizing staff, was very expensive and food that wasn't great.  My solution was a great 24/7 diner across the street that did tasty but very cheaply priced food. So, in conclusion, great location and great rooms, but that's all...

title: Not as nice as Hyatt Andaz
text: Decent hotel, expensive room service. Rooms average size at best. Nice staff. Has Bob's Steak house from Dallas inside hotel. It is better than some hotels in city, like hyatt grand central, Hampton inns, Hilton garden inns, but not as nice as Marriott Marquis, Hyatt Andaz (my favorite in town). Rooms not soundproof, can hear adjacent rooms. Views from rooms not good.

title: Great Location
text: My wife and I were in the city celebrating her birthday. We had theater tickets so wanted a hotel near broadway. The Omni fit the bill. The rooms are large but basic. The location and staff make the hotel. We had a slight problem with the heat which was corrected immediately. The room was clean with plenty of towels and toiletries. The concierge was great with directions and suggestions for food. I would recommend the Omni for anyone wanting to stay near the theater district.

title: excellent service
text: The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are descent. It would be nice if they had more useable pillows on the bed.
