I never feel comfortable using hotel throw pillows so by the time you took those off, there were only 2 pillows. The service was fantastic. They were quick to answer the phone and respond to my requests.

title: Comfortable stay in excellent location
text: Very clean and comfortable hotel, nothing amazing just clean, tidy and it is the location that really sells it. 5 minutes walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station, Central Park and The Top of the Rock. No fridge or coffee/tea making facilities in the room which is disappointing especially as this part of Manhattan has very few actual food shops to buy water etc.Staff were pleasant and helpful, I would go back on the grounds of its location but if you do go make sure you take snacks and water into room.

title: Hotel is in dire need of update
text: These rooms have no been through a proper remodel since 1990’s if I had to take a guess. First room was a suite but the bedroom was touching the elevator bank. Next room was a room that had a terrace, but was such odd room layout, not much on the walls felt bare and old. Terrace was nice but when it is 40 out, no going out there. Was a wet spot of water (I think) on the carpet that was from a drip on the ceiling. Listed tbs as a Chanel they have but they don’t and I wanted to watch mlb playoffs and then couldn’t. They told me to go to the bar....so I could give them more money. Would have been appropriate for them to offer a drink at the bar during the game. Other Omni like Nashville and Phoenix are fantastic but this one in NYC really let me down. An update Hilton garden inn or four points by Sheraton would have been much better.

title: Fav hotel in NYC!
text: This is my third visit to the Omni Berkshire Place and I will always stay here if I can.  It’s a perfect location!  Easy walk to Rockefeller, theatre district, Central Park, subway, etc.  The staff is efficient, helpful and friendly.  Rooms are nice.  Highly recommended!

title: Very good but not great!
text: Location is great and service was very good!  I am the highest level of Loyalty with a couple other brands and thought I would try Omni. A few adjustments and this property could be GREAT. No water available to even purchase in my room? I was charged for breakfast a reasonable amount but not explained this at check in. I spent the same elsewhere but would have had breakfast there. Dinner was great!  Everyone else I encountered was a 10!

title: Schickes 4* Hotel in optimaler Lage
text:
Das Omni Berkshire Place befindet sich in Manhattan in direkter Nähe zum Central Park, Times Square und Broadway.
Viele weitere Sehenswürdigkeiten sind fußläufig erreichbar.

Zimmer: 4/5
Die Zimmer sind sauber und besitzen eine gute Größe ähnlich wie das Badezimmer.
Die Zimmer sind mit TV (inklusive PayTV), Safe und Bügeleisen ausgestattet.
Zudem befindet sich ein Kühlschrank zur freien Nutzung im Zimmer.
Die innenliegenden Zimmer erhalten kaum Tageslicht.

Verpflegung: -/5
Keine Verpflegung gebucht. Das Hotel besitzt jedoch ein Steak-Restaurant im gehobenen Preissegment.

Service: 5/5
Der Service ist sehr hilfsbereit und freundlich. Die Rezeption ist 24h erreichbar. 

Ausstattung: 4/5
Das Hotel besitzt eine Hotelbar und Restaurant. WLAN ist gratis und auf den Zimmern verfügbar (gute Signalstärke). 

Lage: 5/5
Die Lage des Hotels ist optimal für Touristen, die New York erkunden möchten. Auch die Anbindung an den Flughafen JFK via öffentlicher Verkehrsmittel ist in Ordnung (ca. 40-60min).

Fazit:
Sehr schönes 4**** Hotel im Herzen von Manhattan, in direkter Nähe zu den Sehenswürdigkeiten der Stadt.

title: Great mid town location and staff
text: Staff were lovely. Location was perfect if 5th Avenue, Central Park and Times Square and ESB are on your list, and it’s right next to the blue subway line to get you straight to battery park with no changes for SoL ferries. Recommendations for local food were ok, not great. Breakfast was expensive so go across to road to Isadora’s cafe for awesome food in a locals cafe. Hotel could do with a sauna. Rooms were a good size, v comfy beds and feather pillows, and clean. They had an iron and board but for some reason no kettle to make hot drinks which was a bit poor, you had to ring room service to bring you one up (it is FOC though, but just a bit of hassle after a busy day). Rooms at the back overlooked the air con fans so no view...it’s NYC so it’s noisy so take ear plugs. Over all I would recommend and would stay here again.

title: Customer sevices
text: I'm a long time Omni member, my first time at Berkshire NY and probably my last, we booked for 3 nights and from day one we can't have tv in our room, every time we ask/call we were told someone from thier tv specialist group will look at it......even when i present my self at the front desk the customer service representative never look at me.....probably because i was not wearing suit and tie.......we never been offered to switch room until day two but even then according with manager on duty there was not a good thing to do......they offer us breakfast......

title: A Good Choice
text: This was definitely a good choice for us considering where our activities planned were located. Easy to walk to 30 Rock, Times Square, Broadway, and surrounded by multiple great chocolate shops! Room was clean, the curtains were thick and blocked out light well, and the staff was helpful. I wouldn't say this is a "hip" hotel, but a good choice for most travelers.

title: Absolutely Fabulous
text:
We have just returned home from a six night stay at the hotel.  It was absolutely fabulous.  There is nothing more you need from a hotel than what they offer.  The rooms are huge, comfortable, beautiful decor, large bathrooms with lots of amenities.  Bobs restaurant was lovely, the food was fab, the staff are lovely and the general atmosphere was always friendly.

The hotel concierge go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need, help with restaaurants, directions, ideas and shopping.

The Omni Berkshire made our holiday very special with so many fond memories, thank you.

title: Very good stay
text:
Two adults and two teens stayed in a double. Rooms were up to date and nice. We had free drinks in the morning and a welcome package when we arrived. The hotel is within walking distance to very good shopping and luxury items 

Stayed in the 6th floor across from elevator.

title: Great Hotel
text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Berkshire and loved it. We enjoyed a 4-day weekend in NYC with friends and this location was perfect. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our rooms were very comfortable and I loved the character of the hotel. We would definitely recommend and will stay again on our next visit. There is a convenient restaurant/deli across the street for coffee, water, etc., But it would be nice if there were coffee pots and water bottles available in the rooms.

title: 21st birthday present
text:
When we arrived myself and my son, had no warm welcoming after arriving at 10pm from the airport coming from London. Bad mannered at reception - didn’t even tell us our room number, no hot beverages supplied in our room, so you couldn’t even make a-cup of tea. 
Clean, good location for theatre land, Central Park.

title: Always a Plesure
text:
Third time stay during annual visit to NYC.  As always the staff was professional and accommodating.  One of the easiest hotel check in’s we encounter, year after year.  Have to open with a very gracious thank you for the celebratory champagne and chocolate strawberries in honor of our anniversary.  The suite was very clean, amenities well stocked and an air conditioning system that actually cools to the set temperature.  After being out all day and caught in a late evening post nap time crunch for restaurants closing, the Concierge recommended a great little pub we had never noticed before a block over which saved the evening.  Morning room service was spot on time every day.  Each visit has been better than the last.  The only amenity we did not understand was the lack of in room fridge with beverage options.  Make a run or bring snacks and adult beverages if you plan on having a nightcap in your room.  Price point for location and room type is a good value compared to many other hotels in the area.  
Will be back again soon.

title: Lovely hotel in fantastic location
text: We have just spent 5 nights at the Omni Berkshire. I spent ages researching our choice of hotel before travelling and we weren’t disappointed. This was our first time in New York and we booked the trip to celebrate a special birthday and meet up with friends from California who we had not seen for a long time. We took a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel which was easy and relatively cheap. On arrival check in was easy and the receptionist was very friendly. The room was a premier double and was very comfortable and a reasonable size. The bathroom was well appointed, the shower was good and there were  good quality toiletries available. We went out to a nearby restaurant to eat and on our return there was a lovely birthday cake, bottle of sparkling wine and handwritten card in the room  - a very thoughtful and much appreciated gesture. The bed was very comfy and we slept really well indeed. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room but this is quite standard in better class US hotels apparently. If you join the loyalty scheme I think you can get free hot drinks delivered to the room but this is not available on your first stay if you book through Expedia, as we did. There is a deli across the road which serves every type of breakfast and other food that you can imagine at very cheap prices - it may not be the most glamorous place to sit and eat at, but the food is really very good, especially at around $4 for a breakfast muffin. There are also a number of coffee shops very close by including Gregory’s which is a great NY coffee shop - we very quickly became Gregulars !!! The hotel is in a fantastic location for exploring the city- there are two subway stops in close proximity to the front entrance. Negotiating the subway system is easy and a great way to get around and see the sights. We enjoyed sitting on the decked area on the 17th floor of the hotel in the evenings with a bottle of wine from the local store - there are ice buckets in the rooms and an ice machine on the 17th floor. There is also a small gym on the 17th floor which doesn’t seem to be used that often by guests. We didn’t eat at the restaurant at the hotel, as for us the prices were prohibitive and because we also prefer to explore restaurants outside of the hotel. Despite being in a very central location and within walking distance of some of the major city attractions, the hotel was very quiet and peaceful and has a touch of old world charm that is often lacking in many establishments. Everything and everywhere was immaculately clean and all of the staff that we met were very friendly and helpful. I think the hotel would definitely benefit from a bar area (away from the restaurant) where guests could sit and have a drink at the start or end of an evening, but this is a minor point. We are very particular about where we book and stay when on holiday  - I can honestly say that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Omni, have no criticisms to make and would recommend the hotel to anyone. We would like to return to NYC to explore the city further and would have no hesitation in returning. Thank you Omni for making our first stay so great !!

title: We were in the city for a wedding. We were thrilled by the service and pleasant staff at the hotel, all from
text:
I chose a lower floor room as i think its much easier and less waiting for elevators. Our room was terrific! lots of space, great bed. 
I loved the restaurant for breakfast, very good, and again, great service.
Key - location! its fantastic for all things mid town.

title: Excellent Hotel to explore NY
text: It was great stay with OMNI in NY. Excellent service and room cleanliness. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My family enjoyed the stay and I would highly recommend for anyone who wants luxury experience in city.

title: Perfect hotel, Great location
text: This is a great hotel in the perfect location. Close to everything (attractions, nightlife) but also the subways for easy access to other options (Statue of Liberty, 9-11 Memorial). The hotel is well maintained and clean. The staff is professional, helpful and efficient. They could be a little more outgoing and friendly (but we found this at most places in New York). We didn't find a lot of hotel amenities (like coffee easily available). It would be a BIG PLUS if they offered coffee in the mornings. They probably had it at their restaurant but I'm not sure and the restaurant was very pricey. Alfredo, the server at Bob's, though was amazing (and extremely friendly and funny).

title: Great Weekend NYC Hotel Option
text: Omni Berkshire should be on your short-list of hotel options for NYC. They did everything right.  Great and spacious room at a reasonable price. (for NYC that is...) wonderful service from everyone we encountered.

title: Perfect!
text: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is very centrally located to be  able to walk around for shopping, theater,subway access, etc.  it was very clean, the beds were very comfortable.  Omni never disappoints!

title: Fun in NYC
text: The hotel was very nice and in a good location for us. Service was good.  The only problem was not the hotel's fault. The UN was in session and streets shut down periodically making getting places impossible except by walking. Avoid that week! No coffee maker or mini bar in rooms.  If you are a Select Guest coffee will be delivered to you.

title: Another excellent stay at the Omni
text: Continues to be my preferred hotel in NYC. Consistently delivers great service Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable and clean, location is perfect for me. Overall would highly recommend the Omni

title: Nice traditional hotel in New York
text: Traditional rather than modern hotel in New York. Great service and decent food in Bob's steak house which is part of the hotel. Amazing barman called Robert (is the steakhouse named after him?) who talks you into having bread and butter with your food, which turns out to be a small cottage loaf !

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Easy walking distance to anywhere you want to go to in NYC.  Unfortunately I was there when Trump was at the UN among all the UN attendees.  Police presence like I've never seen, 1000's of police etc.  so don't go when UN in session.

Be sure to join their loyalty program, free internet and free coffee in the morning.  Great room, comfortable beds, great toiletries and great bathroom.  Can't find a bad word to say about anything at Omni.

title: Great location!
text: We stayed.in the perfect location for a family with young kids.  We walked everywhere and were conveniently located to Central Park, midtown, the upper east side, etc.  Really nice, safe block and hotel is clean and accommodating!

title: Home away from home
text: I have been staying at the Omni Berkshire since 2001.  But even If its your first time you will notice the warmth when you arrive.  There are so many great people here. Yumi and Sarge will great you.  Mary will find you the best restaurant or tour.  And don’t miss the Iconic Robert in the bar.  There are so many great service individuals that make this boutique hotel special.  Enjoy this incredible location and meet your newest friends !

title: Una desilusión
text:
Primera vez en este hotel.  Por lejos el hotel más caro que he pagado en NYC (antes estuve en el Essex House y en el Lotte Palace) y este costando el doble que los otros dos resultó ser el peor.

Me asignaron una suite al lado de los ascensores por lo que el ruido de estos al subir y bajar se escuchaba constantemente.

Además, la suite solo contaba con dos cajones para guardar mi ropa y no tenía frigobar ni calentador de agua.

La ubicación es excelente pero se puede obtener algo igual o similar por mucho menos dinero.  De verdad no vale la pena este lugar.

title: Great Hotel
text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  Great staff, service, food and beverage.  Room rates are very  competitive also. You can't go wrong with this hotel.  Bob's Steakhouse is one of the best restaurants in the city.

title: Great experience at the Omni Berkshire Place in NYC.
text:
My wife and I were in town for a wedding and we stayed at the Omni Berkshire place hotel.  We booked directly with Omni. And since we had stayed with Omni before we were treated to complementary coffee each morning. 
The staff were all great from checking in to the house keepers.  No complaints at all. 
We really enjoyed the fitness center and the 17th floor outdoor terrace. Great view of the Saint Patrick's Cathedral from the terrace.
It was a great experience to be able to stay there while the United Nations was in session. We saw foreign diplomats in the Omni Berkshire place lobby.  That was exciting. 

The traffic gridlock was bad because NYPD, Secret Service and FBI have enhanced security measures in place for the 73rd session of the United Nations General Assembly, which began on Monday and runs through October 1. so allow for extra time getting anywhere in the city.

title: This hotel is a great ambassador for NYC
text:
As anyone that has traveled will know, the hotel you stay in while away from home can act as an ambassador or representative for the destination visited.

My wife and my recent and 1st visit to NYC to celebrate her birthday was made especially wonderful and memorable by our decision to stay in the Omni Berkshire Place Hotel.
We had initially chosen this hotel on account of its excellent central location. Connections with the major subway (Metro) lines are convenient and only a few blocks away. For example no transfers to other metro lines are needed to get to Broadway (4 stops on the A C E lines) or the MET and Guggenheim museums (4-5 stops on the 4 5 6 lines).
The MOMA and Rockefeller Center are also within an easy walking distance. Breakfast locations are directly across the street from the hotel entrance, or around the corner on Madison Avenue, among others.

While the hotel’s outstanding location is reason enough to stay here, the friendly reception and service we received from the staff made the hotel an excellent experience and as such a highlight of our special trip to NYC. The front desk staff went out of their way to accommodate our every need and upgraded us to two very nice, quiet and luxurious rooms. The second room was a little higher up and therefore experienced less traffic sounds (which we were not used to and was more than usual due to the UN General Assembly taking place). Thus, we had the rare and wonderful opportunity to stay in two different - and very nicely appointed - rooms on the 11th and 19th floors. A number of the front desk staff went out of their way to make our stay even more memorable by helping us celebrate my wife’s birthday with a very nice bottle of sparkling wine, a number of tasty amenity platters and even a hand-written welcome and Happy Birthday card. This is a very personable hotel and staff, who go out of their way for their guests. 

We really felt very privileged and special throughout or stay. As mentioned above, we attribute our fond memories and experiences to the extra efforts made on our behalf by the various staff members at the front desk and behind the scenes in the office. 

Perhaps not everyone will have a chance to experience this hotel the way we did, but I can only say that it will be remembered as a highlight of our visit to NYC. 

Therefore I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to make the best from their visit to this fascinating metropolitan city.

title: Great Hotel
text: What can I say? What a great hotel right in the heart of New York, from arriving to leaving we were treated to real American hospitality. Beverages delivered every morning, great room service very reasonable prices,beautiful room soft comfy beds .and most of all great friendly staff. Would we stay again definitely loved it . Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so special .

title: Waouh
text: Super experience dans sa globalité ! Le personnel est adorable à tout point de vue, la localisation est parfaite, proche du Rockfeller et de Central Park ! Je recommande 1000 fois cet hotel  où j'ai passé les meilleures nuit de ma vie, les lits sont vraiment très confortables. Je reviendrai sans hésiter.

title: Todo muy bien
text:
Tercera vez en este hotel (esta vez por 5 noches) y todo salio muy bien. 
Si tuviera que criticar algo seria que a veces es un poco caro con respecto a otros hoteles de su misma categoria.
Buen servicio y camas muy comodas.

title: excellent service with one caveat
text: We had booked a suite for one night to attend a Saturday 4pm NYC wedding. We had also requested early check-in which was normally at 3pm.  We arrived at 1:30pm and were told our room probably wouldn't be ready before 3pm.  The front desk person was a bit snarky.  We returned to the desk at 2:40pm - another more snarky front desk person - room not ready.  Finally, at 2:50pm, Brian (a manager?) came over and arranged for us to quickly get into an upgraded suite at no extra charge.  This was a smart, professional move.  We were grateful.  The room was terrific.

title: Überbucht - leider keine Alternative geboten
text: Wir sind angereist und haben beim Einchecken erfahren, dass das Hotel überbucht ist. Leider hat das niemanden interessiert und geholfen hat man uns auch nicht. Wir sind also auf der Strasse gestanden. Haben uns sehr auf den Aufenthalt in diesem Hotel gefreut - war ja nun leider ein Riesen Flop...

title: Terrible Experience
text: Booked this hotel for a 7 night stay via Expedia for a visit to New York for my son's 21st birthday present. Had a terrible terrible experience that left me so upset. Received an email less than 24hours before to say the hotel had cancelled our reservation due to a natural disaster in the area!  Immediately called the hotel who said that a problem with the Expedia computer system meant they were overbooked- this was despite the fact we had booked 5 months earlier! Offered zero help and redirected us to Expedia who said they would relocate us to another hotel for an additional cost of £750. They said the Omni Berkshire Place had cancelled the reservation as the UN delegation was staying there. My son called the hotel several times to ask for help as we were stranded in the US with nowhere to stay. They displayed an absolute lack of an empathy for our situation. The manager said he would speak to Expedia and call us back but never has. Book this hotel at your peril. A terrible way to treat ordinary people - shame on you Omni Berkshire.

title: Good Hotel
text:
Nice hotel, good location. Close to Fifth Avenue, walking distance to Broadway & Rockefeller Centre (for Top of the Rock viewing), Central Park, Times Square & subway station nearby.

Arrived about 8:30pm, one doorman/bellman on duty but he wasn’t really paying attention as we got out of the cab so we just made our own way in with our luggage & approached reception.  Checked in promptly & politely by a friendly guy. Allocated an ‘inwards facing’ room on the fifth floor, had read an earlier review regarding noise from the air condition equipment servicing all the rooms & located outside on the third floor level, so I asked if we could possibly have a room higher up. Appreciated an earlier warning that if you had not booked directly with the hotel, but via a ‘third party’ (eg travel agent) you were unlikely to be allocated an ‘outwards facing’ so didn’t bother to try for that as well.

No rooms available higher up so we decided to just be relieved we weren’t on the noisy third floor.  I should say “noisier” really, because I could see what the other review meant. The equipment outside (yes, roughly level with the third floor) is huge & IS noisy. I could hear a constant low hum from it even 2 floors higher!  I don’t sleep well in strange rooms & my hearing is very good so can’t really blame it for keeping me awake.

Reception directed us to the lifts, concierge desk is also located there & there’s a cold water unit & plastic cups so you can help yourself to a drink. Good small maps on the desk there to help you navigate round the midtown area & subway routes. Didn’t need the services of the concierges so can’t comment on that.

Invisible the whole time to the doorman/bellman but that was fine with us, wheeled cases we could easily manage on our own, which was just as well because he was busy doing nothing!

Easily found our room, no view to speak of apart from the windows of other rooms & this massive hotel servicing equipment a few floors below. To be honest we don’t spend time sitting in the room anyway, so we weren’t particularly bothered by no view which is just as well. Apparently there is a roof top seating area guests can use, but we didn’t bother to go up & find it.

Nice clean, tidy, well equipped, sizeable room. Bigger than I had been led to believe hotel rooms in New York are! Pleasantly surprised.

Plenty of mirrors, TV, tea/coffee making facility, a safe (now that was a bonus), hairdryer, iron & ironing board, dressing gowns/slippers, loads of storage space for clothing. King size bed, which we both found comfortable.  Air conditioning was working well, good job because it was in the high 80’s during our stay (& 92 degrees one day).

Well-equipped bathroom, though I couldn’t get their hairdryer to work from the sockets in it, fine with me, I just moved to the full length mirror instead, so no problem.  Good supply of bathroom products though they use soap, so no shower gel. Shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, cotton buds & some cotton wool pads.  Plenty of towels & face flannels.

Got very early morning wake up calls from banging doors. I had initially assumed that was inconsiderate, noisy, rude, guests arriving or leaving at the crack of dawn. But no, I discovered that a room close to ours appeared to be allocated to staff (changing into uniforms perhaps??), their coming & going was the door slamming.

Only used the hotel restaurant once for an evening meal. 1 beer, 1 cola, duck with jacket potato & veg, pork chops with fries & veg (though it came with smashed potato but I couldn’t be bothered to point out that wasn’t exactly what I’d ordered as it didn’t really matter), came to just over £100 (including the tip). OUCH!  Didn’t eat there again though not exactly because of the price, we found the service to be offhand, very offhand. We assume because there was only 2 of us & there were 2 or 3 tables of several people, so clearly the tip would be bigger from those.

Directly opposite the hotel is an eatery of some sort, cooked food served like a school canteen & sandwiches with an eating area upstairs. Probably a cheap place for a quick meal, didn’t use that either but it is worth investigating.  Apart from that place the hotel location isn’t necessarily great for just nipping out for a quick, inexpensive bite to eat. Chemist & supermarket nearby.

Asked early on if we could possibly have a later check-out than midday, got an extra hour free of charge with no problem. Decided not to pay for more & sat for a couple of hours on the comfy sofas in reception with a book & cold drinks from the supermarket. They have luggage storage if you want to utilise it & go out though.

We’d had a couple of more attentive doormen for a few days, but when we asked one if he could help get us a cab he said the guy outside would do that. No-one outside & clear he just couldn’t be asked, so we walked a few hundred yards to the corner of the street & hailed our own. I’ve seen compliments paid to doormen at the Omni on other reviews, so perhaps we were just unlucky during our 6 nights there.

I’ve deducted 1* from my rating due to lack of attention by waiter staff in the Omni restaurant & doormen/bellman.

Unfortunately getting a cab took over 30 minutes though, it was so hot people who might ordinarily walk to their destinations were using the cabs, so very busy.  Apparently the cabbies are not allowed to refuse a fare if they are available, trouble is when you are going to the airport  (with what is supposed to be a set charge), & blatently obvious because you’ve got suitcases, you may get the excuse we got when they are obliged to stop, “can’t go to the airport, I’m finishing in an hour”. So I suppose technically they can’t be accused of refusing to pick up a fare.

Do your research regarding yellow cab set charge for airport runs beforehand, & be crystal clear about roughly how much it should be. Know in advance, have the cash (include a tip) ready & just hand it over.

title: Everything's Great
text: Business Hotel with great service. We had a spacious room looking onto Madison Avenue.  The room was great - everything works, it's clean, it's comfortabe.... and that's what you want when you stay in NYC. Great staff.

title: regular at the Omni
text:
I stay regularly at the Omni, best price/quality relationship, and best location. 
Staff is VERY friendly and helpful. I fell like at home!
There is a subway entrance on the same block  (no need to cross the street), which is very helpful during winter when snow piles on the sidewalks!

title: Perfect.
text: A beautiful hotel with wonderful staff and a perfect location. Great shopping on Madison Ave and nice bars / restaurants near by. Easy to get around anywhere from here via subway or taxi. We decided to try the steakhouse attached to the hotel and the filet mignon was 10/10. They also allow you to purchase cocktails from there and take them up to the rooftop terrace. Would highly recommend and cannot wait to return.

title: One night stay, but oh so worth it
text: I love love LOVE the Omni and while this was my first visit to Omni Berkshire, they did not disappoint. It's great to know that a brand is trustworthy from west to east coast.  Used my experience for a free breakfast at Bob's... and it was awesome.  Planning on a girl's trip next fall and we will be staying at the Omni Berkshire.

title: TOP !
text: Hôtel extrêmement bien situé entre la 5ème et Madison Avenue. Les chambres sont très bien agencées. La literie et confortable et les nuits sont calmes. Excellent service. Restaurant de l’hôtel un peu cher mais sympa pour passer la soirée.

title: Great hotel perfect location
text: Stumbled upon the Omni Berkshire -  it’s a nice hotel in a great area. Clean rooms and bathrooms. I had the king size room which was a decent size for one or two persons.  My only issue would have been with the a/c which didn’t move the air as strong as I would’ve liked it. No street noise and I slept very soundly.

title: Comfortable room, great location.
text: Spent three days midtown and in the boroughs, and found it convenient to subway, trains and transportation. Also, a great selection of restaurants within one or two blocks. Even the most modest room is comfortable, fresh, and well appointed,

title: Mittelmäßig
text:
Lage sehr gut - sehr zentral.
Service schon an der Reception sehr holprig, nicht sonderlich freundlich, eher unterkühlt.
Concierge dagegen sehr hiflsbereit und freundlich.
Keine Kühlschränke oder Mini-Bar auf den Zimmern. Muss alles geordert werden oder rangeschleppt (Wasser). Wenigstens Wasser wäre schön auf den Zimmern ;-) .
Gott sei Dank war es nur eine Stippvisite. Für einen längeren Aufenthalt würden wir uns defintiv für andere Hotels entscheiden.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
This is a truly wonderful hotel. Fantastic location, just off 5th Avenue, walking distance to all of the landmarks in Midtown and beyond. Our room was super quiet with no traffic noise whatsoever. The bathroom was well-stocked and the dressing gowns were a nice touch. The best hotel bed I’ve ever slept in, with the comfiest pillow. 
The cafe across the road is very handy, but we would have liked a kettle in the room to make a cup of tea or coffee - that’s the only negative. 
We got engaged in the hotel room, so the Omni Berkshire Place will always hold a special place in our hearts! We wouldn’t hesitate to book this hotel again, it was absolutely perfect!

title: OMNI BERKSHIRE PLACE-  BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text:
The Omni Berkshire Place continues to be the best Hotel in New York city. I have stayed in many Luxury Hotels in New York City and I have found that the Omni Berkshire is the nicest of them all at affordable prices and in the greatest location!! I have stayed at the Omni many times in the past few years. My recent stay at the Omni in August was fantastic just like all the other times I have stayed at the Hotel....so I decided to write a review. To start, the location in Midtown is central to everything you would want to do and see. The Hotel is located in walking distance to Broadway, the best shopping and Central Park. One night we took the short walk to see a Broadway Show. We took the short walk to Central Park and to Rockefeller Center for lunch. The Hotel is only 2 blocks from the Subway for a quick ride Downtown (Subway fare only $2.75) to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy). The Omni is on Madison Avenue (the best shopping in the world) and only 1 block from 5th Avenue (also great shopping).
   Everyone at the Berkshire is so friendly and helpful.....from the moment you arrive including the Doormen (particularly Lenny), check-in personnel at the front desk and housekeeping staff. The recently renovated room was quiet, smoke-free, very spacious and EXTREMELY CLEAN!  The bed was so comfortable....I slept better at the Berkshire then in my own bed at home. The marble bathrooms are luxurious and are well equipped with everything you need (water pressue in the shower superb).
   I met the Manager of the Hotel in the Lobby (David Chase)....he was so nice to take time out to see how our stay was going. From the short conversation I had with David Chase, he appears to be very hands on at every level of the Hotel, personable and has done a remarkable job keeping up the high standards of the hotel.
   The new Restaurant at the Hotel is Bob's Steak and Chop House....nice for a great Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner. Bob's Bar is also nice for drinks with 2 huge big screen TV's.
   The Concierge desk was very helpful in giving us directions, making plans and getting us dinner reservations. Every type of food/restaurant is within walking distance of the Omni. I like Sarabeth's (Central Park South), Norma's and 40 Carats/Bloomingdales for Breakfast/Lunch/Brunch....all within walking distance. If you need theatre tickets, the Concierge will help you as well....we already had tickets to see "Dear Evan Hansen" (we loved it!).
   I can't recommend the Omni Berkshire Place enough. Everything about it is perfect. There are so  many hotels to choose from in new York City but this one stands out above the rest.  The Omni is so comforting and welcoming....it feels like a home away from home.

title: omni berkshire place NY
text: very old property felt like I was 30 years back...room very dirty, no perks inside room (coffee tea) no breakfast - good bed good location.  front desk at arrival no kind specially when I asked if breakfast was included - gym facility super tiny and packed, no acces with elevator had to use the stairs from 16th floor

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Fabulous hotel with a great bar and restaurant...serving everything ypu could want....lovely atmosphere
Very clean spacious and comfortable with a great location just off 5th avenue ....highly recommend and will definitely stay again!

title: Great stay at Omni Berkshire Place
text: This hotel was marvellous. They made my husbands birthday special by sending a cake and champagne to the room. Patrick at the front desk was so nice and easy to deal with. We found it in an ideal location and could walk almost everywhere we wanted to visit, the subway was only round the corner also. We will definitely visit again.

title: Great place
text: This is a very nice hotel in a great location, between Madison and 5th Avenue, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. It feels small and personal, the rooms are clean and comfortable and are pretty quiet, considering it’s in the middle of the city. I particularly like the bathrooms.

title: Excellent location
text: We recently stayed at the Omni for my husband's birthday/wedding anniversary trip.  The location was fantastic.  Close to the subway, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th Avenue, Central Park.  The king size bed was very comfortable.  There were subway maps on the counters.  There was fruit infused water near the elevators.  Though we did not have a view, the room was very quiet.  If we go to New York again, we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great spot in Manhattan
text: This location has easy access to great shopping and dining.  The subway is a short walk from the hotel.  We arrived very late after flying all day.  The front desk staff made our check in a breeze which I greatly appreciated at the late hour.  We loved the night view from the observation deck.  I would stay in this hotel again!

title: Clean, helpful and fantastic location in Manhattan
text: Our family of 4 stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place over Labor Day weekend.  Everyone at the hotel was a pleasure to deal with.  The concierge helped us figure out the best way to get down to the Freedom Tower in the financial district and all the way back up to the theater via subway, even with the trains running on a holiday schedule.  He saved us so much time!  The rooms were very nice and clean.  But possibly the best thing about this hotel is that it's only a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, the theater district and not too far from Central Park.  We were able to visit all of these places in one day!  We love the refreshing lemon water in the lobby.

title: Belle presta et emplacement top
text:
Prestations conformes aux annonces de l’hôtel. 
(Pas de petit dej sauf au resto accolé mais 30USD/pers ... aïe ! -pas testé-)
Chambre pour 4 spacieuse, literie confortable, différents choix d’oreillers (plumes, synthétiques...), grde SDB. 
Emplacement facile proche métro et CP :
Les bouches de métro sont à 5 min d’un côté moins de 10 de l’autre. 
Très proche de Central Park, parfait pour le jogging matinal.

title: Superb location
text: First visit to New York and couldn’t have picked a better hotel or location. Within easy reach of Times Square, Grand Central, Madison Ave, 5th Avenue and even MOMA was only 5 mins walk. Rooms were clean and ok in size. Roof terrace was lovely and quiet but too hot on a sunny day. Concierge was very helpful with tourist info and the best way to get to the places we were looking for. A metro card was our best purchase for traveling around.

title: Excellent value, location and staff.
text: Couldn't fault our stay here.  Attentive and friendly staff, and a great location.  Booked it as a "budget"option, but it certainly didn't feel as such.  We have never stayed in a hotle where the staff will come around and knock on the door in the evening with bottled water should we need it.  Also ... when checking in, the man next to me asked if there were fridges in the room.  He was told "No ... would you like me to send one up?".

title: Terrific Hotel in Manhattan
text: The Omni Berkshire hotel in midtown Manhattan is an excellent choice for any trip to New York.  The staff are all friendly, and welcome you warmly when you arrive.  The lobby area is beautiful, and there's never a wait for an elevator.  The rooms are always clean, and if there's anything you need, they can usually accommodate you.  I can't recommend this place enough - they take very good care of me every time.  The location is great too, you're between Times Square and Central Park, both an easy walk yet far enough away from the crowds and noise.  I think it's perfect!

title: Decent Hotel in Midtown
text:
Pros: 
1. Close to everything
2. Clean rooms
3. Comfy bed
4. Friday free mojito in lobby
5. If you are a select guest: free drinks in the morning, free bottles of water
6. Champagne and cake for my husbands bday
7. Cookies and chocolate milk for my little girl 

Cons:
1. Service at front desk could be friendlier 
2. Turn down service not consistent 
3. Room Service was too expensive
4. No lobby bar
5. No restroom in gym
6. Restaurant “Bobs” was sleepy and expensive, didn’t anyone under 60 in there.
7. Tv reception is bad
8. No floss in dental kit 

I would stay there again can’t beat the location.

title: NYC Weekend
text: Omni Berkshire is an excellent  Hotel in a great location I'll keep coming back. Will like to have an upgrade every now and then when available. Front desk staff is very nice. Door staff is great! the best staff!

title: Excellent hotel, friendly and most importantly clean.
text: Excellent hotel, friendly and most importantly clean. Stayed in the Madison suite where we had a turn down service every evening. Join the Hotels membership service and receive a complimentary drink every morning and free WiFi.

title: Great location!
text: The Omni is our favorite hotel in New York, centrally located near many major attractions, shopping and restaurants.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Also near central subway line and bus routes for easy travel to further points of interest.  On-site (Bob's) restaurant is very good.

title: Prima Hotel met vriendelijk personeel
text: We hadden een goed verblijf in het hotel, het personeel is heel vriendelijk en behulpzaam. De kamers zijn wat oudbollig maar prima in orde ik zou dit hotel zeker nogmaals bezoeken. Complimenten! De kamers werden goed onderhouden, ze hadden zelfs een verloop stekker omdat wij de onze vergeten waren. Bij de lift staat elke dag vers gekoeld water wat op warme dagen een uitkomst is.

title: Honeymoon
text:
We recently stayed her for 5 nights for our honeymoon. The location of this hotel is perfect and within short walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller. 

The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious comfy. We were a little disappointed that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the hotel room. We found it a bit odd, unless this isn't something that is standard in America??

There's so much around the hotel, there's a great cafe type diner across the road which has a good selection of food and drink if you are looking for a cheap place to eat.

Prior to our arrival I had been in contact with the hotel to ask for recommendations on some nice restaurants, they were so helpful and booked a table for us.

Overall this hotel is almost perfect, with the facility to make tea and coffee in the room it would have been perfect. I would definately recommend it to anyone planning a trip to New York.

title: August visit to NYC
text:
I enjoyed not only the hotel it’s self but also the staff I encountered daily. Bob’s was also a nice place to hang out and then eat at. Food and drink was excellent. 
The hotel is also located in a easy walk to almost all of the fun stuff in NYC.  I liked walking around and experiencing the electric atmosphere of the neighborhood.

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
Excellent stay at Omni Berkshire Hotel. Rooms are clean, tidy and the beds are so comfy.  All staff are friendly and helpful. 

The hotel is located in a good position, near to a subway station, 20 minutes from Penn Station and walking distance to central park and Times Square.

Would definitely stay again.

title: Good Hotel- Good Location
text: Good location with many restaurants and bars around. The hotel was recently renovated, clean   rooms. Will use again. There is a subway just few minutes away. Also they have a good steakhouse. Overall good location, clean and priced right.

title: Great place.
text: Very clean and friendly environment I enjoyed my stay here...Rooms were comfortable and food for the most part was great..Loved it there,Will be back but with more friends..I highly recommend this place.

title: Excellent
text: The accommodations, amenities, location and front desk staff were all first rate. No problem making connections regarding transportation to reach museums, theaters, restaurants or the airport. We couldn't have hoped for more.

title: Location is great, but everything else NOT
text: Staff was rude and inattentive. They spend more time talking to each other rather than help guests. Shower pressure is really bad. WiFi is expensive ($25 for amenities/day) and really slow. Noisy - you can hear what is going on in other rooms.

title: Excellent!
text: The location of this hotel is amazing! The hotel itself is outstanding with tastefully decorated rooms, the staff friendly. We were there to celebrate my daughters bday and the loyalty ambassador went out of her way to make the day special! I would recommend this hotel to everyone

title: Staff is amazing but rooms need an overhaul
text: The staff here is amazing but the rooms need a serious upgrade. My curtains had large visible holes in them and there was an large exposed hole in the wall exposing internal wiring. Im not sure how anyone could miss these things and not have them fixed. I have stayed here before and the location is amazing and the staff are very helpful but sadly I dont thinn I will stay here again. This hotel does not live up to the omni name.

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text: Nous avons séjourné quelques nuits en famille dans cet hôtel. Les chambres sont confortables, la literie est très bien. L'hôtel est très bien situé pour visiter New York. Par contre la carte du restaurant n'est pas "bon marché" mais comme beaucoup d'endroits à New York !

title: Exemplary staff and service
text: The staff here is exceptional.  I had an unexpected emergency on my last day.  Mary (concierge), Pedro (Security) and Joey (packages) are exemplary in their field and i am grateful for them.  They were the utmost professional, selfless, and kind in their assistance which went above and beyond -- without them I would not have made it home that day.  Besides, the room was bright and I loved the location.  It was a short walk to the conference that I was attending, and these accommodations were far superior.  I will return absolutely.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: Great midtown location. Wonderful service. Second stay here and really no longer look to stay anywhere else when in NYC. For the best rest, I chose a suite facing the interior atrium. No view but amazingly peaceful for a good night's rest.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: Really enjoyed our stay at The Omni Berkshire Place, you cannot fault the location for exploring NYC it's just a short walk from Broadway, Central Park and lots more. The only thing I found was the reception staff were a little unfriendly on check in but as that was our only dealings with them it didn't spoil our stay.  We didn't use the restaurant Bob's because we found it a little pricey for our budget but it seemed a really buzzy place.  My only negative comment really was as we were leaving the doorman asked if we needed a taxi to the airport and said he had a private guy we could use that worked with the hotel for $65 dollars including tolls and everything, as we had paid $70 for a yellow cab at JFK on arrival we accepted only to find that it was in fact $65 without tolls and a tip on arrival at the airport so it ended up costing $75! Just a little something to be aware of.  We would definitely still stay at Omni Berkshire Place if we visit NYC again though.

title: Great Location-Very Nice Property
text: We spent 3 nights with the Omni as our base as we explored the bright lights of the city. The hotel is situated where you can easily walk to a number of attractions. The property is very well appointed, clean and comfortable and all staff friendly and great to deal with. The rooms are elegant and the bed was comfortable. A bit small but pretty typical by New York standards. An in room coffee option would have been nice but we really enjoyed staying here and would definitely return. A note to hotel management - your man at the front door - Lenny I believe - is an incredible ambassador for your property. Always friendly, always attentive and ever so helpful!

title: Exceeded our expectations!
text: The Omni Berkshire is now our go-to place to stay in NYC.  The location can't be beat - great shopping, subway access, and easy walk to the theatre district.  Our room (905) was comfortable and quiet.  We enjoyed drinks and tasty beef sliders in the adjacent steak house and discovered the abundant joys of Isadora Cafe-Deli just across the street.  Nicest touch of all was returning to the hotel on a sweltering August afternoon where we were greeted with fresh watermelon slices and "martinis" in the lobby!

title: Great location
text: Good business hotel close to offices and restaurants. I come to NYC few days every month and this hotel is very convenient. Quality-Price is fair.  The lobby bar is very welcoming and the staff is really friendly.

title: Perfect Location , Brilliant Staff
text:
We were a family of 4 stayed in a family room between 6th August to 13th August . Rooms were of a good size , comfortable bed enough wardrobe space and a nice size bathroom. 
Best things about this hotel is that it’s in a perfect location where everything is within walking distance. 
The concierge staff are so knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Best concierge experience I have had from all the hotels I’ve been to so far. Even the bell boys and guys at the front by the entrance are so helpful and friendly, hail a cab down for you in no time. 
The only negative would be there is no bottled water provided in the room and no coffee making facilities, hence I gave four stars.

title: Friends weekend
text: First time at the Berkshire, will definitely be coming back.  Great service great staff perfect location. For the friends traveling with us it was their first time in NYC and the Berkshire wowed them.  Rooms were great very comfortable beds.

title: Muy bien
text: Hotel centrico, limpio, agradable. Todo muy bien. No se le puede poner ningun pero. Habitacion limpia y espaciosa, perfecta. Cerca de Moma, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. Personal agradable y muy atento. Para repetir

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: Had a great stay in NYC and have used this hotel a few times. The location is perfect for fun in the city. The staff was welcoming and helpful, the rooms were clean. I feel the price was reasonable and would definitely stay here again.

title: Exceptional hotel. Should be 5 star hotel. You cannot beat the location.
text: Exceptional hotel very elegant with old world New York feel. Should be 5 star hotel. You cannot beat the location (4 blocks to Central Park; right on 5th Avenue). They allowed me to do early check-in which was wonderful. Will definitely recommended to others and consider for future trips.

title: 18th Birthday Celebration
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire for four nights about two weeks ago. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms, the friendliness of the staff, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel. During a discussion with the reservation agent, I mentioned that it was my daughter's 18th birthday celebration and that we had never been to NY before. The very first night we were there we went out to do a little sightseeing and came back to the sweetest surprise. The hotel had delivered a delicious piece of cake, chocolate chip cookies, bottles of water, a bottle of chocolate milk and the sweetest note ever!! What a great way to start a birthday weekend!!  It set the tone for our entire stay and I will never stay anywhere else when we return. Thanks Omni Berkshire for an unforgettable birthday weekend!!!

title: Perfect Location
text:
We booked this is a package deal with British Airways which brought the price of the hotel down by a mile! Originally our 5 day stay as room only would have cost £800 each!! But we got a truly great deal. The hotel was clean and smart and in the ideal location...5th Avenue. Withing walking distance of many attractions such as - Trump Tower, 5th Ave, Times Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station and many more! if you wanted to venture out further you could hop on the tube which is only around the corner. The room was kept clean and was quite quiet! Front of desk staff at reception were lovely and very polite - not too keen on the older lady and the concierge who was rather patronising and rude when we asked what the best route was to liberty island. She clearly didnt like her job and showed it too. 

We were able to leave our bags til our flight which was super and we always had water available. 

a few tips: 

always bring enough money for tips, New Yorkers can be very rude if you dont tip - especially cab drivers

bring comfy shoes 

dont take much personally

title: Excellent hôtel
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, avec beaucoup de charme (un petit côté old school très agréable)!
Les chambres sont spacieuses et très confortables. Le tout en plein centre de Manhattan: le MoMa est juste à côté, Broadway est à 10 minutes à pied ainsi que Times Square!
Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel et nous sommes ravis de notre séjour.
Le petit bémol est sur le tarif des petits déjeuner, mais vous n’avez qu’à traverser la rue et vous avez l’embarras du choix pour trouver votre bonheur à un tarif abordable!

title: Gem in Manhatten
text: Excellent hotel in a superb location in the middle of Manhattan with central access to theatres and subway just around the corner. Huge rooms excellent staff interaction and useful advice. We will definitely use this hotel if we return to New York

title: Can't go wrong here
text:
Recently stayed here for 3 nights in early July.  The location is perfect with easy access to all parts of the city by subway or walking.  I booked through a 3rd party and arrived a bit early at 1pm.  A room was available on the 3rd floor in the back but it faced an air vent which had the potential to be noisy at night.  So I returned to the front desk and was given another room on the 7th floor also in the back.  This proved to be a satisfactory choice.  While it was without much natural light, it was quiet and peaceful.  I suspect if you book via a 3rd party you will be given a room in the back sandwiched between 2 buildings.  That is perfectly acceptable although you may want to ask for a higher floor if the vision of seeing a vent bothers you.  The room was wonderfully comfortable and nicely arranged with an actual chair and a side table that faced the tv.  I have no idea why other hotels do not arrange furniture this way. The bathroom was well appointed with elegant marble finishes that suggest an era long ago.  Steps away is the Blue Bottle Cafe for a great pour over coffee to start the day.  Also nearby is the restaurant, La Grenouille, with its riot of flowers inside.  One could eat reasonably here if the pre theater menu is ordered or if one stops by later for a snack rather than a full meal.
This is one of the few hotels that still gives its guests a NY Times, WSJ, Asian Financial, and USA Today.  I appreciate they offer these periodicals for free.  The gym is decent and on the same floor is a small terrace with an herb garden to enjoy the view.  The bottom line is that virtually all guests will enjoy the Omni Berkshire Hotel.

title: Going back already
text: Fantastic midtown location and, for New York City, good sized room. Feels utterly reliable to the extent we are heading back into town again tomorrow and have booked it again. Public areas a bit uninspired.

title: Very Nice Hotel Mid-Town Manhattan
text: 6th Floor - not the best floor, over looking Madison Ave. 17th floor has gym and terrace that looks at St Patrick's Cathedral. Food portions are huge when ordering from Bob's - the food is great. The room was kept neat daily and the concierge service above average.

title: Un bel hotel in centro a Manhattan
text:
Due notti tra arrivo e ripartenza in New York, abbiamo prenotato questo hotel più per la posizione che altro, ma dobbiamo dire che è pulito, e ben tenuto.
Non ha la piscina e questo è spiaciuto a mia figlia, però tutto il resto si.
Unica pecca, secondo noi, è il costo della colazione nel ristorante che, per due pancake e un piatto di frutta è costata 95 usd.... buoni ma cari!

title: Prepare to be treated like a VIP
text: The OMNI is a first class hotel that is relatively affordable on a modest budget.  The room and amenities were absolutely fabulous.  This is not one of those ultra pricey luxury hotels or boutique hotels but it felt that way.  From complimentary coffee delivered to the room each morning, to helpful concierge service and an outstanding bar/restaurant, all of our needs were well met.  I called a couple of days before to request a dozen roses to be in the room at the time of check-in and the concierge had that taken care of at a very reasonable charge, with a lovely bouquet of long stem roses.  Located in mid-town it was easy to walk to some of the Broadway theaters and high level shops.  There were so many restaurants in the neighborhood that offered plenty of variety.

title: Average with some faults
text: Average hotel, probably over-priced. Food Service forgot to deliver the order 2 nights in a row, was late the third. Manager was very apologetic and comped one meal and gave a bottle of wine on the house. Room was clean, TV channels didn't work one night. Overall not a place I would recommend for $300 a night.

title: Excelente localização e acomodações
text: Fica na esquina da Madison com a 52, perto de tudo, inclusive do sibway que fica na 53 com a 5th, da pra ir ao Central Park a pé ou a Times Square, muitos bares e restaurantes por perto. Em frente ao hotel tem um deli bem razoável. Os quartos e banheiros são ótimos, muito limpos e arrumados. Não tem frigobar nem vi maquina de gelo no andar. Café da manhã é a parte. E pelo que entendi eles cobram US$ 25 por dia, para receber encomendas e pelo wifi no quarto. Há wifi no saguão liberado. Atendimento correto. Fiz a reserva pelo Hotwire e não tive nenhum problema ou reclamação. Recomendo.

title: Great Stay in Historic Hotel
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire last summer.  It was clean and modern.  I'd highly recommend this hotel because of it's convenience to City attractions.  It's situated in the Rockefeller Center area, close to Times Square, Central Park, St Patrick's Cathedral, and Grand Central Station.  Enjoy your stay!

title: Another lovely stay
text: This was our second time visiting the Omni Berkshire Place. The first time we went as a couple and this time as a family with our three kids. We booked a Berkshire Suite which was perfect for our party size. The bedroom was a very good size with a large bed and the living area was equally as big with a large sofa bed for the kids. The room was clean on arrival, and continued to be tidied and cleaned, with fresh sheets daily. On arrival the kids were provided with chocolate milk and cookies.  As we were signed up to the loyalty scheme we also got free wifi and coffee each morning. The staff were very helpful throughout our stay. The location is brilliant, very central to anywhere you may want to visit in Manhattan. Next time we visit NYC we'll definitely be staying at the Omni again.

title: Business Trip
text: This is a great location as its just off 5th Avenue. I really like staying at this Hotel as it takes me 2 min walk to all my customers. It has a fantastic steak restaurant in the hotel. The room are a really good size. If you looking for a well priced hotel in a great location i would definitely recommend staying here. The staff are wonderful.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: We stayed here over the festive season and it was perfect in terms of location. We were just around the corner from Sachs and not too far a walk to Central Park. The hotel room was immaculate. Also, we couldn’t hear any noise from the streets below, so slept well every night. A lovely hotel over all.

title: CUIDADO FAMILIAS!!!
text:
No se os ocurra coger una habitación para más de dos personas!!!! Son camas individuales un poco más grandes, 1,20cm a lo sumo.Y ni de broma llega a Queen size  o a cama de matrimonio de 1,35m. La publicidad de habitación para 4 personas es errónea por no decir falsa. Me reconocieron en recepción que nunca han tenido habitaciones cuádruples.  Como mínimo has de coger la suite con cama Queen Size y sofa cama para 2. O para 1 y un plegatin( que se paga a parte). Aparte solo hay un armario. 2 personas se quedan sin poder deshacer su equipaje...como un camping, vamos.
 El hotel esta muy bien situado, tiene un estilo típico neoyorkino de las películas y con mucho encanto. La habitación, si es para una pareja, es muy confortable. Recomendable.

title: Very Disappointed!!!!
text:
I stayed at the Omni in Atlanta Georgia and it was amazing, so I thought New York would be comparable but that is not the case. Rooms outdated, especially the bathrooms. The lighting was horrible in bath area and the room itself. Decor was unpleasant, room service food was unbearable both times ordered. Very uninviting lobby who's front desk had no personality.
The bed was comfortable and the door men were wonderful however!!!

title: Great hotel in Mid-town Manhattan.
text:
I stay at the Omni Berkshire for both business and personal travel.  The central location is great and the staff is wonderful.  I appreciate the perks of the Omni Select Guest program - free morning beverage room delivery.  
The fitness center is good size for a city hotel.

title: Needs Change
text: I have stayed in this hotel several times over the years. Lately it has ceased to be value for money, I had to pay for wifi, no coffee machine in room, they starting to nickel and dime. I definitely will try another hotel when I'm back in NYC

title: Luxury Escape
text: We bought a luxury escape and felt it was good value for money if there are only 2 of you (a family of four would be double the cost) - it was $400 AUD a night including breakfast which was a la carte. I prefer buffet style as you can pick and chose what you want, but breakfast is waiter style - quite generous servings and a broad menu. Make sure you receive a card when you check in that explains how the breakfast works if you have it included in your room - we ordered an extra pot of tea and this was not included, but we were not aware as at check in we were never informed of the restrictions. They did waiver it when we made a fuss. Location is very good on 52nd street and air conditioning was lovely after such hot days. Did not seem very busy at all. Check out was 12 noon which was so sensible - I wish more hotels would do this. Would most likely stay again.

title: New York trip
text: Need to have coffee and tea set up in the room - very unusual that a hotel of this caliber does not have coffee and tea in the room. Otherwise the room was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning was suitable.

title: 5 star property, 5 star location
text:
The Omni Berkshire is a great hotel for the following reasons:

- even the standard rooms are fairly large and they are up-to-date.  Desk in the room, free wi-fi if you are a Guest Rewards Member, free coffee, too. Gracious staff.

- I stayed in the Madison Suite, which is really nice: it had a separate living room, large bathroom that had its own bath, nice welcome gift 

- great location: at 52nd and Madison, it is close to all the shopping on 5th ave and Madison, close to tourist spots like St Patrick’s, Central Park, Grand Central. Not too far from the Lexington Ave subway. 

- one con is that since it’s on the East Side, it’s quite a pain to get to if you get in via Amtrak at Penn Station.

title: Worst experience ever!
text: Day 1 has been a terrible experience. The check in process was relatively easy. I was too early for check in- but they were great to send me a text when the room was ready. When I went into my room- the first thing I noticed- no toilet paper. Even worse- hair all around the bathroom sink and toilet. I was tired from walking around the city all day- so I just did my best to clean it. I then moved to the bed area. Gum stuck to the bedsheets. Black streaks along the pillow cases- and some other stain on the sheets that I won’t go into detail on. Not a big fan of co planning- but there was no way I would sleep on those sheets. I called the front desk- the apologized- and said they would send someone up to take care of it. 40 mins later- no one shows up. It’s night time and I am already exhausted. I call the front desk again- this time they just transfer me to housekeeping( why didn’t they do that the first time?). Housekeeping says hey will be right up. About 10 mins later a woman from housekeeping knocks on the door. I let her in and I show her the sheets- even she was pretty disgusted with them. She puts the clean sheets and pillow cases on the FLOOR!- and then proceeds to remove the dirty sheets which land near the clear sheets on the floor. I typically love staying at Omni properties- but this is by far one of he worst properties I have ever stay at. I am hoping day 2 is better than day 1 - I can’t imagine it being any worse.

title: Good stay.
text: Stayed in a Premier Executive Room for six nights. Very convenient location. Room was updated and got enough space for moving around. Bathroom was serviceable but could use an update to give it a more contemporary look. Front desk staff was helpful when we needed to check out an hour later.

title: Great location but needs some updating
text: We have always enjoyed staying at Omni Berkshire. Their bell staff and gentlemen at the front door are phenomenal. Lenny is my absolute favorite! However, the rooms, hallways and lobby are getting a bit dated. You CANNOT beat the hitel’s location!! It is in the heart of Manhattan and located near great restaurants, entertainment and shopping.

title: Perfect stay in the heart of the City
text: I enjoyed every single minute spent in this hotel. Every staff member likes what they do. I will definitely go back. An incredible stay in the heart of New York City. I had asked to have an ice pack frozen and the staff kindly succeeded in keeping track of it, whereas in other even more expensive hotel I had a lesser service. This is the best.

title: Great Stay!
text: Service was incredible for my 5 year anniversary! I really appreciate their warm welcome.   "The most beautiful things are not associated with money; they are memories and moments. If you don't celebrate those, they can pass you by"

title: Pas mal!
text:
Un hôtel, contrairement à quelques avis, que nous avons trouvé bien décoré et très jolie dans son ensemble. 
La chambre (deluxe) est de taille plus que correcte. La literie (kingsize) est parfaite pour une bonne nuit de sommeil après avoir marché des kilomètres dans NY. 
Point très important à noter : très calme et très bien situé ! Et ce n’est pas le cas de tout les hôtels même « de luxe » dans la grosse pomme. 

Si nous devions chipoter, deux points seraient un peu moins bons: 

- Notre accueil n’a pas été des plus chaleureux le jour de notre arrivée. Aucune explication sur les installations de l’hôtel ne nous a été donnée.
Mettons cela sur le fait que notre anglais n’est pas d’un niveau exceptionnel...
- La chambre ne possède pas de réfrigérateur. Peut-être est-ce un critère très européen ? Mais cela nous a parfois manqué ! (Surtout en plein mois de juillet!) 

Cependant, nous vous conseillons sans hésiter cet hôtel !

title: Gute Lage für Manhattan und Shopping
text: Das Omni ist ein typisches Hotel nahe den Einkaufsstrassen und Sehenswürdigkeiten in Midtown Manhattan. Central Park ist relativ nahe. Wegen des vielen Verkehrs ist es eher laut. Die Zimmer sind älter, mit Teilrenovationen, aber ok. Das Restaurant im Haus ist überteuert, auch das Frühstück.

title: Perfect location
text: Located on 52nd between 5th and Madison, hotel was perfect walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, MoMA, et al. Comfortable room, as far as NY hotels go. And reasonably priced (again, as far as NY hotels go).

title: Excellent hotel and staff, great location!
text: Excellent hotel and staff, especially the bartenders.  Great location.  Don't miss a trip to the rooftop terrace on the 17th floor. Complimentary Mojitas on Friday afternoon were a nice touch.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Fantastic Location
text: Great hotel.  Fantastic location.  Hotel is very clean and well-maintained.  Staff is extremely helpful.  Had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs - one of the best breakfasts I’ve ever had in a hotel.  Little pricey, but that’s New York.  The French toast was heaven, the eggs were perfectly cooked, and the fruit was super fresh.  I’d stay here again for the breakfast alone.  All of the other advantages the hotel offers are icing on the cake!

title: Great location, great customer service
text: We got a great deal on this hotel through Hotwire. We arrived very early intending to check our bags and head out for our first day of sightseeing, but they let us check in to our room early! Great start. In the room, we discovered the carpet was damp and called to let the staff know. A housekeeping manager came up to the room in a matter of minutes to check it out, and when we returned later in the evening there was a floor fan/dryer in the room. It helped a little but we turned it off and went to sleep. The next day we came back in the middle of the day to rest up from a morning of activities, and found a mildew odor from the (still) damp carpet. We called again, and someone came up and attempted to freshen up the room with a spray. On the way out for the afternoon and evening, we went to the front desk and asked if was possible to move rooms if we came back and there was still an odor. Before returning, I got a call from the hotel telling us we had a new room, offered to move our belongings for us, and to pick up the new keys when we returned. We opted to move ourselves and they even kept us on the same floor. Once we moved, everything was fantastic. Room was very comfortable. We slept well. Even got another follow-up call from housekeeping manager apologizing and offering any additional help we needed. Earlier in the stay we requested a refrigerator, which they were out of at the moment, but when we moved rooms we discovered one waiting for us which was very nice and already cooled. All in all, a great stay, with a minor mishap that was handled extremely well. Door/bell staff was every friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

title: This Hotel is fantastic!
text: I was so pleased to share this information with other travelers. Not sure I can fit all my raves in! The hotel was by far the best I have ever stayed in. The location was perfect - a block from Rockefeller Center. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway shows, and so much more. A block from St Patrick’s Cathedral and 5th Ave, we felt safe walking. Super clean, friendly staff - Omni Management should be proud!

title: Localização top
text: Localização perfeita. Bom atendimento. Hotel um pouco antigo mas muito limpo. Limpeza do quarto duas vezes ao dia. Atendentes bem educado. Guardam as malas pra quem chega cedo. Consegui um valor ótimo pelo Hotwire. Pelo valor normal não pagaria.

title: Olympic caliber get away
text: You want a great place to stay?  Stay here spotless great service good food can't go wrong with this place not good value but great value. I now look for Omni's in other cities to stay at.They treated my wife and I like king and queen.

title: This was an amazing hotel with a friendly staff.
text: The room was a great view of Saint Patrick's Cathedral. It had A king bed with a pull out bed in the other room. Everynight they asked if we wanted turndown service. The Concerige that I think was from England she was Phenomenal. The Deli across the street was  very nice as well.

title: Perfect Spot
text: The Omni Berkshire NYC is amazing.  Beautiful,  spacious, clean rooms.  Near Central Park, Rockefeller Center, shopping, restaurants, etc.  Great hotel close to everything.  We will definitely be returning.

title: Charged for parking twice....
text: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night.  I added valet parking because lets face it, it makes it much easier.  When I approached the front desk, the lady that was checking us in could not get past the fact that I cancelled a couple of reservations before my current reservation.  And she kept telling me I didn’t have valet parking.  Word to the wise, please print out your reservation before you check in.  Keep that reservation handy, because they will change the price. mine increased by almost 100 dollars, yes, just for one night.  When leaving I had to deal with the same lady again…..she could not get past the reservations I cancelled before.  Then she was going to add parking again, trying to double charge me for parking.  Another person working the desk came over and explained to the lady that it was already charged on my bill as a package for the room, I thought she finally gave in gave me a copy of my bill and I thought that was it.  But I went on my way to my next location (another Omni in Providence RI, which by the way is the best hotel ever!), when I got to my next location, I noticed, when my back was turned, they charged my card anyway for the parking again.  Yup!  Nice huh!  Just be careful and watch this hotel even after you leave, check your credit card for rouge charges.  I am an Omni fan.  I love Providence and stay at the Omni at least once a year in Providence, but I will never stay at the Omni in New York.  Its unfortunate that I felt I spent most of my vacation trying to resolve credit card charges that should have never happened in the first place.  There isn’t enough discounts for them to give for me to go back.

title: Omni Berkshire Place NYC - The ONLY Place to Stay!
text: Originally, I stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place in NYC because my company recommended it (less than a 5 min walk to the office). And now, with all of the other hotels close by, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The Omni Berkshire Place is my preferred hotel when visiting NYC for business or pleasure. The hotel is always clean, I feel safe when traveling alone that there's always a doorman and someone at the front desk. The rooms are always clean, comfortable, and quiet. Even if I arrive late in the evening, I truly appreciate that they have a late-night room service menu. I cannot tell you how many times that late-night service has saved me! Their Business Center provides computers and printers to check-in or change flight reservations and the staff is always so helpful!

title: Best hotels on the planet
text: Omni hotels are the best. Everyone employed there wants nothing better than for you to enjoy your time there, from the bellman to the maids. The service is impeccable. We were referred to several restaurants which were excellent. We will not stay at any other hotel if there is a Omni hotel available.

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights, great location very clean and comfortable room, lovely bed!!
Staff very friendly and extremely helpful . 
Was recommend by concierge La Villetta Italian restaurant on East 53 and 1st. Thoroughly recommend it but get hotel to book as gets busy. Wonderful Italian food.

title: Clean
text: Room was clean, service friendly, coffee and tea in the morning is 25$, dinner at BoBs over 200$ for two. Steak was irregular in that it was chewy and tough in parts and ok in other sections. For the price I believe the entire steak should be tender and edible. Carrot was fantastic and salmon dish was tasty. Not feeling happy about credit card payments, seeing a double charge and we are currently watching our statement closely. Called and still don’t feel secure about transactions and will call our bank in am. Doormen were super friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location, excelent service
text: Was here for family trip, the location is excellent, hotel near shopping, restaurants, public transportation, and services. Very friendly staff. Check in can take some time, checkout is express so as fast as you want it to be. Room service for breakfast efficient, good quality. Cons... elevators can be slow, 3 out of 4 working for customers, and the noise from outside can bother light sleepers. Would stay here again.

title: Excellent Value/Nice Room
text: Lucked into a three-day stay at Berkshire Place on Hotwire. The room was large, well-appointed, cool (during a massive heatwave), and quiet. We found the staff to be entirely helpful and polite. We were a bit reluctant to stay in Midtown, but the location proved to be wonderful. No coffeemaker in the room, but there are loads of coffee places nearby. Of course, New York City water beats bottled water, so provided glass goblets got plenty of use. I look forward to staying there again.

title: Nice place to stay
text: Omni is a nice place to stay near the theater district, Rockefeller center, MoMo and lots of high end shopping. They actually have king size beds and the rooms are pretty spacious for NYC.  Close to the 53rd/5th Ave subway station.

title: steve and sybille
text: this hotel was the best we've stayed in, great quality, good size rooms, fabulous location, not one negative issue, staff very efficient and welcoming, felt extremely comfortable the whole time, would come again

title: Rien de négatif à dire
text:
Très bel hôtel. Bon emplacement. Personnel super courtois et souriant. Les chambres sont petites mais tout de même fonctionnelles. Belle terrasse. 
 Je recommanderais et j'y retournerais sans hésitation.

title: Good and bad points
text:
Stayed here in June this year (2018) for 5 nights and booked 2 x rooms for 4 guests.

One of the rooms didn't have a cooler/fridge which was requested on 3 separate occasions each time on the promise that one would be sent up.
Regrettably one never appeared which was disappointing see as were were in the 90s outside and wanting a cool drink to cone back to.

The other room never locked when closing the door unless you put the key card back in on your way out 
Unfortunately the house cleaning didn't realise this so we returned every day to an unlocked room, not good!!

On the plus side the rooms were of good standard and the bell staff were very friendly and helpful.

Also be aware that the rooftop terrace is just a terrace and not a bar

A small bat area I'm sure would've made it really nice.

Wi-Fi is available if you pay for it and the price was very expensive

title: CAN'T GO WRONG BOOKING THIS HOTEL
text: We try to go yearly to NYC and always stay at the Omni Berkshire! It is the perfect hotel if you want location, service and beautiful rooms! Stayed here 35 years ago for our honeymoon and we have never stayed anywhere else. Feels special every time you enter through the door. Also, try Bob's Steak and Chop House because the serve possibly best fillet I have ever had.

title: Great location and solid Manhattan hotel
text: This Omni is right around the corner to Radio City, 30 Rock, St Patrick's Cathedral, and 5th Ave shopping. Numerous restaurants and all of midtown. Our room was larger than many Manhattan kings, but still "New York" large. Front desk, concierges, and service personnel were top notch.
