title: Great Stay Great Location
text: Went to NYC for my sisters surprise birthday.  Hotel was in a great location and staff was very friendly with every interaction.  Definitely would go back again. Most sites were in walking distance and it was very easy to get Uber or a taxi with minimal to no wait time.

title: paid wifi - is this 1998?
text:
The hotel charges for wifi, which is really poor practice in 2018.
I stayed there for 5 nights and they messed up my in-room breakfast order on 2 out of 5. The room itself is ok but has no mini-fridge or tea/coffee maker, you'd expect much (much much) more from a 4 star hotel.

title: Perfect location, gorgeous rooms, and excellent service
text: Our favorite place to stay during our yearly trips to the city. Perfect location steps from 5th Ave, and around the corner from St. Pats. Easy walk to Times Square and Central Park. Rooms are beautifully kept, and the staff is fantastic. Once we stayed at this hotel, we have never stayed anywhere else!

title: Great place for conferences
text:
Our Organization has had several conferences and meetings here in the past 3 months. Everything went so well that we are booking again for next year.
At all times the staff has been very helpful and pleasant.
The food at the meetings is really good and dinners at Bob's are fantastic.
Meeting room space is comfortable and since the hotel is on the smaller size, people really enjoy being so close to meeting rooms.  
The hotel rooms are spacious and make for a very comfortable stay.
I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent hotel and great stay
text: Recently stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. We arrived early for the check-in and the front desk was nice enough to accommodate us and provided a good nice room. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and room service was very good too. Staff over all is very helpful and courteous. Location is a big advantage for this hotel. It is located close to many major attractions and shopping. From Central Park to Empire State Building, Time square is all within walkable distance. There are many restaurants and bars nearby so you cannot go wrong with this hotel and location. Highly recommend.

title: The only good thing, location.
text:
Surprised by the housekeeping services which was below standard at most of the time where I stayed in the hotel for almost a good week.  

Front office hasn’t been friendly which you almost don’t want to talk to them as you almost feel unwelcome.  Just the way they talk to you, you feel very much criticising especially one Asian look receptionist.  Was surprised that when you had enquiry about the charge of the parcel handling, they told you that’s not from Reception which they didn’t know why it’s charged but I guess as a reception and to customers, aren’t they THE ambassador in helping on enquiry?  It’s really new to me that I was told that I has to ask the other department by myself? 

However, the bell desk has been nice.  

Was quite shocked on the quality of housekeeping as they had a bathrobe with stains and sewed bedsheet for guests or they don’t put a new bathrobe when they collected yours?  After they serviced your room, you’ll see stuff just ‘freely’ put instead of nicely put back or hung up.  

With the price they were charging, that’s disappointing but their location is superb for business travellers or even for leisure, still a central location for some museums and scenery.  

If I’m coming back to NYC, I’ll definitely consider somewhere else then here.

title: June 14-June 17
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights. Although this hotel is old and dated I'm overall very happy with the hotel. The staff are very nice and extremely helpful. The location is outstanding as you are in walking distance to Central Park and many other attractions. We took the subway everywhere which is very close to the hotel. Rooms were immaculate bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size for Manhattan. We did not eat at the restaurant and the menu is expensive but had drinks in the bar and it was very relaxing. 

We are part of the loyalty program however had to ask for bottles of water daily as well as the sleep machine we asked for..

The front desk generally has water available.  There are maps at the concierge...make sure you grab one as it can get a bit confusing.

title: One of the best!
text:
We've been to NYC numerous times and this was our first stay at the Omni - it won't be our last. This is truly one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in - anywhere. The service was impeccable and our room(s) were fabulous. Very spacious - far above what we expect from most Manhattan hotels - excellently appointed with a great view of Madison Ave. The bed was really comfortable and we had no problem with street noise in the night. (9th floor)
We had the opportunity to enjoy breakfast at the restaurant and not only was the food excellent, the service couldn't have been better. 
If you are looking for an experience beyond the ordinary, then I recommend this property.

title: Great for a stay in New York
text: This was our first visit to New York and we were delighted with the Omni hotel. Its in a great location and we found it easy to get everywhere. The room was large and comfortable with excellent bathroom facility. Only down side for us was not facility to make hot drink in room but that is rather a British thing I believe.   There was no resort fee to pay and there was free wifi available in the lobby. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would definitley recommend this hotel if staying in New York.

title: Great spot in midtown
text: Been coming to this property for over 20 years. It is a quiet, nicely appointed hotel. Staff is great and you can get to the west side, uptown, downtown or to the piers and waterfront pretty easily.(minus the ny traffic of course).

title: The best time ever!!!
text: Went to NYC for 3 days primarily to see the Belmont (oh my gosh!!!!!) The Omni Berkshire was Fantastic! Perfect location, beautiful room, Sonny the bartender (great guy) , felt special and safe for i traveled this trip solo. Truly the best vacation ever! (I met the most interesting people in the hotel bar)

title: Beautiful NYC Midtown Hotel
text:
Arrived at the hotel approx 945pm - greeted by doorman on 52nd street who was going to take care of overnight parking - but before he did so , he kindly reminded me that the inspection was due next month - so thoughtful bc I def would have forgotten this item. 
Front Desk clerk was lovely, check in was easy peasy. Arrived at room which was spotless, to a turned down bed with a lovely Omni Bathrobe draped invitingly over each bed. I was also greeted by a fresh bowl of assorted fruit - and 5 bottles of water - very nice touch and truly appreciated. 

Room and bathroom were spotless. Enjoyable stay wish it was for more than one evening.

title: Our NY Favorite!
text: The Omni Berkshire on 52nd is our favorite place to stay when visiting NYC.  They’re staff is always friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are always clean and welcoming.  They also offer special deals that don’t rob your pocketbook.  We love their central location since we like to walk to many of the fun sites and great restaurants in that area of the city!

title: Fabulous Location
text: Would definitely stay here again.  Great location. Terrific staff.  Rooms and lobby are very pretty.  Extremely friendly hotel -- what a terrific welcome in a fun and exciting city.  Rooms are small compared to other cities I have been to, but I'm sure typical for a large city.

title: Excellent experience, but....
text: Free WIFI at the local public park and at Starbucks, but you still charge a daily rate for non-frequent visitors???   Free bottle of water at the Parking Spot when I returned from my trip, but no bottles of water in the room despite paying multiple hundreds of dollars per night (yes I did see the water dispenser downstairs by the elevator...but....from this class of hotel I would expect better).  Otherwise, my room, and especially the bathroom, was clean, clean, clean... love that.  I would return, but come on, do something about the little comforts, water bottle and WIFI.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Location was great!  Near downtown sites.  The restaurant in the hotel is extremely overpriced for what is offered.  The food was OK, but certainly not worth the prices being charged. Luckily we found a deli nearby for a more reasonable breakfast. The room was nice, nothing special.  Nice size bathroom.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: A traditional, well preserved hotel in midtown, between Madison and 5th Aves. It is a bit old fashioned, but in good condition. Good toiletries, a bath robe and a good shower. A lot of space in the room, a rarity in New York City.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text:
This is the second time I have stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place. This is a wonderful hotel from check in to check out. I was here for three nights to see the Orioles play the Mets. Check in was easy. I arrived one hour before the 3PM check in and was immediately given a room. It was a very nice room which had I everything I could have wanted except a working TV. This is second time which I have stayed at this hotel, and the TV keeps cutting out on multiple channels. This might be the hotel's way of saying you are not in NYC to watch TV. If that is the case, they are right, but it still should be my choice. 

Back to the room. The bed was nice. The bathroom was nice. The shower was nice. I think you get the message.

The staff is very friendly. Stay at the Omni, and you should be very happy in New York

title: Highly recommend
text: We love this hotel. The location is great. The service is great. It is clean. The entire staff is very customer oriented and pleasant. The rooms are great and clean and quiet.  I can't say enough good things about it.  I stay here every time I am in NYC now.  It is great value and a great experience.

title: Bello e centrale
text: Sono stato 5 notti presso questo albergo in piena Midtown a 5 minuti a piedi da Rockefeller center e Times Square. La posizione secondo me è impareggiabile perché a piedi raggiungi tutte le numerose attrazioni di Midtown compreso Central Park. Le camere sono molto spaziose, cosa non facile a NY. Non ho fatto la colazione perché intorno ci sono innumerevoli posti. Lo consiglio vivamente . Se dovessi tornare a NY tornerei di sicuro qui.

title: Camere ampie
text:
Albergo praticamente sulla fifth . la posizione è davvero comodissima a due passi da Central Park e dalla stazione. Vi è anche un ristorante all’interno dell’albergo.  
Le camere sono grandi (cosa abbastanza rara dentro manhattan) ed arredate in maniera elegante . Letto King size davvero comodissimo e gigantesco (anche se noi avevamo un upgrade di livello ). La strada su cui si affaccia l'hotel è un po trafficata quindi si sente un po di traffico dalla camera. 
La Wi-Fi non è compresa cosa abbassa scomoda se si è in viaggio . 
Ben fornito di accessori per il bagno.  Il Bagno è  grande ed ha la  vasca .

title: Wonderful hospitality during our 5 night stay
text:
This was our 11th stay in New York and first visit to this hotel.  Immediately we were greeted by Patrick at the front desk who took us through the check in process.  He was most attentive and gave us a great welcome.  We explained that this stay was to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday, Patrick advised us that he had given us a nice room on the 15th floor and also gave us complimentary tea each morning of our stay.
The hotel is very well situated for many of the attractions, very close to St Patricks Cathedral. Our room was very spacious, immaculately clean with a bath tub.  The bed was very comfy with plenty of pillows.
A couple of days into our stay there was a lovely surprise of a nice bottle of wine a birthday cake and card delivered to our room which was a really nice touch.  All staff were very friendly and accommodating.  On departure, Lenny the Bellman was very helpful with our transport to the airport and it was lovely to see how this chap genuinely enjoyed his role at this hotel.  This was a fantastic stay and would definitely use this hotel again.  Refreshing to see people with pride in their jobs.  Thanks again Patrick and staff for making this so memorable for us.

title: Great hotel and great service
text: All the staff are extremely professional, friendly and helpful, they all added to our positive experience of New York, would highly recommend this hotel. The room was spacious and bed plus sofa bed very comfortable.

title: Pleasant weekend stay
text: The guest room was comfortable, large, and clean. Food at the restaurant was excellent. Bar service was very good, but the prices were steep, even by NYC standards. The lobby and entrance need renovating--old and dated.

title: Nice hotel - good location
text: I stayed at the Omni Berkshire for business and the hotel is quite nice.  Rooms are comfortable, contemporary.  Lobby is a bit underwhelming though accommodating.  The location is pretty central if you want to be in midtown.

title: Loved Omni Berkshire Place
text:
We flew over from the UK for a long weekend break in NYC over the Memorial Day Weekend and chose Omni Berkshire.

As we were celebrating our joint birthdays, the hotel kindly provided some complimentary treats upon arrival and we were also upgraded to a bigger room, which was fab!

The room was big, clean and the bed was comfortable. We utilised the room service a couple of times for breakfast, which was tasty and ample. 

The location in Midtown is great for walking to all the nearby sights and the rest of Manhattan by subway/cabs.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Omni Berkshire last weekend and will definitely check it out again when next booking NYC. 

Thank you.

title: Good location
text: This was my second stay at the Omni Berkshire. The location allows me to walk to shopping and restaurants.   The restaurant is now open- a welcome change as it was being renovated during my last stay.   While the hotel offers a great location, friendly valet staff and updated rooms, I was disappointed by the delay in available rooms at check in.  With a check-in time of 3pm, my expectation was the room would be available by 4pm - the time I attempted to check. To my surprise it was not.   Huge frustration.  The staff provided a drink voucher which did very little ease the inconvenience.   I received notification of an available room approximately an hour later.  Not sure there will be a third stay at the Omni Berkshire.

title: 52 th street and 5th avenue
text:
Une adresse à ne pas manquer à New York 
Un très bon qualite prix avec un excellent personnel
son restaurant Bob et sa carte de viandes excellentes 
Seul point noir le prix du breakfast par rapport à l'offre

title: Great hotel- quiet great location friendly people
text: This is a great title I booked as part of a jet blue package and I would stay here again and again. Everyone was friendly , you can't beat the location. And it is quiet so you can sleep. Stay here it's great and I don't normally write reviews .

title: Location couldn't be more perfect
text: We have stayed here every visit to new york for years. We love this hotel b/c of it's central location, easy in and out and the quietest stay we have found in this area.  We love to walk to the Broadway shows and there is great shopping and eating.  The beds are super crisp and comfy.  Everything is in tip top condition.  We didn't get to try the restaurant this last time b/c they were doing a huge renovation.  We will be staying next week so I'll update the review.  I'm sure the renovatoin is going to be spectatcular.

title: Great location
text:
The hotel was excellent and the location was just perfect for us. 
We arrived several hours before checkin and they were very accommodating and stored our luggage while we explored the immediate area. 
I made several requests from reception during our stay and was very pleased with the service. 
The bagels they served with our breakfast were amazing.

title: Excellent Base For Exploring NYC
text: We had a very comfortable 4-night stay at the Omni Berkshire Place, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great base from which to explore Manhattan and beyond. Check-in was seamless, efficient and friendly despite our early arrival. Our room and bathroom was larger than expected and very quiet, ensuring a good night's sleep every night. There was no pressure to have breakfast in the hotel, and no hidden charges, which was extremely refreshing. All in all a great stay!

title: Superb first holiday in New York
text:
A lovely hotel with very friendly, helpful staff. The room was great and the bed extremely large and comfortable. We were on the 17th floor which was quiet but not far from the lift. 
The hotel is in a great location, very close to 5th Avenue. We used 5th Avenue as a marker as everything we wanted to see was relatively close to it, either one side or another. 
Food and drinks are expensive but there are plenty of other options around. Overall an excellent holiday at a hotel I would highly recommend.

title: Great location, Friendly staff
text:
I totally enjoyed my stay at Omni Berkshire. The location was fantastic and the service was good. I really liked that the bathroom had little amenities like shower cap and mouth wash - some hotels forget about these things. The rooms are very quiet. Was able to get a good night sleep in the heart of NYC. Did not hear any sounds from neighbors either.

It is really close to Time Square and it was easy to see a broadway show. I had tickets to go see Hamilton, but was able to sell them at the last minute at a substantial profit.

title: Well appointed, quiet, very friendly staff
text: We stayed here for six nights in May.  We were after a central midtown location within good (half hour) walking distance of a number of synagogues for the Shavuot holiday.  The hotel fitted the bill very well.  We found the staff friendly, the room well appointed and our request for a fridge easily met.   The decor is traditional and within this parameter, well preserved.  Our room was very quiet.   The subway is no more than a block or two away.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Good hotel in a good location
text: We arrived late at night after a long flight and drive in from the airport. Check in was quick and friendly. Our room was a decent size by Manhattan standards and the bathroom was really lovely and big. Bed was super comfy. The main reason for choosing the hotel was it's location which enabled us to get around Manhattan with ease. Restaurants are too expensive and you can eat in some super NY restaurants for the same price. As a tip I'd say ditch breakfast at the hotel and go to the cafe directly across the road which is super good value and very tasty. Wifi should really be free in the room but isn't. There is also no mini-bar/fridge which we were disappointed about.

title: Fabulous central Hotel
text: Excellent service, very  helpful, friendly staff,  Great central location. Jut a couple of bklock away from Times Square and Broadway. Superb, large comfy beds. Quiet ambience inside hotel. Food very tasty and well cooked but large portions. Stayed on group booking so didn't have  contact with checking in staff.

title: Not as expected
text: Omni hotels come with excellent quality and customer service. We did not experience either of those and given the option will not be staying at OMNI hotel again.  - the wifi experience was atrocious -holes in the sheets - no mini fridge/coffee service

title: Best hotel in New York City
text: The omni is the best hotel in New York City.  Being a select guest gives you many perks and this hotel really takes care of its guests.  The steak and eggs breakfast in Bob's is just the best breakfast.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful and very appreciative that we stayed there.  I very strongly recommend this hotel.  The location is also great for visiting Central Park or even going to a show.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: I was on the phone and the net to try to prepay for my son's room It was quite the runaround  when my son arrived late at night, his partner's name was on the reservation, but not his .I spent a lot of time working on this, and it still wasnt correct!  Our rooms were smaller than I remember and the bath tub  had only one had to help entering and exiting

title: Overrated
text: Way overrated.  Small rooms with little amenities and management balked at promise to correct valet parking nightmare.  The walk too the far away parking garage to and from the hotel in the rain with my luggage and disabled wife was certainly a turn off.

title: Excellent choix !
text: Excellente situation entre la 5 ème Avenue et Madison Avenue, pas loin de 2 stations de métro, de Times Square et de Central Park. Service au top, personnel très serviable, chambre nickel et literie extrêmement confortable, ce qui n est pas négligeable après avoir marché énormément !

title: lovely hotel
text: we stayed here for five nights with our adult daughter for a special birthday.  we told Suzanne and she kindly  had cake and wine placed in our room the first night which was so kind and much appreciated..  .we received a fantastic welcome from Rachel and it would have been nice to have received a similar response from the receptionist checking us out!   we had enrolled as select guests so had free Wi-Fi during our stay, we had coffee on our first morning which was most welcome  but unfortunately not on the others. The hotel does provide citrus water by the elevators which was always welcomed but it was very wet during our stay and it would have been lovely to have been able to make a hot drink before we went out and came back something we have always been able to in other countries.   we received great help from the concierges especially Ms Murphy.  This is not a criticism of the hotel but  we had no where to dry our wet clothes I am sure our cases doubled in weight  with our wet clothes but we were very grateful for the umbrellas the Omni provided. The hotel does not provide shower gel just bath soap but I assume this is  the American way! As soon as I arrived home there was an email asking about or stay.. .

title: Wonderful staff and room
text: Very courteous staff were very helpful which was nice since this was our first time in NYC. The doormen, the bellmen, the staff at the front desk and even the painter doing touch ups around the building were all very polite which was unexpected. I guess one shouldn't always believe the cliche's one hears about a city or it's residents. We will be back for sure.

title: Our 17th NYC hotel review. Standard 4 star chain. nice perks for club members
text: this is a very typical 4 star hotel so if you have been in one before, you know what to expect. a little bland but everything well maintained. if you are a club member you get two items pressed for free and free coffee delivered in the morning. the lack of a coffee maker or even water in the room is a minus but overall, decent choice for the east side.

title: Magnifique hôtel très central
text: Excellent hôtel très bien situé à proximité des transports et à courte distance de la plupart des endroits à visiter. Personnel aux petits soins et chambre très joliment décorée avec un grand lit et tout le nécessaire. N’oubliez pas de souscrire au programme de fidélité pour avoir de jolies surprises. Seul bémol, pas de petit déjeuner buffet et prix exorbitants pour la nourriture. Mais tout New York est très cher.

title: Family
text: We received perfect service from the bellman, check in desk and cleaning staff.  I look forward to another stay. We visited New York for a graduation, and did not have time for sighhtseeing.  The location is perfect for a walk to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway, and many other destinations.

title: A comfortable, well located hotel.
text: This is a high quality, service oriented hotel.  It is not for the budget traveler but one can find deals on-line.  I did not have any food or beverage at the hotel but the all day deli across the street has all you might need.  I recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in mid-town Manhattan

title: Nice hotel, staff a mixed bag of very good and average quality.Good location.
text: Hotel was immaculately clean and check out at lunchtime was good. When my wife mentioned this trip was for my birthday, the lady receptionist offered a room upgrade on the 7th floor with a view of Madison Ave for $30 a night which we accepted.View was excellent.  Our room was nice with a king size bed. Again the room was immaculate, but no tea or coffee making facilities which apparently is nothing new for U.S. hotels. (This was our first trip to the U.S.). Mini bar was empty and no water. Initially, we were under the impression that we could ask for a couple of bottles of water from reception when the water dispenser in the concierge area was empty but after a couple of days of asking, we were met with the reply from two separate receptionists of "I'll see if we have any left."  and they came back with "This is the last one." Of course it was(!) We ate once at the hotel restaurant. We ordered steak and salmon. Both were incredibly salty and the wine very expensive. We got the impression that the hotel was aimed more at corporate customers than us tourists. On the eve of our departure, (we needed a cab at 5am for our flight), we were told by a friend that the main bridges would be closed. We checked at reception the afternoon before our departure and were told to see the concierge. On approaching him, we were greeted with a very disdainful look and dismissively told that "the bridges would be open and reception could have told us that".  Personally, I did not really care of the internal politics between staff, all we were doing was making 100% sure we did not miss our flight! The door staff we were very polite and accommodating.Housekeeping staff kept our room absolutely immaculate. Thank you, ladies! xx  Overall, a pleasant stay, but the jury is still out if we would stay there again, but thanks to the staff who made our trip worthwhile.

title: Very nice stay at the Omni Berkshire NYC
text: The hotel is in a very nice location.  Within walking of Broadway and Central Park.  Good restaurants nearby and high end shopping.  The rooms are very nice but not luxurious.  The service staff was excellent. I would stay there again.

title: Super zentrale Lage!
text: Das Hotel liegt um die Ecke vom Rockefeller Plaza. Zum Times Square somit  nur ca. 10 Minuten. Das Zimmer war ausreichend groß, leider ohne Kühlschrank.  Der Gang vom Aufzug zum Zimmer war zu stark herunter gekühlt (sogar für Ami-Verhältnisse zu kalt). Service hat gepasst.

title: very satisfied
text: I love this location, handy to everything and out of the crowds of the city. Rooms are clean, people are very friendly. I love the number of suites available, restaurant/bar are good, nice gym and outside space.

title: IN ALL MY YEARS..............
text:
In all my years of staying in hotels...and being in NYC, I've never ever been actually asked for a tip !!!!   Today it happened twice in the same hotel by the same employee!  Perhaps he's not being paid as much as he thinks he's worth?   My wife was trying to cross the street in front of the hotel...the doorman (this morning 5/9/18   7:55 AM ) offered to help her....however in the same sentence he asked her if she had her cash ready for the service....my wife thought he was kidding until she got on the other side and the doorman stood there, took out lot of cash and asked her if she needed change!  She said no and walked away.....   Later I about to leave the room and go have breakfast when I received a call from the doorman advising me that my limo was downstairs. I told him thank you , but the limo is early...He told me that he needs the room on the street and that I must come down now !  I guess the hotel doesn't care about not serving me breakfast and making money.....when I walked outside, he asked me the same question....if I have my cash ready or do I need change?  I looked at him and kept walking....upon getting in the limo my driver told me that the doorman told him that he must come up wtth cash....he wasn't really parked in front of the hotel, he as up the block..!  My driver didn't give him any cash either..!
I had a meeting at a nearby 5 star hotel....the service from the doorman was night and day.....there is a difference!!
The omni is nice....but it doesn't go the extra mile in any sense of the word....the employees are for the most part very matter of the fact...and the doormen have a lot of nerve....
ENOUGH SAID !

title: A reasonable stay, but not top of the line
text:
The Omni Berkshire Hotel is a kind of property that makes an effort, but just comes up a little short if you peel back the outside layers and see what is beneath the surface. I stayed recently with the wife and here was our experience:

Pros:
+ The staff tried. They were friendly and made an effort to help out whenever they could.

Cons:
- I understand NYC is loud. You can't control what happens outside of the windows. But you can control how well the room is soundproofed, and when I can hear conversations in adjacent rooms, it is disappointing.
- Details in a hotel like this matter. For example, when the cup that is in the bathroom is stained on the bottom, it bothers me. At a Holiday Inn, it is less of an issue, but the Omni is held to a higher standard.

All in all, this is more of a 3.5 star property. Would I return? Probably not, given the plethora of choices in New York.

title: Loved It
text: The Omni Berkshire Place in Manhattan, New York was a great place to stay.  Will stay there again.  Everything was wonderful.  From the front desk to guest services, I completely recommend.  Bob's Steak and Chop was just icing on the cake.

title: Mother and Daughter trip to celebrate her significant birthday
text: Stayed 3  nights. the location is perfect for visiting the city. Staff are very helpful and welcoming. Our room was small, but very clean and well appointed. I would definitely return. The bar is a great place to relax after a busy day, excellent service.

title: Beautiful Hotel. Slightly flawed
text:
Was in town for a three day event. Checked in Monday afternoon and the front desk staff were incredibly nice and accommodating. I was in 925, which is right next to the room where the cleaning people store all of their stuff so their is a lot of little noises during the day. No big deal as I wasn’t around during the day, for the most part. When I did have to spend time in the room, it was a pain, for other reasons. Room was a consistent 65, which made me cold and I kept a hoodie and slippers on most of the time. And no, the thermostat did not allow me to change the temperature. I put it on 75 and it just kept giving me cold air. The internet did not work and required a 20 minute call with tech support to get it working. Once the internet worked, I just spent all my hote time under the covers to keep warm. To be honest, at that temperature, another blanket would have been nice. Sleeping was difficult because the bed was hard so I ended up rolling around a lot. 

I let the hotel staff know about the temperature issue and they said, “ok.”  Hopefully they fix it but I’ll probably not be back anytime soon.

title: Wonderful start to finish
text: From the moment your vehicle approaches the Omni staff are making sure your stay is a great one. Doormen, bellmen, front desk clerks and housekeeping staff all combine to make a stay at the Omni Berkshire wonderful.

title: nice location
text: I was happy to be able to walk just one block to Saint Patrick's cathedral and Rockefeller Center, and just 2 blocks to the Museum of Modern Art. On a Friday afternoon after 4pm, admission to MOMA was free. Our meeting was being held in the hotel itself.

title: Stay here!
text: We spent 5 nights at the hotel for my parents special birthdays - fabulous staff on reception, concierge and the door who couldn't do enough to help.  The room was a great size -  clean with a comfy bed - we were on the 3rd floor which was a little noisy from road noise  - but if you want a great hotel, in the heart of Manhattan, minutes away from 5th avenue -  it's to be expected. Would recommend and stay here again!

title: Girls birthday trip
text: We stayed at the beautiful Omni Berkshire hotel last weekend to celebrate 2 best friends turning 11 years old. I first had the pleasure of speaking with Suzanne and discussed our celebration on the phone prior to our trip-she was extremely professional and accommodating. Upon check in, our first contact was with the wonderful doormen that made sure we were safe exiting the taxi. The front desk staff again extremely helpful including our girls in conversation. Our room was beautiful- nice large bathroom. The umbrellas were extremely helpful on an unexpected rainy day! Mary and Beatriz, experts and our lifesavers in concierge, not only helped to give us options on dining, but made the reservations and made sure we knew where we were going! Also- asking us how things were on return!  The fruit and wine/ milk and cookies that we found in our room after our play was a fun unexpected treat and the birthday cake sent the next night on “the fancy table” made the girls smile in excitement! We ended our weekend with room service breakfast in bed! What a treat! Felt like royalty as we were instructed to let them take care of us! Above and beyond! We are thankful for all the memories that made this trip unforgettable! We will never stay any where else! Thanks to Lenny for the picture before our play! You and the other guys are really wonderful To see when we first enter the hotel- so engaging! Thanks for all you do! You are all the best!

title: We enjoyed our stay
text:
Just returned from spending 3 nights here.   It is a very comfortable hotel.   Though it was odd that there were no top sheets on our beds the first night (annoying to find that after a long day of walking and it was too late to really call someone plus we just wanted to sleep).

The next day they put the sheets on the bed.    The know on our bathroom sink leaked water all over the counter but they fixed it the next day so that was good.

I do wish they provided a few complimentary water bottles in the room, that would be a nice touch.   The location is great.  Isadora's across the street is quick and convenient if you need a sandwich or food for any meal.

They did bring up cookies the first night for our daughters.   The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had lots of large mirrors (very important when sharing a bathroom with 2 daughters) and the rooms were well appointed.

title: Great rate, good experience
text: We stayed here for my birthday weekend in late March. I shopped around extensively and finally secured a great rate at the Omni. As a matter of fact, the rate dropped after I made my reservation and the Omni was happy to honor the lower rate when I called with no fuss. I would say this is a solid 4 star hotel, but not a 4.5 star hotel. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom average. There was no free water and no mini fridge. The website stated that you could request a mini fridge for your room which I did, confirmed and asked again upon check in. Guess what? No mini fridge was in the room. Oh well, it did not ruin our stay. Finally, we had a view of the backside of some neighboring buildings. However, I determined this was the reason our room was so quiet (no street noise) so I would not necessarily regarding this as a bad thing. I would encourage you to stay here if you get a great rate.

title: Location, location, location
text:
If you're looking for a hotel in mid-town Manhattan, you're looking for location, not cost-effectiveness. This hotel is easy walking distance from Times Square and the theater district.
Check-in was fast, friendly and efficient.
The room was comfortable. House-keeping was efficient and unobtrusive.
The Concierge and other staff were friendly and helpful.
The TV was a fossil, insisting on starting at high volume and having to navigate through a cumbersome menu to find the channels requires. Often the system froze. This was a negative.
Room service options were rudimentary.
Wi-Fi was not free although they did give us complimentary access when we asked. In this day and age free Wi-Fi should not be favor grudgingly granted.
Checkout was quick.
Parking is a problem. Anywhere in New York I suppose. I rented a car to enter, left my luggage in the hotel and returned the car, reversing the process when checking out.

title: Best Value NYC
text: The hotel is located in a safe and convenient part of NYC.  Great for family or couples get away.  There are SO many options when staying in NYC but this hotel and it's location is perfect for a quite and elegant experience.  While staying here, be sure to visit the adjacent restaurant Bob's Chop House.  Remarkable value for the quality food and service.  If you are intending to attend the theatre district, this is a short ride.  The hotel offers all the wonderful amenities Omni does so well at all their locations and the staff is top shelf.  We have stayed here twice and have become familiar and appreciative of the neighborhood with abundant restaurants and shopping.  Unlike other hotels in NYC, you will rest peacefully without all the night sounds of sirens and trash trucks.  The gym is also really nice!  Check in/out is a breeze and friendly. Across the street is a great restaurant Fig & Olive.  Perfect proportions if you want quality food at a fantastic price and experience if you need a harty snack prior to lunch or dinner.  Obviously, you can find less/more expensive hotels but this is a great value all things considered.

title: A weekend in the big apple
text: It was our first visit to this hotel and we would definitely return!  The room, a standard king, was spacious (by NYC standards) with plenty of room for suitcases, etc. and the bathroom was very nice with a great shower.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet, even though we were next to the ice machine!  We had to call maintenance as the iron didn’t work but the gentleman on duty showed up with a new one within minutes!  And he was as friendly as the front desk staff and the door men.  We didn’t eat here so I can’t comment on the food.  The only thing I wish they provided was bottled water in the rooms.

title: An outstanding experience
text: The Omni Berkshire in Midtown Manhattan provided the usual over the top customer service during a weekend excursion to New York.  This was our first stay at this Omni Property, but as with our stays at many other Omni properties, the staff at the Berkshire were over the top in providing outstanding customer service!  Every one was gracious and we we enjoyed a marvelous stay!

title: Great Location, Exceptional Staff, Truly Comforting, Will Return!!
text:
My wife and I were driving our daughter home to Brooklyn and we wanted to stay in NYC and catch a show which we did. We were at this location last year, We used our Discovery membership for the stay which includes wifi bottles of water and 2 carafes of coffee each morning quite the perks.  The staff was accommodating from the restaurant to the front desk to the housekeeping. 

On sunday afternoon just before leaving the hotel for the 3pm showing of Hello Dolly (which was fantastic by the way) I stopped at the concierge desk to ask for a florist as my wife's birthday was on monday. Melissa Scotti informed me of 2 florists to contact.  When we returned from the theatre and dinner we found a surprise in the room. A bottle of Proseco and a delicious red velvet cake wishing a "Happy Birthday" along with turn down service of the bed. Quite a surprise and very kind of them.  We stayed last year, returned this year, still a great place to stay and look forward to returning!!

title: Omni Berkshire New York
text: This hotel is a beautiful example of a classic New York City hotel. The room was immaculate and well-appointed. The lobby and general areas were lovely. And the desk staff were welcoming and efficient. The valet car service worked most efficiently. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Omni Berkshire and will definitely return for future visits.

title: Lacked warmth but conveniently positioned
text:
I chose a different hotel for this visit as I wanted to be closer to Central Park for my one night stay.  The location was perfect, almost next door to my office and a short jog from Central Park.

The hotel, by New York standards, was medium to large size with an imposing lobby. Reception had one person working there early evening when I arrived and check-in was lacklustre but acceptable.

My room was ok.  I was there for one night and what else could I need other than a bed, bathroom and TV.  Water.  I needed water and there wasn't any!  There was a restaurant but no vending machine, obvious bar area and for the amount of money the room cost why was there no water?!

Checkout took a bit longer than I expected and wasted some time, making this 12 hour stay very average.

As a location and basic hotel with no frills I recommend but that's it.  No views, basic service and an average room (without drinking water!!).

title: NOT a 4.5 star hotel.....poor beds and poor service
text: The only really good was the location....and then it fell apart....beds were awful....3 pillows for a king size bed......nothing great about hotel.  If you are looking for a 4.5 star hotel you need to pick another one....there is nothing special about this hotel and the staff is not friendly.

title: Excellent Staff, Very good location, nice rooms
text: Our three night stay at the Omni Berkshire was very pleasing, particularly regarding the service.  As soon as we stepped into the hotel, we were greeted and assisted... although when I insisted on carrying my own bags, I was pleasantly surprised that the Bellman did not force himself upon me, nor was he upset, as I have experienced in other hotels.  Those at the front desk were friendly and we were checked in earlier than I had expected.  The hotel is not too large, which I appreciate, as I hate getting lost in the various lobbies, waiting rooms, lounges, bars, etc.  The room was of a decent size for New York, although the area around the bed by the closet was tight, especially for 2 people.  I would rearrange the furniture or get a smaller desk and place it in the spot of the closet.  One could see that there was some updating and some not, but it was clean which is of the utmost importance.  It was not dingy, dusty, dirty, etc.  The bathtub was old, which was fine for me as I was not there to take a spa bath.  It was clean and spacious, again of the utmost importance for me.  The bed was comfortable, the linens nice and crisp, and I truly appreciated the curtains, as they extended across the entire window, thus closing out all of the city lights at night, which is extremely important.  Speaking of the night, being that the hotel is on a side street, it was quieter than if on 5th Ave, which was 1/2 block away.  It's still the city, however, and thus expect some sirens and honking horns. It would have been nice to have a coffee/tea machine and a small refrigerator.  Nonetheless, we had some very good sleep and superb service in this hotel.  Moreover, the price was quite good, but it was not during the high season.  I would recommend this hotel to those looking for a comfortable, clean space to stay whilst in NYC.  And again, the service from all was fantastic!

title: Location
text: Very near of many palaces of my interest  Rcockefeller, san Patrick, moma, Central Park, time square,, also a very good place to take breakfast just 2 blocks, 2 subway lines around the corner, The have also water in the desk front and just 2 5 block from gran central

title: Excellent Midtown Hotel
text: Been staying at the Omni Berkshire for about 20 years now.  I am fairly particular about hotels that I stay at, having traveled across the globe for business and pleasure.  Consistently: - Clean - Quiet - Excellent service - Overall value  The location is outstanding: -  Surrounded by excellent restaurants of various types. -  5 blocks to Central Park, 2 blocks to Rockefeller Center, right next to 5th Avenue.    They have also recently added "Bob's" steakhouse, which has solid food and drink options for when one just wants to stay in.  Staff is very polite and responsive.

title: excellence in the city
text: Excellent hotel. All the amenities.  Location in the city was convenient to all midtown attractions from the Museum of Modern Art to Rockefeller Center.  Staff was friendly, attentive and professional.  Will definitely return in future.

title: Will be back
text: The best house keeping I've experienced in quite some time. Lovely terrace on 17th floor for coffee & reading the morning paper. Location is excellent - you are very close to much that NYC has to offer.

title: Has it all!
text: From check-in, to daily greetings, to check-out; this hotel was a perfect combination of it all. The location was perfect and the room was so cozy and comfortable. The only thing I wish they had was in room coffee. But the cafe across the street served cheap and yummy breakfast selections and good coffee. Eric at the front desk was a charm and provided above and beyond service. We will be coming back to this hotel mainly because of his service.

title: Top class hotel
text: This is a hidden gem of a hotel smack in the middle of Manhattan . The staff were helpful and very friendly . We woke up every morning to coffee and tea dilivered to our room . We enjoyed our stay we have booked for November.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Loved the location of this hotel, you can walk to most attractions, just off 5th avenue, Mary Murphy on the concierge desk was very helpful as were all the staff, Isadoras deli across the street served beautiful pancakes, oatmeal, fresh orange juice to mention a few all cooked fresh, when I return to New York I will definitely book this hotel again

title: Early April stay at Omni Berkshire, NY
text: Overall, OK hotel in nice area of NY City. Was staying overnight for a show and was close to Broadway, while being far enough from Times Square to avoid the craziness.  Room was OK, needs much better sound proofing as you hear way too much noise from outside.  On 6th floor, with windows closed, sounded like you were right on the street.  Do not order room service unless money is no object.  2 Burgers and fries for $ 85.00 was outrageous.  Not quite up to the usual Omni standards.  Thank You.

title: Amazing Stay
text: The Omni Berkshire exceeded my expectations!!  The location is convenient to many of the shops and sights in downtown NYC.  In addition to the convenient location, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.

title: Best Hotel in Manhattan, Best bartenders ever
text: Upon visiting the city for pleasure I find it necessary to inform the world of a great hotel with a great staff. From checkin to checkout all was fantastic. Nevertheless there is always something that stands out. For us it was the bartender Sonny Koltovski at the bar in Bobs Steakhouse. He might be the most friendly, quick witted and knowledgable server we have ever met. Recently a holdover at now closed Waldorf, the Omni must recognize what they got when he arrived.Perfect drink, conversation and again quick wit says it all. Without a doubt the best we have ever encountered. On the prettier side there was Ellen who was pretty good herself and along with Robert a great staff. Maybe the best trio ever. Feel like friends we laughed so much. So if ever in NYC make the Omni your place. And then ask for Sonny. You won't regret it.

title: The only hotel to stay in uptown
text: The hotel has a great location and the staff is very efficient and accommodating. It's my 3rd. time staying and it's the only hotel that is reasonable for New York City. The rooms are not a closet like so many hotels in New York.

title: Very Good Experince
text: We have stayed at numerous NY hotels and this one will now be our go-to hotel when we return.  The room size was very good for NY standards, very clean, and the bathroom was a good size.  The location was great.

title: A repeat customer has a bad experience. Construction noise all night, which prevented any sleep, my news channel on TV w
text: Construction noise kept us up all night, buzzing noise from a light in the bathroom, favorite news channel would not work and no bathroom n the gym( extremely inconvenient) We waited from 8 to 12 to get a room and then had to be moved the following day due to the noise.

title: Efficient and comfortable, but no free wifi
text:
The Good
Clean, comfortable, efficient, with polite staff.  
Room was well sound proofed, and bed comfortable.
Great location for midtown, lots of great places to eat in the area.

The Not So Good
Wifi was not free (irritating, and at these prices should be included).

title: Fantastic one-night stay
text: The service was phenomenal and the room was immaculate and decent-sized by NYC standards. It was also quiet -- I couldn't hear anything from neighboring rooms or hallway activity. The hotel is in walking distance from the MOMA, St. Patrick's, and Central Park. Overall, it was a wonderful one-night stay.

title: Great location and affordable
text: This is my second time at the Omni Berkshire place NYC.  The location is perfect at 52nd and Madison.  The rooms are large, the beds comfortable and the lobby very pleasant.  Most importantly, it's a fantastic deal for Manhattan.

title: Top Choice in NYC
text: The Omni Berkshire Place is my go-to hotel in New York on business trips. The location is incredible (52nd between Madison and 5th Ave) and so much is walkable. Rooms are a good size and super-comfortable (I don’t agree with some of the negative comments I’ve seen about the beds and bed linen - I’m from England originally and so am quite used to having a duvet without a sheet, and I am quite certain that they change the duvet covers when guests leave). The staff are courteous and helpful. There aren’t a ton of amenities ... the gym is very nice and Bob’s Steak House (the in-house restaurant) is fabulous - I live in Texas and Bob’s is based there, and serves the best steak I have ever had). I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent Experience
text: The hotel is in an excellent location at Midtown Manhattan. So much is within walking distance. The rooms are sizable. The staff were friendly from the front door to the registration desk to the room service.

title: Skip this one
text:
Pros: 
location, beautiful lobby, beautiful bathrooms, clean, magnifying mirror in bath. 

Cons: 
So unhelpful. Hotel wasn’t fully booked but they refused to give us two rooms away from street side. In fact when we asked to pls move before we settled in they put us across from two elevators and near a machine room. SO LOUD so highly disturbed sleep (and here I thought that was the purpose of staying here). 
- No sheet just a duvet. 
- No turn down all 3 nights. 
- No robes despite it being the ONLY amenity listed. 
- No ice anywhere. 
- No coffee or water or anything offered in room
- No views from rooms. Just a building across the street and ugly rooftop. 
- Beds almost as firm as the floor. We should have left after the first night but they refused to refund. We’ve stayed elsewhere with them but after this I’ll never give Omni our business again. 

The positives have to be shills. Seriously wished I had believed the negatives and had stayed elsewhere.

title: over priced
text: this hotel is overpriced.   even compared to NYC rates.  Look around there are other just as nice hotels at a better rate.  the bed does not have a top sheet  - just a duvet and I am not sure if the hotel changes these as the guests check out and I am not going to sleep in a bed where the previous guest slept without new bed linens.  so be aware and make sure you ask for a top sheet for the bed.

title: The heart of Manattan
text: We stayed here for 6 days as part of a package with some others visiting from the English National Opera. It was a nice hotel, rather dated and limited in facilities, but welcoming and conveniently located. We had a problem with the heating in our room on the first day, but once we pointed it out, it was fixed very quickly and on the whole the staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant was a bit expensive to eat in, but then this is Madison Avenue, I guess

title: Omni Berkshire New York - well worth it
text: It was our second stay at the Omni Berkshire in New York and once again it was a good one. I like the hotel (location, service, rooms -- all good) and the Omni brand. The rooms are very nice, the location is great, the staff are friendly and competent and try to accommodate requests (early check in etc). Highly recommended!

title: Great hotel
text: The Omni Berkshire is our must stay hotel when in NYC.  Well situated, clean, friendly staff.  Wonderful loyalty program. Great amenities.  The staff is very helpful, politez and courteous.  When in NYC, we always choose the Omni.

title: Great midtown business hotel
text:
My use of the Omni Berkshire is for business meetings and it is excellent - both in guest services and in meeting support. It’s also in a good location for other purposes (Shopping, museums, the cathedral) but these haven’t been my foci. 

Guest rooms are medium sized by NYC standards (larger than average but not compared to other luxury hotels. There’s only one restaurant but it’s good (and the hotel is close to a hundred other choices). Service is strong.

title: GREAT LOCATION
text:
This hotel was conveniently located near 5th Avenue, Rockefeller, NBC and the Today show, Radio City Music Hall, the subway station, and HALAL GUYS.  The room itself was quite small for the four of us, we only had 2 double beds and there isn't room for a rollaway so we brought our own blow up air mattress. For almost $600/night I would have expected at least queen mattresses and a refrigerator.

NO REFRIGERATOR in our room. They delivered cookies and chocolate milk at night when we checked in, and I wanted to put the milk in the refrig for the kids to consume in the morning because I do not want my kids eating chocolate cookies and milk before they go to bed!! We ended up dumping all the milk because we couldn't keep it cold. 

TWO CLOSETS to hang your coats and jackets. We barely had room to open up our 4 suitcases in the room. 

BATHROOM was small. The toilet was leaking water all over the floor the whole entire time we were there, but I never said anything because I kept thinking it was my kids making a mess, but every day when we came back sure enough there was water on the floor. We only stayed in the room at night and I don't like maintenance crews coming in while I'm not in the room. 

Overall I liked the location of the hotel and the water that they put next to the elevators. My only complaint is they don't put it out early enough/leave it out long enough. After walking 9 miles a day trying to catch subways etc, I looked forward to that cup of water before heading to my room.

title: Nice stay
text:
Ankunft und checkin um Mitternacht war etwas holprig.
Meine Frage nach dem stockwerk wurde nicht beantwortet. Auf die Frage, was ein kostenpflichtiges Upgrade kosten würde, war die Antwort ausverkauft fragen sie morgen den Manager. Da wir für 3 Nächte gebucht hatten, beliess ich die gebuchte Zimmerkategorie sein.
Zimmer sehr sauber, tolles Fitness im 17. Stock, insgesamt freundliches und aufmerksames Personal. Unvernünftige Frühstückpreise. Es war für meine frau und mich ein guter und angenehmer Omni Aufenthalt.

title: Go To in NYC
text: I took my daughter to NYC the first time 3 years ago and after some research I chose the Omni.  Fast forward and this was our 3rd stay.  We took a mini family vacation last year with 2 rooms and had the best time.  This year returned again and from the rooms, location, staff, I will always return to the Omni.  We save all year for our mini vacations and enjoy our time so much.

title: Weekend Girls Trip to NYC
text: My friend and I took our musical theater loving daughters to NYC for a weekend of Broadway shows & shopping. The Omni Berkshire is a beautiful hotel in a great location! Close to Rockefeller Center and not far from Times Square and the Theater district. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

title: Nice Hotel in Great Location
text: The hotel is on 52nd between Madison and 5th - great location and easy in and out.  Nice steakhouse attached to hotel.  Decent sized room.  Bathroom has nice magnifying mirror but fair overall lighting.  As a rewards club member, you have coffee delivered to your door in the morning!

title: Nice Hotel
text: Very nice location and nice rooms.  There are few inexpensive restaurants near by so be prepared to pay a lot for meals!!  There is no refrigerator or coffee pot in the room.  The rate was fair for the location, however for the same amount there are hotels with more amenities in the room.  We had to ask for ice from the front desk as the machines were broken.  Only received turn down service one night.

title: Nice Mid-Town Location at good price
text: Good location just off Madison Ave in Mid-Town. We walked to Harlem one day and back from  WTC another day.  Short walk to theater district. comfortable room, nice size bathroom. Was able to open window for fresh air which helps when heat is on.  Will stay there again next year when we visit.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location, nice hotel, clean and nicely appointed room, especially liked the bathroom. Friendly staff, feels like a small hotel. I really can recommend this hotel highly for any kind of trip to New York.

title: So far my favorite Omni
text: My husband I had have stayed with Omni several times over the years, and although others have a resort atmosphere to offer the Berkshire is my favorite so far.  Our room was HUGE- in NYC!  Plenty of space, great bathroom & shower and very quite.  I sleep like a rock.  The service was also top notice, no issues there at all.  Our coffee was also delivered on time.  Centrally located in Midtown & close to everything.  We will return.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed there over the weekend and loved the location. Great rooms and actually pretty spacious for NYC. Staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great stay. Also loved the interior design which was old school style.

title: Nice Stay
text: My fiance and I had a nice time at the hotel. We were checked in quickly and any questions we had were answered. The room was clean and the bed sheets crisp. The shower had great water pressure and there was a comp robe and hair dryer. The towels were a little scratchy but nothing to get in a fuss about.

title: Anniversary Trip
text: We just left the Omni Berkshire Place for our 8th wedding anniversary and we loved the hotel! It was my first time to NYC and I felt like we were located in the perfect spot. Great, spacious room that was very clean. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby which was great. The drinks in the restaurant located in the hotel was VERY pricey so just be prepared! Lastly, our favorite part about the hotel was the doorman, Lenny! Since the first day we were there he always greeted us and talked to us while we waited outside for a car or if we were about to walk around Manhattan. Everyday when we saw him he always had the biggest smile on his face and was so friendly. Kudos to the Omni and thanks to Lenny for making our experience great!

title: Good location and rooms BUT...
text: Having been indicated by front desk over the phone that external calls to New Jersey were quite cheap, imagine my surprise when 2 calls, one to NJ and the other to Connecticut, both less than half an our in length, were charged to my bill at $120. I think the word is usury. On departure I was in a hurry, though a young man sympathetically admitted that their telephone charges were exceptionally high. Oh well, never again. It's no way to treat guests.

title: Service ok
text: My experience was okay, checking in was prompt. Rooms were big, bedding was good, long wait at the concierge but once past that the service was great. Check out was also prompt although we wanted to stay another day the hotel was not willing to honor the price from previous reservation.

title: Quick Trip
text:
Last minute overnight trip to NYC had us booking on the Hotel Tonight app at 9pm. We arrived in NYC from DC at 1am on March 24th and found the hotel to be in a great location. We checked into room 519 which was a well appointed 2 room suite. Very traditional furnishings, clean and comfortable. Just what we needed after a delayed train ride that got us in at 1am. 

A little disappointed that we could not get a later check out as the hotel was booked. And then on second inspection we noticed that the wine glasses in the room had been used and still had red wine in them. Definitely did not notice that at 1am but sure did when we checked out at 12noon. 

It looks like the hotel is doing some modest updates (painting, etc). All in all I would stay again.

title: Perfect hotel
text:
As a member of the loyalty program, i was given an upgrade to a superior room. This was one of the largest rooms I have enjoyed in Manhattan. The room was a great size, with a separate armchair and footstool, desk area and a large, clean, large bathroom.

Having mentioned it was my wedding anniversary the hotel was good enough to give us sparkling wine and chocolate strawberries.

As mentioned on other reviews, the hotel can provide a coffee machine in the room on request, and it is worth joining the omni loyalty scheme just to get the free coffee delivered to  the room every morning as a  loyalty member!

title: Great Girls Weekend
text: Great central location for a girls weekend. This is a perfect hotel with excellent staff.  Doormen offered suggestions for dining and entertainment outside of the normal places.  They also made sure we knew some safety rules for using Uber and cabs.

title: Great Hotel in great location
text: Phillip at front desk was awesome. Location was perfect, easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Central Park and Broadway area. The Madison Suite was very spacious and comfortable. Noise from the street was minimal. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Back again for a wonderful weekend
text: Fantastic weekend getaway to NYC. Omni Berkshire was a wonderful place to stay as always. Location is terrific (1/2 a block walk to watch the St.Patricks parade. Beautiful room, great staff. Five stars!

title: Very comfortable and well located.
text: We spent two days, the room was big and comfortable. Service was very helpful at any time. Staying at Omni was a very good experience. It was not the first time we stayed at this hotel and definitely not the last one.

title: Great location
text: Very nice hotel with a great location. The room was great for our needs (we were mostly out and the bed was very comfortable). The room was on 6th floor so street noise can be an issue. However the curtains, if pulled create a very nice sound barrier.

title: Just one night but good
text: Arrived teatime on St Patrick's Day and left the next afternoon so it was a short stay but everything was great.  Very centrally located close to the Subway and 5th/Madison and I could leave my luggage there while I went exploring before heading for the airport.

title: My new favorite place
text: Everything was perfect from location to staff to beautiful room to cleanliness.   I will never stay anywhere else in NY.   it just couldn't be better.  The staff somehow made us feel like we were the only ones there and that they'd known us forever.

title: Beautiful room!
text: Beautiful room, wonderful staff, felt welcome the minute I walked in to the second I left!! Received a free upgrade! Would definitely recommend!!!!!!!!!! The only complaint was that room service was very expensive so we used #ubereats! No biggie!

title: Great location - wonderful service
text: For location alone this hotel is great, but add old world charm, thoughtful service and clean you have a winner. Not a cookie cutter hotel, the rooms are spacious, the bed was wonderful, bathroom impeccably clean. If your room package includes breakfast at Bobs Steak house, don't miss it - who doesn't love white tablecloth service first thing in the morning.

title: Better choices in this price range
text: Beautiful small hotel that is centrally located right off of Madison Ave. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Food option is resturant next door. No gift shop for quick soda or snack. Room was very noisey from traffic below. Service was lacking with multiple requests for simple things like newspaper.

title: Speravo meglio
text: Abbiamo scelto questo hotel in virtù della nostra precedente esperienza presso l'Omni hotel di San Francisco (eccellente, in quell'occasione): decisamente non allo stesso livello!!! Piuttosto deludente: camere con arredo piuttosto "basic" e trasandato per un hotel di questo livello, dotazione scarsa (vedere il vano frigo-bar senza frigorifero risulta piuttosto squallido). Vale per la posizione: a piedi si raggiunge il parco, il Moma, Broadway, Rockefeller Centre....fermata di metro a due minuti.

title: Great Value, and more...
text:
Stayed 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. Began with check in with Analefia(?) who was both informative and charming. Our room was spacious and comfortable on 4th Floor. Used workout facility on 17th Floor and enjoyed complimentary coffee delivered to room daily. 

Location is tops, and our rate was a terrific value. We visit NYC often and know how rates run.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Suzzane & Rachel are the most Welcoming Loyalty Ambassador's.  They wholeheartedly rectify any issues that seem to challenge my travels.  As great as the Omni Berkshire Hotel is, there can always be expected   hiccups & human errors.  They make every effort to make it a flawless stay.  Thank you

title: Convenient location, efficient, friendly and clean
text: What more do you need in a hotel?  I have stayed in this hotel for decades and find it to be my NYC home. The personnel has changed but the service remains excellent. I watched the cleaning lady clean my room and she did not skip any steps. I am allergic to dust so the vacuuming was appreciated

title: Quick Visit to the City
text:
I flew into town to catch a Knicks game in February.  I was somewhat concerned by some of the reviews on here.  I am glad that I didn't let them deter me.  

I've stayed in different NYC shoeboxes (aka hotel rooms).  However, this property delivered in true Omni style.  From my pre-arrival email to my arrival at the front desk, to my departure, this hotel provided a level of customer service that is comparable to the Omni brand.  The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable.  This location is also close to a lot of the iconic shopping sites in NYC.  I would have no reservation about staying at this location again in the future.

Kudos to you and your staff as I was well-taken care of during my stay.

title: Hôtel sympa bien placé
text: Très joli hôtel au centre, bouche de métro à proximité. La chambre est bien, très propre, tout est fourni, manque un peu de discrétion vis-à-vis du couloir. Restaurant de l’hôtel pas top pour y avoir petit-déjeuné.

title: Great hotel!
text: This hotel was modern, clean, and spacious. Having stayed in NYC in numerous hotels, I can definitely say this was one of my favorite, especially for the price. Great location as well...we could easily walk all over town.

title: Great experience at this hotel!
text: We visit NYC several times a year and stay in different hotels and areas.  We had a great experience at this hotel in Midtown.  Check in was quick and easy, no wait, staff was very friendly.  The hotel is clean and very pretty.  We would definitely book our next stay here.

title: Excellent in every way
text: Stayed for a long weekend in February, from arrival to departure, excellent customer service, friendly, helpful team, who couldn’t do enough to help. Room was excellent size, spacious, with very comfortable bed and large bathroom and huge wardrobe for storage, no coffee making but that’s Ok, as there are several coffee shops just outside the hotel. Our room (1025) was at back of hotel and was super quiet, we slept like logs and didn’t hear any NYC city noise at all.  We ate in the restaurant, Bobs Steak and Chophouse, which was really excellent, and had drinks and snacks in the bar (great service again and fab choice and delicious food). All in all an excellent stay, as this incredibly central hotel, 5 mins to Rockefeller, 10 to Times Square, and right on 5th for high end shopping. Toiletries in room soap, shampoo, conditioner..my husband forgot his toiletry bag but thankfully there is a Duane Reade 2 mins walk so all resolved with a quick shopping trip!  Would definitely stay again when we next visit. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Great location/ so-so service
text: The location is fantastic. The hotel staff needs improvement. The good: location, Bob's, and day bellman. The bad: We checked in at midnight and the front desk staff and doorman were underwhelming, at best. The bellman didn't help with the door or our luggage. Every other bellman went out of their way to help during the day. We had cat food on our carpet for 3 days, we don't have a cat, so obviously the floor isn't vaccummed daily. The shower was cold for 2 days until I complained. The plug in the bathroom didn't work upon arrival, so I dryed my hair sitting on the floor near a working outlet. The bed is extremely uncomfortable. I could say more, but I won't. I definitely feel that I received what I paid for. The location is worth the price.

title: Used to be my favorite
text:
I have stayed at the Omni everytime i visit New York City because of its location and friendly staff who would welcome us back warmly like family  but  this last visit was not satisfactory.
Omni has not moved with the times and expectations of today’s times.
Really 
- no free wifi
- no coffee maker
- not even a bottle of water in room
- no fridge 
- no USB chargers in room ?
Is just not good enough at such pricey rates !!

title: Beautiful and comfortable place. Very convenient.
text: I booked as part of a group and my stay was very comfortable. Despite the occasional issues arising from group bookings, the hotel was able to accommodate for us.The manager who conducted our booking was beyond amazing, the staff were friendly except for your rare confused staff - we had one lady. The amenities for VIP were lovely, and many of our group enjoyed the fact that they weren't all lumped together on one floor next to each other. The hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and convenient. The location and staff, including the doorman were great!

title: Excellent hotel, great location
text: I had a pleasant stay with my daughter as we were in town for a quick getaway. Great location, hotel and staff. Would definitely come back. The hotel is very clean and location great for shopping, restaurants and places to see.

title: Nice hotel in good location
text:
My husband & I stayed here for 4 days during end of August last year.  We have tried a couple of different hotels in NYC, but they have usually been rooms with the addition of a kitchen & a separate bedroom. This time around we planned on eating out a bit more so we weren’t so bothered about the kitchenette, so opted for a standard room. 

It was a peasant enough hotel, room was clean & tidy & bathroom was huge. Plenty of space in the room for the time we were there. 

Hotel has a bar & restaurant, we had a drink in the bar but didn’t eat in the restaurant. It looked very pricey but then I expect that in a hotel in Manhattan. 

The hotel had a gym which we made good use of whilst there, in addition to enjoying a good run in Central Park! 

Hotel was in a good central location.

title: Excellent!
text: We love New York Omni hotel! Customer service is superb and the entire staff is very friendly and welcoming! The room is always so clean and pleasant. Morning coffee delivery is another great feature and the coffee is so fresh, I enjoy it so much! Each time we visit New York (my parents-in-law live in the city),  Omni is where we stay. We are regular customers here. We love everything about this hotel! Thank you so much for making us feel comfortable and happy! Keep up the great work! From Katz family with lots of love ❤️

title: Amazing
text: Great hotel with friendly staff. The doorman and bellman were extremely knowledgeable with places to go and see in the city. The rooms were spacious for NYC and extremely clean. I will be staying here in the future!

title: Great find in the heart of mid-town!
text: Great location, friendly staff.  The Omni was the perfect place for a weekend hub for all things Midtown and Theater related.  My only complaint was the lack of any real food options connected to the hotel for a quick bite for breakfast or snack (we did not try the steakhouse) but there are several places within walking distance.  The junior suite was perfect to provide a little extra room with kids in tow!

title: Terrific Hotel
text: This was my 2nd trip to this Omni hotel.  As a Black Level Member, I can tell you that this hotel knows how to take care of it's clientele. I always rank a hotel by the manner in which they handle challenges that guests face - and this hotel shines.  The management is great, and my requests were handled with grace and kindness.  Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location
text: Great location in the city, especially for shopping...the room was nice but nothing special. Great value for the location. Rooms are noisy, we could hear the persons alarm clock going off next door & people in the hall.

title: Excellent location, great price, friendly service.
text: First time we stayed here... our favorite has been getting a little tired lately so we decided to try somewhere new. The Omni was excellent on all counts... very competitive pricing for a beautiful suite. The service was superb, check-in staff were friendly and fast, and the adjacent bar / restaurant (Bob's Steak House) offers lots of options with the same friendliness as the hotel. Our new favorite in NY. Looking forward to staying again with the friendliest doorman in the city!

title: Lovely Stay
text: Excellent hotel for business stays. Comfortable, spacious and well appointed rooms with enough room to work. Location in midtown is great to access both East and West side of midtown. Would stay here again in a hearbeat.

title: Pleasure Trip
text: Whenever I travel to NY I make it a point to stay at this hotel.  Close to everything from shopping to Broadway shows to Sylvia's in Harlem for a nice soul food meal.  Definitely will be staying here again.

title: average
text: Not clean. No upgrades. Benefits of Select guest not received. Good location close to times square. Close to subway and MOMA. E train around the corner. Close to Madison and 5th ave.   Did do a great job on the shoe shine

title: Great stay, great value, excellent for travelling with baby
text: My husband and I stayed here for a Saturday night when we were in town for a friend's party. We got a suite for around $250 so we could put the baby down in one room and relax, watch tv and eat dinner without whispering :) It was perfect! The staff were super friendly upon arrival and helped us with everything. The hotel was very clean and spacious for what we needed, all at a great rate.

title: NY's Best Hotel
text: This hotel is outstanding. When I check-in into the OMNI I feel almost like seeing family again, such is the warmth with which I am received. And the OMNI is the best located hotel in NY. Very close to everything. Period.

title: Down hill
text: Lots of cuts. No more minibar or fridge in room. No more complimentary ice bucket fills before I arrived. In-room dining food choices and quality have really gone down. This has been my go-to hotel in midtown for the last 15 years. Looks s like it's time to move on, they  are not a "4 star" hotel any longer.

title: Look No Further!
text: The Omni Berkshire is an excellent property with a great staff, great location and great value. From the front door to the room, the service is on-point! I would highly recommend the Berkshire whether traveling on business or vacation. You can't beat location and the hotel is awesome.

title: Luxury in the Heart of Madison Ave
text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Berkshire for a staycation (we live in Brooklyn). It is prime location for exploring the shopping at 5th ave/ Madison ave, and convenient to the E and M train. The staff are all very attentive, and the rooms are a good size for NYC. Bob's Steak and Chophouse is delicious; we ate so much we were good for nothing the next day. The Omni Berkshire is the ideal place to allow yourself to be pampered and enjoy what midtown Manhattan has to offer.

title: Great experience
text: We had a great experience durig our stay. Friendly staff, clean quiet rooms. Overall no complaints,  This is the 2nd time we've stayed at this hotel.   Don't forget to try the citrus water by the elevators.

title: Excellent stay, until we checked out...
text:
Our stay began wonderfully. We enjoyed the accommodation, steakhouse, valet parking. Employees were pleasant and professional. A minor error was made (charge for WiFi) and a lovely desk agent said it would not be a problem to correct the bill before checkout. We were not concerned, we know OMNI is a fine establishment.

At checkout, we discovered this correction was not done. When pointing out the discrepancy to the OMNI front desk agent checking us out, she was rude and impatient. I stepped aside suggesting she take the next customer while I called my credit card company to verify exactly what was charged. The OMNI front desk agent not only insulted me, but publicly embarrassed me as well. I was spoken to as if I was incapable of comprehending the difference between a standard hold for incidentals, and an ACTUAL ERROR in billing. THIS IS ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, ever. Customer Service should always incorporate courtesy and respect. We expected much better.

Bottom Line: 5 STARS for accommodation and location. ZERO STARS for the checkout experience. This averages 2.5 stars but since that is not option I'm rating 3 stars to be generous.

title: Yes and no
text:
I want to like this hotel. It’s got history and the flowers are pretty but it falls short. I like to unpack my clothes if staying more than a couple of days but this hotel only has the side tables to offer. I would like to crack my window but I can’t. I would like a snack, or coffee or to be able to put my leftovers in my refrigerator but there is not mini bar, fridge or coffee maker in the rooms. 

I woke up this morning to a circular saw three doors down this morning at nine am. I asked for another room and they were accommodating but seemed inconvenienced by it all. I asked for an up grade which I received after I offered to pay the difference. And I have.
