My new room is pretty and spacious but the air conditioning fan is faulty. It is so loud I can’t run it. 

The hotel is clean and tidy but just lacks that extra mile to be a four to five star hotel in New York.

title: charged my card  for incorrect amount
text: you guys charged my card for the incorrect amount and when i call to get clarification -- you guys stated I never stayed there. How is that possible when i have the transaction number on my card and a paper receipt that i signed -- now I am going to have to file a dispute with my bank and get ALL my money back since I did not stay there. Unbelievable!

title: Brilliant hotel
text: We had a wonderful stay here for 4 nights. The room was comfortable,clean and decent sized, also the hotel is in a superb location to walk anywhere in midtown, but what made this such a special stay was the staff, from the doormen(who were stars)to Patrick on reception, nothing seemed to much trouble always friendly and happy to help. This was our 1st time in New York and when we return we would have no hesitation in staying here again.

title: Mediocre At Best
text:
We chose to stay at Omni based on reviews seeming so wonderful. The location was convenient, but I believe our trip started off on the wrong foot.

An observation I made, is that doormen never opened the doors for us upon arrivals or departures through our 2 night 3 day stay. The last day, the doorman did help us with bags and was friendly. 

Front desk was not very welcoming upon arrival and there was a bit of attitude perceived. We had a very nice tech that brought us a mini fridge. He was more welcoming than the front desk! We had an issue in our room with the lighting that actually posed a danger, and not once did anyone ask if we were ok. A light bulb from the sconce popped out and hit the wall, then the floor and was just inches away from hitting a pregnant woman. The manager on the following day shift did upgrade our room after we had to ask to be moved because we felt unsafe. They moved all of our items while we were out. 

It just did not feel as luxurious as previous reviewers have mentioned. I don't think I would stay here again.

title: Remarkably welcoming
text: The entire staff at the Omni Berkshire Place displayed a cheerfulness, friendliness and welcoming attitude that was striking, with a particular feeling of calm right in the midst of Midtown Manhattan.  Our room was beautiful.  It gave us a sense of old-time New York because of the hotel's history, dating to the 1920s.  At the same time, our room had all of the modern conveniences and was fresh and well-appointed, thanks to multiple renovations that have been completed over the years.  The lobby is elegant but also small and not overstated; we immediately felt at home and were sad to check out.  Again, the staff is truly distinctive -- the bellmen, the housekeepers, the front desk attendants, the doormen are all highly professional and take pride in their work and their hotel.  The Omni Berkshire should be proud of the feeling that has been created within this special team of people.

title: The Best Hotel in NY
text: Everything works perfect.   The location is the best and the quality is great! The food is great.. The restaurant is high quality.  Dinner or breakfast, never had lunch.  The size of the rooms is ideal.  This time I had a terrible view but I usually get a very nice view.

title: Great Place to Stay in New York
text: The Omni Berkshire provides nice accommodations, excellent service, available restaurant/bar and great location. You will not be disappointed! The steakhouse has a variety of food choices and the food is great.

title: SUITS TAKE OVER
text: Hotel staff The BEST. Corporate policy dictated by suits who would not have a clue between the front door and the rest room door, need to spend more time with the guests instead  of the spread sheets. YOU COULD NOT FIND A FINER HOTEL STAFF ANYWHERE.

title: Solid Hotel for Sure, but is there anything that makes it Special?
text: I expect a clean room and friendly staff at a fair price.  The Omni delivers all of these points.  Plus it has a convenient mid-town location.  Only problem with this hotel is that nothing stood out.  Now mind you, I'm not expecting Ritz Carleton performance for a value price.  That's not it at all.   I'm just looking for something that says this place is special, and it's not.  Expect a decent size room, a helpful staff and a good location.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Emplacement assez sympa proche de tout sur la 5 eme avenue.
Il est un peu vieillissant mais a son charme
La restauration est très chère c’est pourquoi nous avons pris nos petits déjeuners dehors et nous n’avons jamais dîner non plus

title: Never disappoints
text: Another wonderful stay at this lovely hotel. So well located, and feel thoroughly spoilt by the staff - from the doormen to the front desk to the concierge desk. The loyalty ambassadors take care of your every request. Go if you can!

title: Omni Berkshire Place
text: The Omni Berkshire Place is an excellent hotel, located in a perfect part of Midtown Manhattan - I was travelling with my teenage daughter and the area felt really safe even in the evenings.  The hotel staff were super friendly and helpful.  Highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York.

title: Great location to Time Square and Central Park sights
text: Walking distance to Time Square, food, shops on 5th and Madison streets and to Central Park. We also walked to Metropolitan Museum of Arts. Very easy access to subway line. Nice historical hotel with nice space for room.

title: One night, quick trip
text:
Booked through Expedia, we stayed at the Omni Berkshire place due to its proximity to Radio City Music Hall. The location can’t be beat if you want to stay right in midtown. They have a bar and restaurant on location that we did not utilize based on mixed reviews. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards, well decorated, and clean. The bathroom water pressure and temperature were great throughout. Elevators were a tad slow, but all were functional. The king bed was comfortable, however if you prefer a firmer pillow, it’s best to bring your own. Our room had a sitting chair, desk and chair with phone, flat screen TV, a lighted wardrobe with bathrobes, extra hangers, ironing board and iron, Ice bucket and wine opener, and a safe. The entranceway had a huge full length mirror and the bathroom was almost fully surrounded in mirrors (+ blowdryer, a lighted adjustable cosmetic mirror and a telephone next to the toilet which my husband found amusing). Some furnishings are showing signs of wear. There was no view out our window (industrial units and other buildings), but we were fine with that for the little time we spent there. 

At check in, we asked to pay full in cash. Maria did not take our cash and a $300 hold was placed on our card regardless. She treated us and spoke to us very different than the couple checking in before us, who got an upgraded room, free coffee for the next morning, and complimentary WiFi. I am not sure if this is because we booked third party, wanted to pay cash, were only staying out first time for one night, or because we looked weary from traveling all day. 

Check out was a breeze. The young man at the desk (I apologize for not remembering his name but it starts with a T!) was very friendly, let us pay cash, told us the hold on our card would drop off in a few days, and said we could stow our bags with the concierge while we grabbed breakfast across the street. It was delicious and he was right! There was a drug store the next block over for anything you may forget.

title: New York
text: Omni Berkshire  -  Lovely hotel, Rooms were clean and roomy. Staff extremely helpful and friendly (especially Lenny the doorman). Morning wake up with juice, tea or coffee was much appreciated. Beds really comfortable Would definately use this hotel again.

title: Brilliant location, good size room
text:
This hotel is well placed for all the main tourist attractions in midtown and close to the subway too.  We were fortunate to be upgraded and we had a very good size room and a big bathroom with full size tub (our friends and their kids stayed at the hilton round the corner and their room was the same size for 4 and a tiny bathroom).  The view from our room wasnt great - we looked onto the building opposite but that was a small thing in what was otherwise a great stay.  

I did find the hotel's use of 'single use' plastic items quite shocking though - especially the number of straws that they put in the drinks in the bar.

title: Still Great, But restaurant is BIG MISTAKE
text: this is a great hotel, service is great, especially if you are a member of their membership club  But. o Not Use Restaurant.  It is way over priced. We have been using this hotel for years.  The former restaurant was very nice, good for drinks and light breakfasts and lunch.  It was closed and a steakhouse was added.  Breakfast will run $30 to $40 per person and lunch , even more.  This was a terrible merchandising  decision by management.  Now there is no reasonable priced restaurant within blocks.  It may be enough to make us  move to another hotel

title: My Favorite in NYC
text:
This was my first time at the Omni Berkshire and I really can’t wait to go back. I have traveled to New York in numerous occasions and never felt I wanted to go back to a hotel, until my stay at Omni Berkshire.
The staff was outstanding! From the door guys (especially Lenni) who kindly greeted us every day, to the front desk guy Patrick who was extremely helpful, to the Polish cleaning lady who was sooo attentive and sweet! They all really made a difference!
Area was beautiful, safe, the restaurant downstairs was awesome, rooms were very clean. Thank you for your hospitality!

title: Fantastic and reliable accomodations
text: I've been coming to the Omni Berkshire since 2004 and have had a consistently wonderful experience at this hotel. It is the only place I really love staying at in NYC. Can't beat the rates, service, location and room quality

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel for Business
text: I stay at the Omni Bershire New York at least one or twice a month for work, so I feel like it's become my home away from home. There are so many other hotels and AirBNBs nearby, but with Omni, I feel safe, taken care of, I know my room will be clean and the accommodations will be of excellent quality. My three top reasons for choosing the Omni are the quality of the room, the in room services available, and the friendly doormen/concierge. I want to take a moment to express how much I appreciate the kindness, friendliness, respectful, professionalism, and care that the doormen always give. When a woman is on her own and traveling, it feels so comforting to know there is a group of guys who are always on the look out to make sure she is well taken care of. The concierge staff is always friendly, professional, and extremely knowledgeable with their suggestions and with helpful tips. I've never stayed anywhere other than the Omni Berkshire when I'm in New York for work because of these reasons. Thank you for providing a great guest experience! Looking forward to the next time at the end of February.

title: Hard to find more friendly/warm staff -- a real gem
text: The Omni Berkshire is a home away from home and they never fail to disappoint.  Their loyalty ambassador, Suzanne, could not be more wonderful and the bellman and concierge treat us like family.  The location is tough to beat and they treat every guest like royalty.  It is a delight to return there time and again!

title: Great value hotel. .
text: We stayed on the 16th floor in a deluxe king room for 4 nights. It was a birthday break for my husband.  Patrick on the front desk sent a cake and bottle of bubbly to our room which was a nice gesture.  Great location, easy access to subway.  We caught the subway and air train from jfk.  Really quick and easy and cheaper than taxi.  No hairdryer in room that was the only fault.

title: Fantastic Hotel in NYC
text:
5 Nights in this amazing hotel and didn't want to come home! Location is excellent in between 5th and Madison Av, with most of the major attractions within walking distance. 

The hotel itself is lovely - a classical touch combined with modern features including free wifi as a Select Member. We had the pleasure of a standard room for the first night, and also much to our surprise / delight an upgraded suite on the 19th floor for the remainder. The rooms are spacious, especially for New York, and both of the beds were divine, especially in the second room.

The real selling point are the staff - each and all were genuinely friendly and wanted to ensure your stay was enjoyable. Special mention though to Charles the maintenance engineer, and Patrick on the front, both who are fantastic and a real credit to the hotel and the brand. 

Whenever i find myself planning a trip to NY again, this will be my hotel of choice.

title: Great for the price for New York, hard beds
text:
When reviewing a New York hotel, one must always take into consideration the fact that there is far less space in Manhattan and most of the buildings are about 100 years old. Having stayed in many hotels in New York City, I can say that the Omni was quite lovely. It was clean, the staff was friendly, service was prompt, and the dreamy robes are a great plus. That being said, the beds are uncomfortably firm. If you enjoy a mattress that feels more like a flat futon, you will love it. As for myself, the same bed with the addition of a foam mattress topper would have been wonderful. 
 Overall, if you can deal with the bed, it’s a terrific location in a beautiful historic NY building.

title: Clean & Pristine
text: I love the modern vibe in a classic location. The Omni takes excellent care of its guests and the amenities here are spot on. Loved the food, got a great workout and I was steps away from everything I wanted or needed.

title: Great NY hotel
text: This is a solid hotel option for New York City. I stay here frequently for business.  Prices can get crazy so it is best to book early.  Convenient location.  Helpful staff.  It is not too small with all of the services available for a nice stay.

title: Accommodation's have really changed.
text:
I just returned home from a four night stay at your property with my family in January (January 1st - 5th). The Omni Berkshire has typically been our hotel of choice when we visit NYC annually. In fact, we have stayed there four out of the last five years. However, this year we were very disappointed in our stay.  It was even more frustrating since I redeemed a free night that I had accumulated with prior Omni stays.  As a manager, I feel like you would be interested in hearing about our stay. 
 
•       First of all, the safe in our room was not working when we checked in. In addition, the television was cracked and had to be 
be replaced. Both of these items should have been checked by housekeeping to make sure they were operational prior to our check in.
•       On the second night, we called for ice—we never received it.
•       There were not enough towels refreshed in our room each day. We had two adults and two teens in our room.
•       After the first night, the bath rug was removed and never replaced.
•       On the second morning, I accidently dripped coffee on the small side table by the bed—the drips were never wiped up during the remainder of our stay.
•       There was a penny on the floor by the wall by the chair—it was there ALL week—never picked up. This tells me that the room was not even vacuumed all week thoroughly. 
•       The staff at the front desk was not friendly at all!
•       The only staff member that went out of their way to be friendly was one of the bartenders in the bar!
 
 
I have the opportunity to stay in a lot of hotels across the country and I it was my choice to pick the Omni Berkshire.  It was a lackluster week!  This was our vacation and I did not feel like you made me or my family feel like it was a wise choice to have selected the Omni Berkshire.  I sent a note to the manager of the hotel right after our visit to express our dis-satisfcation, and did not receive a response.
 
I look forward to hearing back from you.

title: Great location
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Omni Berkshire many times. Lenny at the front door and Mary At customer service are wonderful. They give us a room upgrade when available. The only weakness is the bar tender.  He’s grouchy.  The serving staff is great.

title: Love this Hotel!
text: I have been staying at the Omni Berkshire for many years now, and they never disappoint!  The location is perfect and the customer service is excellent!  The staff is very accommodating!  We'll be back next time in NYC!

title: Very comfortable hotel but incidentals pricey
text:
Very comfortable hotel in good location. Elegant and clean. Service prompt and attentive. 

A couple of negatives: there is no in-room minibar, no complimentary water, and no tea/coffee in room. Ordering room service is pricey - a bottle of water is $10 plus 18% service charge and a flat $5 fee for any room service delivery. In-room dining was also pricy. I ordered a standard American breakfast, with a small pot of coffee and a glass of orange juice. The bill came to $64, which is the most I have ever paid for a pretty standard breakfast which should cost $20. 

My recommendation to travelers would be to bring your own bottled water and eat elsewhere.

title: Fantastic stay
text: First time in new york, what an amazing city if a bit cold.The Omni Berkshire was a fantastic place to stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were big and clean. Hotel is central to the attractions will definately book again.

title: Business Trip to PA
text: I traveled to Pittsburgh for business and decided to stay at the Omni rather than a cheaper option.  The hotel is nice, but when I got to the room it smelled like a locker room.  Next, at 2:00am I was woken up by what sounded like a college party in the room next door to me. It took over an hour for the hotel to shut down the party.  I would unlikely stay at this hotel again in the future, especially given all of the other luxury hotel options in the downtown area.

title: Great Location, Quiet, Excellent Accommodations
text: I spent a Friday-Sunday weekend with my family on a combo work/fun trip.  The Omni offered great rates that weekend ($225) for a large room, king-size bed, and a very comfortable rollaway for my daughter.  The staff was always cheery, helpful, and professional.  You can't beat the location -- mid-town in between 5th and Madison.  They don't have their own parking garage, but do have access to a large garage two blocks west on 52nd (the same street as the hotel).  Very nice gym facilities and outdoor terrace open to all. Also, one of the few hotels in mid-town that allow pets, in case that is of interest. If you happen to have a daughter who has an American Girl doll, the NYC mega store is a block away from the Omni - best to set a spending limit there (!)

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: My wife and I were in town for a brief vacation and were extremely happy with our stay.  The location was perfect for visiting NYC.  Couldn't have picked a better place to stay.  This will be our go to hotel moving forward.

title: Great Place
text: The Omni Berkshire was a great place to stay. The staff was very friendly. I cannot say enough nice comments. The room was big, we did not trip over each other. The location was god for us we went to Central Park and also went to a play.

title: Upcoming visit to Omni Berkshire Place
text: Our stay is not for another week but I had to share my wonderful experience while booking the Omni Berkshire Place. Let me start off by saying we are very loyal Omni customers! We find their hotels to have the best accommodations and the staff to be kind and attentive to all their customers needs. We are celebrating my wife's  birthday next weekend and I wanted to plan a special night for her. We spoke to Mary C. in customer service, she was WONDERFUL! We wanted a room with a king bed and pull out couch . She went above and beyond by contacting the hotel directly to see if they would be able to accommodate us. Eileen , the hotel manager, was amazing! She went out of her way  to get us a room that would work best for our family. We are looking forward to our upcoming visit to  the Omni Berkshire Place. I am sure they will go above and beyond to make our visit extra special. Thank you Mary and Eileen! We look forward to our visit.

title: A magical Christmas at The Omni Berkshire
text:
I have to say I’m so pleased with the choice of hotel for this trip. We have previously stayed at a couple of Omni Hotels in the US and I specifically looked for their New York offering. It’s in a fantastic position, the staff are all wonderful and so helpful (particularly Mary on the concierge desk). We upgraded to a corner ‘Madison’ suite which I had previously negotiated the week before with the team. It meant we had a lounge area which was really nice for Christmas. They even agreed to put a tree in our room! 

Thanks to everyone for a wonderful stay.

title: Best hotel in NYC- Great for theatre
text: This was not our first stay at the Omni Berkshire place and will not be our last. The location at 52nd and Madison is convenient for everything. It is safe and clean and welcoming. This visit was all about theatre. It was a short and easy walk to all of the shows we saw. The room was spotless. Staff friendly. I feel like a resident when I stay here. it has a boutique feel.

title: Great location, comfortable rooms
text: Everything about this hotel is perfect for a few days in the city.  BUT - 2 of the 3 elevators were out of order for most of our two-day stay and that made going to and from room take a long time.  The staff is friendly and helpful - they even managed to find a pair of gloves I had left in the lobby and get them back to me!

title: Brief, comfortable, unflashy stay
text:
For a January New York trip, I had prepaid an unchangeable stay at the Towers at Lotte New York Palace.  When I decided to add a day, I had to look for another hotel for one night, and it was the Omni.  The hotel came up as an opaque ("Hush Hush") sale on GiltTravel.  With some online sleuthing based on hints provided by Gilt, I was able to deduce the secret hotel was the Omni, which is one block away from Lotte.  The Lotte booking was also through Gilt, although it was not opaque.  The Omni was a pleasant, comfortable, unflashy  one-night stay.  

I did not realize the Omni was a historic hotel, because its exterior architecture is quite minimalist compared to other lavishly ornate Beaux Arts buildings from the same time period.  In fact, the hotel was built in 1926 by Warren and Wetmore, who had a hand in designing Grand Central Terminal.  In 1942, Rodgers and Hammerstein wrote their famous musical "Oklahoma!" in a suite here, now named in their honour.
The L-shaped hotel sits on the corner of 52nd and Madison, a stone's throw from Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral.  Times Square and its theatres are a short walk, as is MOMA.  The architecturally significant Austrian Cultural Forum New York building is right next door on 52nd.  A pleasant, inexpensive deli/take-away place called Isadora's is across 52nd.

My room type was the hotel's least expensive, a Deluxe.  These rooms (approx. 270 sq ft) all face away from the street, so are surely quieter.  The interior view was not as dark as expected either, given the hotel's L-shape.  The room was decent-sized, especially for New York.  There were no built-in features--the closet was a modern armoire that also held shelves and a safe (no minibar).  The desk had a lot of counter space.  The bathroom was smallish, but the combo tub-shower had a curved curtain rod and there were lots of mirrored walls.  There were robes but no slippers, and no turndown service.  The room had an ice bucket, but I'm not sure if there was an ice machine.  It seems USA Today is the hotel's only English-language newspaper.

The best accommodations at the Omni are the Terrace Suites.  However, the St. Patrick's Terrace on the 17th floor opposite the Fitness Centre is open to all guests and looked like a small but pleasant place to relax in more temperate weather.  The Cathedral "view" from the hotel, however, is not outstanding.

If you are an member of Omni's Select Guest program, Wifi is free, and you get a hang card to put on your door that entitles you to a free morning beverage delivered to your room.  Mind you, the orange juice I ordered was tiny and from concentrate, and the avocado toast, available via the hang card at about half the price of the room service toast, was actually a lesser product that the room service version (no egg, etc).  Still, it gives you some nourishment before leaving the room.

The hotel's restaurant is Bob's Steak and Chop House, which is part of a small chain of 16 restaurants (the majority are in Texas).  I did not try it, but the menu had classic steakhouse fare, and the decor was also classic steakhouse (dark wood paneling).  They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The bar looked popular.

Because my room category at the Towers at Lotte Palace was quite different from the Omni, I cannot fairly compare them.  I will say the Lotte is a larger, more bustling and frenetic place, has more obvious historic features (the Villard Mansion) and better Cathedral views.  The Omni was a quieter, less flashy place.  Both have great midtown locations for tourists.

title: Great Location, Amazing Rooms, Excellent Service
text:
Stayed here in June, first time visiting New York to celebrate an anniversary. 
Can not fault anything about the hotel and staff who work here. If you want a hotel that delivers on location, room size, and top quality helpful staff you will not go wrong here. David Chase and his team were brilliant throughout. Location between 5th Avenue and Madison Avenue is situated close to everywhere you need to be whilst being quiet enough as not directly on any crowded areas. If and when I return, I'll be heading straight back to the Omni.

title: Great staff
text:
Loved the Omni Hotel.  It is so well placed just off 5th Avenue, with Cartier Jewellers just across the road.  Well I could enjoy the window display of jewellery.
Due to the flood chaos at JFK Airport, we had no luggage at all whilst at the Omni, the staff went out of their way to recommend reasonably priced shops where we could buy essential clothing.  I must thank the receptionist Patricia who twice tried to Virgin Atlantic to chase up our luggage, who of course, had her holding the line for over half an hour and as usual did not answer..
The room was very attractive with two very large beds, well stocked bathroom. We treated ourselves to an excellent dinner on the last night, it really was a fabulous experience and the waiter was helpful over the drinks.
I would certainly recommend this hotel.  It is nearly central and you could walk to the Empire State Building and the Met Museum the other way.

title: Elegant Mid Town Hotel That Periodically Offers Great Deals
text: This is the 3rd time that I have stayed at this hotel because it is centrally located in mid town (Madison and 52nd; convenient to sub way, buses and an easy walk to Theater district, the park and great restaurants and shops).  The hotel is elegant; should be rated a 5 star but is rated as a 4-4.5 star.  The rooms and common areas are beautifully furnished/appointed and overall the hotel is in great condition.  We stayed in a superior double room (280+ sq ft; 2 double beds, 2 r moires (sp), big bathroom) and paid a little less than $400 for two nights including tax.  In the Spring when travel demand to NYC is higher, I have paid more for a weekend stay in a comparable room.  I would stay here even if I had to pay $500-$600 for a weekend.  You cant find a 5 star hotel at that price.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This is consistently my favorite hotel in NYC.  Rooms are spacious, clean, and quiet - particularly compared to other hotels in the city.  Staff is extremely friendly.  Location is fantastic for shopping, Rockefeller center, and central park.  Overall a very good hotel.

title: NYC Hotel Excellence
text: This hotel is worth co spidering for its great service, amenities and perfect mid town location.  It is close enough to walk everywhere but far enough from the noise. This hotel never disappoints. Am already planning a return trip.

title: Great hotel at a great location
text: Great location. Very attentive staff. Sonny, the bartender, is the best. He created a drink that I had not had here in the USA And could not find elsewhere. Room was ideal; we even had a balcony- on the 19th floor. Great views.

title: Best Place to Stay. LOVED IT!!
text:
Myself and my eldest daughter travelled to NYC December 2017 our first and definitely not last visit.
Our hotel was great, literally 2 minutes from 5th Avenue, and the amazing shops.
We had room service every morning which was so lovely, always delivered with a smile, and beautifully presented.
Our overall trip was great and our hotel being in such a great location made it easy to pop back.

The only true negative I have about our trip was the airport transfer ( nothing to do with our hotel)
We flew with BA and used the airline transfer service, on the way home to JFK our driver was rude and very abusive, demanding more money from two females travelling alone.... he visited that we help him load suitcase into his vehicle and made us pay him an extra $10 dollars as he said they were heavy!!!! This transfer was already prepaid When my daughter questioned him, he shouted in her face. We asked for a receipt for payment and he threatened to call the police??? Not a nice ending to a wonderful holiday.

title: Needs updating
text: Nice location. Nice staff. Comfortable room. But lobby seems outdated and elevators didn't work. Two out of three were out of operation for both days I was staying there. Seems like the hotel owner isn't investing in the property.

title: Great pick
text: Great hotel!  Great location!  Great service!  Very helpful staff. Airline lost my luggage and they helped me in every way. Only one complaint, Street below room was super loud. I’ve stayed in NY many times before and I never noticed it before this stay. That said, I’d still stay there again, but I’d request a room on the other side.

title: Another great experience!
text: This is the second time we visited the Omni Berkshire Place. The last time was in 2016. Our opinion of this hotel remains extremely positive. This is a first class hotel in the center of Midtown Manhattan. The staff is excellent and is always trying to make your stay the best it can be. The room is large, especially considering that you're in New York and extremely comfortable. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are well maintained. The next time we're here in New York we will be staying here.

title: Fine Hotel
text: Great hotel and service. You get what you pay for! This is an expensive hotel that has high standards. Food at BOB's is excellent steak house quality and service is friendly and professional. Check in and out is fast and easy. Bar is a pleasant spot to pass some time.

title: Great location, great hotel.
text:
We stayed at Omni Berkshire Place from 20/12/2017 to 27/12/2017. We got married whilst in NYC and a number of our guests also stayed at the hotel and shared our experience.

The room was a really good size which was a huge benefit for my wife and her wedding crew whilst they were getting ready. We visit New York regularly and have had some box rooms in our times but this was great, as were facilities in there. We also arrived to a complimentary bottle of champagne which was great of them, and much to my delight found they had NFL network on the Tv listings. My wife was less pleased about this.

The internet was really good and seemed to work well across the whole hotel. Everything was really clean, staff were friendly and the room service my wife ordered was excellent from what she said. 

Location for this hotel is perfect. Only a short walk to so many tourist hotspots, Rockefeller centre is only a block or so away, Central Park about a 15 minute walk, you couldn’t really ask to be better situated. It also has a fantastic deli over the road which was great for eating on the move. 

We stayed over the Christmas period and the decoration in and around the hotel was superb. Staff were really friendly, even when having to work on Christmas morning etc and check in and out was a breeze compared to previous hotel experiences we have had in the city. 

A really good experience all in all, would definitely stay again if we were able to find it at a similar price to what we paid on this trip.

title: Clean and friendly
text: Beautiful lobby and rooms!  Very clean.  All of the employees were extremely friendly.  Wonderful location and morning beverages delivered to your door were such a delight!!!  The rooms were quite large and the bathroom was so spacious!  Beds were very comfy too!

title: Comfortable, convenient, quiet
text:
I took a solo trip to NYC to visit churches, hear music, and eat at some stellar restaurants. Omni is very convenient to Midtown, Grand Central, subways, Central Park, and walkable to Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle. 
The room was small but elegant, third floor,  backside (no view) but very quiet.  Desk, side chair, and armoire were nice to have. Bathroom was clean. Mattress was a bit soft but not too bad. Housekeeping was good - even filled my ice bucket the second and third days. All of my staff encounters were friendly. This is a great small hotel to retreat to. Deli / pizza / breakfast place across the street is very convenient and affordable.

title: comfortable, friendly helpful staff
text:
Lovely hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Clean and tidy and well maintained. Fitments looking tired but all clean and working well. Don't expect a view. Really convenient for shops, restaurants, Central Park, Rockefeller etc. 
Will definitely go back.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Our suite was beautiful.  The hotel was in a great location and the staff was excellent.  Our breakfast to the room was not hot and not worth the amount we spent, but other than that the experience was excellent.

title: Clean, Quiet, Comfy, Covenient
text: Great location right off Madison - if getting a cab, usually one drives right by headed east. If not, go to Madison corner and easily flag one - they all head north. Best place to stay if going north for business travel.   Best coffee in NY served free every morning along with a second beverage of your choice - be sure to join their frequent traveler program in order to qualify. And they bring the newspapers every morning as well!

title: Very old in need of a full restoration
text: Very well located that's the reason that I booked here. But once you are in is clear that this place is in need of a full restoration. Considering what you pay for sure you deserve much more. Not in Omni standards.

title: Excellent Stay, Service
text: Excellent stay.  Very convenient location, shopping and restaurants within walking distance.  Close enough to walk to MOMA, Time Square, Rockefeller Center.  When not walking, we used UBER.   Our room was clean, bed was comfortable. Bob's was a great place to gather at the end of the day.  Great service, good food and drinks.  Everyone was friendly, hotel was clean.  We would definitely come back again.

title: Only GREAT thing is the Staff...
text:
I frequently visit New York, and have stayed at several 4 and 5 star hotels in the city. Omni Berkshire was a repeat visit for me, having stayed here on different ocassions over 5 years ago as well. 

Unfortunately, this time arround we really felt the hotel and rooms to be tired and worn out. In urgent need of a major overhaul and remodel. 

Bathroom window shutters, room lampshades, air vents, and other fixtures in the room where dusty, hadnt been cleaned for a while (picture attached) . 

Marble floors in bathroom where stained. (Picture attached) 

Windows need to be resealed (even on the 20th floor, we heard street noise). 

Loud AC/heater noise throughout the night. 

Worn uff furniture and curtains.

On our 2nd night there was an uncomfortable noise that seemed to be a plumbing problem coming from the ceiling. We spoke with staff which came up to review problem, the only answer we got was "can we offer you earplugs?" NOT WHAT YOU EXPECT FROM A LUXURY HOTEL.

No minibar or fridge in room. Had to order water up with roomservice, got the check, for 2 small bottles of water, extremely overpriced at $24, I would say rudely overpriced. We did talk with front desk which later kindly accomodated. 

On a POSITIVE note: staff in general is trying its to be as accomodating and helpful as possible, but seem not to have the management or hotel infrastructure on their side. 

Location is fantastic. Center of everything.

THE BOTTOM LINE IS: 
Used to be a great hotel. Its glory days are over. 

Staff is great, they do a great job trying to satisfy your requests.

Would not return until this hotel gets a much needed makeover. Once they do, will be back.

title: Not a Good Business Hotel
text:
I rarely write reviews but my negative hotel experience is causing me to share the following: 

(1) The Good:
- I stayed on the 14th floor two days 1/9 - 1/11, housekeeping was very attentive
- Room service delivery time was quick

(2) The Bad
- Uncomfortable beds with very soft mattress and rough feeling bedding, cover and decorative pillows (note: this is not a Macy's show room, pls provide good quality pillows because that is what matters to business travelers)
- Not nearly enough power outlets and inconvenient location, incl night stand where it didn't leave enough room for other things when plugged in
- Tiny TV of may be 32 inches plus super slow response to remote taking forever to navigate
- food quality of room service was not good at all.  Odd tasting Cesar salad and very unhealthy, chewey cheese hamburger
- I understand this is NY, but even then the room service was expensive plus they have these 0.2 liter, tiny coke bottles. It screams "nickel and dime" and above all leaves you thirsty
- Charging for Internet (excuse me?!?)
- Bathroom definitely feeling dated.  What is with all the wood paneling in the rooms? Makes it feel even smaller than it already is.  
- Toilet was plugged but that I am sure was a one off

I know that a Marriott is boring but at least I know they understand what a business travel needs and that is in addition to some tasteful décor, mostly a productive set up.

title: Brilliant First Trip To New York
text:
...had a great time seeing the highlights New York has to offer. The Hotel was great, superb location and fairly central to everything we wanted to see and do while there. 
Would highly recommend to anyone who wanted a nice cheap hotel that's centrally located to all the amenities and highlights the Big Apple has to offer..

title: Great trip
text: The Omni was the perfect choice in location for my business trip. Great location, attentive staff and great food with Bobs Chop House. The room was comfortable and everything worked. Elevators were fast and so was room service. I was really surprised at how nice a stay it was! Had heard some horror stories about some of the  nicer NYC hotels. I don’t travel here much and for the price it was perfect. Rooms are so expensive in NYC and tiny but my room was a nice size. I would definitely stay here again. Location is great for shopping and sites. Only problem we had was for uber to pick up we had to go to corner of Park Ave. at rush hour(s). It’s too hard for taxis and uber to get down  the street. No problem getting our ride at the corner.

title: Very nice management but our second visit had more issues than our first
text:
We like the Omni hotels in a couple of other locations in the U.S. and our first visit here was about a year and a half ago.  We experienced some issues with that stay (you can read that review for details) and a super responsive manager spoke with me over the phone about it and sent a gift certificate for a free night's stay.  So, this December we decided to use the certificate for one of our staycations in NYC.  

I was early for check-in and the front desk staff were very welcoming and took my cell number to text me when the room was ready.  The small but elegantly decorated "old NYC" style lobby was filled with guests coming or going and I gave our bag to the bellman after a bit of a wait in line. Since this hotel is so close to Rockefeller Center and the flagship Saks store, I decided it had been a long time since I visited these places so off I went.  Surprisingly I got a text that our room was ready way earlier than expected while I was still at lunch!

Our king room was decorated in beiges and browns and had a little extra chair and lamp near one side of the bed.  The bathroom was all in a brownish marble.  Nice.  Lighting was good.  There was no mini fridge so I called down to request one but understandably they were all out, so I asked for a bucket of ice.  Then I noticed the bedspread had several brownish red stains on it.  I considered calling to get it replaced but I was really tired and didn't want to deal with housekeeping coming and just wanted to have a cold drink and relax, plus we weren't going to sleep with the bedspread on anyway.  

I turned on the TV and intermittently the sound would degrade to an annoying buzz several times.  The heater was noisy whenever it would run.  As my husband is a loyalty member, two bottles of water were delivered along with a note from the loyalty manager and the managing director (he was the same gentleman who gave me the certificate) reminding us to put the "Select Guest" hangtag on the door by 2 a.m. to get our complimentary morning beverages.  I looked everywhere and there was no "Select Guest" hangtag.

Two hours passed and still no ice delivery and by that time we had to go to an appointment so I called the front desk to tell them no ice had been delivered and we didn't want it anymore.  Instead of an apology the staff person just said "I'll connect you with Housekeeping" but I said to forget it and they just said "OK."

When we got back to the hotel in the late evening our room had benefited from turndown service (which included ice) and we didn't really want to try and deal with any of the other issues, so I wrote up all of our issues with this stay (complete with photos and video)  to the lovely managing director via email and sent it off to him in the early morning.  The HVAC worked fine, fyi, it was just noisy.  Then we went down to Bob's (in the hotel) for breakfast.  

Not surprising, he responded within the hour, apologizing for our problems with the room and offering to buy our breakfast.  The restaurant manager graciously took care of the bill after I showed him the email and we had a nice conversation.  

With such guest-oriented and responsive management I am a bit perplexed as to how our second "make it up to us" experience missed the mark in a variety of ways.  I really expected everything to go smoothly for this little one-night stay.

title: Winter visit
text: Great location and our room was a decent size compared to other hotels in the area which is one reason we chose this hotel. Room was clean except there was hair in the shower when we arrived, towels had marks on them which appeared to be dirty or not properly cleaned and the sheets had a large hole in them. We requested a fridge and they were out of mini fridges so they went out of their way to get us what they could which was great. Also got a complimentary hour late checkout. My only complaint would be that anytime during our 5 day 4 night stay when we entered or exited the building I noticed other guests being welcomed etc by staff and my husband and I were never acknowledged by staff until our last day when we were leaving with luggage.

title: Holiday Get Together
text: Great location for holidays in NYC!  Stay there every year, good service, expensive restaurant, but location and everything else wonderful, will be back again next year!  A great location if you want to park and walk or take a taxi anywhere in the area!

title: Good location
text: This hotel is in a very good location, 52nd and 5th, very central. However the service was a little disappointing to be honest. As a valued guest of their fidelity program you expect a better service and all the extras that should be provided like bottled water every day, etc...

title: Really pleased with this hotel
text: We stayed for four nights. The extra $$ for the larger room was worth it. The rooms were very comfortable. The location in midtown was great; we ventured out to upper east side, upper west side, downtown and Brooklyn very easily. The attached steak house was just ok in value. Some of our party found the neighborhood too loud.

title: Great business & experience in mid-town
text: Superbly run property in the heart of mid-town - guest service, amenities perfect for business part of the trip.  Management super friendly, great gym and restaurant made it an awesome family experience too on this combined trip.

title: No more than regular
text:
The Berkshire hotel used to be a real notable 5 star hotel, very well located. The location still stands, but the notability is lost. Maybe as part of the membership of the Omni chain. It simply lacks the touch of real care taking that makes the difference between a regular hotel and those that succeed to conquer the heart of their guests. 

No nice reception, just a technical check in. Not even a water in the room and then difficulty to order some. The restaurant burned the filet mignon, even joked about when the visible left overs where cleaned. Etc etc

Having said that, the hotel offers a fair price, a great location and, still a fair regular service

title: Very nice
text: The Omni Berkshire exceeded my expectations regarding location and quality. The lobby is but underwhelming but the rooms are quiet and quality and the beds and linens are very nice. I will stay here again.

title: Great Location/Friendly Staff
text: We stayed here between Christmas and New Years, so the room rate was high, but not compared to other hotels.  The location of this hotel is perfect!   Two blocks from Radio City/Rockefeller; 6 blocks from Times Square and 7 blocks from Central Park!    The staff was friendly and our stay was great!!

title: Muy buen Hotel Magnifica Ubicacion
text: El hotel es lindo, las habitaciones grandes y cómodas, esta maravillosamente ubicado y cuenta con un personal de Front Desk impecable. Cuando llueve te dan paraguas de cortesía y el Guardavalijas funciona muy bien. La recepción es cómoda con grandes sillones de espera y cuenta con Wi Fi

title: Omni Berkshire - Perfect
text: We chose to stay at the Omni Burkeshire during the December holidays so that we can enjoy New York. The entire experience with the hotel for making the reservation to check out was superb. The hotel staff is welcoming, helpful, and professional. The quality of our suite was perfect. The room was clean in very good shape. The hotel is located in the ideal location in Manhattan, convenient to all that New York has to offer. We will return to the hotel, and highly recommend the property.

title: Family new year
text:
Excellent location staff friendly rooms of good size and clean 
Bobs bar was great with plenty of choice and quality products the
Food in the restaurant was amazing not sure about the carrot but as a gimmick it works

title: big disappointment
text: Paid a fortune and got a teeny room. Have been an OMNI Hotels loyal member for some time but because we booked through Booking.com we did not receive our normal upgrade. Lesson learned. I had no idea that using a booking agent would result in such poor treatment at the hotel. Lesson learned.

title: NEW YEARS EVE OVERNIGHT STAY
text: Booked this room last minute, excellent accommodations, upgraded at the time of visit, checked us in early, in the heart of NYC, great gym and out door lounge. We also had breakfast at Bob's Steakhouse which was excellent as well.

title: Great in midtown
text: Our go-to hotel for midtown NYC.  Third stay and have been happy every time.  Can't beat the location, but just far enough from 5th Ave to avoid the congestion.  Room, although not large was clean and comfortable, and the hotel, although I'm sure probably almost full never felt too busy.

title: Overpriced for limited services
text:
New Year’s Eve in New York City, was cold and crowded. We stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place since it was available and close to all activities. I noticed a definite difference in the services when compared to my usual hotels I stay at.
At the Omni it was just another work day for the staff. They book you in and check you out. No free WIFI, no member lounge, no complimentary anything. Not even a grace period for checking out. They just don’t care. Compared to what I get at the lowest level Marriott this was just a room for the night at a very high price and nothing more. 
Now I know why I prefer to be a Marriott platinum Elite member instead of an Omni hotel advantage member. ☺️

title: Perfect location and pleasant stay
text:
We came with relatively high expectations as we've come to expect good things from the Omni, and for the most part this property delivered.  It's very well situated for shopping, museums, art, theater and a good selection of restaurants.  The room was larger than we had expected and comfortably appointed.  (One is thing, two entrance lamps seemed to be hardwired with no switch so I resorted to loosening the bulbs to sleep.)

Staff was friendly but seemed to be very busy.  For instance, we arrived early and checked our bags since no rooms were yet available and were told we would be contacted as soon as we could check in.  No such contact was ever made.

Overall we had a good stay and will likely return.

title: central location
text: We enjoyed the central location though it comes at a price for room and parking ($55/night!). The room was comfortable if a bit on the small side. The lobby could do with a sharpening up. You are charged $14.95 for WIFI unless you sign up for the club.

title: Omni Berkshire
text: Great location but service is not warm at all. It is an efficient hotel but not memorable. However, Joey at the Concierge is a great asset to the team. The rooms are ok but seem dated, no minibar in the room, limited TV channels and no USB plugs.

title: very comfortable stay in NYC
text: We spent a week in NYC for Christmas at the Omni hotel and were very pleased with it. Large and comfortable rooms, quiet considering the location (5th and 52nd). Friendly and efficient staff. Very good location, within walking distance of most places of interest.

title: NYC Christmas honeymoon
text: We stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place during our honeymoon Christmas 2017. I cannot say enough wonderful things about our stay! Great location, gorgeous interior, and outstanding customer service! We'll be back!

title: Omni Berkshire place NY
text: Omni Berkshire place in NY hotel is a very good hotel. However, since the lobby looks so cheap, it would be better to improve. However, I  will choose this hotel when I am staying in New York. again because is s very convenient location.

title: 70 th birthday
text: Great first experience of The Big Apple ,The OMNI is in a perfect location for all major attractions and Shopping areas. Together with helpful and friendly staff a memorable stay,we hope to be back one day.

title: Great place
text: The hotel was very comfortable (nice size room for NYC) and in a great location - walking distance to Radio City, Saint Patrick’s and good restaurants. The staff was friendly and professional. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Beautiful Hotel & Great Lication
text: Our stay at the Omni was great! We could walk to everything and the hotel staff was very attentive to all our needs!  Old world charm, cozy rooms with great ambiance and best doormen! I can't wait to come back next year!

title: NYC travel
text: The hotel is very ggod, but the bath rooms and some apliances coud be modernized. They seems to be old and do not have some facilities as USB plugs, glass in the shower box, etc.  The hotel also could provide shuttle to airport for families.

title: good location and good steady relaible service
text: A place with a solid service crew who knows the business. Room was neat, clean and we liked the the beds. Room maybe a bit small but we got used to it. The location is great and Time square is a not that far away. Good walking distance. If we go back to NY ......yes would mind staining again here.

title: Christmas trip to New York City
text: Amazing hotel!  This hotel was in a great location.  It was close to Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Central Park, shopping, restaurants, and many more things to do in the city.  The only draw back was the $55 a day you pat in taxes to stay in the city.

title: Great location, very friendly service
text: This hotel is located within a very short walking distance from Sak’s,  Lincoln Center, Radio City Music Hall, and CBS and NBC (52nd and Madison).   The “theater district”/Times Square is only a very short distance away.  We saw five shows (the furthest  away was on West 45th)  and never had more than a 25 minute walk even  wending through the massive crowds around the attractions in the area during Christmas   Personnel are knowledgeable, friendly, and extremely helpful. We had a Deluxe King room. Somewhat larger than a balcony cabin on a cruise  ship, the room was   narrow but well laid  out. Except to sleep, we spent very little time in the room.  While the hotel did provide two very warm “luxurious” robes, and an iron and ironing board,  it did not have either a  refrigerator or  a coffee/tea maker. As members of the loyalty program, we had coffee/juice delivered to the room every morning.  On a future visit, we would stay here again.

title: great stay
text: booked a great suite for a great price and surprised me with even better upgrade !! great location for seasonal attractions ! Doormen are the same everytime  I come and are the best. Definitely coming back in the spring.

title: Near luxury in mid-town NYC.
text:
This is a near luxury hotel in Mid-town NYC. Service is good, rooms are clean & beds comfy. Our son/2 grandsons shared a common foyer with my wife & me (rooms 01 & 02 suite) which allowed extra easy family access & privacy too.
Central locale makes walking & public transportation additionally easy.

title: Holiday getaway
text: wanted to spend the night in the city - was able to book at the Omni where I have black status - so our service was excellent, the room / suite was large and was very pleased that we were able to have a quick getaway here.  The location is close to all the tourist-y sights- like the tree, etc. but with Uber/cabs everything is only a quick ride away, also this isn't too far from the subway, so location is pretty convenient.

title: Great hotel,Bob's Steak & Chop House needs improvement.
text: Steak & chops overcooked lobster tail cold & legendary carrot was undercooked & not very appealing.Great hotel & location in Midtown but restaurant needs to improve on quality entrees for the price. Nix the carrot!

title: Omni Berkshire
text: Very nice hotel just one block from St. Patrick's Cathedral and two blocks from Rockefeller Center/Tree. The doorman will flag you down a taxi and it's close to two subways as well. Great location and we had a very nice stay!

title: Really enjoyed our stay; amazing location
text: We traveled in early December when the city was bursting with holiday visitors.  This hotel is very close to the action in Rockefeller Center to make it easily walkable, but distant enough away to be removed from the hoards of people visiting the decorated windows, etc.  The staff was excellent and our room was great: clean and quiet.  Santa greeted us in the lobby when we checked in which was very nice.  I will definitely return.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent location NYC for the holiday cheer. Walking distance to stores and Rockefeller Center.  Hotel service is always outstanding.  This is the only hotel u stay in when visiting the City for business or personal time.

title: Christmas New York
text: The hotel is in perfect spot for seeing all the sites. It was a short walk to Time Square for the show. Very close to see the Christmas Tree in Rock Center as well as all the shopping. The kids loved it.

title: Weekend in New York
text:
On arrival, there was a patch of sticky stain next to the bed with a near empty bottle of shampoo container on the night stand.

Overall well furnished room and bathroom was very clean. Friendly staff.

title: Less than Expected
text: Do not order room service as the food is not good.   Our room was not cleaned as expected.   If you are driving into the city it's difficult to get in and out of this hotel.  The location is nice and the beds sleep well.  The lower floors do have road noise.

title: sweet suite
text:
I enjoy the suites at the hotel as they offer room for 2 people to spread out.  in the days of air BnB and other type of services I like the fact that Omni has the 24 hour desk who are very accomodating.  The location is superb and the restaurants are fabulous. my only only wish coffee machines to be available in the rooms.   room service coffee in mornings is a nice gesture but it t seems so 1950 madmen (remember that show) 

would return and stay there again. (used my united points) 

cheers from down under 

Melbournedes

title: Nice hotel..not a great hotel
text: We really wanted to like this hotel but every day of our stay there was a glitch. Small glitches, but they add up over time. First - not drinking glasses in our room - had to ask on two occasions for these. Turn down service happened first night, not the second night.  Ice bucket filled first night, not the second, third or fourth night. No ice available on our floor - 15. The room where the ice machine is located is locked so we had to run from floor to floor for ice. Yes, we could have it delivered to the room - but chose not too. Bathroom has an old fluorescent light about the vanity mirror and sink - no hotel uses these anymore, let a long workplaces. Dull, dark bathroom because of the poor lighting. On a plus - the bed was really comfy - king size, room was very large and the wardrobe was nice, though, no drawers other than the nightstand drawers for your bits and bobs. Hallway table by the elevators hasn't seen a duster in ages, we drew a Holiday cartoon in the dust!!!  Front desk staff were very accommodating, helpful and charming to deal with as well as the doormen. Gym was fabulous - lots of options for cardio and weights and love the outside patio off the Gym. Hallways are quiet - hotel is quiet and very comfortable.

title: Great NYC location, convenient and homey feel
text: We come here every year during Christmas, and this place has become our xmas home. Lots of familiar faces, great location and easy access to shops and subway. Rooms are very well kept. Love this place, this is by far our best NY hotel experience.

title: Wonderful Visit
text: Hotel staff warm and welcoming!  Room lovely and clean. Perfect location. We had a fabulous dinner at Bob’s Steakhouse with very good friendly service. We always enjoy staying at Omni properties and this trip was no exception.

title: Best Hotel in Midtown NYC!
text: From check-in, to room service to overall room accommodations, Omni Berkshire is the BEST hotel in NYC.  The staff is top notch and the location makes it a perfect place to stay to get around to the main attractions and food.  So glad Omni has a NYC hotel to ensure I keep my points and/or leverage my Select Guest points.  Though we have stayed here several times there is something special about being in NYC in December!!

title: Great location, but noisy
text: Older hotel in good condition. Rooms are updated. Staff is good - concierge staff is amazing. Got us in to last tables in fabulous restaurants virtually every day. You can truly walk almost everywhere from here. But bring your earplugs: the hotel and street sounds are oppressive. Bad enough with honking New Yorkers outside, even with drapes closed. But the hallways reverberate with doors closing throughout each floor; and the hvac and plumbing are very noisy.

title: Omni drives me nuts - but the hotel has a great location!
text:
We stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place December 8th. We had a gift card to Omni Hotels that we went to use in Mexico and once we got there, they wouldn't accept it. I complained to Omni and they sent me a certificate for a free 2 night stay that I found out too late expired! I opened the certificate to book this trip and they wouldn't honor it. 

Let me tell you, after being stranded in Mexico and having to pay for that hotel because they wouldn't accept their own GC, I wasn't in a hurry to book with Omni again any sooner. Who sends a free stay certificate as an apology for messing up our vacation and won't honor it? Omni. 

The location of the Berkshire Hotel is great. I felt like we were within 1 or 2 blocks of everything. The Lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and Santa even stopped by. Concierge was very helpful for recommendations / cabs and the room was nice. The room was not on the higher floor that we requested, so it was a little noisy from the street but still nice. 
We had drinks and apps in the bar which was convenient and very friendly. Then wee ate dinner across the street. Definitely stay here for the location, not so much the central reservation department at Omni. They are SO frustrating.

title: Great rooms and a wonderful location.
text: This hotel is located in an excellent part of town that made our ventures out into the city easy walking distances.  The staff support was wonderful and made getting a dinner reservation easy and usually at the time desired.

title: Omni needs to work harder
text: Roth is is my third stay in a row severely impacted by how noisy the rooms are. This time I paid for a suite and the mechanicals were deafening. When I reported it, got a shrug from the front desk. Bathrooms are functional, no more and the toiletries have not been improved/updated for years. Location good and clean, concierge Mary is outstanding but restaurant recommendation was off base and took us in opposite direction from hotel after a show. Looking for better alternative after being a loyal customer for over 15 years

title: Very Nice Stay
text: Hotel was very nice- rooms are on the larger side for NYC standards.  I had a room on the backside of the property and it was exceptionally quiet! Also, hotel is located in a perfect location- close to everything- shopping, dining, etc.

title: Great place for NYC visit
text: I love this hotel, and have gone here several times.  The Santa is the best around.  Very comfortable, clean and nicely decorated.  Centrally located towards Rockefeller center and other midtown places. Valet does share their garage with Radio City Music Hall, so you will need to leave extra time to get your car.  Also, during the holiday season, if driving, leave extra time to get there because many intersections are closed and need to go a round about way.

title: Do NOT stay here.
text: We booked a room here through priceline ( it was my first time using this site) for a one night stay with my teenage children and husband. We were taking our children to see the Rockettes for an early Christmas gift.   Upon arriving I checked into the front desk and ask to please have two beds.  The gentleman who was helping me stated they could not accommodate this request.  What?? He stated that priceline will only give you a  king size bed.  I had no idea, it was not stated when I booked this.  Well ok, can I please get a room with two beds and I will pay the difference.  No I am sorry we are "sold out".  Now I am on the verge of tears.  Can you please check again sir.  " I told you we are sold out."  Of course now I am saying what am I going to do?  His response " I don't know."  Well we can give you a room with a roll away for an additional charge.  I agree to this as it will help a little.  We are then told our room is not ready so we check our luggage and head out to the city.  We return and ask one more time if there have been any cancellations, I know it is a long shot but no.  Ok we head up to the room and now I online going to book another hotel room somewhere else for half of my family. I go onto the Omni Berkshire website and I can book a room with two double beds.  My brother in law also called to make a reservation for this night and asked for two beds and it was confirmed that they did have availability.  Are you kidding me. I walk down stairs and ask at the front desk why they have not been honest with me, no response other than we can move you.  We decided not as we had made other arrangements.  You are a customer service company who failed in every aspect of customer service.  Your front desk staff is rude and unfriendly and you should not tolerate lying. Room was not cleaned very well, looked like it had not been vacuumed.   We visit NYC at least 4 times per year and I will never stay at this facility or recommend this to others.  Also if you are thinking of staying here, there is not any coffee in the rooms and they also do not have any small store if you need anything.  The only positive aspect was the kindness of the doormen.

title: (Om)azing Stay
text: Stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place during a Christmas gift trip to New York City and one of the best parts of the present was getting to come “home” to this beautiful hotel. The lobby was decorated beautifully for Christmas, definitely put a smile on our faces when we arrived, as did the courteous bellman, who we enjoyed joking around with during the trip, and the friendly front desk agent. The bar area is a great size and the bartender, Robert, was just as great. Our room was the perfect size for the two of us, with the comfiest bed I have EVER slept on in a hotel. Ever. I appreciated the little details in the room like the complimentary comfy robe, the built in outlets in the bedside table lamps, and (even though I didn’t use it) the cute little sewing kit in the restroom, which by the way, NEVER ran out of hot water even in the 20 degrees too cold NYC weather. As well, the light blocking curtains on the windows were a much-appreciated feature. We actually slept in one day accidentally because we couldn’t tell whether or not it was 10 AM or 10 PM. The actual location of the hotel could NOT be more perfect. You are within walking distance, and I mean 5-10 minutes walking distance, of the best Christmas shopping, the best Christmas show (Rockettes) at Radio City Music Hall, and the best Christmas tree in America at Rockefeller Center. I cannot wait to come back to the Omni Berkshire Place. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Great location and wonderful service!
text:
Stayed at the Omni  for Christmas sightseeing trip and enjoyed a huge room for NYC. Clean and well appointed with friendly and accommodating staff. By joining up with their preferred member’s club, you get free wifi and the best part......complimentary hot carafes of coffee delivered to your room at the time you want! My favorite part of the trip!

Very convenient to Rockefeller Center and Radio City. Several deli’s, a drug store and shopping within the block around the hotel. Walkable to theater district and Broadway. 

Ate at the Bob’s Chop and Steakhouse for dinner and it was ok. Better options for higher end in meal in the city.

Look forward to staying again!

title: Special Weekend in NYC
text: We just returned from staying at the Omni - Berkshire Place where we celebrated our Anniversary.  Our stay was 'perfect' (from check-in, the room, the service and attentive staff to check-out)....it was a GREAT Experience.  The Omni is located in the heart of Midtown and is the perfect place to start you NYC experience.

title: Lovely Property/Perfect Location
text: We had a wonderful pre-Holiday visit to NYC/Omni Berkshire. Great location to appreciate the Holiday decorations, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Fifth Avenue retail, etc. etc..We found our room to be very comfortable in size and bedding! I would strongly recommend this property.

title: Great location for the holiday season
text: Great location! The rooms need to be updated. Plus the overall quality of the food in the restaurant needs improvement. I would suggest if you book your room in advance you should get the room that you booked.

title: great hotel
text: As i said earlier we loe staying at the hotel.   The rooms, locations, loyalty program and employees are the best.  We come twice a year or more and always stay with you.   Your bell staff and hotel greeters are the best.  Love the water by elevators it helps after a day out and about.

title: Functional hotel...quite expensive
text:
Decent, functional hotel...and quite expensive, even by NY standards!

Pros:
- Was close to my office (2 mins walk)
- Decent size rooms (by NY standards)
- Good service

Cons:
- Expensive
- No gym (they provide some weights in the room)
- Food is barely okay
- Valets almost demand tips (for the slightest of help)

title: Christmas in NYC
text: The Omni Berkshire is a beautiful upscale hotel that is centrally located. The rooms are small (as most are in NYC) but very inviting and comfortable. Bob's Steak & Chop house was delicious! Definitely some of the best steaks in NYC!

title: Hotel hit all of the Marks
text: This is in a very convenient location.  The staff is extremely helpful and available.  Having a great restaurant and bar on site is very nice.  We would definitely stay in this hotel again as everything about the experience was easy and comfortable.

title: Great location
text: I have stayed here with family and on business. Overall great place to stay in the city.  Location is terrific. If you arrive late head across the street to Fig and Olive- its good.  Or Scatos down the street.

title: Great hotel , perfect location
text: Great hotel , in the best location .it was near all the main attractions and perfect . We would defiantly stay here again and will recommend to family and friends . The hotel was clean and inviting . Bobs steak house, bar done a fantastic French martini 🍸

title: The hotel dreams are made of!
text: Everything about our stay at the Omni Berkshire was amazing.  The staff was all friendly and helpful and our room was an oasis.  Shocking quiet even though it’s located only 2-3 blocks from the tree 🌲.

title: Concierge and other staff were excellent.
text: We just stayed at the Omni Berkshire for a week's NYC holiday.  Front desk staff were very accommodating and helpful, especially Brent who was our main contact there.  The concierge desk was also excellent.  My party of three travellers (myself, my husband, and my brother) got advice from the concierges on at least, I'd say, 10-15 occasions during the week, on everything from transportation (all of subway, cab, bus and walking) to theatre, to walking tours, to tourist sights, to restaurants, to getting boarding passes printed.  In all cases the concierges were knowledgeable, super pleasant, and expeditious with our requests.  We dealt with Mary and Kevin and Mark, who were all very good.  We'll come back!

title: Nice place but watch your wallet at breakfast
text: As part of the Select Guest program you get a morning tray with coffee. Awesome! So each can get two, or does the room get two total? So I order two coffees and two OJ's. The OJ's were small, tiny even. Ordered a bagel too. The total for two pathetic sized juices and a bagel ... $27! When questioned at check out I was just a rube who didn't understand NYC prices. Guess I'm out of touch! With all the nice hotels in midtown why take advantage of an SG?

title: Delightful Stay
text: The Omni Berkshire has to be about the most friendly hotel in NYC--staff is extremely helpful, gracious and accommodating. Our room was spacious, neat and clean. We can also recommend Bob's Restaurant, for both food and the quality of the wait staff. Visitors will love the location--easy access to shopping, theaters and museums--what could be better.

title: Good location
text:
Good location, staff was friendly, but the rooms are not in a good condition and it’s not very clean. 
We stayed for 5 nights and expected more from NYC hotels. It was a bit noisy as well, since there where always people walking around and at night it was a little annoying.

title: Location, Style and Good Service
text: I love OMNI Hotel. Location is amazing close to the 5th avenue, and the hotel quality is great, staff very friendly and it has nice rooms. It´s also a cozy hotel and it has a very nice restaurant in the first floor.

title: Our New York favorite
text: The Omni is friendly, clean and convenient.  We enjoyed Bob’s Steak & Chop House and we met Bob.  New York can be a tough place to find a friendly hotel.  We also appreciate the hot water pressure in the shower.  Omni’s always have great beds and pillows.  There are a lot of choices in New York, so for the price the Omni Berkshire is a great value.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Myself, my daughter and my sister recently stayed at the Omni Berkshire hotel on a 4 day first time visit to New York.  So happy that I chose this hotel.  Perfect location, very clean hotel, lovely big room, bed really comfortable, friendly and helpful staff - what more could you ask for.  Will definitely stay here on my next visit to NY.   Would highly recommend.

title: Omni Bershire Place
text: Excellent hotel, nice spacious rooms based on New York standards.  Very quiet and clean.  Great concierge.  Excellent food service.  Really convenient location for shopping, dining and theater.  It is my go to hotel in Manhattan.

title: Best place to stay in NYC!
text: If you want to be near it all, but out of the fray, stay at the Omni Berkshire.  It is a lovely hotel with very nice rooms and impeccable service. The hotel restaurant is also a nice breakfast option and the steaks are outstanding for dinner. The location can't be beat and the staff makes staying there a pleasure.  I will return again and again!

title: Great place to stay at a great location
text: great place to stay and convenient location .Easy to get to and from . So much nicer to be away from the crowds and congestion and yet in minutes be in the theater district or the shopping stores. The staff went out of their way to answer our questions or fill our requests

title: Nice hotel but not the one of the best
text: This was a nice hotel but we were let down to find our suite had no mini fridge, no microwave, and no wifi included in the $900per night stay. This hotel does not cater to those who have children & need certain amenities for comfort.  Our room was nice but small for the price & the bathroom had a strong cigarette odor the whole weekend.  I was overall fine with the stay but did not feel I got my monies worth & will probably not stay here again in the future.

title: Great hotel!
text:
Anytime I'm in NY for work this is the first hotel I check to see if there's availability.  I love staying here.  The location is great, the rooms are decent sized, especially for NY and everything is always clean and the staff is always pleasant.  
Whenever I can't stay here I'm bummed, not only for the hotel itself but their loyalty program; coffee delivered to my door each morning, it doesn't get much better!!

title: Perfect location, room and customer service!
text: Just returned from a lovely girl’s trip with my mom and sister. We couldn’t have asked for a better location or accommodations- the rooms are huge (for NYC standards) and very clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms clean. Everyone from housekeeping to the doorman was professional, approachable and kind. David was especially helpful in meeting some requests and we appreciate his attention and help in making a great trip even more perfect!!! Look no further... great experience!!!!

title: Bel hôtel idéalement situé
text:
Nous avions choisi cet hôtel pour notre 1ere venir sur New York avec nos 3 enfants.
Nous avons été ravis de l'accueil, de la disponibilité, de la gentillesse du personnel.
Nos chambres étaient tres confortables et propres. Effectivement la décoration n'est pas très moderne mais ce n'était pas une priorité.
Idéalement situé près de la 5e avenue.
A conseiller sans modération !!!

title: Supreme Location, Disappointing Room
text:
One can't beat the location on 52nd and Madison for conducting business anywhere in Midtown. As an Omni Select member I was disappointed to find out that I was assigned a low floor room right next to the elevator. I did not object as I figured I would persevere for a one night stay. However, the foot traffic around the elevator in the morning confirmed my worst fears as far as noise goes.

The room itself was nothing special; a typical Manhattan size small room. In room coffee service was not available and that is always appreciated by me. 

It's not that I wouldn't return to the Omni Berkshire, I would just be more particular about the room I was assigned.

title: A real gem in Midtown!
text: I stayed at the Omni Berkshire Place over Thanksgiving weekend with my husband to celebrate my 30th birthday. We booked a combined flight and hotel deal with lastminute.com early this year so the cost for the trip was competitive, considering the standard of the hotel. We arrived around 9pm and the service on check in was great and the hotel had even put cake, champagne and a card in the room to celebrate my birthday, which was a truly lovely touch. Our room was a really good size by any standard, but especially by those in NYC, and was well appointed. The bed was huge and very comfortable, and the room was really quiet (we were on the 17th floor and at the back of the hotel, so no street noise at all). Daily housekeeping and turndown service was excellent, and although we did not have much interaction with the staff as we were out and about so much, they were always very helpful and polite when we did speak with them. This included on our final day when the bellman stored our luggage after checkout whilst we awaited our transfer to Newark. The hotel is in a great location for shopping on 5th Avenue, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park, and there are subway stations that can get you anywhere else you might need to go very close by. All in all, this was the perfect place to spend a holiday weekend in New York, and there was even a visit from Santa. If it's good enough for the man in red, then it's definitely good enough for me!

title: Lovely hotel in a very popular location
text:
We stayed here last week during Thanksgiving and I must say we really enjoyed our stay.
The lobby was just being decorated with Christmas decorations as we arrived to the hotel  which was a great start to the holiday season and our stay.
